Text

[An extremely pretty girl]566-an extremely pretty girl occupied [a second - class compartment in one of those trains which percolate through [the rural tranquillities of [middle England]569-middle england]568-the rural tranquillities of middle england from [[Ganford]1-ganford in [Oxfordshire]3-oxfordshire to [Rumbold Junction]4-rumbold junction in [Kent]5-kent]2-ganford in oxfordshire to rumbold junction in kent]567-a second - class compartment in one of those trains which percolate through the rural tranquillities of middle england from ganford in oxfordshire to rumbold junction in kent . [She]566-an extremely pretty girl was going to join [[her]566-an extremely pretty girl family]570-her family at [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet after a visit to [some [Gloucestershire]7-gloucestershire friends]571-some gloucestershire friends . [[Her]566-an extremely pretty girl father]572-her father , [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , once [a leader in the coach - building world]573-a leader in the coach - building world and now by retirement [a gentleman]574-a gentleman , had taken [the Buryhamstreet vicarage]575-the buryhamstreet vicarage furnished for two months ( beginning on the fifteenth of July ) at [his]246-mr. pope maximum summer rental of seven guineas a week . [[His]246-mr. pope daughter]576-his daughter was on [her]566-an extremely pretty girl way to [this retreat]577-this retreat . At first [she]566-an extremely pretty girl had been [an animated traveller]578-an animated traveller , erect and keenly regardful of every detail upon the platforms of [the stations at which [her]566-an extremely pretty girl conveyance lingered]579-the stations at which her conveyance lingered , but the tedium of the journey and the warmth of the sunny afternoon had relaxed [her]566-an extremely pretty girl pose by imperceptible degrees , and [she]566-an extremely pretty girl sat now comfortably in the corner , with [her]566-an extremely pretty girl neat toes upon the seat before [her]566-an extremely pretty girl , ready to drop them primly at the first sign of [a fellow - traveller]580-a fellow - traveller . [Her]566-an extremely pretty girl expression lapsed more and more towards an almost somnolent reverie . [She]566-an extremely pretty girl wished [she]566-an extremely pretty girl had not taken a second - class ticket , because then [she]566-an extremely pretty girl might have afforded a cup of tea at Reading , and so fortified [herself]566-an extremely pretty girl against this insinuating indolence . [She]566-an extremely pretty girl was travelling second class , instead of third as [she]566-an extremely pretty girl ought to have done , through one of those lapses so inevitable to [young people in [her]566-an extremely pretty girl position]581-young people in her position . [The two Carmel boys]582-the two carmel boys and [a cousin]583-a cousin , two greyhounds and [a chow]584-a chow had come to see [her]566-an extremely pretty girl off ; [they]582-the two carmel boys had made a brilliant and prosperous group on the platform and extorted the manifest admiration of [two youthful porters]585-two youthful porters , and it had been altogether too much for [Marjorie Pope]323-marjorie to admit it was the family custom — except when [[her]566-an extremely pretty girl father]572-her father 's nerves had to be considered — to go third class . So [she]566-an extremely pretty girl had made a hasty calculation — [she]566-an extremely pretty girl knew [her]566-an extremely pretty girl balance to a penny because of the recent tipping — and found it would just run to it . Fourpence remained,—and there would be [a porter at [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet]587-a porter at buryhamstreet ! [[Her]566-an extremely pretty girl mother]588-her mother had said : " [You]566-an extremely pretty girl will have [Ample]248-ample . "[588-her mother] Well , opinions of amplitude vary . With numerous details fresh in [her]566-an extremely pretty girl mind , [Marjorie]323-marjorie decided it would be wiser to avoid financial discussion during [her]566-an extremely pretty girl first few days at [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet . There was much in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's equipment in the key of travelling second class at the sacrifice of afternoon tea . There was , for example , a certain quiet goodness of style about [her]323-marjorie clothes , though the skirt betrayed age , and an entire absence of style about [her]323-marjorie luggage , which was all in the compartment with [her]323-marjorie , and which consisted of a distended hold - all , a very good tennis racquet in a stretcher , a portmanteau of cheap white basketwork held together by straps , and a very new , expensive - looking and meretricious dressing - bag of imitation morocco , which had been one of [her]323-marjorie chief financial errors at [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge . The collection was eloquent indeed of incompatible standards .... [Marjorie]323-marjorie had a chin that was small in size if resolute in form , and a mouth that was not noticeably soft and weak because it was conspicuously soft and pretty . [Her]323-marjorie nose was delicately aquiline and very subtly and finely modelled , and [she]323-marjorie looked out upon [the world]589-the world with steady , grey - blue eyes beneath broad , level brows that contradicted in a large measure the hint of weakness below . [She]323-marjorie had an abundance of copper - red hair , which flowed back very prettily from [her]323-marjorie broad , low forehead and over [her]323-marjorie delicate ears , and [she]323-marjorie had that warm - tinted clear skin that goes so well with reddish hair . [She]323-marjorie had a very dainty neck , and the long slender lines of [her]323-marjorie body were full of the promise of a riper beauty . [She]323-marjorie had the good open shoulders of [a tennis - player]590-a tennis - player and [a swimmer]591-a swimmer . Some day [she]323-marjorie was to be [a tall , ruddy , beautiful woman]592-a tall , ruddy , beautiful woman . [She]323-marjorie wore simple clothes of silvery grey and soft green , and about [her]323-marjorie waist was a belt of grey leather in which there now wilted two creamy - petalled roses . That was the visible [Marjorie]323-marjorie . Somewhere out of time and space was an invisible Marjorie who looked out on [the world]589-the world with those steady eyes , and smiled or drooped with the soft red lips , and dreamt , and wondered , and desired . What [a queer thing the invisible human being]594-a queer thing the invisible human being would appear if , by some discovery as yet inconceivable , some spiritual X - ray photography , [we]595-we could flash it into sight ! Long ago [I]0-i read a book called " Soul Shapes "[0-i] that was full of ingenious ideas , but [I]0-i doubt very much if the thing so revealed would have any shape , any abiding solid outline at all . It is something more fluctuating and discursive than that — at any rate , for [every one young enough not to have set and hardened]596-every one young enough not to have set and hardened . Things come into it and become it , things drift out of it and cease to be it , things turn upside down in it and change and colour and dissolve , and grow and eddy about and blend into each other . [One]597-one might figure it , [I]0-i suppose , as a preposterous jumble animated by a will ; a floundering disconnectedness through which an old hump of impulse rises and thrusts unaccountably ; a river beast of purpose wallowing in a back eddy of mud and weeds and floating objects and [creatures drowned]598-creatures drowned . Now the sunshine of gladness makes it all vivid , now it is sombre and grimly insistent under the sky of some darkling mood , now an emotional gale sweeps across it and it is one confused agitation .... And surely [these invisible selves of [men]600-men]599-these invisible selves of men were never so jumbled , so crowded , complicated , and stirred about as [they]599-these invisible selves of men are at the present time . Once [I]0-i am told [they]599-these invisible selves of men had a sort of order , were sphered in religious beliefs , crystal clear , were arranged in a cosmogony that fitted [them]599-these invisible selves of men as hand fits glove , were separated by definite standards of right and wrong which presented life as planned in all its essential aspects from the cradle to the grave . Things are so no longer . That sphere is broken for [most of [us]595-we]601-most of us ; even if it is tied about and mended again , it is burst like a seed case ; things have fallen out and things have fallen in .... Can [I]0-i convey in any measure how it was with [Marjorie]323-marjorie ? What was [her]323-marjorie religion ? In college forms and returns , and suchlike documents , [she]323-marjorie would describe [herself]323-marjorie as " [Church of [England]9-england]4720-church of england . "[323-marjorie] [She]323-marjorie had been baptized according to the usages of that body , but [she]323-marjorie had hitherto evaded confirmation into it , and although it is [a large , wealthy , and powerful organization with many minds to serve it]602-a large , wealthy , and powerful organization with many minds to serve it , it had never succeeded in getting into [her]323-marjorie quick and apprehensive intelligence any lucid and persuasive conception of what [it]603-it considered [God]249-god and [the universe]604-the universe were up to with [her]323-marjorie . It had failed to catch [her]323-marjorie attention and state itself to [her]323-marjorie . [A number of humorous and other writers]605-a number of humorous and other writers and the general trend of talk around [her]323-marjorie , and perhaps [her]323-marjorie own shrewd little observation of superficial things , had , on the other hand , created a fairly definite belief in [her]323-marjorie that it was n't as a matter of fact up to very much at all , that what it said was n't said with that absolute honesty which is a logical necessity in every religious authority , and that its hierarchy had all sorts of political and social considerations confusing its treatment of [her]323-marjorie immortal soul .... [Marjorie]323-marjorie followed [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father in abstaining from [church]607-church . [He]572-her father too professed [himself]572-her father " [Church of [England]9-england]4720-church of england , "[572-her father] but [he]572-her father was , if [we]608-we are to set aside merely superficial classifications , [an irascible atheist with a respect for usage and Good Taste]609-an irascible atheist with a respect for usage and good taste , and an abject fear of the disapproval of [other gentlemen of [his]572-her father class]610-other gentlemen of his class . For the rest [he]572-her father secretly disliked [clergymen]611-clergymen on account of the peculiarity of [their]611-clergymen collars , and a certain influence [they]611-clergymen had with [women]612-women . When [Marjorie]323-marjorie at the age of fourteen had displayed a hankering after ecclesiastical ceremony and emotional religion , [he]572-her father had declared : " [We]4722-we do n't want any of that nonsense , "[572-her father] and sent [her]323-marjorie into [the country]613-the country to [a farm]614-a farm where there were young calves and a bottle - fed lamb and kittens . At times [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother went to [church]607-church and displayed considerable orthodoxy and punctilio , at times [the good lady]617-the good lady did n't , and at times [she]617-the good lady thought in a broad - minded way that there was a Lot in Christian Science , and subjected [herself]617-the good lady to the ministrations of an American named [Silas Root]250-silas root . But [his]250-silas root ministrations were too expensive for continuous use , and so the old faith did not lose its hold upon [the family]618-the family altogether . At [school]619-school [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been taught what [I]0-i may best describe as Muffled Christianity — a temperate and discreet system designed primarily not to irritate [parents]620-parents , in which the painful symbol of the crucifixion and the riddle of what Salvation was to save [her]323-marjorie from , and , indeed , the coarser aspects of religion generally , were entirely subordinate to images of amiable perambulations , and a rich mist of finer feelings . [She]323-marjorie had been shielded , not only from arguments against [her]323-marjorie religion , but from arguments for it — the two things go together — and [I]0-i do not think it was particularly [her]323-marjorie fault if [she]323-marjorie was now growing up like [the great majority of [respectable English people]622-respectable english people]621-the great majority of respectable english people , with [her]323-marjorie religious faculty as it were , artificially faded , and an acquired disposition to regard any speculation of why [she]323-marjorie was , and whence and whither , as rather foolish , not very important , and in the very worst possible taste . And so , the crystal globe being broken which once held souls together , [you]623-you may expect to find [her]323-marjorie a little dispersed and inconsistent in [her]323-marjorie motives , and with none of that assurance a simpler age possessed of the exact specification of goodness or badness , the exact delimitation of right and wrong . Indeed , [she]323-marjorie did not live in [a world of right and wrong]624-a world of right and wrong , or anything so stern ; " horrid "[323-marjorie] and " jolly "[323-marjorie] had replaced these archaic orientations . In a world where a mercantile gentility has conquered passion and [God]249-god is neither blasphemed nor adored , there necessarily arises [this generation of young people]625-this generation of young people , a little perplexed , indeed , and with a sense of something missing , but feeling [their]625-this generation of young people way inevitably at last to the great releasing question , " Then why should n't [we]4723-we have a good time ? "[625-this generation of young people] Yet there was something in [Marjorie]323-marjorie , as in [most human beings]626-most human beings , that demanded some general idea , some aim , to hold [her]323-marjorie life together . [A girl upon the borders of [her]323-marjorie set at [college]628-college]627-a girl upon the borders of her set at college was fond of the phrase " living for the moment , "[323-marjorie] and [Marjorie]323-marjorie associated with it [the speaker]629-the speaker 's lax mouth , sloe - like eyes , soft , quick - flushing , boneless face , and a habit of squawking and bouncing in a forced and graceless manner . [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's natural disposition was to deal with life in a steadier spirit than that . Yet all sorts of powers and forces were at work in [her]323-marjorie , some exalted , some elvish , some vulgar , some subtle . [She]323-marjorie felt keenly and desired strongly , and in effect [she]323-marjorie came perhaps nearer the realization of that offending phrase than its original exponent . [She]323-marjorie had a clean intensity of feeling that made [her]323-marjorie delight in a thousand various things , in sunlight and textures , and the vividly quick acts of animals , in landscape , and the beauty of [other girls]630-other girls , in wit , and [people]631-people 's voices , and good strong reasoning , and the desire and skill of art . [She]323-marjorie had a clear , rapid memory that made [her]323-marjorie excel perhaps a little too easily at [school]619-school and college , an eagerness of sympathetic interest that won [people]631-people very quickly and led to disappointments , and a very strong sense of the primary importance of [Miss Marjorie Pope]323-marjorie in [the world]589-the world . And when any very definite dream of what [she]323-marjorie would like to be and what [she]323-marjorie would like to do , such as being [the principal of [a ladies ' college]636-a ladies ' college]635-the principal of a ladies ' college , or [the first woman member of Parliament]637-the first woman member of parliament , or [the wife of [a barbaric chief in [Borneo]10-borneo]639-a barbaric chief in borneo , or [a great explorer]640-a great explorer , or [the wife of [a millionaire]642-a millionaire and [a great social leader]643-a great social leader]641-the wife of a millionaire and a great social leader]638-the wife of a barbaric chief in borneo , or a great explorer , or the wife of a millionaire and a great social leader , or [George Sand]251-george sand , or [Saint Teresa]252-saint teresa , had had possession of [her]323-marjorie imagination for a few weeks , an entirely contrasted and equally attractive dream would presently arise beside it and compete with it and replace it . It was n't so much that [she]323-marjorie turned against the old one as that [she]323-marjorie was attracted by the new , and [she]323-marjorie forgot the old dream rather than abandoned it , simply because [she]323-marjorie was [only one person]644-only one person , and had n't therefore the possibility of realizing both . In certain types [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's impressionability aroused a passion of proselytism . [People of the most diverse kinds]645-people of the most diverse kinds sought to influence [her]323-marjorie , and [they]645-people of the most diverse kinds invariably did so . [Quite a number of people]646-quite a number of people , including [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother and [the principal of [[her]323-marjorie college]649-her college]648-the principal of her college , believed [themselves]646-quite a number of people to be the leading influence in [her]323-marjorie life . And this was particularly the case with [[her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt [Plessington]253-aunt plessington . [[Her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt [Plessington]253-aunt plessington was devoted to social and political work of an austere and aggressive sort ( in which [Mr. Plessington]254-mr. plessington participated ) ; [she]253-aunt plessington was childless , and had a Movement of [her]253-aunt plessington own , the Good Habits Movement , a progressive movement of the utmost scope and benevolence which aimed at extensive interferences with the food and domestic intimacies of [the more defenceless lower classes]652-the more defenceless lower classes by means ultimately of legislation , and [she]253-aunt plessington had [Marjorie]323-marjorie up to see [her]253-aunt plessington , took [her]323-marjorie for long walks while [she]253-aunt plessington influenced with earnestness and vigour , and at times had an air of bequeathing [her]253-aunt plessington mantle , movement and everything , quite definitely to [her]253-aunt plessington " little Madge . "[253-aunt plessington] [She]253-aunt plessington spoke of training [[her]253-aunt plessington niece]653-her niece to succeed [her]253-aunt plessington , and bought all the novels of [Mrs. Humphry Ward]255-mrs. humphry ward for [her]253-aunt plessington as they appeared , in the hope of quickening in [her]253-aunt plessington that flame of politico - social ambition , that insatiable craving for dinner - parties with [important guests]654-important guests , which is so distinctive of [the more influential variety of English womanhood]655-the more influential variety of english womanhood . It was due rather to [her]253-aunt plessington own habit of monologue than to any reserve on the part of [Marjorie]323-marjorie that [she]253-aunt plessington entertained the belief that [[her]253-aunt plessington niece]653-her niece was entirely acquiescent in these projects . [They]657-they went into [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind and passed . For nearly a week , it is true , [she]323-marjorie had dramatized [herself]323-marjorie as the angel and inspiration of [some great modern statesman]658-some great modern statesman , but this had been ousted by a far more insistent dream , begotten by a picture [she]323-marjorie had seen in some exhibition , of a life of careless savagery , whose central and constantly recurrent incident was the riding of barebacked horses out of [deep - shadowed forest]659-deep - shadowed forest into [a foamy sunlit sea]660-a foamy sunlit sea — in a costume that would certainly have struck [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington as a mistake . If [you]661-you could have seen [Marjorie]323-marjorie in [[her]323-marjorie railway compartment]662-her railway compartment , with the sunshine , sunshine mottled by the dirty window , tangled in [her]323-marjorie hair and creeping to and fro over [her]323-marjorie face as [the train]663-the train followed the curves of the line , [you]661-you would certainly have agreed with [me]0-i that [she]323-marjorie was pretty , and [you]661-you might even have thought [her]323-marjorie beautiful . But it was necessary to fall in love with [Marjorie]323-marjorie before [you]661-you could find [her]323-marjorie absolutely beautiful . [You]661-you might have speculated just what business was going on behind those drowsily thoughtful eyes . If [you]661-you are — as [people]631-people say—"Victorian , "[661-you] [you]661-you might even have whispered " Day Dreams , "[661-you] at the sight of [her]323-marjorie .... [She]323-marjorie was dreaming , and in a sense [she]323-marjorie was thinking of beautiful things . But only mediately . [She]323-marjorie was thinking how very much [she]323-marjorie would enjoy spending freely and vigorously , quite a considerable amount of money,—heaps of money . [You]661-you see , [the Carmels]256-the carmels , with whom [she]323-marjorie had just been staying , were shockingly well off . [They]256-the carmels had [two motor cars]665-two motor cars with [them]256-the carmels in [the country]613-the country , and [the boys]667-the boys had the use of [the second one]668-the second one as though it was just [an old bicycle]669-an old bicycle . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had had a cheap white dinner - dress , made the year before by [a Chelsea French girl]670-a chelsea french girl , a happy find of [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother 's , and it was shapely and simple and not at all bad , and [she]323-marjorie had worn [her]323-marjorie green beads and [her]323-marjorie Egyptian necklace of jade ; but [Kitty Carmel]257-kitty carmel and [[her]257-kitty carmel sister]672-her sister had had a new costume nearly every night , and pretty bracelets , and rubies , big pearls , and woven gold , and half a score of delightful and precious things for neck and hair . Everything in [the place]673-the place was bright and good and abundant , [the servants]674-the servants were easy and well - mannered , without a trace of hurry or resentment , and [one]675-one did n't have to be sharp about the eggs and things at breakfast in the morning , or go without . All through the day , and even when [they]256-the carmels had gone to bathe from [the smart little white and green shed on [the upper lake]677-the upper lake]676-the smart little white and green shed on the upper lake , [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been made to feel the insufficiency of [her]323-marjorie equipment . It was like calling a row of [boy - scouts Potsdam grenadiers]743-boy - scouts potsdam grenadiers . The trees were at irregular distances , of various ages , and mostly on one side . Still it was a shady , pleasant approach . And [the vicarage]734-the vicarage was truly very interesting and amusing . To these Londoners accustomed to live in a state of compression , elbows practically touching , in [a tall , narrow fore - and - aft stucco house]745-a tall , narrow fore - and - aft stucco house , all window and staircase , in [a despondent Brompton square]746-a despondent brompton square , there was an effect of maundering freedom about [the place]673-the place , of enlargement almost to the pitch of adventure and sunlight to the pitch of intoxication . [The house]742-the house itself was long and low , as if [a London house holidaying in [the country]613-the country]749-a london house holidaying in the country had flung [itself]742-the house asprawl ; [it]742-the house had two disconnected and roomy staircases , and when [it]742-the house had exhausted [itself]742-the house completely as [a house]751-a house , [it]742-the house turned to the right and began again as [rambling , empty stables]752-rambling , empty stables , [coach house]753-coach house , [cart sheds]754-cart sheds , [[men]600-men 's bedrooms up ladders , and [outhouses]757-outhouses of the most various kinds]756-men 's bedrooms up ladders , and outhouses of the most various kinds . [None of [them]782-all three sisters]790-none of them had seen [any of [the vicarage people]792-the vicarage people]791-any of the vicarage people at all — [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope had come on [a bicycle]793-a bicycle and managed all the negotiations — and it was curious to speculate about [the individuals whose personalities pervaded the worn and faded furnishings of [the place]673-the place]794-the individuals whose personalities pervaded the worn and faded furnishings of the place . The ideals of decoration and interests of [the vanished family]796-the vanished family were so absolutely dissimilar to the [London]17-london standards as to arouse a sort of astonished wonder in [their]782-all three sisters minds . [Daffy]258-daffy was perhaps more inclined to contempt , and [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope to refined amusement and witty appreciation than [Marjorie]323-marjorie . [Marjorie]323-marjorie felt there was something in [these people]797-these people that [she]323-marjorie did n't begin to understand , [she]323-marjorie needed some missing clue that would unlock the secret of [their]797-these people confused peculiarity . [She]323-marjorie was one of [those people who have an almost instinctive turn for decoration in costume and furniture]798-those people who have an almost instinctive turn for decoration in costume and furniture ; [she]323-marjorie had already had a taste of how to do things in arranging [[her]323-marjorie rooms at [Bennett College]19-bennett college]799-her rooms at bennett college , [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge , where also [she]323-marjorie was in great demand among [the richer girls]800-the richer girls as [an adviser]801-an adviser . [She]323-marjorie knew what it was to try and fail as well as to try and succeed , and [these people]797-these people , [she]323-marjorie felt , had n't tried for anything [she]323-marjorie comprehended . [She]323-marjorie could n't quite see why it was that there was at the same time an attempt at ornament and a disregard of beauty , [she]323-marjorie could n't quite do as [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother did and dismiss it as an absurdity and have done with it . [She]323-marjorie could n't understand , too , why everything should be as if it were faded and weakened from something originally bright and clear . All [the rooms]786-the rooms were thick with queer little objects that indicated a quite beaver - like industry in the production of " work . "[323-marjorie] There were embroidered covers for nearly every article on the wash - hand - stand , and mats of wool and crochet wherever anything stood on anything ; there were " tidies "[262-rom] everywhere , and odd little brackets covered with gilded and varnished fir cones and bearing framed photographs and little jars and all sorts of colourless , dusty little objects , and everywhere on the walls tacks sustained crossed fans with badly painted flowers or transfer pictures . There was a jar on the bedroom mantel covered with varnished postage stamps and containing grey - haired dried grasses . There seemed to be a moral element in all this , for in [the room [Sydney]261-sydney shared with [Rom]262-rom]805-the room sydney shared with rom there was a decorative piece of lettering which declared that—"Something attempted , something done , Has earned a night 's repose . "[264-mrs. pope] There were a great number of texts that set [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind stirring dimly with intimations of a missed significance . Over [her]323-marjorie own bed , within the lattice of an Oxford frame , was the photograph of a picture of [an extremely composed young woman in a trailing robe , clinging to the Rock of Ages in the midst of histrionically aggressive waves]806-an extremely composed young woman in a trailing robe , clinging to the rock of ages in the midst of histrionically aggressive waves , and [she]323-marjorie had a feeling , rather than a thought , that perhaps for all the oddity of the presentation it did convey something acutely desirable , that [she]323-marjorie [herself]323-marjorie had had moods when [she]323-marjorie would have found something very comforting in just such an impassioned grip . And on a framed , floriferous card , these incomprehensible words : [Thy]807-thy Grace is Sufficient for [Me]0-i . seemed to be saying something to [her]323-marjorie tantalizingly just outside [her]323-marjorie range of apprehension . [The drawing - room]811-the drawing - room had no texts ; [it]811-the drawing - room was altogether more pretentious and less haunted by the faint and faded flavour of religion that pervaded [the bedrooms]812-the bedrooms . It had , however , evidences of travel in [Switzerland]20-switzerland and [the Mediterranean]21-the mediterranean . There was a piano in black and gold , a little out of tune , and surmounted by a Benares brass jar , enveloping a scarlet geranium in a pot . There was a Japanese screen of gold wrought upon black , that screened nothing . There was a framed chromo - lithograph of [Jerusalem]22-jerusalem hot in the sunset , and another of [Jerusalem]22-jerusalem cold under a sub - tropical moon , and there were gourds , roses of [Jericho]23-jericho , sandalwood rosaries and kindred trash from [the Holy Land]24-the holy land in no little profusion upon a what - not . At present [they]814-their were piled on a side - table . Upon a notice board hung about the waist of the portly pulpit were the numbers of hymns that had been sung three days ago . The sound Protestantism of [the vicar]765-the vicar had banished superfluous crosses from [the building]825-the building ; the Bible reposed upon the wings of a great brass eagle ; shining blue and crimson in the window , [Saint Christopher]277-saint christopher carried [[his]277-saint christopher Lord]826-his lord . It was all so very cool and quiet now — with something of the immobile serenity of death . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope was [a man of firm and resentful temper]896-a man of firm and resentful temper , with an admiration for [Cato]280-cato , [Brutus]281-brutus , [Cincinnatus]282-cincinnatus , [Cromwell]283-cromwell , [Washington]284-washington , and [the sterner heroes]897-the sterner heroes generally , and by nature a little ill - used and offended at things . [He]246-mr. pope suffered from indigestion and extreme irritability . [He]246-mr. pope found [himself]246-mr. pope in control of [a business where more flexible virtues were needed]898-a business where more flexible virtues were needed . [The Popes]273-the popes based [their]899-their fame on a heavy , proud type of vehicle , which the increasing luxury and triviality of the age tended to replace by lighter forms of [carriage]900-carriage , carriages with diminutive and apologetic names . As these lighter forms were not only lighter but less expensive , [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope with a pathetic confidence in the loyalty of [the better class of West End customer]901-the better class of west end customer , determined to " make a stand "[246-mr. pope] against [them]901-the better class of west end customer . [He]246-mr. pope was [the sort of man to whom making a stand]902-the sort of man to whom making a stand is in itself a sombre joy . If [he]246-mr. pope had had to choose [his]246-mr. pope pose for a portrait , [he]246-mr. pope would certainly have decided to have one foot advanced , the other planted like a British oak behind , the arms folded and the brows corrugated,—making a stand . Unhappily the stars in [their]903-their courses and the general improvement of roads throughout [the country]613-the country fought against [him]246-mr. pope . [The lighter carriages]905-the lighter carriages , and especially the lighter carriages of [that varnish - selling firm]906-that varnish - selling firm , which was now absorbing [businesses right and left]907-businesses right and left , prevailed over [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope 's resistance . For crossing [a mountain pass]908-a mountain pass or fording [a river]909-a river , for driving over the scene of a recent earthquake or following [a retreating army]910-a retreating army , for being run away with by frantic horses or crushing [a personal enemy]911-a personal enemy , there can be no doubt [the Pope]912-the pope carriages remained to the very last the best possible ones and fully worth the inflexible price demanded . Unhappily all carriages in [a civilization essentially decadent]913-a civilization essentially decadent are not subjected to these tests , and the manufactures of [[his]246-mr. pope rivals]914-his rivals were not only much cheaper , but had a sort of meretricious smartness , a disingenuous elasticity , above all a levity , hateful indeed to the spirit of [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope yet attractive to [the wanton customer]915-the wanton customer . Business dwindled . Nevertheless the habitual element in [the good class customer]916-the good class customer did keep things going , albeit on a shrinking scale , until [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope came to the unfortunate decision that [he]246-mr. pope would make a stand against [automobiles]917-automobiles . [He]246-mr. pope regarded [them]917-automobiles as an intrusive nuisance which had to be seen only to be disowned by [the landed gentry of [England]9-england]918-the landed gentry of england . Rather than build [a car]919-a car [he]246-mr. pope said [he]246-mr. pope would go out of business . [He]246-mr. pope went out of business . Within five years of this determination [he]246-mr. pope sold out the name , good will , and other vestiges of [his]246-mr. pope concern to [a mysterious buyer who turned out to be no more than [an agent for [these persistently expanding varnish makers]922-these persistently expanding varnish makers]921-an agent for these persistently expanding varnish makers]920-a mysterious buyer who turned out to be no more than an agent for these persistently expanding varnish makers , and [he]246-mr. pope retired with a genuine grievance upon the family accumulations — chiefly in Consols and [Home Railways]923-home railways . [He]246-mr. pope refused however to regard [his]246-mr. pope defeat as final , put great faith in the approaching exhaustion of the petrol supply , and talked in a manner that should have made [the Automobile Association]924-the automobile association uneasy , of devoting the rest of [his]246-mr. pope days to the purification of [England]9-england from these aggressive mechanisms . " It was a mistake , "[246-mr. pope] [he]246-mr. pope said , " to let [them]922-these persistently expanding varnish makers in . "[246-mr. pope] [He]246-mr. pope became more frequent at [[his]246-mr. pope excellent West End club]925-his excellent west end club , and directed a certain portion of [[his]246-mr. pope capital]926-his capital to largely indecisive but on the whole unprofitable speculations in [South African]927-south african and South American enterprises . [He]246-mr. pope mingled a little in affairs . [He]246-mr. pope was [a tough conventional speaker]928-a tough conventional speaker , rich in established phrases and never abashed by hearing [himself]246-mr. pope say commonplace things , and in addition to [his]246-mr. pope campaign against automobiles [he]246-mr. pope found time to engage also in quasi - political activities , taking chairs , saying a few words and so on , cherishing a fluctuating hope that [his]246-mr. pope eloquence might ultimately win [him]246-mr. pope an invitation to contest [a constituency]929-a constituency in the interests of reaction and [the sounder elements in [the Liberal party]931-the liberal party]930-the sounder elements in the liberal party . [He]246-mr. pope had a public - spirited side , and [he]246-mr. pope was particularly attracted by that mass of modern legislative proposals which aims at a more systematic control of the lives of [lower class persons]932-lower class persons for [their]932-lower class persons own good by [[their]932-lower class persons betters]933-their betters . Indeed , in the first enthusiasm of [his]246-mr. pope proprietorship of [the Pope works at [East Purblow]26-east purblow]934-the pope works at east purblow , [he]246-mr. pope had organized one of those benevolent industrial experiments that are now so common . [He]246-mr. pope felt strongly against the drink evil , that is to say , the unrestricted liberty of [common people]935-common people to drink what [they]935-common people prefer , and [he]246-mr. pope was acutely impressed by the fact that [working - class families]936-working - class families do not spend [their]936-working - class families money in the way that seems most desirable to [upper middle - class critics]937-upper middle - class critics . Accordingly [he]246-mr. pope did [his]246-mr. pope best to replace the dangerous freedoms of money by that ideal of [the social reformer]938-the social reformer , Payment in Kind . To use [his]246-mr. pope invariable phrase , the East Purblow experiment did " no mean service "[323-marjorie] to the cause of social reform . Unhappily it came to an end through a prosecution under the Truck Act , that blot upon the Statute Book , designed , it would appear , even deliberately to vitiate [man]939-man 's benevolent control of [[his]939-man fellow man]940-his fellow man . The lessons to be drawn from that experience , however , grew if anything with the years . [He]246-mr. pope rarely spoke without an allusion to it , and it was quite remarkable how readily it could be adapted to illuminate a hundred different issues in the hospitable columns of the Spectator .... At seven o'clock [Marjorie]323-marjorie found [herself]323-marjorie upstairs changing into [her]323-marjorie apple - green frock . [She]323-marjorie had had a good refreshing wash in cold soft water , and it was pleasant to change into thinner silk stockings and dainty satin slippers and let down and at last brush [her]323-marjorie hair and dress loiteringly after the fatigues of [her]323-marjorie journey and the activities of [her]323-marjorie arrival . [She]323-marjorie looked out on [the big church]941-the big church and the big trees behind [it]941-the big church against the golden quiet of a summer evening with extreme approval . " [I]258-daffy suppose those birds are rooks , "[258-daffy] [she]323-marjorie said . But [Daffy]258-daffy had gone to see that [the pseudo - twins]739-the pseudo - twins had done [themselves]739-the pseudo - twins justice in [their]739-the pseudo - twins muslin frocks and pink sashes ; [they]739-the pseudo - twins were apt to be a little sketchy with [their]739-the pseudo - twins less accessible buttons . [Marjorie]323-marjorie became aware of [two gentlemen with [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother on the lawn below]943-two gentlemen with her mother on the lawn below . One was [[her]323-marjorie almost affianced lover]945-her almost affianced lover , [Will Magnet]285-will magnet , [the humorous writer]946-the humorous writer . [She]323-marjorie had been doing [her]323-marjorie best not to think about [him]285-will magnet all day , but now [he]285-will magnet became an unavoidable central fact . [She]323-marjorie regarded [him]285-will magnet with an almost perplexed scrutiny , and wondered vividly why [she]323-marjorie had been so excited and pleased by [his]285-will magnet attentions during the previous summer . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was one of [those quiet , deliberately unassuming people who do not even attempt to be beautiful]947-those quiet , deliberately unassuming people who do not even attempt to be beautiful . Not for [him]285-will magnet was it to pretend , but to prick the bladder of pretence . [He]285-will magnet was [a fairish man of forty , pale , with a large protuberant , observant grey eye]948-a fairish man of forty , pale , with a large protuberant , observant grey eye — [I]0-i speak particularly of the left — and a face of quiet animation warily alert for the wit 's opportunity . [His]285-will magnet nose and chin were pointed , and [his]285-will magnet lips thin and quaintly pressed together . [He]285-will magnet was dressed in grey , with a low - collared silken shirt showing a thin neck , and a flowing black tie , and [he]285-will magnet carried a grey felt hat in [his]285-will magnet joined hands behind [his]285-will magnet back . [He]285-will magnet was in a dark bluish - grey suit ; a black tie that was quite unusually broad went twice around [his]285-will magnet neck before succumbing to the bow , and [his]285-will magnet waistcoat appeared to be of some gaily - patterned orange silk . [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's eyes returned to [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet . It was funny how [his]285-will magnet tie came out under [his]285-will magnet chin to the right . What [an odd thing]955-an odd thing [men]600-men 's dress had become , [she]323-marjorie thought . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope had fallen into a pleasant musing ; several other ripe old yarns , dear delicious old things , had come into [his]246-mr. pope mind that [he]246-mr. pope felt [he]246-mr. pope might presently recall when this unavoidable display of accomplishments was overpast , and it was with one of them almost on [his]246-mr. pope lips that [he]246-mr. pope glanced across at [[his]246-mr. pope guest]1004-his guest . [He]246-mr. pope was surprised to see [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet 's face transfigured . [He]246-mr. pope was sitting forward , looking up at [Marjorie]323-marjorie , and [he]246-mr. pope had caught something of the expression of [those blessed boys who froth at the feet of an Assumption]1005-those blessed boys who froth at the feet of an assumption . For an instant [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope did not understand . Then [he]246-mr. pope understood . It was [Marjorie]323-marjorie ! [He]246-mr. pope had a twinge of surprise , and glanced at [[his]246-mr. pope own daughter]1006-his own daughter as though [he]246-mr. pope had never seen [her]1006-his own daughter before . [He]246-mr. pope perceived in a flash for the first time that [this troublesome , clever , disrespectful child]1007-this troublesome , clever , disrespectful child was tall and shapely and sweet , and indeed quite [a beautiful young woman]1008-a beautiful young woman . [He]246-mr. pope forgot [his]246-mr. pope anecdotes . [His]246-mr. pope being was suffused with pride and responsibility and the sense of virtue rewarded . [He]246-mr. pope did not reflect for a moment that [Marjorie]323-marjorie embodied in almost equal proportions the very best points in [[his]246-mr. pope mother]970-his mother and [[his]246-mr. pope mother - in - law]997-his mother - in - law , and avoided [his]246-mr. pope own more salient characteristics with so neat a dexterity that from top to toe , except for the one matter of colour , not only did [she]323-marjorie not resemble [him]246-mr. pope but [she]323-marjorie scarcely even alluded to [him]246-mr. pope . [He]246-mr. pope thought simply that [she]323-marjorie was [[his]246-mr. pope daughter]576-his daughter , that [she]323-marjorie derived from [him]246-mr. pope , that [her]323-marjorie beauty was [his]246-mr. pope . [She]323-marjorie was the outcome of [his]246-mr. pope meritorious preparations . [He]246-mr. pope recalled all the moments when [he]246-mr. pope had been kind and indulgent to [her]323-marjorie , all the bills [he]246-mr. pope had paid for [her]323-marjorie ; all the stresses and trials of the coach - building collapse , all the fluctuations of [his]246-mr. pope speculative adventures , became things [he]246-mr. pope had faced patiently and valiantly for [her]323-marjorie sake . [He]246-mr. pope forgot the endless times when [he]246-mr. pope had been viciously cross with [her]323-marjorie , all the times when [he]246-mr. pope had pished and tushed and sworn in [her]323-marjorie hearing . [He]246-mr. pope had on provocation and in spite of [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother 's protests slapped [her]323-marjorie pretty vigorously , but such things are better forgotten ; nor did [he]246-mr. pope recall how bitterly [he]246-mr. pope had opposed the college education which had made [her]323-marjorie now so clear in eye and thought , nor [the frightful shindy]1013-the frightful shindy , only three months since , about that identical green dress in which [she]323-marjorie now stood delightful . [He]246-mr. pope forgot these petty details , as [an idealist]1014-an idealist should . There [she]323-marjorie was , [[his]246-mr. pope daughter]576-his daughter . An immense benevolence irradiated [his]246-mr. pope soul — for [Marjorie]323-marjorie — for [Magnet]286-mr. magnet . [His]246-mr. pope eyes were suffused with a not ignoble tenderness . [The man]1016-the man , [he]246-mr. pope knew , was worth at least thirty - five thousand pounds , a discussion of investments had made that clear , and [he]1016-the man must be making at least five thousand a year ! [A beautiful girl]1017-a beautiful girl , [a worthy man]1018-a worthy man ! [A good fellow]1019-a good fellow , [a sound good fellow]1020-a sound good fellow , [a careful fellow]1021-a careful fellow too — as [these fellows]1022-these fellows went ! [Old Daddy]278-daddy would lose [his]278-daddy treasure of course . Indeed , it was rare that [any one]1035-any one won but [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . It was called " [The Great Departed]292-the great departed , "[287-mr. wintersloan] and it had such considerable educational value that all [the children]1036-the children had to play at it whenever [he]246-mr. pope wished . It was played in this manner ; [one of [the pseudo twins]1038-the pseudo twins]1037-one of the pseudo twins opened a book and dabbed a finger on the page , and read out the letter immediately at the tip of [her]1037-one of the pseudo twins finger , then [all of [them]1039-all of them]1039-all of them began to write as hard as [they]1039-all of them could , writing down the names of [every great person [they]1039-all of them could think of , whose name began with that letter]1040-every great person they could think of , whose name began with that letter . At the end of five minutes [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope said Stop ! and then began to read [his]246-mr. pope list out , beginning with the first name . [Everybody who had that name]1041-everybody who had that name crossed it out and scored one , and after [his]246-mr. pope list was exhausted [all the surviving names on the next list]1042-all the surviving names on the next list were read over in the same way , and so on . It was great fun . "[323-marjorie] " Oh ! here goes , "[286-mr. magnet] and [she]323-marjorie stood up and grappled with the task of undressing . It was presently quite evident to [Marjorie]323-marjorie that [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet intended to propose marriage to [her]323-marjorie , and [she]323-marjorie did not even know whether [she]323-marjorie wanted [him]286-mr. magnet to do so . [She]323-marjorie had met [him]286-mr. magnet first the previous summer while [she]323-marjorie had been staying with [the Petley - Cresthams]320-the petley - cresthams at [High Windower]32-high windower , and it had been evident that [he]286-mr. magnet found [her]323-marjorie extremely attractive . [She]323-marjorie had never had [a real grown man]1065-a real grown man at [her]323-marjorie feet before , and [she]323-marjorie had found it amazingly entertaining . [She]323-marjorie had gone for a walk with [him]286-mr. magnet the morning before [she]323-marjorie came away — a frank and ingenuous proceeding that made [Mrs. Petley - Crestham]321-mrs. petley - crestham say [the girl]1066-the girl knew what [she]323-marjorie was about , and [she]323-marjorie had certainly coquetted with [him]286-mr. magnet in an extraordinary manner at golf - croquet . After that [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge had swallowed [her]323-marjorie up , and though [he]286-mr. magnet had called once on [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother while [Marjorie]323-marjorie was in [London]17-london during the Christmas vacation , [he]286-mr. magnet had n't seen [her]323-marjorie again . [He]286-mr. magnet had written — which was exciting — a long friendly humorous letter about nothing in particular , with an air of its being quite the correct thing for [him]286-mr. magnet to do , and [she]323-marjorie had answered , and there had been other exchanges . But all sorts of things had happened in the interval , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie had let [him]286-mr. magnet get into quite a back place in [her]323-marjorie thoughts — the fact that [he]286-mr. magnet was [a member of [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father 's club]1068-a member of her father 's club had seemed somehow to remove [him]286-mr. magnet from a great range of possibilities — until a drift in [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother 's talk towards [him]286-mr. magnet and a letter from [him]286-mr. magnet with an indefinable change in tone towards intimacy , had restored [him]286-mr. magnet to importance . Now here [he]286-mr. magnet was in the foreground of [[her]323-marjorie world]1071-her world again , evidently more ardent than ever , and with a portentous air of being about to do something decisive at the very first opportunity . What was [he]286-mr. magnet going to do ? What had [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother been hinting at ? And what , in fact , did the whole thing amount to ? [Marjorie]323-marjorie was beginning to realize that this was going to be a very serious affair indeed for [her]323-marjorie — and that [she]323-marjorie was totally unprepared to meet it . It had been very amusing , very amusing indeed , at the [Petley - Cresthams]320-the petley - cresthams ' , but there were moments now when [she]323-marjorie felt towards [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet exactly as [she]323-marjorie would have felt if [he]286-mr. magnet had been [one of [the Oxbridge tradesmen hovering about [her]323-marjorie]1074-the oxbridge tradesmen hovering about her]1073-one of the oxbridge tradesmen hovering about her with a " little account , "[667-the boys] full of apparently exaggerated items .... [Her]323-marjorie thoughts and feelings were all in confusion about this business . [Her]323-marjorie mind was full of scraps , every sort of idea , every sort of attitude contributed something to that Twentieth Century jumble . For example , and so far as its value went among motives , it was by no means a trivial consideration ; [she]323-marjorie wanted a proposal for its own sake . [Daffy]258-daffy had had a proposal last year , and although it was n't any sort of eligible proposal , still there it was , and [she]323-marjorie had given [herself]323-marjorie tremendous airs . But [Marjorie]323-marjorie would certainly have preferred some lighter kind of proposal than that which now threatened [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie felt that behind [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet were sanctions ; that [she]323-marjorie was n't free to deal with this proposal as [she]323-marjorie liked . [He]286-mr. magnet was at [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet almost with the air of being [[her]323-marjorie parents]1075-her parents ' guest . Less clear and more instinctive than [her]323-marjorie desire for a proposal was [her]323-marjorie inclination to see just all that [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was disposed to do , and hear all that [he]286-mr. magnet was disposed to say . [She]323-marjorie was curious . [He]286-mr. magnet did n't behave in the least as [she]323-marjorie had expected [a lover]1076-a lover to behave . But then [none of [the boys]667-the boys]1077-none of the boys , [the " others "[322-shakespeare] with whom [she]323-marjorie had at times stretched a hand towards the hem of emotion]1079-the " others " with whom she had at times stretched a hand towards the hem of emotion , had ever done that . [She]323-marjorie had an obscure feeling that perhaps presently [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet must light up , be stirred and stirring . Even now [his]286-mr. magnet voice changed very interestingly when [he]286-mr. magnet was alone with [her]323-marjorie . [His]286-mr. magnet breath seemed to go — as though something had pricked [his]286-mr. magnet lung . If it had n't been for that new , disconcerting realization of an official pressure behind [him]286-mr. magnet , [I]0-i think [she]323-marjorie would have been quite ready to experiment extensively with [his]286-mr. magnet emotions .... But [she]323-marjorie perceived as [she]323-marjorie lay awake next morning that [she]323-marjorie was n't free for experiments any longer . What [she]323-marjorie might say or do now would be taken up very conclusively . And [she]323-marjorie had no idea what [she]323-marjorie wanted to say or do . Marriage regarded in the abstract — that is to say , with [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet out of focus — was by no means an unattractive proposal to [her]323-marjorie . It was very much at the back of [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind that after [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge , unless [she]323-marjorie was prepared to face a very serious row indeed and go to teach in [a school]1080-a school — and [she]323-marjorie did n't feel any call whatever to teach in [a school]1080-a school — [she]323-marjorie would probably have to return to [Hartstone Square]18-hartstone square and share [[Daffy]258-daffy 's room]1082-daffy 's room again , and assist in the old collective , wearisome task of propitiating [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father . The freedoms of [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge had enlarged [her]323-marjorie imagination until that seemed an almost unendurably irksome prospect . [She]323-marjorie had tasted life as it could be in [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father 's absence , and [she]323-marjorie was beginning to realize just what [an impossible person]1085-an impossible person [he]572-her father was . Marriage was escape from all that ; it meant not only [respectful parents]1086-respectful parents but [a house of [her]323-marjorie very own]1087-a house of her very own , furniture of [her]323-marjorie choice , great freedom of movement , an authority , an importance . [She]323-marjorie had seen what it meant to be [a prosperously married young woman in the person of [one or two resplendent old girls revisiting [Bennett College]19-bennett college]1089-one or two resplendent old girls revisiting bennett college , scattering invitations , offering protections and opportunities .... Of course there is love]1088-a prosperously married young woman in the person of one or two resplendent old girls revisiting bennett college , scattering invitations , offering protections and opportunities .... of course there is love . [Marjorie]323-marjorie told [herself]323-marjorie , as [she]323-marjorie had been trained to tell [herself]323-marjorie , to be sensible , but something within [her]323-marjorie repeated : there is love . Of course [she]323-marjorie liked [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet . [She]323-marjorie really did like [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet very much . [She]323-marjorie had had [her]323-marjorie girlish dreams , had fallen in love with pictures of [men]600-men and [actors]1091-actors and [a music master]1092-a music master and [a man who used to ride by as [she]323-marjorie went to [school]619-school]1093-a man who used to ride by as she went to school ; but was n't this desolating desire for self - abandonment rather silly?—something that one left behind with much else when it came to putting up [one]675-one 's hair and sensible living , something to blush secretly about and hide from every eye ? Among other discrepant views that lived together in [her]323-marjorie mind as cats and rats and parrots and squirrels and so forth used to live together in those Happy Family cages [unseemly men in less well - regulated days]1096-unseemly men in less well - regulated days were wo nt to steer about [[our]1097-our streets]1098-our streets , was one instilled by quite a large proportion of the novels [she]323-marjorie had read , that [a girl]1099-a girl was a sort of self - giving prize for high moral worth . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet [she]323-marjorie knew was good , was kind , was brave with that truer courage , moral courage , which goes with [his]286-mr. magnet type of physique ; [he]286-mr. magnet was modest , unassuming , well off and famous , and very much in love with [her]323-marjorie . [His]286-mr. magnet True Self , as [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope had pointed out several times , must be really very beautiful , and in some odd way a line of [Shakespeare]322-shakespeare had washed up in [her]323-marjorie consciousness as being somehow effectual on [his]286-mr. magnet behalf : " Love looks not with the eye but with the mind . "[323-marjorie] [She]323-marjorie felt [she]323-marjorie ought to look with the mind . [Nice people]1100-nice people surely never looked in any other way . It seemed from this angle almost [her]323-marjorie duty to love [him]286-mr. magnet .... Perhaps [she]323-marjorie did love [him]286-mr. magnet , and mistook the symptoms . [She]323-marjorie did [her]323-marjorie best to mistake the symptoms . But if [she]323-marjorie did truly love [him]286-mr. magnet , would it seem so queer and important and antagonistic as it did that [his]286-mr. magnet hair was rather thin upon the crown of [his]286-mr. magnet head ? [She]323-marjorie wished [she]323-marjorie had n't looked down on [him]286-mr. magnet .... [Poor Marjorie]323-marjorie ! [She]323-marjorie was doing [her]323-marjorie best to be sensible , and [she]323-marjorie felt [herself]323-marjorie adrift above a clamorous abyss of feared and forbidden thoughts . Down there [she]323-marjorie knew well enough it was n't thus that love must come . Deep in [her]323-marjorie soul , the richest thing in [her]323-marjorie life indeed and the best thing [she]323-marjorie had to give humanity , was a craving for beauty that at times became almost intolerable , a craving for something other than beauty and yet inseparably allied with it , a craving for deep excitement , for a sort of glory in adventure , for passion — for things akin to great music and heroic poems and bannered traditions of romance . [She]323-marjorie had hidden away in [her]323-marjorie an immense tumultuous appetite for life , an immense tumultuous capacity for living . To be loved beautifully was surely the crown and climax of [her]323-marjorie being . [She]323-marjorie did not dare to listen to these deeps , yet these insurgent voices filled [her]323-marjorie . Even while [she]323-marjorie drove [her]323-marjorie little crocodile of primly sensible thoughts to their sane appointed conclusion , [her]323-marjorie blood and nerves and all [her]323-marjorie being were protesting that [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet would not do , that whatever other worthiness was in [him]286-mr. magnet , regarded as [a lover]1076-a lover [he]286-mr. magnet was preposterous and flat and foolish and middle - aged , and that it were better never to have lived than to put the treasure of [her]323-marjorie life to [his]286-mr. magnet meagre lips and into [his]286-mr. magnet hungry , unattractive arms . " The ugliness of it ! The spiritless horror of it ! "[323-marjorie] so dumbly and formlessly the rebel voices urged . " [One]675-one has to be sensible , "[325-lady petchworth] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie to [herself]323-marjorie , suddenly putting down [Shaw]324-shaw 's book on [Municipal Trading]34-municipal trading , which [she]323-marjorie imagined [she]323-marjorie had been reading .... ( Perhaps all marriage was horrid , and [one]675-one had to get over it . ) That was rather what [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother had conveyed to [her]323-marjorie . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet made [his]286-mr. magnet first proposal in form three days later , after coming twice to tea and staying on to supper . [He]286-mr. magnet had played croquet with [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , [he]286-mr. magnet had been beaten twelve times in spite of twinges in the sprained ankle — heroically borne — had had three victories lucidly explained away , and heard all the particulars of the East Purblow experiment three times over , first in relation to the new Labour Exchanges , then regarded at rather a different angle in relation to [female betting]1104-female betting , [tally - men]1105-tally - men , and the sanctities of [the home]1106-the home generally , and finally in a more exhaustive style , to show its full importance from every side and more particularly as demonstrating the gross injustice done to [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope by the neglect of its lessons , a neglect too systematic to be accidental , in the social reform literature of the time . Moreover , [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet had been made to understand thoroughly how several later quasi - charitable attempts of [a similar character]1107-a similar character had already become , or must inevitably become , unsatisfactory through [their]1108-their failure to follow exactly in the lines laid down by [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope was really very anxious to be pleasant and agreeable to [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet , and [he]246-mr. pope could think of no surer way of doing so than by giving [him]286-mr. magnet an unrestrained intimacy of conversation that prevented anything more than momentary intercourse between [[his]246-mr. pope daughter]576-his daughter and [[her]576-his daughter admirer]1110-her admirer . And not only did [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet find it difficult to get away from [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope without offence , but whenever by any chance [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope was detached for a moment [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet discovered that [Marjorie]323-marjorie either was n't to be seen , or if [she]323-marjorie was [she]323-marjorie was n't to be isolated by any device [he]286-mr. magnet could contrive , before the unappeasable return of [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet did not get [his]286-mr. magnet chance therefore until [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's little gathering at [Summerhay Park]35-summerhay park . [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth was [[Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope 's oldest friend]1111-mrs. pope 's oldest friend , and one of those brighter influences which save [[our]1112-our [English country]1114-english country - side]1113-our english country - side from lassitude . [She]325-lady petchworth had been more fortunate than [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope , for while [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope with that aptitude for disadvantage natural to [his]246-mr. pope temperament had , [he]246-mr. pope said , been tied to a business that never gave [him]246-mr. pope a chance , [[Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's husband]1115-lady petchworth 's husband had been [a reckless investor of exceptional good - luck]1116-a reckless investor of exceptional good - luck . In particular , led by a dream , [he]1115-lady petchworth 's husband had put most of [his]1115-lady petchworth 's husband money into a series of nitrate deposits in caves in [Saghalien]36-saghalien haunted by benevolent penguins , and had been rewarded beyond the dreams of avarice . [His]1115-lady petchworth 's husband foresight had received the fitting reward of a knighthood , and [Sir Thomas]326-sir thomas , after restoring [the Parish Church]1117-the parish church at [Summerhay]37-summerhay in a costly and destructive manner , spent [his]1115-lady petchworth 's husband declining years in an enviable contentment with [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth and [the world]589-the world at large , and died long before infirmity made [him]1115-lady petchworth 's husband really troublesome . Good fortune had brought out [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's social aptitudes . [Summerhay Park]35-summerhay park was everything that [a clever woman , inspired by that gardening literature which has been so abundant in the opening years of the twentieth century]1119-a clever woman , inspired by that gardening literature which has been so abundant in the opening years of the twentieth century , could make it . [It]35-summerhay park had rosaries and [rock gardens]1120-rock gardens , sundials and yew hedges , [pools and ponds]1121-pools and ponds , lead figures and stone urns , box borderings and wilderness corners and hundreds and hundreds of feet of prematurely - aged red - brick wall with broad herbaceous borders ; the walks had primroses , primulas and cowslips in a quite disingenuous abundance , and in spring the whole extent of [the park]1122-the park was gay , here with thousands of this sort of daffodil just bursting out and here with thousands of that sort of narcissus just past its prime , and every patch ready to pass itself off in its naturalized way as the accidental native flower of [the field]1123-the field , if only it had n't been for all the other different varieties coming on or wilting - off in adjacent patches .... [[Her]325-lady petchworth garden]1124-her garden was only the beginning of [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's activities . [She]325-lady petchworth had [a model dairy]1125-a model dairy , and all [her]325-lady petchworth poultry was white , and so far as [she]325-lady petchworth was able to manage it [she]325-lady petchworth made [Summerhay]37-summerhay [a model village]1126-a model village . [She]325-lady petchworth overflowed with activities , it was astonishing in one so plump and blonde , and meeting followed meeting in [the artistic little red - brick and green - stained timber village hall [she]325-lady petchworth had erected]1127-the artistic little red - brick and green - stained timber village hall she had erected . Now it was [the National Theatre]1128-the national theatre and now it was [the National Mourning]1129-the national mourning ; now it was the Break Up of the Poor Law , and now the Majority Report , now the Mothers ' Union , and now Socialism , and now Individualism , but always something progressive and beneficial . [She]325-lady petchworth did [her]325-lady petchworth best to revive the old village life , and brought [her]325-lady petchworth very considerable powers of compulsion to make [the men]984-the men dance in simple old Morris dances , dressed up in costumes [they]984-the men secretly abominated , and to induce [the mothers]1131-the mothers to dress [[their]1131-the mothers children]1132-their children in art - coloured smocks instead of the prints and blue serge frocks [they]1131-the mothers preferred . [Her]325-lady petchworth little gatherings were quite distinctive of [her]325-lady petchworth . "[323-marjorie] When [Marjorie]323-marjorie said " Good - night , "[572-her father] [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope kissed [her]323-marjorie with an unaccustomed effusion . Subsequent events greatly intensified this persuasion . A pair of new stockings [she]323-marjorie had trusted sprang a bad hole as [she]323-marjorie put them on . [She]323-marjorie found two unmistakable bills from [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge beside [her]323-marjorie plate , and [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father was " horrid "[258-daffy] at breakfast . [[Her]323-marjorie father]572-her father , it appeared , had bought the ordinary shares of [a Cuban railway]1225-a cuban railway very extensively , on the distinct understanding that they would improve . In a decent universe , with a proper respect for [meritorious gentlemen]1226-meritorious gentlemen , these shares would have improved accordingly , but the weather had seen fit to shatter the wisdom of [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope altogether . The sugar crop had collapsed , the bears were at work , and every morning now saw [his]246-mr. pope nominal capital diminished by a dozen pounds or so . [I]0-i do not know what [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope would have done if [he]246-mr. pope had not had [[his]246-mr. pope family]831-his family to help [him]246-mr. pope bear [his]246-mr. pope trouble . Half foo ' . "[323-marjorie] [Marjorie]323-marjorie wanted to know why [every one]4731-every one did n't get up and leave [the room]813-the room . " [I]323-marjorie know that 's wrong , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie , and rested [her]323-marjorie chin on [her]323-marjorie hand , knitted [her]323-marjorie brows and tried to remember the details of orders and deliveries .... [Marjorie]323-marjorie had fallen into the net prepared for [[our]1234-our sons]1235-our sons and [daughters]1236-daughters by the delicate modesty of [the Oxbridge authorities]1237-the oxbridge authorities in money matters , and [she]323-marjorie was , for [her]323-marjorie circumstances , rather heavily in debt . But [I]0-i must admit that in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's nature the [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge conditions had found an eager and adventurous streak that rendered [her]323-marjorie particularly apt to these temptations . [I]0-i doubt if reticence is really a virtue in [a teacher]1238-a teacher . But this is a fearful world , and [the majority of those who instruct [[our]1234-our youth]1240-our youth]1239-the majority of those who instruct our youth have the painful sensitiveness of the cloistered soul to this spirit of terror in things . [The young]1241-the young need particularly to be told truthfully and fully all [we]1234-our know of three fundamental things : the first of which is [God]249-god , the next [their]1241-the young duty towards [[their]1241-the young neighbours]1242-their neighbours in the matter of work and money , and the third Sex . These things , and the adequate why of them , and some sort of adequate how , make all that matters in education . But all three are obscure and deeply moving topics , topics for which [the donnish mind]1243-the donnish mind has a kind of special ineptitude , and which it evades with the utmost skill and delicacy . The middle part of this evaded triad was now being taken up in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's case by [the Oxbridge tradespeople]1244-the oxbridge tradespeople . [The Oxbridge shopkeeper]1245-the oxbridge shopkeeper is peculiar among [shopkeepers]1246-shopkeepers in the fact that [he]1245-the oxbridge shopkeeper has to do very largely with [shy and immature customers]1247-shy and immature customers with an extreme and distinctive ignorance of most commercial things . [They]1247-shy and immature customers are for the most part short of cash , but with vague and often large probabilities of credit behind [them]1247-shy and immature customers , for [most people]1248-most people , even quite [straitened people]1249-straitened people , will pull [[their]1248-most people sons]1250-their sons and [daughters]1236-daughters out of altogether unreasonable debts at the end of [their]1248-most people university career ; and so [the Oxbridge shopkeeper]1245-the oxbridge shopkeeper becomes [a sort of propagandist of the charms and advantages of insolvency]1253-a sort of propagandist of the charms and advantages of insolvency . Alone among [retailers]1254-retailers [he]1245-the oxbridge shopkeeper dislikes the sight of cash , declines it , affects to regard it as a coarse ignorant truncation of a budding relationship , begs to be permitted to wait . So [the youngster]1255-the youngster just up from [home]810-home discovers that money may stay in the pocket , be used for [cab and train]1257-cab and train fares and light refreshments ; all the rest may be had for the asking . [Marjorie]323-marjorie , with [her]323-marjorie innate hunger for good fine things , with [her]323-marjorie quite insufficient pocket - money , and the irregular habits of expenditure [a spasmodically financed , hard - up [home]810-home]1258-a spasmodically financed , hard - up home is apt to engender , fell very readily into this new , delightful custom of having it put down ( whatever it happened to be ) . [She]323-marjorie had all sorts of things put down . [She]323-marjorie and [the elder Carmel girl]1260-the elder carmel girl used to go shopping together , having things put down . [She]323-marjorie brightened [[her]323-marjorie rooms]1261-her rooms with colour - prints and engravings , got [herself]323-marjorie pretty and becoming clothes , acquired a fitted dressing - bag already noted in this story , and one or two other trifles of the sort , revised [her]323-marjorie foot - wear , created a very nice little bookshelf , and although at times [she]323-marjorie felt a little astonished and scared at [herself]323-marjorie , resolutely refused to estimate the total of accumulated debt [she]323-marjorie had attained . Indeed until the bills came in it was impossible to do that , because , following the splendid example of [the Carmel girl]1262-the carmel girl , [she]323-marjorie had n't even inquired the price of quite a number of things .... [She]323-marjorie did n't dare think now of the total . [She]323-marjorie lied even to [herself]323-marjorie about that . [She]323-marjorie had fixed on fifty pounds as the unendurable maximum . " It is less than fifty pounds , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie said , and added : " must be . "[1263-the oxbridge tradesman] But something in [her]323-marjorie below the threshold of consciousness knew that it was more . And now [she]323-marjorie was in [her]323-marjorie third year , and [the Oxbridge tradesman]1263-the oxbridge tradesman , generally satisfied with the dimensions of [her]323-marjorie account , and no longer anxious to see it grow , was displaying the less obsequious side of [his]1263-the oxbridge tradesman character . [He]1263-the oxbridge tradesman wrote remarks at the bottom of [his]1263-the oxbridge tradesman account , remarks about settlement , about having a bill to meet , about having something to go on with . [He]1263-the oxbridge tradesman asked [her]323-marjorie to give the matter [her]323-marjorie " early attention . "[323-marjorie] [She]323-marjorie had a disagreeable persuasion that if [she]323-marjorie wanted many more things anywhere [she]323-marjorie would have to pay ready money for them . [She]323-marjorie was particularly short of stockings . [She]323-marjorie had overlooked stockings recently . [Daffy]258-daffy , unfortunately , was also short of stockings . And now , back with [[her]323-marjorie family]570-her family again , everything conspired to remind [Marjorie]323-marjorie of the old stringent habits from which [she]323-marjorie had had so delightful an interlude . [She]323-marjorie saw [Daffy]258-daffy eye [her]323-marjorie possessions , reflect . This morning something of the awfulness of [her]323-marjorie position came to [her]323-marjorie .... " [I]323-marjorie 'd swear [I]323-marjorie have n't had three pairs of house shoes , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie . " But what can [one]675-one do ? "[323-marjorie] And about the whole position the question was , " what can one do ? " [Madge]323-marjorie , "[259-theodore] said [Theodore]259-theodore , appearing in the sunshine of the doorway . " [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's coming ! "[253-aunt plessington] [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's descent was due to [her]253-aunt plessington sudden discovery that [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet was in close proximity to [Summerhay Park]35-summerhay park , indeed only three miles away . [She]253-aunt plessington had promised a lecture on [her]253-aunt plessington movement for [[Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's village room in [Summerhay]37-summerhay]1266-lady petchworth 's village room in summerhay , and [she]253-aunt plessington found that with a slight readjustment of dates [she]253-aunt plessington could combine this engagement with [her]253-aunt plessington promised visit to [[[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband 's sister]1268-her husband 's sister , and an evening or so of influence for [[her]253-aunt plessington little [Madge]323-marjorie]1269-her little madge . "[338-hubert] There , at any rate , [she]253-aunt plessington was , and [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert was up [the platform]1270-the platform seeing after the luggage , in [his]338-hubert small anxious way . [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington was [a tall lean woman , with firm features , a high colour and a bright eye]1272-a tall lean woman , with firm features , a high colour and a bright eye , who wore hats to show [she]253-aunt plessington despised them , and carefully dishevelled hair . [Her]253-aunt plessington dress was always good , but extremely old and grubby , and [she]253-aunt plessington commanded respect chiefly by [her]253-aunt plessington voice . [Her]253-aunt plessington voice was the true governing - class voice , a strangulated contralto , abundant and authoritative ; it made everything [she]253-aunt plessington said clear and important , so that if [she]253-aunt plessington said it was a fine morning it was like leaded print in the Times , and [she]253-aunt plessington had over [her]253-aunt plessington large front teeth lips that closed quietly and with a slight effort after [her]253-aunt plessington speeches , as if the words [she]253-aunt plessington spoke tasted well and left a peaceful , secure sensation in the mouth . [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert was [a less distinguished figure]1273-a less distinguished figure , and just a little reminiscent of [the small attached husbands one finds among [the lower crustacea]1275-the lower crustacea]1274-the small attached husbands one finds among the lower crustacea : [he]338-hubert was much shorter and rounder than [[his]338-hubert wife]848-his wife , and if [he]338-hubert had been left to [himself]338-hubert , [he]338-hubert would probably have been comfortably fat in [his]338-hubert quiet little way . But [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington had made [him]338-hubert [a Haigite]1277-a haigite , which is one of the fiercer kinds of hygienist , just in the nick of time . [He]338-hubert had round shoulders , a large nose , and glasses that made [him]338-hubert look astonished — and [she]253-aunt plessington said [he]338-hubert had a great gift for practical things , and made [him]338-hubert see after everything in that line while [she]253-aunt plessington did the lecturing . "[323-marjorie] " A second 's good enough for [me]253-aunt plessington , [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert , "[253-aunt plessington] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie , and asked if [they]1281-they would rather walk or go in [the donkey cart]1282-the donkey cart , which was waiting outside with [Daffy]258-daffy .
