But [no pseudo - twins]1285-no pseudo - twins or [Theodore]259-theodore came to meet this arrival , as [both uncle]1286-both uncle and [aunt]1287-aunt had a way of asking how the lessons were getting on that [they]1281-they found extremely disagreeable . Also , [[their]1281-they aunt]1288-their aunt measured [them]1281-they , and incited [them]1281-they with loud encouraging noises to grow one against the other in an urgent , disturbing fashion . [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's being was consumed by thoughts of getting on . [She]253-aunt plessington was like [Bernard Shaw]324-shaw 's life force , and [she]253-aunt plessington really did not seem to think there was anything in existence but shoving . [She]253-aunt plessington had no idea what a lark life can be , and occasionally how beautiful it can be when [you]1289-you do not shove , if only , which becomes increasingly hard each year , [you]1289-you can get away from [the shovers]1290-the shovers . [She]253-aunt plessington was [one of [an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained [themselves]1292-an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained themselves against a mutual pressure by the use of their elbows from the cradle against a mutual pressure by the use of [their]1292-an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained themselves against a mutual pressure by the use of their elbows from the cradle elbows from the cradle]1292-an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained themselves against a mutual pressure by the use of their elbows from the cradle]1291-one of an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained themselves against a mutual pressure by the use of their elbows from the cradle . [They]1292-an energetic family of eight sisters who had maintained themselves against a mutual pressure by the use of their elbows from the cradle had all married against [each other]709-each other , all sorts of [people]631-people ; two had driven [[their]1295-their husbands]1296-their husbands into [bishoprics]1297-bishoprics and made quite [[typical bishop]1298-typical bishop 's wives]1299-typical bishop 's wives , one got [a leading barrister]1300-a leading barrister , [one a high war - office official]1301-one a high war - office official , and [one a rich Jew]1302-one a rich jew , and [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , after spending some years in just missing [a rich and only slightly demented baronet]1303-a rich and only slightly demented baronet , had pounced — it 's the only word for it — on [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert . " [A woman]4857-a woman is nothing without [a husband]4858-a husband , "[253-aunt plessington] [she]253-aunt plessington said , and took [him]338-hubert . [He]338-hubert was [a fairly comfortable Oxford don]1304-a fairly comfortable oxford don in [his]338-hubert furtive way , and bringing [him]338-hubert out and using [him]338-hubert as a basis , [she]253-aunt plessington specialized in intellectual philanthropy and evolved [her]253-aunt plessington Movement . It was quite remarkable how rapidly [she]253-aunt plessington overhauled [[her]253-aunt plessington sisters]1305-her sisters again . What the Movement was , varied considerably from time to time , but it was always aggressively beneficial towards [the lower strata of [the community]1307-the community]1306-the lower strata of the community . Among [its]1308-its central ideas was [her]253-aunt plessington belief that [these lower strata]1309-these lower strata can no more be trusted to eat than [they]1309-these lower strata can to drink , and that the licensing monopoly which has made [the poor man]1310-the poor man 's beer thick , lukewarm and discreditable , and so greatly minimized its consumption , should be extended to the solid side of [his]1310-the poor man dietary . [She]253-aunt plessington wanted to place considerable restrictions upon the sale of all sorts of meat , upon groceries and the less hygienic and more palatable forms of bread ( which do not sufficiently stimulate the coatings of the stomach ) , to increase the present difficulties in the way of [tobacco purchasers]1311-tobacco purchasers , and to put an end to that wanton and deleterious consumption of sweets which has so bad an effect upon the enamel of the teeth of [the younger generation]1312-the younger generation . Closely interwoven with these proposals was an adoption of the principle of the East Purblow Experiment , the principle of Payment in Kind . [She]253-aunt plessington was quite in agreement with [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope that [poor people]1313-poor people , when [they]1313-poor people had money , frittered it away , and so [she]253-aunt plessington proposed very extensive changes in the Truck Act , which could enable [employers , under suitable safeguards]1314-employers , under suitable safeguards , and with the advice of [a small body of [spinster inspectors]1316-spinster inspectors]1315-a small body of spinster inspectors , to supply [hygienic housing]1317-hygienic housing , approved clothing of moral and wholesome sort , various forms of insurance , edifying rations , cuisine , medical aid and educational facilities as circumstances seemed to justify , in lieu of the wages [the employees]1318-the employees handled so ill .... As [no people in [England]9-england]1319-no people in england will ever admit [they]1319-no people in england belong to [the lower strata of society]1320-the lower strata of society , [[Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's Movement]1321-aunt plessington 's movement attracted [[adherents]1322-adherents from every class in [the community]1307-the community]1323-adherents from every class in the community . [She]253-aunt plessington now , as [they]1325-they drove slowly to [the vicarage]734-the vicarage , recounted to [Marjorie]323-marjorie — [she]253-aunt plessington had the utmost contempt for [Daffy]258-daffy because of [her]253-aunt plessington irregular teeth and a general lack of progressive activity — the steady growth of the Movement , and the increasing respect shown for [her]253-aunt plessington and [Hubert]338-hubert in the world of politico - social reform . Some of the meetings [she]253-aunt plessington had addressed had been quite full , [various people]1327-various people had made various remarks about [her]253-aunt plessington , hostile for the most part and yet insidiously flattering , and [everybody]1328-everybody seemed quite glad to come to the little dinners [she]253-aunt plessington gave in order , [she]253-aunt plessington said , to gather social support for [her]253-aunt plessington reforms . [She]253-aunt plessington had been staying with [the Mastersteins]339-the mastersteins , who were keenly interested , and after [she]253-aunt plessington had polished off [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth [she]253-aunt plessington was to visit [Lady Rosenbaum]340-lady rosenbaum . [I]253-aunt plessington do not think that [any one]1035-any one can accuse [its editor]4881-its editor of being unmindful of [his]4881-its editor great responsibilities — — "[253-aunt plessington] [Marjorie]323-marjorie found it a very interesting conversation . [She]323-marjorie always met [[her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt again with a renewal of a kind of admiration . That loud authoritative rudeness , that bold thrusting forward of the Movement until it became the sole criterion of worth or success , this annihilation by disregard of all that [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington was n't and did n't and could n't , always in the intervals seemed too good to be true . Of course this really was the way [people]631-people got on and made a mark , but [she]323-marjorie felt it must be almost as trying to the nerves as aeronautics . Suppose , somewhere up [there]1343-there [your]1344-your engine stopped ! How [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington dominated the table ! [Marjorie]323-marjorie tried not to catch [Daffy]258-daffy 's eye . [Daffy]258-daffy was unostentatiously keeping things going , watching the mustard , rescuing the butter , restraining [Theodore]259-theodore , and [I]0-i am afraid not listening very carefully to [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington . [The children]1036-the children were marvellously silent and jumpily well - behaved , and [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , in a very unusual state of subdued amiability , sat at the end of the table with the East Purblow experiment on the tip of [his]246-mr. pope tongue . [He]246-mr. pope liked [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , and [she]253-aunt plessington was good for [him]246-mr. pope . [They]1036-the children had the same inherent distrust of the intelligence and good intentions of [[their]1036-the children fellow creatures]1346-their fellow creatures , and [she]253-aunt plessington had the knack of making [him]246-mr. pope feel that [he]246-mr. pope too was getting on , that [she]253-aunt plessington was saying things on [his]246-mr. pope behalf in influential quarters , and in spite of the almost universal conspiracy ( based on jealousy ) to ignore [his]246-mr. pope stern old - world virtues , [he]246-mr. pope might still be able to battle [his]246-mr. pope way to the floor of [the House of Commons]1347-the house of commons and there deliver [himself]246-mr. pope before [he]246-mr. pope died of a few sorely needed home - truths about [motor cars]1348-motor cars , decadence and frivolity generally .... After lunch [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington took [her]253-aunt plessington little [Madge]323-marjorie for an energetic walk , and showed [herself]253-aunt plessington far more observant than the egotism of [her]253-aunt plessington conversation at that meal might have led [one]675-one to suppose . Or perhaps [she]253-aunt plessington was only better informed . [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington loved a good hard walk in the afternoon ; and if [she]253-aunt plessington could get [any one else]1350-any one else to accompany [her]253-aunt plessington , then [Hubert]338-hubert stayed at [home]810-home , and curled up into a ball on a sofa somewhere , and took a little siesta that made [him]338-hubert all the brighter for the intellectual activities of the evening . The thought of a young life , new , untarnished , just at the outset , just addressing itself to the task of getting on , always stimulated [her]253-aunt plessington mind extremely , and [she]253-aunt plessington talked to [Marjorie]323-marjorie with a very real and effectual desire to help [her]323-marjorie to the utmost of [her]323-marjorie ability . [She]253-aunt plessington talked of a start in life , and the sort of start [she]253-aunt plessington had had . [She]253-aunt plessington showed how many [people who began with great advantages]1352-people who began with great advantages did not shove sufficiently , and so dropped out of things and were n't seen and mentioned . [She]253-aunt plessington defended [herself]253-aunt plessington for marrying [Hubert]338-hubert , and showed what a clever shoving thing it had been to do . It startled [people]631-people a little , and made [them]631-people realize that here was [a woman who wanted something more in [a man]837-a man than [a handsome organ - grinder]1356-a handsome organ - grinder]1354-a woman who wanted something more in a man than a handsome organ - grinder . [She]253-aunt plessington made it clear that [she]253-aunt plessington thought a clever marriage , if not a startlingly brilliant one , the first duty of [a girl]1099-a girl . It was [a girl]1099-a girl 's normal gambit . [She]253-aunt plessington branched off to the things [single women]1359-single women might do , in order to justify this view . [She]253-aunt plessington did not think [single women]1359-single women could do very much . [They]1359-single women might perhaps shove as [suffragettes]1361-suffragettes , but even there [a husband]4858-a husband helped tremendously — if only by refusing to bail [you]1363-you out . [She]253-aunt plessington ran over the cases of [a number of [prominent single women]1365-prominent single women]1364-a number of prominent single women . " And what , "[253-aunt plessington] said [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , " do they all amount to ? " Then , "[253-aunt plessington] said [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington with a joyous lift in [her]253-aunt plessington voice , " [you]1066-the girl 'll begin to weed a little . But [Marjorie]323-marjorie was of the impressionable sex at an impressionable age , and there was something overwhelming in the undeviating conviction of [[her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt , in the clear assurance of [her]323-marjorie voice , that this life which interested [her]323-marjorie was the real life , the only possible successful life . [The world]589-the world reformed itself in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's fluent mind , until it was all a scheme of influence and effort and ambition and triumphs . Dinner - parties and receptions , [men wearing orders]1383-men wearing orders , [cabinet ministers]1384-cabinet ministers more than a little in love asking [her]323-marjorie advice , beautiful robes , a great blaze of lights ; why ! [she]323-marjorie might be , said [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington rising to enthusiasm , " another [Marcella]349-marcella . "[253-aunt plessington] The life was not without its adventurous side ; it was n't in any way dull . [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington to illustrate that point told amusing anecdotes of how two almost impudent invitations on [her]253-aunt plessington part had succeeded , and how [she]253-aunt plessington had once scored off [[her]253-aunt plessington elder sister]684-her elder sister by getting a coveted celebrity through [their]1386-their close family resemblance . " So [he]4896-he came — and stayed as long as [anybody]4898-anybody . "[350-the plessingtons] What else was there for [Marjorie]323-marjorie to contemplate ? Some sort of employment after a battle with [[her]253-aunt plessington father]572-her father , a parsimonious life , and even then [the Oxbridge tradesmen]1388-the oxbridge tradesmen and [their]1388-the oxbridge tradesmen immortal bills .... [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington was so intent upon [her]253-aunt plessington theme that [she]253-aunt plessington heeded nothing of the delightful little flowers [she]253-aunt plessington trampled under foot across the down , nor the jolly squirrel with an artistic temperament who saw fit to give an uninvited opinion upon [her]253-aunt plessington personal appearance from the security of a beech - tree in [the wood]1389-the wood . In the evening after supper the customary games were suspended , and [Mr.]1390-mr. and [Mrs. Plessington]343-mrs. plessington talked about getting on , and work and efficiency generally , and explained how so - and - so had spoilt [his]1391-his chances in life , and why so - and - so was sure to achieve nothing , and how [this man]1392-this man ate too much and [that man]1393-that man drank too much , and on the contrary what [promising and capable people]1394-promising and capable people [the latest adherents]1395-the latest adherents of and [subscribers to the Movement]1396-subscribers to the movement were , until two glasses of hot water came — [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington had been told it was good for [her]253-aunt plessington digestion and [she]253-aunt plessington thought it just as well that [Hubert]338-hubert should have some too — and it was time for [every one]4731-every one to go to bed . Next morning an atmosphere of getting on and strenuosity generally prevailed throughout [the vicarage]734-the vicarage . [Marjorie]323-marjorie , struck by the idea that [she]323-marjorie was not perhaps getting on at [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge so fast as [she]323-marjorie ought to do , went into [the summer - house]1265-the summer - house with [Marshall]351-marshall 's " Principles of Economics , "[264-mrs. pope] read for two hours , and did not think about [her]323-marjorie bills for more than a quarter of the time . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope began the pamphlet [he]246-mr. pope had had in contemplation for some time upon the advantages to public order of Payment in Kind . [Theodore]259-theodore , who had washed behind [his]259-theodore ears and laced [his]259-theodore boots in all the holes , went into [the yard]1406-the yard before breakfast and hit a tennis ball against the wall and back , five hundred and twenty - two times — a record . [He]259-theodore would have resumed this after breakfast , but [[his]259-theodore father]988-his father came round the corner of [the house]742-the house with a pen in [his]988-his father mouth , and asked [him]259-theodore indistinctly , but fiercely , what the devil [he]259-theodore was doing . So [he]259-theodore went away , and after a fretful interval set [himself]259-theodore to revise [his]259-theodore Latin irregular verbs . By twelve [he]259-theodore had done wonders . Later in the day the widening circle of aggressive urgency reached [the kitchen]1405-the kitchen , and at two [the cook]1410-the cook gave notice in order , [she]1410-the cook said , to better [herself]1410-the cook . The lecture in the evening at [Summerhay]37-summerhay was a great success . The chair was taken by [the Rev. Jopling Baynes]328-the rev. jopling baynes , [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth was enthroned behind the table , [Hubert]338-hubert was in charge of [[his]338-hubert wife]848-his wife 's notes — if notes should be needed — and [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , expectant of an invitation at the end to say a few words about [the East Purblow experiment]4865-the east purblow experiment , also occupied a chair on [the platform]1270-the platform . [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth , with [her]325-lady petchworth abundant soft blond hair , brightly blond still in spite of [her]325-lady petchworth fifty - five years , [her]325-lady petchworth delicate features , [her]325-lady petchworth plump hands , [her]325-lady petchworth numerous chins and [her]325-lady petchworth entirely inaudible voice , made a pleasing contrast with [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's resolute personality . [She]325-lady petchworth had perhaps an even greater assurance of authority , but it was a quiet assurance ; [you]1421-you felt that [she]325-lady petchworth knew that if [she]325-lady petchworth spoke in [her]325-lady petchworth sleep [she]325-lady petchworth would be obeyed , that it was quite unnecessary to make [herself]325-lady petchworth heard . [The two women]1422-the two women , indeed , [the one so assertive]1423-the one so assertive , [the other so established]1424-the other so established , were at the opposite poles of authoritative British womanhood , and harmonized charmingly . [The little room]1425-the little room struck the note of a well - regulated brightness at every point , [it]1425-the little room had been decorated in a Keltic but entirely respectful style by one of [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth 's artistic discoveries , [it]1425-the little room was lit by paraffin lamps that smelt hardly at all , and [it]1425-the little room was gay with colour prints illustrating the growth of [the British Empire]1426-the british empire from the battle of [Ethandune]41-ethandune to the surrender of [Cronje]42-cronje . [The hall]1427-the hall was fairly full . [Few]1428-few could afford to absent [themselves]1428-few from these brightening occasions , but there was a tendency on the part of [the younger and the less thoughtful section of the village manhood]1429-the younger and the less thoughtful section of the village manhood to accumulate at the extreme back and rumble in what appeared to be a slightly ironical spirit , so far as it had any spirit , with its feet . [The Rev. Jopling Baynes]328-the rev. jopling baynes opened proceedings with a few well - chosen remarks , in which [he]328-the rev. jopling baynes complimented [every one present]1430-every one present either singly or collectively according to [their]1430-every one present rank and importance , and then [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington came forward to the centre of [the platform]1270-the platform amidst a hectic flush of applause , and said " Haw ! "[253-aunt plessington] in a loud clear ringing tone . [She]253-aunt plessington spoke without resorting to the notes in [Hubert]338-hubert 's little fist , very freely and easily . [Her]253-aunt plessington strangulated contralto went into every corner of [the room]813-the room and positively seemed to look for and challenge [inattentive auditors]1433-inattentive auditors . [She]253-aunt plessington had come over , [she]253-aunt plessington said , and [she]253-aunt plessington had been very glad to come over and talk to [them]1433-inattentive auditors that night , because it meant not only seeing [them]1433-inattentive auditors but meeting [[her]253-aunt plessington very dear delightful friend]1434-her very dear delightful friend [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth ( loud applause ) and staying for a day or so with [[her]253-aunt plessington brother - in - law]1435-her brother - in - law [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope ( unsupported outburst of applause from [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet ) , to whom [she]253-aunt plessington and social reform generally owed so much . [She]253-aunt plessington had come to talk to [them]1433-inattentive auditors that night about the National Good Habits Movement , which was attracting so much attention and which bore so closely on [our]1436-our National Life and Character ; [she]253-aunt plessington happened to be — here [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington smiled as [she]253-aunt plessington spoke — [a humble person connected with that movement]1437-a humble person connected with that movement , just [a mere woman connected with it]1438-a mere woman connected with it ; [she]253-aunt plessington was going to explain to [them]1433-inattentive auditors as well as [she]253-aunt plessington could in [her]253-aunt plessington womanly way and in the time at [her]253-aunt plessington disposal just what it was and just what it was for , and just what means it adopted and just what ends [it]1439-it had in view . Well , [they]1433-inattentive auditors all knew what Habits were , and that there were Good Habits and Bad Habits , and [she]253-aunt plessington supposed that the difference between [a good man]1440-a good man and [a bad man]1441-a bad man was just that [the good man]1442-the good man had good habits and [the bad one]1443-the bad one had bad habits . [Everybody]1328-everybody [she]253-aunt plessington supposed wanted to get on . If [a man]837-a man had good habits [he]837-a man got on , and if [he]837-a man had bad habits [he]837-a man did n't get on , and [she]253-aunt plessington supposed it was the same with [a country]1446-a country , if [[its]1446-a country people]1447-its people had good habits [they]1447-its people got on , and if [[its]1446-a country people]1447-its people had bad habits [they]1447-its people did n't get on . For [her]253-aunt plessington own part [she]253-aunt plessington and [[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband ( [Hubert]338-hubert gave a little self - conscious jump ) had always cultivated good habits , and [she]253-aunt plessington had to thank [him]1267-her husband with all [her]253-aunt plessington heart for [his]1267-her husband help in doing so . ( Applause from the front seats . ) Now , the whole idea of [her]253-aunt plessington movement was to ask , how can [we]1450-they raise the standard of the national habits ? how can [we]1450-they get rid of bad habits and cultivate good ones ? ... ( Here there was a slight interruption due to [some one being suddenly pushed off the end of a form at the back , and coming to the floor with audible violence]1451-some one being suddenly pushed off the end of a form at the back , and coming to the floor with audible violence , after which a choked and obstructed tittering continued intermittently for some time . ) [Some of [[her]253-aunt plessington audience]1453-her audience]1452-some of her audience , [she]253-aunt plessington remarked , had not yet acquired the habit of sitting still . ( Laughter , and a coarse vulgar voice : " [Good old Billy Punt]352-billy ! "[1458-a boy] ) Well , to resume , [she]253-aunt plessington and [[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband had made a special and careful study of habits ; [they]1450-they had consulted all sorts of [people]631-people and collected all sorts of statistics , in fact [they]1450-they had devoted [themselves]1450-they to this question , and the conclusion to which [they]1450-they came was this , that Good Habits were acquired by Training and Bad Habits came from neglect and carelessness and leaving [people]631-people , who were n't fit for such freedom , to run about and do just whatever [they]631-people liked . And so , [she]253-aunt plessington went on with a note of complete demonstration , the problem resolved itself into the question of how far [they]1450-they could get more Training into the national life , and how [they]1450-they could check extravagant and unruly and wasteful and unwise ways of living . ( Hear , hear ! from [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . ) And this was the problem [she]253-aunt plessington and [[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband had set [themselves]1450-they to solve . ( Scuffle , and [a boy]1458-a boy 's voice at the back , saying : " Oh , shut it , [Nuts]353-nuts ! Shut it ! "[328-the rev. jopling baynes] ) Well , [she]253-aunt plessington and [[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband had worked the thing out , and [they]1450-they had come to the conclusion that what was the matter with [the great mass of [English people]1461-english people]1460-the great mass of english people was first that [they]1450-they had rather too much loose money , and secondly that [they]1450-they had rather too much loose time . ( A voice : " What O ! "[253-aunt plessington] and [the Rev. Jopling Baynes]328-the rev. jopling baynes suddenly extended [his]328-the rev. jopling baynes neck , knitted [his]328-the rev. jopling baynes brows , and became observant of [the interrupter]1462-the interrupter . ) [She]253-aunt plessington did not say [they]1450-they had too much money ( a second voice : " Not Arf ! "[253-aunt plessington] ) , but too much loose money . [She]253-aunt plessington did not say [they]1450-they had too much time but too much loose time , that is to say , [they]1450-they had money and time [they]1450-they did not know how to spend properly . And so [they]1450-they got into mischief . [A great number of people in [this country]1464-this country]1463-a great number of people in this country , [she]253-aunt plessington maintained , and this was especially true of [the lower classes]1465-the lower classes , did not know how to spend either money or time ; [they]1450-they bought [themselves]1450-they wasteful things and injurious things , and [they]1450-they frittered away [their]1450-they hours in all sorts of foolish , unprofitable ways . And , after the most careful and scientific study of this problem , [she]253-aunt plessington and [[her]253-aunt plessington husband]1267-her husband had come to the conclusion that two main principles must underlie any remedial measures that were attempted , the first of which was the Principle of Payment in Kind , which had already had so interesting a trial at [the great carriage works of [East Purblow]26-east purblow]1467-the great carriage works of east purblow , and the second , the Principle of Continuous Occupation , which had been recognized long ago in popular wisdom by that admirable proverb — or rather quotation — [she]253-aunt plessington believed it was a quotation , though [she]253-aunt plessington gave , [she]253-aunt plessington feared , very little time to poetry ( " Better employed , "[354-mr. pope)—"satan] from [Mr. Pope)—"Satan]354-mr. pope)—"satan finds some mischief stillFor idle hands to do . "[1468-a female voice] ( Irrepressible outbreak of wild and sustained applause from the back seats , and in a sudden lull [a female voice]1468-a female voice asking in a flattened , thwarted tone : " Ai n't there to be no lantern then ? "[325-lady petchworth] ) [The lecturer]1469-the lecturer went on to explain what was meant by either member of what perhaps [they]1470-they would permit [her]253-aunt plessington to call this double - barrelled social remedy . It was an admirable piece of lucid exposition . Slowly the picture of [a better , happier , more disciplined England]1471-a better , happier , more disciplined england grew upon the minds of the meeting . First [she]253-aunt plessington showed the new sort of employer [her]253-aunt plessington movement would evoke , [an employer paternal , philanthropic , vaguely responsible for the social order of [all [his]1267-her husband dependants]1473-all his dependants]1472-an employer paternal , philanthropic , vaguely responsible for the social order of all his dependants . ( [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth was seen to nod [her]253-aunt plessington head slowly at this . ) Only in the last resort , and when [he]1267-her husband was satisfied that [[his]1267-her husband worker]1474-his worker and [[[his]1267-her husband worker]1474-his worker 's family]1476-his worker 's family were properly housed , hygienically clothed and fed , attending suitable courses of instruction and free from any vicious inclinations , would [he]1267-her husband pay wages in cash . In the discharge of the duties of payment [he]1267-her husband would have the assistance of expert advice , and the stimulus of [voluntary inspectors of [[his]1267-her husband own class]1478-his own class]1477-voluntary inspectors of his own class . [He]1267-her husband would be [the natural clan - master]1479-the natural clan - master , [the captain and leader , adviser and caretaker of [[his]1267-her husband banded employees]1481-his banded employees]1480-the captain and leader , adviser and caretaker of his banded employees . Responsibility would stimulate [him]1267-her husband , and if responsibility did not stimulate [him]1267-her husband , [inspectors]1482-inspectors ( [both men]1483-both men and [women inspectors]1484-women inspectors ) would . [The worker]1485-the worker , on the other hand , would be enormously more healthy and efficient under the new régime . [[His]1267-her husband home]1486-his home , designed by [qualified and officially recognized architects]1487-qualified and officially recognized architects , would be prettier as well as more convenient and elevating to [his]1267-her husband taste , [[his]1267-her husband children]1488-his children admirably trained and dressed in the new and more beautiful clothing with which [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth ( applause ) had done so much to make [them]1488-his children familiar , [his]1267-her husband vital statistics compared with current results would be astonishingly good , [his]1267-her husband mind free from any anxiety but the proper anxiety of [a man in [his]1267-her husband position]1489-a man in his position , to get [his]1267-her husband work done properly and earn recognition from [those competent and duly authorized to judge it]1490-those competent and duly authorized to judge it . Of all this [she]325-lady petchworth spoke with the inspiring note of absolute conviction . All this would follow Payment in Kind and Continuous Occupation as days follow sunrise . And there would always,—and [here]4725-here [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's voice seemed to brighten — be something for [the worker]1485-the worker to get on with , something for [him]1267-her husband to do ; lectures , classes , reading - rooms , improving entertainments . [His]1267-her husband time would be filled . [The proper authorities]1493-the proper authorities would see that it was filled — and filled in the right way . Never for a moment need [he]1267-her husband be bored . [He]1267-her husband would never have an excuse for being bored . That was the second great idea , the complementary idea to the first . " And here it is , "[325-lady petchworth] [she]325-lady petchworth said , turning a large encouraging smile on [Lady Petchworth]325-lady petchworth , " that the work of [a National Theatre]4900-a national theatre , instructive , stimulating , well regulated , and morally sustaining , would come in . "[1495-some would - be humorist] [He]1267-her husband would n't , of course , be compelled to go , but there would be [his]1267-her husband seat , part of [his]1267-her husband payment in kind , and [the public - house]1494-the public - house would be shut , most other temptations would be removed .... [Fortune]357-fortune favoured [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet with a beautiful day , and the excursion was bright and successful from the outset . [She]323-marjorie tried to pull [herself]323-marjorie together , tried not to think about it , tried to be amused by the high spirits and nonsense of [Mr. Wintersloan]287-mr. wintersloan and [Syd]261-sydney and [Rom]262-rom and [Theodore]259-theodore ; but [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was very pervasive , and [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother did n't ever look at [her]323-marjorie , looked past [her]323-marjorie and away from [her]323-marjorie and all round [her]323-marjorie , in a profoundly observant manner . There was a little awkwardness in dispersing after lunch . For the next week [Marjorie]323-marjorie became more nearly introspective than [she]323-marjorie had ever been in [her]323-marjorie life before . [She]323-marjorie began to doubt [her]323-marjorie hitherto unshaken conviction that [she]323-marjorie was [a single , consistent human being]1599-a single , consistent human being . [She]323-marjorie found such discords and discrepancies between mood and mood , between the conviction of this hour and the feeling of that , that it seemed to [her]323-marjorie [she]323-marjorie was rather a collection of samples of emotion and attitude than anything so simple as [an individual]1600-an individual . [She]323-marjorie was profoundly Plessingtonian , and quite the vulgarest of the lot . The aviation accident occurred while [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope , [[her]264-mrs. pope two eldest daughters]1626-her two eldest daughters , and [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet were playing golf - croquet upon [the vicarage lawn]1627-the vicarage lawn . It was a serene , hot afternoon , a little too hot to take a game seriously , and [the four little figures]1628-the four little figures moved slowly over the green and grouped and dispersed as the game required . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was very fond of golf - croquet , [he]286-mr. magnet displayed a whimsical humour and much invention at this game , it was not too exacting physically ; and [he]286-mr. magnet could make [his]286-mr. magnet ball jump into the air in the absurdest manner . Occasionally [he]286-mr. magnet won a laugh from [Marjorie]323-marjorie or [Daffy]258-daffy . [No one else]1629-no one else was in sight ; [the pseudo - twins]739-the pseudo - twins and [Theodore]259-theodore and [Toupee]260-toupee were in [the barn]1631-the barn , and [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope was six miles away at Wamping , lying prone , nibbling grass blades and watching a county cricket match , as [every good Englishman , who knows what is expected of [him]246-mr. pope]1632-every good englishman , who knows what is expected of him , loves to do .... [Click]363-click went ball and mallet , and then after a long interval , click . It seemed incredible that anything could possibly happen before tea . But this is no longer [the world]589-the world [it]1634-it was . Suddenly this tranquil scene was slashed and rent by the sound and vision of [a monoplane]1635-a monoplane tearing across the heavens . A purring and popping arrested [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet in mid jest , and the monster came sliding up the sky over the trees beside [the church to the east]1636-the church to the east , already near enough to look big , a great stiff shape , big buff sails stayed with glittering wire , and with two odd little wheels beneath its body . It drove up the sky , rising with a sort of upward heaving , until [the croquet players]1637-the croquet players could see [the driver]1638-the driver and [a passenger]1639-a passenger perched behind [him]286-mr. magnet quite clearly . [It]1640-it passed a little to the right of [the church tower]4726-the church tower and only a few yards above the level of [the flagstaff]1642-the flagstaff , there was n't fifty feet of clearance altogether , and as it did so [Marjorie]323-marjorie could see [both driver]1643-both driver and [passenger]1644-passenger making hasty movements . It became immense and over - shadowing , and [every one]4731-every one stood rigid as it swept across the sun above [the vicarage chimneys]1646-the vicarage chimneys . Then it seemed to drop twenty feet or so abruptly , and then [both the men]1647-both the men cried out as [it]1640-it drove straight for the line of poplars between the shrubbery and [the meadow]1648-the meadow . " Oh , oh , OH ! "[286-mr. magnet] cried [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope and [Daffy]258-daffy . Evidently [the aviator]1649-the aviator was trying to turn sharply ; the huge thing banked , but not enough , and came about and slipped away until its wing was slashing into the tree tops with a thrilling swish of leaves and the snapping of branches and stays . " Run ! It came on its edge , hesitated whether to turn over as a whole , then crumpled , and amidst a volley of smashing and snapping came to rest amidst ploughed - up turf , a clamorous stench of petrol , and a cloud of dust and blue smoke within twenty yards of [them]862-the three ladies . [The two men]1652-the two men had jumped to clear the engine , had fallen headlong , and were now [both covered by the fabric of the shattered wing]1653-both covered by the fabric of the shattered wing . It was all too spectacular for word or speech until the thing lay still . Even then [the croquet players]1637-the croquet players stood passive for awhile waiting for something to happen . "[1707-the young man] It took some little persuasion before [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson would consent to be moved , and even then [he]364-solomonson was for a time — oh ! crusty . [He]1658-the tall young man certainly had a very nice face . "[264-mrs. pope] [The doctor]721-the doctor arrived after tea , with a bag and a stethoscope in a small coffin - like box , and [the Popes]273-the popes and [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet withdrew while [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson was carefully sounded , tested , scrutinized , questioned , watched and examined in every way known to medical science . The outcome of the conference was presently communicated to [the Popes]273-the popes by [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford and [the doctor]721-the doctor . [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson was not very seriously injured , but [he]364-solomonson was suffering from concussion and shock , two of [his]364-solomonson ribs were broken and [his]364-solomonson wrist sprained , unless perhaps one of the small bones was displaced . [He]364-solomonson ought to be bandaged up and put to bed .... " Could n't [we]4970-we — "[365-trafford] said [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope , but [the doctor]721-the doctor assured [her]264-mrs. pope [[his]721-the doctor own house]1719-his own house was quite the best place . There [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson could stay for some days . At present the cross - country journey over [the Downs]57-the downs or by [the South Eastern Railway]1720-the south eastern railway would be needlessly trying and painful . [The doctor]721-the doctor departed ; [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson , after stimulants , closed [his]364-solomonson eyes , and [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford seated [himself]365-trafford at the tea - things for some more cake , as though introduction by [aeroplane]1732-aeroplane was the most regular thing in [the world]589-the world . [He]364-solomonson had very pleasant and easy manners , an entire absence of self - consciousness , and a quick talkative disposition that made [him]364-solomonson very rapidly at [home]810-home with [everybody]1328-everybody . [He]364-solomonson described all the sensations of flight , [his]364-solomonson early lessons and experiments , and in the utmost detail the events of the afternoon that had led to this disastrous adventure . [He]364-solomonson made [his]364-solomonson suggestion of " trying the thing "[365-trafford] seem the most natural impulse in [the world]589-the world . The bulk of the conversation fell on [him]364-solomonson ; [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet , save for the intervention of one or two jests , was quietly observant ; [the rest]1737-the rest were well disposed to listen . And as [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford talked [his]365-trafford eye rested ever and again on [Marjorie]323-marjorie with the faintest touch of scrutiny and perplexity , and [she]323-marjorie , too , found a curious little persuasion growing up in [her]323-marjorie mind that somewhere , somehow , [she]323-marjorie and [he]365-trafford had met and had talked rather earnestly . [They]1738-they had sat for an hour — [the men from the doctor]1739-the men from the doctor 's seemed never coming — when [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope returned unexpectedly from [his]246-mr. pope cricket match , which had ended a little prematurely in a rot on [an over - dry wicket]1740-an over - dry wicket . [He]364-solomonson was full of particulars of the day 's play , and how [Wiper]369-wiper had got a most amazing catch and held it , though [he]369-wiper fell ; how [Jenks]370-jenks had deliberately bowled at [a man]837-a man 's head , [he]364-solomonson believed , and [little Gibbs]371-little gibbs thrown [a man]837-a man out from slip . [He]365-trafford was burning to tell all this in the utmost detail to [Magnet]286-mr. magnet and [[his]286-mr. magnet family]831-his family , so that [they]831-his family might at least share the retrospect of [his]365-trafford pleasure . [He]365-trafford had thought out rather a good pun on [Wiper]369-wiper , and [he]365-trafford was naturally a little thwarted to find all this good , rich talk crowded out by a more engrossing topic . But that evening [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope got [his]246-mr. pope serve well into the bay of the sagging net almost at once , and with [Marjorie]323-marjorie in the background taking anything [he]246-mr. pope left [her]323-marjorie , [he]246-mr. pope won quite easily , and everything became pleasant again . And at supper [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , rather crushing [[his]246-mr. pope wife]848-his wife 's attempt to recapitulate the more characteristic sayings and doings of [Sir Rupert]364-solomonson and [[his]246-mr. pope friend]1156-his friend , did after all succeed in giving every one a very good idea indeed of the more remarkable incidents of the cricket match at [Wamping]46-wamping , and made the pun [he]246-mr. pope had been accustomed to use upon the name of [Wiper]369-wiper in a new and improved form . A general talk about cricket and the Immense Good of cricket followed . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope said [he]246-mr. pope would make cricket - playing compulsory for [every English boy]1769-every english boy . Everyone it seemed to [Marjorie]323-marjorie was forgetting that dark shape athwart [the lawn]763-the lawn , and all the immense implication of its presence , with a deliberate and irrational skill , and [she]323-marjorie noted that the usual move towards [the garden]4727-the garden at the end of the evening was not made . In the night time [Marjorie]323-marjorie had a dream that [she]323-marjorie was flying about in [the world]589-the world on [a monoplane]1635-a monoplane with [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford as [a passenger]1639-a passenger . Then [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford disappeared , and [she]323-marjorie was flying about alone with a curious uneasy feeling that in a minute or so [she]323-marjorie would be unable any longer to manage the machine . Then [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father and [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet appeared very far below , walking about and disapproving of [her]323-marjorie . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was shaking [his]286-mr. magnet head very , very sagely , and saying : " Rather a stiff job for [little Marjorie]323-marjorie , "[365-trafford] and [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father was saying [she]323-marjorie would be steadier when [she]323-marjorie married . And then , [she]323-marjorie was n't clear how , the engine refused to work until [her]323-marjorie bills were paid , and [she]323-marjorie began to fall , and fall , and fall towards [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet . [She]323-marjorie tried frantically to pay [her]323-marjorie bills . [She]323-marjorie was falling down the fronts of [skyscrapers]1777-skyscrapers and precipices — and [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet was waiting for [her]323-marjorie below with a quiet kindly smile that grew wider and wider and wider .... [She]323-marjorie woke up palpitating . Next morning a curious restlessness came upon [Marjorie]323-marjorie . Conceivably it was due to the absence of [Magnet]286-mr. magnet , who had gone to [London]17-london to deliver [his]286-mr. magnet long promised address on [The Characteristics of English Humour]1778-the characteristics of english humour to [the Literati Club]1779-the literati club . Conceivably [she]323-marjorie missed [his]286-mr. magnet attentions . But it crystallized out in the early afternoon into the oddest form , a powerful craving to go to [the little town of Pensting]1780-the little town of pensting , five miles off , on [the other side of [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet]1781-the other side of buryhamstreet , to buy silk shoelaces . [She]323-marjorie decided to go in [the donkey cart]1282-the donkey cart . [She]323-marjorie communicated [her]323-marjorie intention to [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother , but [she]323-marjorie did not communicate an equally definite intention to be reminded suddenly of [Sir Rupert Solomonson]364-solomonson as [she]323-marjorie was passing the surgery , and make an inquiry on the spur of the moment — it would n't surely be anything but a kindly and justifiable impulse to do that . [She]323-marjorie might see [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford perhaps , but there was no particular harm in that . It is also to be remarked that finding [Theodore]259-theodore a little disposed to encumber [[her]323-marjorie vehicle]1784-her vehicle with [his]259-theodore presence [she]323-marjorie expressed [her]323-marjorie delight at being released from the need of going , and abandoned the whole expedition to [him]259-theodore — knowing as [she]323-marjorie did perfectly well that if [Theodore]259-theodore hated anything more than navigating [the donkey cart]1282-the donkey cart alone , it was going unprotected into [a shop]1786-a shop to buy articles of feminine apparel — until [he]259-theodore chucked the whole project and went fishing — if [one]675-one can call it fishing when there are no fish and [the fisherman]1788-the fisherman knows it — in [the decadent ornamental water]1789-the decadent ornamental water . And it is also to be remarked that as [Marjorie]323-marjorie approached [the surgery]1790-the surgery [she]323-marjorie was seized with an absurd and powerful shyness , so that not only did [she]323-marjorie not call at the surgery , [she]323-marjorie did not even look at the surgery , [she]323-marjorie gazed almost rigidly straight ahead , telling [herself]323-marjorie , however , that [she]323-marjorie merely deferred that kindly impulse until [she]323-marjorie had bought [her]323-marjorie laces . And so it happened that about half a mile beyond the end of [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet [she]323-marjorie came round a corner upon [Trafford]365-trafford , and by a singular fatality [he]365-trafford also was driving [a donkey]1791-a donkey , or , rather , was tracing a fan - like pattern on [the road]1792-the road with a donkey 's hoofs . It was a very similar donkey to [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's , but [the vehicle]1793-the vehicle was a governess cart , and much smarter than [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's turn - out . "[286-mr. magnet] ( But none of this was lost on [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope . ) [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet 's return next day was heralded by nearly two - thirds of a column in the Times . The Lecture on the Characteristics of Humour had evidently been quite a serious affair , and [a very imposing list of [humorists]973-humorists and of [prominent people associated with [their]973-humorists industry]1829-prominent people associated with their industry]1827-a very imposing list of humorists and of prominent people associated with their industry had accepted the hospitality of [the Literati]377-the literati . [Marjorie]323-marjorie ran [her]323-marjorie eyes over [the Chairman]1830-the chairman 's flattering introduction , then with a queer faint flavour of hostility [she]323-marjorie reached [[her]323-marjorie destined husband]1831-her destined husband 's utterance . [She]323-marjorie seemed to hear the flat full tones of [his]286-mr. magnet voice as [she]323-marjorie read , and automatically the desiccated sentences of [the reporter]1832-the reporter filled out again into those rich quietly deliberate unfoldings of sound that were already too familiar to [her]323-marjorie ear . [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet had begun with modest disavowals . " There was a story , [he]286-mr. magnet said,"—so[1832-the reporter] the report began—"whose hallowed antiquity ought to protect it from further exploitation , but [he]286-mr. magnet was tempted to repeat it because it offered certain analogies to the present situation . There were [three characters in the story]5050-three characters in the story , a bluebottle and [two Scotsmen]5051-two scotsmen . ( Laughter . ) The bluebottle buzzed on the pane , otherwise a profound silence reigned . This was broken by one of [the Scotsmen]378-the scotsmen trying to locate the bluebottle with zoölogical exactitude . Said [this Scotsman]5052-this scotsman : ' [Sandy]379-sandy , [I]286-mr. magnet am thinking if yon fly is a birdie or a beastie . ' [The other]5053-the other replied : ' [Man]939-man , do n't spoil good whiskey with religious conversation . ' ( Laughter . ) [He]286-mr. magnet was tempted , [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet resumed , to ask [himself]286-mr. magnet and [them]5055-their why it was that [they]5055-their should spoil the aftereffects of a most excellent and admirably served dinner by an academic discussion on British humour . At first [he]286-mr. magnet was pained by the thought that [they]5055-their proposed to temper [their]5055-their hospitality with a demand for a speech . A closer inspection showed that [he]286-mr. magnet was to introduce a debate and that [others]5056-others were to speak , and that was a new element in [their]5055-their hospitality . Further , [he]286-mr. magnet was permitted to choose the subject so that [he]286-mr. magnet could bring [their]5055-their speeches within the range of [his]286-mr. magnet comprehension . ( Laughter . ) [His]5057-his was an easy task . [He]286-mr. magnet could make it easier ; the best thing to do would be to say nothing at all . ( Laughter . ) "[286-mr. magnet] For a space [the reporter]1832-the reporter seemed to have omitted largely — perhaps [he]1832-the reporter was changing places with [his]1832-the reporter relief — and the next sentence showed [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet engaged as it were in revising a hortus siccus of jokes . " There was the humour of facts and situations , "[286-mr. magnet] [he]286-mr. magnet was saying , " or that humour of expression for which there was no human responsibility , as in the case of Irish humour ; [he]286-mr. magnet spoke of the humour of the soil which found its noblest utterance in the bull . Humour depended largely on contrast . There was a humour of form and expression which had many local varieties . American humour had been characterized by exaggeration , the suppression of some link in the chain of argument or narrative , and a wealth of simile and metaphor which had been justly defined as the poetry of [a pioneer race]5058-a pioneer race . "[323-marjorie] ... Abroad this did not appear to be the case . It was different in [France]28-france . ( ' Hear , hear , ' and cheers . ) "[323-marjorie] ... Attention wandered again . [She]323-marjorie yielded it without reluctance , turned to the breakfast table , and never resumed [her]323-marjorie study of the social relaxations of [humorists]973-humorists .... [She]323-marjorie fretted through the morning , avoided [Daffy]258-daffy in a marked manner , and inflicted a stinging and only partially merited rebuke upon [Theodore]259-theodore for slouching , humping and — of all trite grievances!—not washing behind [his]365-trafford ears . "[365-trafford] The effect of this éclaircissement upon [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford was not what it should have been . Properly [he]365-trafford ought to have realized at once that [Marjorie]323-marjorie was for ever beyond [his]365-trafford aspirations , and if [he]365-trafford found it too difficult to regard [her]323-marjorie with equanimity , then [he]365-trafford ought to have shunned [her]323-marjorie presence . "[323-marjorie] Nothing could show more clearly just how much [he]365-trafford had contrived to fall in love with [Marjorie]323-marjorie during [his]365-trafford brief sojourn in [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet and the acuteness of [his]365-trafford disappointment , and nothing could be more eloquent of [his]365-trafford forcible and undisciplined temperament . And out of ten thousand possible abusive epithets with which [his]365-trafford mind was no doubt stored , this one , [I]0-i think , had come into [his]365-trafford head because of the alert watchfulness with which [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet followed a conversation , as [he]365-trafford waited [his]365-trafford chance for some neat but brilliant flash of comment .... Trafford , like [Marjorie]323-marjorie , was [another of [those undisciplined young people [our]1870-our age]1869-those undisciplined young people our age has produced in such significant quantity]1868-another of those undisciplined young people our age has produced in such significant quantity . [He]365-trafford was just six - and - twenty , but the facts that [he]365-trafford was big of build , had as [an only child]1871-an only child associated much with [grown - up people]1872-grown - up people , and was already a conspicuous success in the world of micro - chemical research , had given [him]365-trafford the self - reliance and assurance of [a much older man]1873-a much older man . [He]365-trafford had still to come [his]365-trafford croppers and learn most of the important lessons in life , and , so far , [he]365-trafford was n't aware of it . [[Trafford]365-trafford 's father]1876-trafford 's father had died early in life . [[His]1876-trafford 's father wife]848-his wife — [she]848-his wife had been [[his]1876-trafford 's father wife]848-his wife for five years — found [[his]1876-trafford 's father child]1882-his child and [his]1876-trafford 's father memory and the quality of the life [he]1876-trafford 's father had made about [her]848-his wife too satisfying for the risks of a second marriage , and [she]848-his wife had brought up [[her]848-his wife son]990-her son with a passionate belief in the high mission of research and the supreme duty of seeking out and expressing truth finely . Then [he]246-mr. pope roused [himself]246-mr. pope with a profound sigh , and put a hand to [his]246-mr. pope cut and bruised cheek . " Well ! "[246-mr. pope] [he]246-mr. pope said . [Crisis]385-crisis prevailed in [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet that night . On [half a dozen sleepless pillows souls]1946-half a dozen sleepless pillows souls communed with the darkness , and two at least of those pillows were wet with tears . Not one of those wakeful heads was perfectly clear about the origins and bearings of the trouble ; not even [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope felt absolutely sure of [himself]246-mr. pope . It had come as things come to [people]631-people nowadays , because [they]631-people will not think things out , much less talk things out , and are therefore in a hopeless tangle of values that tightens sooner or later to a knot .... What an uncharted perplexity , for example , was the mind of [that excellent woman]1948-that excellent woman [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope ! [Poor lady]1949-poor lady ! [she]1949-poor lady had n't a stable thing in [her]1949-poor lady head . It is remarkable that some queer streak in [her]1949-poor lady composition sympathized with [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's passion for [Trafford]365-trafford . But [she]1949-poor lady thought it such a pity ! [She]1949-poor lady fought that sympathy down as if it were a wicked thing . And [she]1949-poor lady fought too against other ideas that rose out of the deeps and did not so much come into [her]1949-poor lady mind as cluster at the threshold , the idea that [Marjorie]323-marjorie was in effect grown up , a dozen queer criticisms of [Magnet]286-mr. magnet , and a dozen subtle doubts whether after all [Marjorie]323-marjorie was going to be happy with [him]365-trafford as [she]323-marjorie assured [herself]323-marjorie [the girl]1066-the girl would be . ( So far as [any one]1035-any one knew [Trafford]365-trafford might be an excellent match ! ) And behind these would - be invaders of [her]1949-poor lady guarded mind prowled even worse ones , doubts , horrible disloyal doubts , about the wisdom and kindness of [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . Quite early in life [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope had realized that it is necessary to be very careful with [one]675-one 's thoughts . They lead to trouble . [She]1949-poor lady had clipped the wings of [her]1949-poor lady own mind therefore so successfully that all [her]1949-poor lady conclusions had become evasions , all [her]1949-poor lady decisions compromises . [Her]1949-poor lady profoundest working conviction was a belief that nothing in [the world]589-the world was of value but " tact , "[1949-poor lady] and that the art of living was to " tide things over . "[246-mr. pope] But here it seemed almost beyond [her]1949-poor lady strength to achieve any sort of tiding over .... ( Why could n't [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope lie quiet ? ) Whatever [she]1949-poor lady said or did had to be fitted to the exigencies of [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope . Availing [himself]246-mr. pope of the privileges of matrimony , [[her]1949-poor lady husband]1267-her husband so soon as [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet had gone and [they]1955-they were [upstairs]1927-upstairs together , had explained the situation with vivid simplicity , and had gone on at considerable length and with great vivacity to enlarge upon [[his]246-mr. pope daughter]576-his daughter 's behaviour . [He]246-mr. pope ascribed this moral disaster,—he presented it as a moral disaster of absolutely calamitous dimensions — entirely to [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope 's faults and negligences . Warming with [his]246-mr. pope theme [he]246-mr. pope had employed a number of homely expressions rarely heard by [decent women]1958-decent women except in these sacred intimacies , to express the deep indignation of [a strong man]861-a strong man moved to unbridled speech by the wickedness of those near and dear to [him]246-mr. pope . Still warming , [he]246-mr. pope raised [his]246-mr. pope voice and at last shouted out [his]246-mr. pope more forcible meanings , until [she]1949-poor lady feared [the servants]674-the servants and [children]1961-children might hear , waved a clenched fist at [imaginary Traffords and scoundrels]1962-imaginary traffords and scoundrels generally , and giving way completely to [his]246-mr. pope outraged virtue , smote and kicked blameless articles of furniture in a manner deeply impressive to the feminine intelligence . Finally [he]246-mr. pope sat down in the little arm - chair between [her]1949-poor lady and the cupboard where [she]1949-poor lady was accustomed to hang up [her]1949-poor lady clothes , stuck out [his]246-mr. pope legs very stiffly across [the room]813-the room , and despaired of [[his]246-mr. pope family]831-his family in an obtrusive and impregnable silence for an enormous time . All of which awakened a deep sense of guilt and unworthiness in [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope 's mind , and prevented [her]1949-poor lady going to bed , but did not help [her]1949-poor lady in the slightest degree to grasp the difficulties of the situation .... [She]1949-poor lady would have lain awake anyhow , but [she]1949-poor lady was greatly helped in this by [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope 's restlessness . [He]246-mr. pope was now turning over from left to right or from right to left at intervals of from four to seven minutes , and such remarks as " [Damned scoundrel]5127-damned scoundrel ! "[258-daffy] kept [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope closely in touch with the general trend of [his]246-mr. pope thoughts . [She]1949-poor lady tried to get together [her]1949-poor lady plans and perceptions rather as though [she]1949-poor lady swept up dead leaves on a gusty day . [She]1949-poor lady knew that the management of the whole situation rested finally on [her]1949-poor lady , and that whatever [she]1949-poor lady did or did not do , or whatever arose to thwart [her]1949-poor lady arrangements , its entire tale of responsibility would ultimately fall upon [her]1949-poor lady shoulders . [She]1949-poor lady wondered what was to be done with [Marjorie]323-marjorie , with [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet ? Need [he]286-mr. magnet know ? Could that situation be saved ? Everything at present was raw in [her]1949-poor lady mind . For example , had [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet noticed [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope 's profound disturbance ? [She]1949-poor lady had to be ready to put a face on things before morning , and it seemed impossible [she]1949-poor lady could do so . In times of crisis , as [every woman]1966-every woman knows , it is always necessary to misrepresent everything to [everybody]1328-everybody , but how [she]1949-poor lady was to dovetail [her]1949-poor lady misrepresentations , get the best effect from [them]1968-them , extract a working system of rights and wrongs from [them]1968-them , [she]1949-poor lady could not imagine .... ( Oh ! [she]1949-poor lady did so wish [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope would lie quiet . ) But [he]246-mr. pope had no doubts of what became [him]246-mr. pope . [He]246-mr. pope had to maintain a splendid and irrational rage — at any cost — to [anybody]4898-anybody . A few yards away , a wakeful [Marjorie]323-marjorie confronted a joyless universe . [She]323-marjorie had a baffling realization that [her]323-marjorie life was in a hopeless mess , that [she]323-marjorie really had behaved disgracefully , and that [she]323-marjorie could n't for a moment understand how it had happened . [She]323-marjorie had intended to make quite sure of [Trafford]365-trafford — and then put things straight . Only [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father had spoilt everything . [She]323-marjorie regarded [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father that night with a want of natural affection terrible to record . Why had [he]572-her father come just when [he]572-her father had , just as [he]572-her father had ? Why had [he]572-her father been so violent , so impossible ? Of course , [she]323-marjorie had no business to be there .... [She]323-marjorie examined [her]323-marjorie character with a new unprecedented detachment . Was n't [she]323-marjorie , after all , rather [a mean human being]1972-a mean human being ? It had never occurred to [her]323-marjorie before to ask such a question . Now [she]323-marjorie asked it with only too clear a sense of the answer . [She]323-marjorie tried to trace how these multiplying threads of meanness had first come into the fabric of a life [she]323-marjorie had supposed [herself]323-marjorie to be weaving in extremely bright , honourable , and adventurous colours . [She]323-marjorie ought , of course , never to have accepted [Magnet]286-mr. magnet .... [She]323-marjorie faced the disagreeable word ; was [she]323-marjorie [a liar]1973-a liar ? At any rate , [she]323-marjorie told lies . And [she]323-marjorie 'd behaved with extraordinary meanness to [Daphne]315-daphne . [She]323-marjorie realized that now . [She]323-marjorie had heard [Trafford]365-trafford 's name in urgent whispers on [the landing]1974-the landing . " [I]323-marjorie suppose [you]323-marjorie could n't leave [him]365-trafford alone , "[323-marjorie] [Daffy]258-daffy had said , after a long hostile silence . That was all . Just a sentence without prelude or answer flung across [the bedroom]784-the bedroom , revealing a perfect understanding — deeps of angry disillusionment . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had stared and gasped , and made no answer . Would [she]323-marjorie ever see [him]365-trafford again ? After this horror of rowdy intervention ? [She]323-marjorie did n't deserve to ; [she]323-marjorie did n't deserve anything .... Oh , the tangle of it all ! The tangle of it all ! And those bills at [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge ! [She]323-marjorie was just dragging [Trafford]365-trafford down into [her]323-marjorie own miserable morass of a life . [Her]323-marjorie thoughts would take a new turn . " Not know it until afterwards , "[1976-the young man in the village] [she]323-marjorie corrected . [She]323-marjorie liked to be exact , even in despair .... [She]323-marjorie wanted to kneel to [him]365-trafford , imagined [herself]323-marjorie kneeling .... And so on , quite inconclusively , round and round through the interminable night hours . [The young man in [the village]4740-the village]1976-the young man in the village was , if possible , more perplexed , round - eyed and generally inconclusive than [anyone else in this series of nocturnal disturbances]1978-anyone else in this series of nocturnal disturbances . [He]1976-the young man in the village spent long intervals sitting on [his]1976-the young man in the village window - sill regarding [a world that was scented with nightstock , and seemed to be woven of moonshine and gossamer]1979-a world that was scented with nightstock , and seemed to be woven of moonshine and gossamer . Being an inexpert and infrequent soliloquist , [his]1976-the young man in the village only audible comment on [his]1976-the young man in the village difficulties was the repetition in varying intonations of [his]1976-the young man in the village fervent , unalterable conviction that [he]1976-the young man in the village was damned . But behind this simple verbal mask was a great fury of mental activity . [He]1976-the young man in the village had something of [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's amazement at the position of affairs . [He]1976-the young man in the village had never properly realized that it was possible for [any one]1035-any one to regard [Marjorie]323-marjorie as [a daughter]1981-a daughter , to order [her]323-marjorie about and resent the research for [her]323-marjorie society as criminal . " Can [any one]1035-any one get a writ of Habeas Corpus for [any one]1035-any one — it does n't matter whom"—more[264-mrs. pope] especially if [you]1983-you are [a young man of six - and - twenty]1984-a young man of six - and - twenty , anxious to exchange a few richly charged words with [a girl of twenty who is engaged to [someone else]1986-someone else]1985-a girl of twenty who is engaged to someone else ? The night had no answer . It was nearly dawn when [he]1976-the young man in the village came to the entirely inadvisable conclusion — [I]0-i use [his]1976-the young man in the village own word's — to go and have it out with [the old ruffian]1987-the old ruffian . [He]1976-the young man in the village would sit down and ask [him]1976-the young man in the village what [he]1976-the young man in the village meant by it all — and reason with [him]1976-the young man in the village . If [he]1976-the young man in the village started flourishing that stick again , it would have to be taken away . And having composed a peroration upon the institution of the family of a character which [he]1976-the young man in the village fondly supposed to be extraordinarily tolerant , reasonable and convincing , but which was indeed calculated to madden [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope to frenzy , [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford went very peacefully to sleep . Came dawn , with a noise of birds and afterwards a little sleep , and then day , and heavy eyes opened again , and the sound of frying and the smell of coffee recalled [[our]1988-our actors]1989-our actors to the stage . [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope was past [her]264-mrs. pope worst despair ; always the morning brings courage and a clearer grasp of things , and [she]264-mrs. pope could face [the world]589-the world with plans shaped subconsciously during those last healing moments of slumber . Breakfast was difficult , but not impossible . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope loomed like a thundercloud , but [Marjorie]323-marjorie pleaded a headache very wisely , and was taken a sympathetic cup of tea . [The pseudo - twins]739-the pseudo - twins scented trouble , but [Theodore]259-theodore was heedless and over - full of an entertaining noise made by a moorhen as it dived in the ornamental water that morning . [You]1992-you could make it practically sotto voce , and it amused [Syd]261-sydney . [He]261-sydney seemed to think the Times opaque to such small sounds , and learnt better only to be dismissed underfed and ignominiously from the table to meditate upon the imperfections of [his]261-sydney soul in [the schoolroom]1993-the schoolroom . There for a time [he]261-sydney was silent , and then presently became audible again , playing with a ball and , presumably , [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's tennis racquet . "[264-mrs. pope] Things were getting straight , [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope felt . [She]264-mrs. pope had now merely to add a few touches to the tranquillization of [Daphne]315-daphne , and the misdirection of [the twin]2002-the twin 's curiosity . These touches accomplished , it seemed that everything was done . After a brief reflection , [she]264-mrs. pope dismissed the idea of putting things to [Theodore]259-theodore . [She]264-mrs. pope ran over the possibilities of [the servants]674-the servants eavesdropping , and found [them]2004-them negligible . Yes , everything was done — everything . And yet .... The queer string in [her]264-mrs. pope nature between religiosity and superstition began to vibrate . [She]264-mrs. pope hesitated . Then [she]264-mrs. pope slipped [upstairs]1927-upstairs , fastened the door , fell on [her]264-mrs. pope knees beside the bed and put the whole thing as acceptably as possible to [Heaven]388-heaven in a silent , simple , but lucidly explanatory prayer .... [She]264-mrs. pope came out of [[her]264-mrs. pope chamber]2006-her chamber brighter and braver than [she]264-mrs. pope had been for eighteen long hours . [She]264-mrs. pope could now , [she]264-mrs. pope felt , await the developments that threatened with the serenity of [one who is prepared at every point]2007-one who is prepared at every point . [She]264-mrs. pope went almost happily to [the kitchen]1405-the kitchen , only about forty - five minutes behind [her]264-mrs. pope usual time , to order the day 's meals and see with [her]264-mrs. pope own eyes that economies prevailed . And it seemed to [her]264-mrs. pope , on the whole , consoling , and at any rate a distraction , when [the cook]1410-the cook informed [her]264-mrs. pope that after all [she]264-mrs. pope had meant to give notice on the day of [aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's visit . [The unsuspecting Magnet]2010-the unsuspecting magnet , fatigued but happy — for three hours of solid humorous writing ( omitting every unpleasant suggestion and mingling in the most acceptable and saleable proportions smiles and tears ) had added its quota to the intellectual heritage of [England]9-england , made a simple light lunch cooked in [homely village - inn]2011-homely village - inn fashion , lit a well merited cigar , and turned [his]2010-the unsuspecting magnet steps towards [the vicarage]734-the vicarage . [He]2010-the unsuspecting magnet was preceded at some distance along [the avenuesque drive]2013-the avenuesque drive by the back of [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford , which [he]2010-the unsuspecting magnet made no attempt to overtake . [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford was admitted and disappeared , and a minute afterwards [Magnet]286-mr. magnet reached the door . [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope appeared radiant — about the weather . " Well , [sir]4762-sir , "[246-mr. pope] said [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope breaking the silence , " [you]4762-sir have come to offer some explanation — — "[246-mr. pope] While awaiting this encounter [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope had not been insensitive to the tactical and scenic possibilities of the occasion . [He]246-mr. pope had also arranged the chairs in a highly favourable pattern . From first to last [neither gentleman]2036-neither gentleman had made the slightest allusion to a considerable bruise upon [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford 's left cheek , and a large abrasion above [his]365-trafford ear . That afternoon [Marjorie]323-marjorie began [her]323-marjorie difficult task of getting disengaged from [Mr. Magnet]286-mr. magnet . [Mr. Pope]246-mr. pope , for all [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's submission to [his]286-mr. magnet wishes , developed a Grand Dudgeon of exceptionally fine proportions when [he]286-mr. magnet heard of the breach of the engagement . [He]286-mr. magnet ceased to speak to [[his]286-mr. magnet daughter]576-his daughter or admit [himself]286-mr. magnet aware of [her]323-marjorie existence , and [the Grand Dudgeon]279-grand dudgeon 's blighting shadow threw a chill over the life of [every one in [the house]742-the house]2043-every one in the house . " [I]323-marjorie thought [he]365-trafford would do that , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie . " [He]365-trafford 's always wanted to do that , "[391-durgan] and said no more . [Trafford]365-trafford went back to [Solomonson]364-solomonson for a day or so , and then to [London]17-london , to resume the experimental work of the research [he]365-trafford had in hand . But [he]365-trafford was so much in love with [Marjorie]323-marjorie that for some days it was a very dazed mind that fumbled with the apparatus — arranged it and rearranged it , and fell into daydreams that gave the utmost concern to [Durgan]391-durgan the bottle - washer .
