" [I]391-durgan was worried for a bit , "[391-durgan] said [Mr. Durgan]391-durgan . " But [I]2059-the trained investigator think it 's all right again . [I]2059-the trained investigator believe it 's all right again . "[2059-the trained investigator] [Trafford]365-trafford was one of [those rare scientific men who really ought to be engaged in scientific research]2048-those rare scientific men who really ought to be engaged in scientific research . [He]365-trafford could never leave an accepted formula alone . [His]365-trafford mind was like some insatiable corrosive , that ate into all the hidden inequalities and plastered weaknesses of accepted theories , and bit its way through every plausibility of appearance . [He]365-trafford was extraordinarily fertile in exasperating alternative hypotheses . [His]365-trafford invention of destructive test experiments was as happy as the respectful irony with which [he]365-trafford brought [them]2049-them into contact with the generalizations [they]2049-them doomed . [He]365-trafford was already , at six - and - twenty , hated , abused , obstructed , and respected . [He]365-trafford was still outside [the Royal Society]64-the royal society , of course , and [the editors of the scientific periodicals]2050-the editors of the scientific periodicals admired [his]365-trafford papers greatly , and delayed publication ; but it was fairly certain that that pressure of foreign criticism and competition which prevents [English scientific men of good family and social position]2051-english scientific men of good family and social position from maintaining any such national standards as [we]2052-we are able to do in art , literature , and politics , would finally carry [him]365-trafford in . And since [he]365-trafford had a small professorship worth three hundred a year , which gave [him]365-trafford the command of [a sufficient research laboratory]2053-a sufficient research laboratory and the services of [Mr. Durgan]391-durgan , a private income of nearly three hundred more , [a devoted mother]2054-a devoted mother to keep house for [him]365-trafford , and an invincible faith in Truth , [he]365-trafford had every prospect of winning in [his]365-trafford particular struggle to inflict more Truth , new lucidities , and fresh powers upon this fractious and unreasonable universe . In [the world of science]2055-the world of science now , even more than in the world of literature and political thought , the thing that is alive struggles , half - suffocated , amidst a copious production of things born dead . The endowment of research , the organization of scientific progress , the creation of salaried posts , and the assignment of honours , has attracted to this field just [that type of man which is least gifted to penetrate and discover , and least able to admit its own defect or the quality of a superior]2056-that type of man which is least gifted to penetrate and discover , and least able to admit its own defect or the quality of a superior . [Such men]2057-such men are producing great , bulky masses of imitative research , futile inquiries , and monstrous entanglements of technicality about [[their]2057-such men subjects]2058-their subjects ; and it is to [their]2057-such men instinctive antagonism to the idea of a " gift "[970-his mother] in such things that [we]2052-we owe the preposterous conception of a training for research , the manufacture of mental blinkers that is to say , to avoid what is the very soul of brilliant inquiry — applicable discursiveness . [The trained investigator]2059-the trained investigator is quite the absurdest figure in the farce of contemporary intellectual life ; [he]2059-the trained investigator is like a bath - chair perpetually starting to cross the Himalayas by virtue of a licence to do so . For such enterprises one must have wings . Organization and genius are antipathetic . The vivid and creative mind , by virtue of its qualities , is a spasmodic and adventurous mind ; it resents blinkers , and the mere implication that it can be driven in harness to the unexpected . It demands freedom . [It]2060-it resents regular attendance from ten to four and punctualities in general and all those paralyzing minor tests of conduct that are vitally important to the imagination of [the authoritative dull]2061-the authoritative dull . Consequently , it is being eliminated from [its]2060-it legitimate field , and it is only here and there among [the younger men]2062-the younger men that such a figure as [Trafford]365-trafford gives any promise of a renewal of that enthusiasm , that intellectual enterprise , which were distinctive of the great age of scientific advance . [Trafford]365-trafford was [the only son of [[his]365-trafford parents]2064-his parents]2063-the only son of his parents . [[His]365-trafford father]988-his father had been [a young surgeon , more attracted by knowledge than practice , who had been killed by a scratch of the scalpel in an investigation upon ulcerative processes , at the age of twenty - nine]2066-a young surgeon , more attracted by knowledge than practice , who had been killed by a scratch of the scalpel in an investigation upon ulcerative processes , at the age of twenty - nine . [Trafford]365-trafford at that time was three years old , so that [he]365-trafford had not the least memory of [[his]365-trafford father]988-his father ; but [[his]365-trafford mother]970-his mother , by a thousand almost unpremeditated touches , had built up a figure for [him]365-trafford and a tradition that was shaping [his]365-trafford life . [She]970-his mother had loved [[her]970-his mother husband]1267-her husband passionately , and when [he]1267-her husband died [her]970-his mother love burnt up like a flame released , and made a god of the good [she]970-his mother had known with [him]1267-her husband . [She]970-his mother was then [a very beautiful and active - minded woman of thirty]2070-a very beautiful and active - minded woman of thirty , and [she]970-his mother did [her]970-his mother best to reconstruct [her]970-his mother life ; but [she]970-his mother could find nothing so living in [the world]589-the world as the clear courage , the essential simplicity , and tender memories of [the man [she]970-his mother had lost]2072-the man she had lost . And [she]970-his mother was the more devoted to [him]1267-her husband that [he]1267-her husband had had little weaknesses of temper and bearing , and that an outrageous campaign had been waged against [him]1267-her husband that did not cease with [his]1267-her husband death . [He]1267-her husband had , in some medical periodical , published drawings of a dead dog clamped to display a deformity , and these had been seized upon by [a group of [anti - vivisection fanatics]2074-anti - vivisection fanatics]2073-a group of anti - vivisection fanatics as the representation of a vivisection . A libel action had been pending when [he]1267-her husband died ; but there is no protection of [the dead]2075-the dead from libel . That monstrous lie met [her]970-his mother on pamphlet cover , on hoardings , in sensational appeals ; it seemed immortal , and [she]970-his mother would have suffered the pains of a dozen suttees if [she]970-his mother could have done so , to show [the world]589-the world how the power and tenderness of this alleged tormentor of helpless beasts had gripped [one woman]2077-one woman 's heart . It counted enormously in [her]970-his mother decision to remain [a widow]2078-a widow and concentrate [her]970-his mother life upon [[her]970-his mother son]990-her son . [She]970-his mother watched [his]1267-her husband growth with a care and passionate subtlety that even at six - and - twenty [he]1267-her husband was still far from suspecting . [She]970-his mother dreaded [his]1267-her husband becoming [a mother]4834-a mother 's pet , [she]970-his mother sent [him]1267-her husband away to [school]619-school and fretted through long terms alone , that [he]1267-her husband might be made into [a man]837-a man . [She]970-his mother interested [herself]970-his mother in literary work and social affairs lest [she]970-his mother should press upon [him]1267-her husband unduly . [She]970-his mother listened for the crude expression of growing thought in [him]1267-her husband with an intensity that was almost anguish . [She]970-his mother was too intelligent to dream of forming [his]1267-her husband mind , [he]1267-her husband browsed on every doctrine to find [his]1267-her husband own , but [she]970-his mother did desire most passionately , [she]970-his mother prayed , [she]970-his mother prayed in the darkness of sleepless nights , that the views , the breadths , the spacious emotions which had ennobled [[her]970-his mother husband]1267-her husband in [her]970-his mother eyes should rise again in [him]1267-her husband . There were years of doubt and waiting . [He]1267-her husband was [a good boy]2084-a good boy and [a bad boy , now brilliant , now touching , now disappointing , now gloriously reassuring , and now heart - rending]2085-a bad boy , now brilliant , now touching , now disappointing , now gloriously reassuring , and now heart - rending as only [the children of [our]2087-our blood]2086-the children of our blood can be . [He]1267-her husband had errors and bad moments , lapses into sheer naughtiness , phases of indolence , attacks of contagious vulgarity . But more and more surely [she]970-his mother saw [him]1267-her husband for [[his]1267-her husband father 's son]2088-his father 's son ; [she]970-his mother traced the same great curiosities , the same keen dauntless questioning ; whatever incidents might disturb and perplex [her]970-his mother , [his]1267-her husband intellectual growth went on strong and clear and increasing like some sacred flame that is carried in procession , halting perhaps and swaying a little but keeping on , over the heads of [a tumultuous crowd]2089-a tumultuous crowd . [He]1267-her husband went from [[his]1267-her husband school]2090-his school to [the Royal College of Science]2091-the royal college of science , thence to successes at [Cambridge]25-cambridge , and thence to [Berlin]65-berlin . [He]1267-her husband travelled a little in [Asia Minor]66-asia minor and [Persia]67-persia , had a journey to [America]43-america , and then came back to [her]970-his mother and [London]17-london , sunburnt , moustached , manly , and a little strange . When [he]1267-her husband had been [a boy]1458-a boy [she]970-his mother had thought [his]1267-her husband very soul pellucid ; it had clouded opaquely against [her]970-his mother scrutiny as [he]1267-her husband passed into adolescence . Then through the period of visits and departures , travel together , separations , [he]1267-her husband grew into something detached and admirable , [a man curiously reminiscent of [[his]1267-her husband father]988-his father , unexpectedly different]2093-a man curiously reminiscent of his father , unexpectedly different . [She]970-his mother ceased to feel what [he]1267-her husband was feeling in [his]1267-her husband mind , had to watch [him]1267-her husband , infer , guess , speculate about [him]1267-her husband . [She]970-his mother desired for [him]1267-her husband and dreaded for [him]1267-her husband with an undying tenderness , but [she]970-his mother no longer had any assurance that [she]970-his mother could interfere to help [him]1267-her husband . [He]1267-her husband had [[his]1267-her husband father]988-his father 's trick of falling into thought . [Her]970-his mother brown eyes would watch [him]1267-her husband across the flowers and delicate glass and silver of [her]970-his mother dinner table when [he]1267-her husband dined at [home]810-home with [her]970-his mother . Sometimes [he]1267-her husband seemed to forget [she]970-his mother existed , sometimes [he]1267-her husband delighted in [her]970-his mother , talked to amuse [her]970-his mother , petted [her]970-his mother ; sometimes , and then it was [she]970-his mother was happiest , [he]1267-her husband talked of plays and books with [her]970-his mother , discussed general questions , spoke even of that broadly conceived scheme of work which engaged so much of [his]1267-her husband imagination . [She]970-his mother knew that it was distinguished and powerful work . [Old friends of [[her]970-his mother husband]1267-her husband]2097-old friends of her husband spoke of it to [her]970-his mother , praised its inspired directness , its beautiful simplicity . Since the days of [Wollaston]392-wollaston , [they]2097-old friends of her husband said , [no one]4871-no one had been so witty [an experimenter]2100-an experimenter , [no one]4871-no one had got more out of mere scraps of apparatus or contrived more ingenious simplifications . When [he]1267-her husband had accepted the minor Professorship which gave [him]1267-her husband a footing in the world of [responsible scientific men]2102-responsible scientific men , [she]970-his mother had taken [a house in [a quiet street in [Chelsea]68-chelsea]2104-a quiet street in chelsea which necessitated a daily walk to [[his]1267-her husband laboratory]2105-his laboratory]2103-a house in a quiet street in chelsea which necessitated a daily walk to his laboratory . [She]970-his mother was [a woman of persistent friendships]2111-a woman of persistent friendships , and there came to [her]970-his mother , old connections of those early times trailing fresher and [younger people]2112-younger people in [their]2112-younger people wake , [sons]2113-sons , [daughters]1236-daughters , [nephews]2115-nephews , [disciples]2116-disciples ; [[her]970-his mother son]990-her son brought [home]810-home [all sorts of interesting men]2119-all sorts of interesting men , and it was remarkable to [her]970-his mother that amidst the talk and discussion at [her]970-his mother table , [she]970-his mother discovered aspects of [[her]970-his mother son]990-her son and often quite intimate aspects [she]970-his mother would never have seen with [him]990-her son alone . [She]970-his mother would not let [herself]970-his mother believe that this Indian summer of [her]970-his mother life could last for ever . [He]990-her son was [no passionless devotee of research]2121-no passionless devotee of research , for all [his]990-her son silence and restraints . [She]970-his mother had seen [him]990-her son kindle with anger at obstacles and absurdities , and quicken in the presence of beauty . [She]970-his mother knew how readily and richly [he]990-her son responded to beauty . Things happened to have run smoothly with [him]990-her son so far , that was all . " Of course , "[970-his mother] [she]970-his mother said , " [he]990-her son must fall in love . It can not be long before [he]990-her son falls in love . "[323-marjorie] Once or twice that had seemed to happen , and then it had come to nothing .... [She]970-his mother knew that sooner or later this completion of [his]990-her son possibilities must come , that the present steadfastness of purpose was a phase in which forces gathered , that love must sweep into [his]990-her son life as a deep and passionate disturbance . [She]970-his mother wondered where it would take [him]990-her son , whether it would leave [him]990-her son enriched or devastated . [She]970-his mother saw at times how young [he]990-her son was ; [she]970-his mother had , as [I]0-i suppose [most older people]2122-most older people have about [[their]2122-most older people juniors]2123-their juniors , the profoundest doubt whether [he]990-her son was wise enough yet to be trusted with a thing so good as [himself]990-her son . [He]990-her son had flashes of high - spirited indiscretion , and at times a wildfire of humour flared in [his]990-her son talk . So far that had done no worse for [him]990-her son than make [an enemy or so in scientific circles]2124-an enemy or so in scientific circles . But [she]970-his mother had no idea of the limits of [his]990-her son excitability . [She]970-his mother would watch [him]990-her son and fear for [him]990-her son — [she]970-his mother knew the wreckage love can make — and also [she]970-his mother desired that [he]990-her son should lose nothing that life and [his]990-her son nature could give [him]990-her son . In the two months of separation that ensued before [Marjorie]323-marjorie was one - and - twenty , [Trafford]365-trafford 's mind went through some remarkable phases . At first the excitement of [his]990-her son passion for [Marjorie]323-marjorie obscured everything else , then with [his]990-her son return to [London]17-london and [[his]990-her son laboratory]2105-his laboratory the immense inertia of habit and slowly developed purposes , the complex yet convergent system of ideas and problems to which so much of [his]990-her son life had been given , began to reassert itself . [His]990-her son love was vivid and intense , a light in [his]990-her son imagination , a fever in [his]990-her son blood ; but it was a new thing ; it had not crept into the flesh and bones of [his]990-her son being , it was away there in [Surrey]30-surrey ; [the streets of [London]17-london]2126-the streets of london , [[his]990-her son home]1486-his home , [the white - walled chamber with [its]2128-the white - walled chamber with its skylight and high windows and charts of constants , in which his apparatus was arranged skylight and high windows and charts of constants , in which [his]990-her son apparatus was arranged]2128-the white - walled chamber with its skylight and high windows and charts of constants , in which his apparatus was arranged , had no suggestion of [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie was outside — an adventure — a perplexing incommensurable with all these things . [He]990-her son had left [Buryhamstreet]6-buryhamstreet with [Marjorie]323-marjorie riotously in possession of [his]990-her son mind . [He]990-her son could think of nothing but [Marjorie]323-marjorie in [the train]663-the train , and how [she]323-marjorie had shone at [him]990-her son in [the study]4728-the study , and how [her]323-marjorie voice had sounded when [she]323-marjorie spoke , and how [she]323-marjorie stood and moved , and the shape and sensation of [her]323-marjorie hands , and how it had felt to hold [her]323-marjorie for those brief moments in the wood and press lips and body to [his]990-her son , and how [her]323-marjorie face had gleamed in the laced shadows of the moonlight , soft and wonderful . In fact , [he]990-her son thought of [Marjorie]323-marjorie . [He]990-her son thought [she]323-marjorie was splendid , courageous , wise by instinct . [He]990-her son had no doubt of [her]323-marjorie or that [she]323-marjorie was to be [his]990-her son — when the weeks of waiting had passed by . [She]323-marjorie was [his]990-her son , and [he]990-her son was [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's ; that had been settled from the beginning of [the world]589-the world . It did n't occur to [him]990-her son that anything had happened to alter [his]990-her son life or any of [his]990-her son arrangements in any way , except that they were altogether altered — as [the world]589-the world is altered without displacement when the sun pours up in the east . [He]990-her son was glorified — and everything was glorified . [He]990-her son wondered how [they]2133-they would meet again , and dreamt a thousand impossible and stirring dreams , but [he]990-her son dreamt them as dreams . At first , to [Durgan]391-durgan 's infinite distress , [he]990-her son thought of [her]323-marjorie all day , and then , as the old familiar interests grappled [him]990-her son again , [he]990-her son thought of [her]323-marjorie in the morning and the evening and as [he]990-her son walked between [[his]990-her son home]1486-his home and [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory and at all sorts of incidental times — and even when the close - locked riddles of [his]990-her son research held the foreground and focus of [his]990-her son thoughts , [he]990-her son still seemed to be thinking of [her]323-marjorie as a radiant background to ions and molecules and atoms and interwoven systems of eddies and quivering oscillations deep down in the very heart of matter . And always [he]990-her son thought of [her]323-marjorie as something of the summer . The rich decays of autumn came , [the Chelsea roads]2136-the chelsea roads were littered with variegated leaves that were presently wet and dirty and slippery , the twilight crept down into the day towards five o'clock and four , but in [his]990-her son memory of [her]323-marjorie the leaves were green , the evenings were long , the warm quiet of [rural Surrey in high August]2137-rural surrey in high august filled the air . So that it was with a kind of amazement [he]990-her son found [her]323-marjorie in [London]17-london and in November close at hand . [He]990-her son was called to [the college]2138-the college telephone one day from a conversation with [a proposed research student]2139-a proposed research student . It was [a middle - aged woman bachelor anxious for [the D.Sc .]2141-the d.sc . , who wished to occupy the further bench in [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory]2140-a middle - aged woman bachelor anxious for the d.sc . , who wished to occupy the further bench in the laboratory ; but [she]323-marjorie had no mental fire , and [his]990-her son mind was busy with excuses and discouragements . [He]990-her son had no thought of [Marjorie]323-marjorie when [she]323-marjorie answered , and for an instant [he]990-her son did not recognize [her]323-marjorie voice . " Yes , [I]990-her son 'm [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford . "[990-her son] ... " Who is it ? "[2143-the little voice] [he]990-her son reiterated with a note of irascibility . " Who ? "[2143-the little voice] [The little voice]2143-the little voice laughed . " Why ! [I]323-marjorie 'm [Marjorie]323-marjorie ! "[323-marjorie] it said . Then [she]323-marjorie was back in [his]990-her son life like a lantern suddenly become visible in a wood at midnight . It was like meeting [her]323-marjorie as a china figure , neat and perfect and two inches high . It was [her]323-marjorie voice , very clear and very bright , and quite characteristic , as though [he]990-her son was hearing it through the wrong end of a telescope . It was [her]323-marjorie voice , clear as a bell ; confident without a shadow . " It 's [me]990-her son ! [Marjorie]323-marjorie ! [I]990-her son 'm twenty - one to - day ! "[990-her son] It was like a little arrow of exquisite light shot into the very heart of [his]990-her son life . [He]990-her son laughed back . " Are [you]323-marjorie for meeting [me]365-trafford then , [Marjorie]323-marjorie ? "[365-trafford] [They]2144-they met in [Kensington Gardens]69-kensington gardens with an air of being clandestine and defiant . It was one of those days of amber sunlight , soft air , and tender beauty with which [London]17-london relieves the tragic glooms of the year 's decline . There were still a residue of warm - tinted leaves in puffs and clusters upon the tree branches , a boat or two ruffled the blue Serpentine , and the waterfowl gave colour and animation to the selvage of [the water]2145-the water . The sedges were still a greenish yellow . [The two]2146-the two met shyly . [They]2146-the two were both a little unfamiliar to [each other]709-each other . [Trafford]365-trafford was black - coated , silk - hatted , umbrella - d , [a decorous young professor in the place of the cheerful aeronaut who had fallen so gaily out of the sky]2148-a decorous young professor in the place of the cheerful aeronaut who had fallen so gaily out of the sky . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had a new tailor - made dress of russet - green , and a little cloth toque ruled and disciplined the hair [he]365-trafford had known as a ruddy confusion .... " And so , "[365-trafford] said [Trafford]365-trafford , " [we]2144-they meet again ! "[323-marjorie] " [I]365-trafford do n't see why [we]2144-they should n't meet ! " There ought to be squirrels here , as there are in [New York]70-new york , "[365-trafford] [he]365-trafford said at last . [They]2144-they sat down . [He]365-trafford tried afterwards to retrace that conversation . [He]365-trafford was chiefly ashamed of [his]365-trafford scientific preoccupations during that [London]17-london interval . [He]365-trafford had thought of a thousand things ; [Marjorie]323-marjorie had thought of nothing else but love and [him]365-trafford . [Her]323-marjorie happy assurance , [her]323-marjorie absolute confidence that [his]365-trafford desires would march with [hers]323-marjorie , reproached and confuted every adverse thought in [him]365-trafford as though it was a treachery to love . [He]365-trafford had that sense which [I]0-i suppose comes at times to [every man]2153-every man , of entire unworthiness for the straight , unhesitating decision , the clear simplicity of [a woman]4857-a woman 's passion . [He]365-trafford had dreamt vaguely , unsubstantially , the while [he]365-trafford had arranged [his]365-trafford pressures and temperatures and infinitesimal ingredients , and worked with goniometer and trial models and the new calculating machine [he]365-trafford had contrived for [his]365-trafford research . [She]323-marjorie had thought out everything that bore upon that ; reasons for preciptance , reasons for delay , [she]323-marjorie had weighed the rewards of conformity against the glamour of romance . [Her]323-marjorie definiteness shamed [his]365-trafford poverty of anticipation . [Her]323-marjorie enthusiasm carried [him]365-trafford with [her]323-marjorie . Of course it was so that things must be done .... When at last [they]2155-they parted under the multiplying lamps of the November twilight , [he]365-trafford turned [his]365-trafford face eastward . [He]365-trafford was afraid of [[his]365-trafford mother]970-his mother 's eyes — [he]365-trafford scarcely knew why . [He]365-trafford walked along [Kensington Gore]72-kensington gore , and the clustering confused lights of [street]2157-street and [house]1875-house , white and golden and orange and pale lilac , the moving lamps and shining glitter of the traffic , the luminous interiors of [omnibuses]2159-omnibuses , the reflection of [carriage]900-carriage and hoarding , the fading daylight overhead , the phantom trees to the left , the deepening shadows and blacknesses among [the houses on [his]365-trafford right]2161-the houses on his right , the bobbing heads of [wayfarers]2162-wayfarers , were just for [him]365-trafford the stir and hue and texture of fairyland . [Trafford]394-trafford 's second meeting with [Marjorie]323-marjorie , which , by the by , happened on the afternoon of the following day , brought [them]2195-them near to conclusive decisions . The stiffness of [their]2195-them first encounter in [London]17-london had altogether vanished . [She]323-marjorie was at [her]323-marjorie prettiest and in the highest spirits — and [she]323-marjorie did n't care for anything else in [the world]589-the world . A gauzy silk scarf which [she]323-marjorie had bought and not paid for that day floated atmospherically about [her]323-marjorie straight trim body ; [her]323-marjorie hair had caught the infection of insurrection and was waving rebelliously about [her]323-marjorie ears . As [he]2197-he drew near [her]323-marjorie [his]2197-he grave discretion passed from [him]2197-he as clouds pass from [a hillside]2198-a hillside . [She]323-marjorie smiled radiantly . [He]2197-he held out both [his]2197-he hands for both of [hers]323-marjorie , and never did [a maiden come so near and yet not get a public and shameless kissing]2199-a maiden come so near and yet not get a public and shameless kissing . [One]675-one could as soon describe music as tell [their]2201-their conversation . It was a matter of tones and feelings . But the idea of flight together , of the bright awakening in unfamiliar sunshine with none to come between [them]2201-their , had gripped [them]2201-their both . A certain sober gravity of discussion only masked that deeper inebriety . It would be easy for [them]2201-their to get away ; [he]2197-he had no lectures until February ; [he]2197-he could , [he]2197-he said , make arrangements , leave [his]2197-he research . [She]323-marjorie dreaded disputation . [She]323-marjorie was for a simple disappearance , notes on pincushions and defiantly apologetic letters from [Boulogne]80-boulogne , but [[his]2197-he mother]970-his mother 's atmosphere had been a gentler one than [[her]323-marjorie home]2203-her home 's , with a more powerful disposition to dignity . [He]2197-he still could n't understand that the cantankerous egotism of [Pope]246-mr. pope was indeed [the essential man]2204-the essential man ; it seemed to [him]2197-he a crust of bad manners that reason ought to pierce . The difference in [their]2201-their atmospheres came out in [their]2201-their talk — in [his]2197-he desire for a handsome and dignified wedding — though the very heavens protested — and [her]323-marjorie resolve to cut clear of [every one]4731-every one , to achieve a sort of gaol delivery of [her]323-marjorie life , make a new beginning altogether , with the minimum of friction and the maximum of surprise . Unused to fighting , [he]2197-he was magnificently prepared to fight ; [she]323-marjorie , with [her]323-marjorie intimate knowledge of chronic domestic conflict , was for the evasion of all the bickerings , scoldings , and misrepresentations [his]2197-he challenge would occasion . [He]2197-he thought in [his]2197-he innocence a case could be stated and discussed ; but no family discussion [she]323-marjorie had ever heard had even touched the realities of the issue that occasioned it . " [I]323-marjorie do n't like this underhand preparation , "[323-marjorie] [he]2197-he said . " Nor [I]323-marjorie , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie echoed . " But what can [one]675-one do ? It would be like confessing [himself]4747-your father wrong not to keep it up that [you]323-marjorie 're the sort of man one hits . "[2242-the young gentleman] In the stillness of the night [Trafford]394-trafford found [himself]394-trafford thinking over [Marjorie]323-marjorie ; it was a new form of mental exercise , which was destined to play a large part in [his]2206-he existence for many subsequent years . [He]365-trafford was extraordinarily perplexed , as well as ashamed and enraged by this uproar . How had it begun ? Of course , [he]365-trafford had been stupidly abusive , but the insult to [[his]365-trafford father]988-his father had been unendurable . It was already vague ; it was a confused memory of headlong words and answers ; what was n't vague , what rang in [his]365-trafford ears still , was the hoarse discord of two shouting voices . Could [Marjorie]323-marjorie have heard ? So [Marjorie]323-marjorie carried [her]323-marjorie point . [She]323-marjorie was n't to be married tamely after the common fashion which trails [home]810-home and all [one]675-one 's beginnings into the new life . [She]323-marjorie was to be eloped with , romantically and splendidly , into [a glorious new world]2269-a glorious new world . [She]323-marjorie walked on shining clouds , and if [she]323-marjorie felt some remorse , it was a very tender and satisfactory remorse , and with a clear conviction below it that in the end [she]323-marjorie would be forgiven . [They]2270-they made all [their]2270-they arrangements elaborately and carefully . [Trafford]365-trafford entered into the conspiracy with a keen interest , a certain amusement , and a queer little feeling of distaste . [He]365-trafford hated to hide any act of [his]365-trafford from [any human being]844-any human being . The very soul of scientific work , [you]2275-you see , is publication . " [He]365-trafford kissed [her]4768-dear , and [she]4768-dear clung to [him]365-trafford as if [he]365-trafford were something too precious to release . The elopement was a little complicated by a surprise manœuvre of [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope 's . [She]264-mrs. pope was more alive to the quality of the situation , [poor lady]1949-poor lady ! than [[her]264-mrs. pope daughter]772-her daughter suspected ; [she]264-mrs. pope was watching , dreading , perhaps even furtively sympathizing and trying to arrange — oh ! trying dreadfully to arrange . [She]264-mrs. pope had an instinctive understanding of the deep blue quiet in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's eyes , and [the girl]1066-the girl 's unusual tenderness with [Daffy]258-daffy and [the children]1036-the children . The weather was beautiful , [Marjorie]323-marjorie must come at once , pack up and come and snatch the last best glow of the dying autumn away there in [the west]5306-the west . [[Her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother had never achieved such miracles of mis - statement , and [she]588-her mother added a vigour that was all [her]588-her mother own . [She]323-marjorie was in a state of intense impatience , and — what is strange — extraordinarily afraid that something would separate [her]323-marjorie from [[her]323-marjorie lover]1579-her lover if [she]323-marjorie did not secure [him]1579-her lover . "[323-marjorie] All honeymoons must end at last , so back [they]2305-they came to [London]17-london , still very bright and happy . Meanwhile [they]2305-they lived in [lodgings]2307-lodgings . There can be no denying that [Marjorie]323-marjorie began [her]323-marjorie furnishing with severely virtuous intentions . [She]323-marjorie was very particular to ask [Trafford]394-trafford several times what [he]2308-he thought [she]323-marjorie might spend upon the enterprise . [He]2308-he had already [a bedroom]2309-a bedroom and [a study equipped]2310-a study equipped , and [he]2308-he threw out three hundred pounds as [his]2308-he conception of an acceptable figure . " Very well , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie , with a note of great precision , " now [I]323-marjorie shall know , "[323-marjorie] and straightway that sum took a place in [her]323-marjorie imagination that was at once definitive and protective , just as [her]323-marjorie estimate of fifty pounds for [her]323-marjorie [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge debts had always been . [She]323-marjorie assured [herself]323-marjorie [she]323-marjorie was going to do things , and [she]323-marjorie assured [herself]323-marjorie [she]323-marjorie was doing things , on three hundred pounds . At times the astonishment of [two or three school friends]2311-two or three school friends , who joined [her]323-marjorie in [her]323-marjorie shopping , stirred [her]323-marjorie to a momentary surprise at the way [she]323-marjorie was managing to keep things within that limit , and following a financial method that had , after all , in spite of some momentary and already nearly forgotten distresses , worked very well at [Oxbridge]8-oxbridge , [she]323-marjorie refrained from any additions until all the accounts had come to hand . It was an immense excitement shopping to make [a home]2312-a home . There was in [her]323-marjorie composition a strain of constructive artistry with such concrete things , a strain that had hitherto famished . [She]323-marjorie was making [a beautiful , secure little home for [Trafford]365-trafford]2313-a beautiful , secure little home for trafford , for [herself]323-marjorie , for possibilities — remote perhaps , but already touching [her]323-marjorie imagination with the anticipation of warm , new , wonderful delights . There should be simplicity indeed in [this home]2314-this home , but no bareness , no harshness , never an ugliness nor a discord . [She]323-marjorie had always loved colour in the skies , in the landscapes , in the texture of stuffs and garments ; now out of the chaotic skein of [countless shops]2315-countless shops [she]323-marjorie could choose and pick and mingle [her]323-marjorie threads in a glow of feminine self - expression . On three hundred pounds , that is to say — as a maximum . [The house [she]323-marjorie had to deal with]2316-the house she had to deal with was , like [[Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford 's]2317-mrs. trafford 's , old and rather small ; it was partly to [its]2316-the house she had to deal with lack of [bedroom accommodation]2318-bedroom accommodation , but much more to the invasion of [the street]1545-the street by [the back premises of [Messrs. Siddons]408-messrs. siddons & [Thrale]105-thrale]2320-the back premises of messrs. siddons & thrale , [the great Chelsea outfitters]2321-the great chelsea outfitters , that the lowness of the rent was due , a lowness which brought it within the means of [Trafford]365-trafford . [Marjorie]323-marjorie knew very clearly that [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father would say [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband had taken [her]323-marjorie to live in [a noisy slum]2324-a noisy slum , and that made [her]323-marjorie all the keener to ensure that every good point in the interior told to its utmost , and that whatever was to be accessible to [[her]323-marjorie family]570-her family should glow with a refined but warm prosperity . [The room]813-the room [downstairs]787-downstairs was shapely , and by ripping off the papered canvas of [the previous occupier]2328-the previous occupier , some very dilapidated but admirably proportioned panelling was brought to light . [The dining - room]2244-the dining - room and study door on [the ground floor]2330-the ground floor , by a happy accident , were of mahogany , with really very beautiful brass furnishings ; and the dining - room window upon the minute but by no means offensive paved garden behind , was curved and had a little shallow balcony of ironwork , half covered by a devitalized but leafy grapevine . Moreover , [the previous occupier]2328-the previous occupier had equipped [the place]673-the place with electric light and [a bathroom of almost American splendour on [the landing]1974-the landing]2333-a bathroom of almost american splendour on the landing , glass - shelved , white - tiled , and white painted , so that it was a delight to go into . [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind leapt very rapidly to the possibilities of [this little establishment]2335-this little establishment . The panelling must be done and done well , anyhow ; that would be no more than a wise economy , seeing it might at any time help [them]2336-them to re - let ; it would be painted white , of course , and thus set the key for a clean brightness of colour throughout . The furniture would stand out against the softly shining white , and its line and proportions must be therefore the primary qualities to consider as [she]323-marjorie bought [it]2337-it . [The study]4728-the study was much narrower than [the dining - room]2244-the dining - room , and so [the passage]2340-the passage , which [the agent]2341-the agent called [the hall]1427-the hall , was much broader and more commodious behind the happily wide staircase than in front , and [she]323-marjorie was able to banish out of the sight of [the chance visitor]2343-the chance visitor all that litter of hat - stand and umbrella - stand , letters , boxes arriving and parcels to post , which had always offended [her]323-marjorie eye at [home]810-home . At [home]810-home there had been often the most unsightly things visible , one of [Theo]259-theodore 's awful caps , or [his]259-theodore school books , and not infrequently [[her]323-marjorie father]572-her father 's well - worn and all too fatally comfortable house slippers . A good effect at first is half the victory of [a well done house]2347-a well done house , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie accomplished another of [her]323-marjorie real economies here by carpeting hall and staircase with a fine - toned , rich - feeling and rather high - priced blue carpet , held down by very thick brass stair - rods . [She]323-marjorie hung up four well - chosen steel engravings , put a single Chippendale chair in [the hall]1427-the hall , and a dark old Dutch clock that had turned out to be only five pounds when [she]323-marjorie had expected [the shopman to say eleven or twelve , on the half - landing]2349-the shopman to say eleven or twelve , on the half - landing . That was all . Round the corner by the study door was a mahogany slab , and the litter all went upon a capacious but very simple dark - stained hat - stand and table that were out of the picture entirely until [you]2350-you reached [the stairs]2351-the stairs . [[Her]323-marjorie dining - room]2352-her dining - room was difficult for some time . [She]323-marjorie had equipped that with a dark oak Welsh dresser made very bright with a dessert service that was , in view of [its]2353-its extremely decorative quality , remarkably cheap , and with some very pretty silver - topped glass bottles and flasks . This dresser and a number of simple but shapely facsimiles of old chairs , stood out against a nearly primrose paper , very faintly patterned , and a dark blue carpet with a margin of dead black - stained wood . Over the mantel was a German colour - print of waves full of sunlight breaking under cliffs , and between this and the window were dark bookshelves and a few bright - coloured books . On the wall , black - framed , were four very good Japanese prints , rich in greenish - blues and blueish - greys that answered the floor , and the window curtains took up some of the colours of the German print . But something was needed towards the window , [she]323-marjorie felt , to balance the warmly shining plates upon the dresser . The deep rose - red of the cherries that adorned them was too isolated , usurped too dominating a value . And while this was weighing upon [her]323-marjorie mind [she]323-marjorie saw in a window in [Regent Street]106-regent street a number of Bokhara hangings very nobly displayed . They were splendid pieces of needlework , particularly glorious in their crimsons and reds , and suddenly it came to [her]323-marjorie that it was just one of these , one that had great ruby flowers upon it with dead - blue interlacings , that was needed to weld [her]323-marjorie gay - coloured scheme together . [She]323-marjorie hesitated , went half - way to [Piccadilly Circus]107-piccadilly circus , turned back and asked the prices . The prices were towering prices , ten , fifteen , eighteen guineas , and when at last [the shopman]2354-the shopman produced one with all the charm of colour [she]323-marjorie sought at eight , it seemed like ten guineas snatched back as they dropped from [her]323-marjorie hands . And still hesitating , [she]323-marjorie had three that pleased [her]323-marjorie most sent [home]810-home , " on approval , "[2368-his] before [she]323-marjorie decided finally to purchase one of them . But the trial was conclusive . And then , struck with a sudden idea , [she]323-marjorie carried off [a long narrow one [she]323-marjorie had had no idea of buying before into [the little study behind]2357-the little study behind]2356-a long narrow one she had had no idea of buying before into the little study behind . Suppose , [she]323-marjorie thought , instead of hanging two curtains as [anybody else]2358-anybody else would do in that window , [she]323-marjorie ran this glory of rich colour across from one side on a great rod of brass . [She]323-marjorie was giving [the study]4728-the study the very best of [her]323-marjorie attention . After [she]323-marjorie had lapsed in [some other part of [the house]742-the house]2360-some other part of the house from the standards of rigid economy [she]323-marjorie had set up , [she]323-marjorie would as it were restore the balance by adding something to the gracefully dignified arrangement of this den [he]2362-he was to use . And the brass rod of the Bokhara hanging that was to do instead of curtains released [her]323-marjorie mind somehow to the purchase of certain old candlesticks [she]323-marjorie had hitherto resisted . [They]2363-they were to stand , bored to carry candle electric lights , on either corner of the low bookcase that faced the window . They were very heavy , very shapely candlesticks , and they cost thirty - five shillings . They looked remarkably well when they were put up , except that a sort of hollowness appeared between [them]2363-they and clamoured for a delightful old brass - footed workbox [she]323-marjorie had seen in [a shop in [Baker Street]77-baker street]2364-a shop in baker street . Enquiry confirmed [her]323-marjorie quick impression that this was a genuine piece ( of quite exceptional genuineness ) and that the price — [they]2363-they asked five pounds ten and came down to five guineas — was in accordance with this . It was a little difficult ( in spite of the silent hunger between the candlesticks ) to reconcile this particular article with [her]323-marjorie dominating idea of an austerely restrained expenditure , until [she]323-marjorie hit upon the device of calling it a hors d'œuvre , and regarding it not as furniture but as a present from [herself]323-marjorie to [Trafford]394-trafford that happened to fall in very agreeably with the process of house furnishing . [She]323-marjorie decided [she]323-marjorie would some day economise its cost out of [her]323-marjorie dress allowance . The bookcase on which it stood was a happy discovery in [Kensington]108-kensington , just five feet high , and with beautiful oval glass fronts , and [its]2365-its capacity was supplemented and any excess in [its]2365-its price at least morally compensated by a very tall , narrow , distinguished - looking set of open shelves that had been made for some special corner in [another house]2366-another house , and which anyhow were really and truly dirt cheap . The desk combined grace and good proportions to an admirable extent , the fender of pierced brass looked as if it had always lived in immediate contact with the shapely old white marble fireplace , and the two arm - chairs were marvels of dignified comfort . By the fireplace were a banner - shaped needlework firescreen , a white sheepskin hearthrug , a little patch and powder table adapted to carry books , and a green - shaded lamp , grouped in a common inaudible demand for a reader in slippers . [Trafford]394-trafford , when at last [the apartment]2251-the apartment was ready for [his]2368-his inspection , surveyed these arrangements with a kind of dazzled admiration . " By [Jove]409-jove ! "[2368-his] [he]2368-his said . " How [little people]5384-little people know of [the homes of [the Poor]5386-the poor]5385-the homes of the poor ! [The good lady]617-the good lady came and admired everything , and particularly the Bokhara hangings . Now [Marjorie]323-marjorie began to show [herself]323-marjorie keenly sensitive to the advent of a score of personalities , and very anxious to show just how completely successful in every sense [her]323-marjorie romantic disobedience had been . [She]323-marjorie knew [she]323-marjorie had been approved of , admired , condemned , sneered at , thoroughly discussed . If [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been [a general]2385-a general [she]323-marjorie would have counted no victory complete if the struggle was not sustained and desperate , and if it left [the enemy]2386-the enemy with a single gun or flag , or [herself]323-marjorie with so much as [a man killed or wounded]2387-a man killed or wounded . [The people [she]323-marjorie wanted to impress]2388-the people she wanted to impress varied very widely . The social side of the position would have to be strained to the utmost , [Marjorie]323-marjorie felt , with [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington . [They]2404-people of that sort do not make steps ; [they]2404-people of that sort boast and quarrel and are jealous perhaps , but that steady patient shove upward seems beyond [their]2404-people of that sort intelligence . Now [he]2457-his was enormously exercised in the search for a reconciliation between these , [he]2457-his felt , incommensurable factors . [He]2457-his was afraid of what might be [Sir Roderick]414-dover 's unspoken judgment on [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [the house [she]323-marjorie had made]2459-the house she had made — though what was there to be afraid of ? [He]2457-his was still more afraid — and this was even more remarkable — of the clear little judgments — hard as loose , small diamonds in a bed — that [he]2457-his thought [Marjorie]323-marjorie might pronounce on [Sir Roderick]414-dover . [He]2457-his had never disguised from [himself]2457-his that [Sir Roderick]414-dover was fat — [nobody who came within a hundred yards of [him]414-dover]2460-nobody who came within a hundred yards of him could be under any illusion about that — and that [he]414-dover drank a good deal , ate with a cosmic spaciousness , loved a cigar , and talked and laughed with a freedom that sometimes drove [delicate - minded new members]2461-delicate - minded new members into the corners remotest from the historical fireplace . [Trafford]394-trafford knew [himself]394-trafford quite definitely that there was a joy in [Dover]414-dover 's laugh and voice , a beauty in [his]2457-his face ( that was somehow mixed up with [his]2457-his healthy corpulence ) , and a breadth , a charity , a leonine courage in [his]2457-his mind ( that was somehow mixed up with [his]2457-his careless freedom of speech ) that made [him]2457-his [an altogether satisfactory person]2462-an altogether satisfactory person . Those were the days of the first enthusiasms of [the militant suffrage movement]2465-the militant suffrage movement , and the occasional smashing of a [Downing Street]112-downing street window or an assault upon [a minister]2466-a minister kept the question of [woman]2467-woman 's distinctive intelligence and character persistently before [the public]2468-the public . [Godley Buzard]416-buzard , [the feminist novelist]2469-the feminist novelist , had been [the guest of some member]2470-the guest of some member to lunch , and the occasion was too provocative for any one about [Dover]414-dover 's fireplace to avoid the topic . [Buzard]416-buzard 's presence , perhaps , drove [Dover]414-dover into an extreme position on the other side ; [he]2469-the feminist novelist forgot [Trafford]394-trafford 's new - wedded condition , and handled this great argument , an argument which has scarcely progressed since its beginning in the days of [Plato]417-plato and [Aristophanes]418-aristophanes , with the freedoms of [an ancient Greek and the explicitness of a modern scientific man]2471-an ancient greek and the explicitness of a modern scientific man . [He]2469-the feminist novelist opened almost apropos of nothing . " [Women]612-women , "[2469-the feminist novelist] [he]2469-the feminist novelist said , " are inferior — and [you]394-trafford ca n't get away from it . "[416-buzard] " [You]394-trafford can deny it , "[414-dover] said [Buzard]416-buzard . " In the face of the facts , "[414-dover] said [Sir Roderick]414-dover . " To begin with , [they]612-women 're several inches shorter , several pounds lighter ; [they]612-women 've less physical strength in footpounds . "[416-buzard] " More endurance , "[2469-the feminist novelist] said [Buzard]416-buzard . " Less sensitiveness merely . All those are demonstrable things — amenable to figures and apparatus . Then [they]612-women stand nervous tensions worse , the breaking - point comes sooner . [They]612-women have weaker inhibitions , and inhibition is the test of [a creature]5390-a creature 's position in the mental scale . "[414-dover] [He]2469-the feminist novelist maintained that in the face of [Buzard]416-buzard 's animated protest . [Buzard]416-buzard glanced at [their]2472-their moral qualities . " More moral ! "[414-dover] cried [Dover]414-dover , " more self - restraint ! Not a bit of it ! [Their]612-women desires and passions are weaker even than [their]612-women controls ; that 's all . And as for [their]612-women biological significance — — "[416-buzard] " [They]612-women are the species , "[416-buzard] said [Buzard]416-buzard , " and [we]612-women are the accidents . "[414-dover] [He]2473-he proceeded to an attack on the intellectual quality of [women]612-women . " [You]5394-you do n't or wo n't understand [me]414-dover , "[414-dover] said [Dover]414-dover . [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope was of course among the first to visit [the new home]2486-the new home so soon as [it]2486-the new home was open to inspection . [She]264-mrs. pope arrived , looking very bright and neat in a new bonnet and some new black furs that suited [her]264-mrs. pope , bearing up bravely but obviously in a state of dispersed and miscellaneous emotion .... In many ways [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's marriage had been a great relief to [[her]323-marjorie mother]588-her mother . Particularly it had been a financial relief . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been [the most expensive child of [[her]323-marjorie family]570-her family]2488-the most expensive child of her family , and [her]323-marjorie cessation had led to increments both of [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope 's and [Daphne]315-daphne 's all too restricted allowances . [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope had been able therefore to relapse from the orthodox Anglicanism into which poverty had driven [her]264-mrs. pope , and indulge for an hour weekly in the consolations of Higher Thought . These exercises in emancipated religiosity occurred at [the house of [Mr. Silas Root]250-silas root]2490-the house of mr. silas root , and were greatly valued by [a large circle of clients]2491-a large circle of clients . Essentially [they]2492-they were orgies of vacuity , and they cost six guineas for seven hours . [They]2492-they did [her]264-mrs. pope no end of good . All through the precious weekly hour [she]264-mrs. pope sat with [him]250-silas root in a silent twilight , very , very still and feeling — oh ! " higher "[250-silas root] than anything , and when [she]264-mrs. pope came out [she]264-mrs. pope wore an inane smile on [her]264-mrs. pope face and was prepared not to worry , to lie with facility , and to take the easiest way in every eventuality in an entirely satisfactory and exalted manner . Moreover [he]250-silas root was " treating "[264-mrs. pope] [her]264-mrs. pope investments . Acting upon [his]250-silas root advice , and doing the whole thing quietly with the idea of preparing a pleasant surprise for [[her]264-mrs. pope husband]1267-her husband , [she]264-mrs. pope had sold out of [certain Home Railway]114-certain home railway debentures and invested in [a company for working the auriferous waste which is so abundant in [the drainage of [Philadelphia]115-philadelphia]2495-the drainage of philadelphia , [a company whose shareholders were [chiefly higher thought disciples]2497-chiefly higher thought disciples and whose profits therefore would inevitably be greatly enhanced by [their]2497-chiefly higher thought disciples concerted mental action]2496-a company whose shareholders were chiefly higher thought disciples and whose profits therefore would inevitably be greatly enhanced by their concerted mental action]2494-a company for working the auriferous waste which is so abundant in the drainage of philadelphia , a company whose shareholders were chiefly higher thought disciples and whose profits therefore would inevitably be greatly enhanced by their concerted mental action . It was to the prospective profits in this that [she]264-mrs. pope owed the new black furs [she]264-mrs. pope was wearing . The furs and the bonnet and the previous day 's treatment [she]264-mrs. pope had had , all helped to brace [her]264-mrs. pope up on [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's doorstep for a complex and difficult situation , and to carry [her]264-mrs. pope through the first tensions of [her]264-mrs. pope call . "[426-napoleonic] [Marjorie]323-marjorie achieved a dress at once simple and good with great facility by not asking the price until it was all over . ( There is no half - success with dinner - dresses , either the thing is a success and inestimable , or not worth having at any price at all . ) It was blue with a thread of gold , and [she]323-marjorie had a necklace of blueish moonstones , gold - set , and [her]323-marjorie hair ceased to be copper and became golden , and [her]323-marjorie eyes unfathomable blue . At [home]810-home , in [[her]323-marjorie pretty bureau]2578-her pretty bureau , a little gathering pile of bills , as yet unpaid , and an empty cheque - book with appealing counterfoils , awaited [her]323-marjorie attention . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had still to master the fact that all the fine braveries and interests and delights of life that offer themselves so amply to [the favoured children of civilization]2579-the favoured children of civilization , trail and , since the fall of [man]939-man at any rate , have trailed after [them]2579-the favoured children of civilization something — something , the justification of morality , the despair of [all easy , happy souls]2581-all easy , happy souls , the unavoidable drop of bitterness in the cup of pleasure — the Reckoning . When the intellectual history of this time comes to be written , nothing [I]0-i think will stand out more strikingly than the empty gulf in quality between the superb and richly fruitful scientific investigations that are going on and the general thought of [other educated sections of [the community]1307-the community]2582-other educated sections of the community . [I]0-i do not mean that [the scientific men]2584-the scientific men are as [a whole]2585-a whole [a class of supermen]2586-a class of supermen , dealing with and thinking about everything in a way altogether better than the common run of humanity , but that in [their]2584-the scientific men own field , [they]2584-the scientific men think and work with an intensity , an integrity , a breadth , boldness , patience , thoroughness and faithfulness that ( excepting [only a few artists]2587-only a few artists ) puts [their]2584-the scientific men work out of all comparison with any other human activity . Often the field in which the work is done is very narrow , and almost universally the underlying philosophy is felt rather than apprehended . [A scientific man]2588-a scientific man may be large and deep - minded , deliberate and personally detached in [his]2588-a scientific man work , and hasty , commonplace and superficial in every other relation of life . Nevertheless it is true that in these particular directions [the human mind]2589-the human mind has achieved a new and higher quality of attitude and gesture , a veracity , self - detachment and self - abnegating vigour of criticism that tend to spread out and must ultimately spread out to [every other human affair]2590-every other human affair . In these uncontroversial issues at least [mankind]2591-mankind has learnt the rich rewards that ensue from patience and infinite pains . The peculiar circumstances of [Trafford]394-trafford 's birth and upbringing had accentuated [his]2588-a scientific man natural disposition toward this new thoroughness of intellectual treatment which has always distinguished [the great artist]2592-the great artist , and which to - day is also the essential quality of the scientific method . [He]2588-a scientific man had lived apart from any urgency to produce and compete in the common business of [the world]589-the world ; [his]2588-a scientific man natural curiosities , fed and encouraged by [his]2588-a scientific man natural gifts , had grown into a steady passion for clarity and knowledge . But with [him]2588-a scientific man there was no specialization . [He]2588-a scientific man brought out from [[his]2588-a scientific man laboratory]2105-his laboratory into the everyday affairs of [the world]589-the world the same sceptical restraint of judgment which is the touchstone of scientific truth . This made [him]2588-a scientific man a tepid and indeed rather [a scornful spectator of political and social life]2596-a scornful spectator of political and social life . Party formulae , international rivalries , social customs , and very much of the ordinary law of [our]2597-our state impressed [him]2588-a scientific man as a kind of fungoid growth out of a fundamental intellectual muddle . [It]2598-it all maintained itself hazardously , changing and adapting itself unintelligently to unseen conditions . [He]2588-a scientific man saw no ultimate truth in this seething welter of human efforts , no tragedy as yet in its defeats , no value in its victories . It had to go on , [he]2588-a scientific man believed , until the spreading certitudes of the scientific method pierced its unsubstantial thickets , burst its delusive films , drained away its folly . [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's talk of order and progress and the influence of [her]253-aunt plessington Movement impressed [his]2588-a scientific man mind very much as the cackle of some larger kind of hen — which cackles because it must . Only [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington being [human]2599-human simply imagined the egg . [She]253-aunt plessington laid — on the plane of the ideal . When the great nonsensical issues between liberal and conservative , between socialist and individualist , between " [Anglo - Saxon "[5501-the " white race " and the " yellow race "] and " Teuton]5500-anglo - saxon " and " teuton , "[5501-the " white race " and the " yellow race "] between [the " white race "[2588-a scientific man] and the " yellow race "]5501-the " white race " and the " yellow race "[2588-a scientific man] arose in [[Trafford]394-trafford 's company]2600-trafford 's company , [he]2588-a scientific man would if [he]2588-a scientific man felt cheerful take one side or the other as chance or [his]2588-a scientific man amusement with [[his]2588-a scientific man interlocutors]2601-his interlocutors determined , and jest and gibe at [the opponent]2602-the opponent 's inconsistencies , and if on the other hand [he]2588-a scientific man chanced to be irritable [he]2588-a scientific man would lose [his]2588-a scientific man temper at this " chewing of mesembryanthemum "[2588-a scientific man] and sulk into silence . " Chewing mesembryanthemum "[2611-a white - faced , red - eyed marjorie] was one of [Trafford]394-trafford 's favourite images,—no doubt [the reader]2603-the reader knows that abundant fleshy Mediterranean weed and the weakly unpleasant wateriness of its substance . [He]2588-a scientific man went back to [[his]2588-a scientific man laboratory]2105-his laboratory and [his]2588-a scientific man proper work after such discussions with a feeling of escape , as if [he]2588-a scientific man shut a door upon [a dirty and undisciplined market - place]2605-a dirty and undisciplined market - place crowded with [mental defectives]2606-mental defectives . Yet even before [he]2588-a scientific man met and married [Marjorie]323-marjorie , there was a queer little undertow of thought in [his]2588-a scientific man mind which insisted that this business could not end with door - slamming , that [he]2588-a scientific man did n't altogether leave the social confusion outside [his]2588-a scientific man panels when [he]2588-a scientific man stood alone before [his]2588-a scientific man apparatus , and that sooner or later that babble of voices would force [his]2588-a scientific man defences and overcome [his]2588-a scientific man disdain . [His]2588-a scientific man particular work upon the intimate constitution of matter had broadened very rapidly in [his]2588-a scientific man hands . The drift of [his]2588-a scientific man work had been to identify all colloids as liquid solutions of variable degrees of viscosity , and to treat crystalline bodies as the only solids . [He]2588-a scientific man had dealt with oscillating processes in colloid bodies with especial reference to living matter . [He]2588-a scientific man had passed from a study of the melting and toughening of glass to the molecular structure of a number of elastic bodies , and so , by a characteristic leap into botanical physiology , to the states of resinous and gummy substances at the moment of secretion . [He]2588-a scientific man worked at first upon a false start , and then resumed to discover a growing illumination . [He]2588-a scientific man found [himself]2588-a scientific man in the presence of phenomena that seemed to [him]2588-a scientific man to lie near the still undiscovered threshold to the secret processes of living protoplasm . [He]2588-a scientific man was , as it were , breaking into biology by way of molecular physics . [He]2588-a scientific man spent many long nights of deep excitement , calculating and arranging the development of these seductive intimations . It was this work which [his]2588-a scientific man marriage had interrupted , and to which [he]2588-a scientific man was now returning . [He]2588-a scientific man was surprised to find how difficult it was to take it up again . [He]2588-a scientific man had been only two months away from it , and yet already it had not a little of the feeling of a relic taken from a drawer . Something had faded . It was at first as if a film had come over [his]2588-a scientific man eyes , so that [he]2588-a scientific man could no longer see these things clearly and subtly and closely . [His]2588-a scientific man senses , [his]2588-a scientific man emotions , had been living in a stirring and vivid illumination . Now in this cool quietude bright clouds of coloured memory - stuff swam distractingly before [his]2588-a scientific man eyes . Phantom kisses on [his]2588-a scientific man lips , the memory of touches and the echoing vibrations of an adorable voice , the thought of a gay delightful fireside and the fresh recollection of [a companion]2607-a companion intensely felt beside [him]2588-a scientific man , effaced the delicate profundities of [this dim place]2608-this dim place . [Durgan]391-durgan hovered about [him]2588-a scientific man , helpful and a mute reproach . [Trafford]394-trafford had to force [his]2588-a scientific man attention daily for the better part of two weeks before [he]2588-a scientific man had fully recovered the fine enchanting interest of that suspended work . At last one day [he]2588-a scientific man had the happiness of possession again . [He]2588-a scientific man had exactly the sensation one gets when some hitherto intractable piece of a machine one is putting together , clicks neatly and beyond all hoping , into its place . [He]2588-a scientific man found [himself]2588-a scientific man working in the old style , with the hours slipping by disregarded . [He]2588-a scientific man sent out [Durgan]391-durgan to get [him]2588-a scientific man tobacco and tea and smoked - salmon sandwiches , and [he]2588-a scientific man stayed in [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory all night . [He]2588-a scientific man went [home]810-home about half - past five , and found [a white - faced , red - eyed Marjorie]2611-a white - faced , red - eyed marjorie still dressed , wrapped in a travelling - rug , and crumpled and asleep in [his]2588-a scientific man study arm - chair beside the grey ashes of an extinct fire . "[2638-he] [The world of [Trafford]394-trafford and [Marjorie]323-marjorie]2635-the world of trafford and marjorie was filled and transfigured by the advent of [[their]2636-their child]2637-their child . [His]2638-he life was to [him]2638-he the service of knowledge — or futility . [He]2638-he had perceived that [she]323-marjorie did not understand this in [him]2638-he ; that for [her]323-marjorie , life was a blaze of eagerly sought experiences and gratifications . So far [he]2638-he had thought out things and had them ready for [her]323-marjorie . But now all this impending discussion vanished out of [his]2638-he world . [Their]2639-their love was to be crowned by the miracle of parentage . This fact flooded [his]2638-he outlook and submerged every other consideration . This manifest probability came to [him]2638-he as if it were an unforeseen marvel . It was as if [he]2638-he had never thought of such a thing before , as though a fact entirely novel in the order of [the universe]604-the universe had come into existence . [Marjorie]323-marjorie became again magical and wonderful for [him]2638-he , but in a manner new and strange , [she]323-marjorie was grave , solemn , significant . [He]2638-he was filled with a passionate solicitude for [her]323-marjorie welfare , and a passionate desire to serve [her]323-marjorie . It seemed impossible to [him]2638-he that only a day or so ago [he]2638-he should have been accusing [her]323-marjorie in [his]2638-he heart of disloyalty , and searching for excuses and mitigations .... All the freshness of [his]2638-he first love for [Marjorie]323-marjorie returned , [his]2638-he keen sense of the sweet gallantry of [her]323-marjorie voice and bearing , [his]2638-he admiration for the swift , falconlike swoop of [her]323-marjorie decisions , for the grace and poise of [her]323-marjorie body , and the steady frankness of [her]323-marjorie eyes ; but now it was all charged with [his]2638-he sense of this new joint life germinating at the heart of [her]323-marjorie slender vigour , spreading throughout [her]323-marjorie being to change it altogether into womanhood for ever . In this new light [his]2638-he passion for research and all the scheme of [his]2638-he life appeared faded and unworthy , as much egotism as if [he]2638-he had been devoted to hunting or golf or any such aimless preoccupation . [Fatherhood]429-fatherhood gripped [him]2638-he and faced [him]2638-he about . It was manifestly a monstrous thing that [he]2638-he should ever have expected [Marjorie]323-marjorie to become a mere undisturbing accessory to the selfish intellectualism of [his]2638-he career , to shave and limit [herself]323-marjorie to a mere bachelor income , and play no part of [her]323-marjorie own in the movement of [the world]589-the world . [He]2638-he knew better now . Research must fall into its proper place , and for [his]2638-he immediate business [he]2638-he must set to work to supplement [his]2638-he manifestly inadequate resources . At first [he]2638-he could form no plan at all for doing that . [He]2638-he determined that research must still have [his]2638-he morning hours until lunch - time , and , [he]2638-he privately resolved , some part of the night . The rest of [his]2638-he day , [he]2638-he thought , [he]2638-he would set aside for a time to money - making . But [he]2638-he was altogether inexperienced in the methods of money - making ; it was a new problem , and a new sort of problem to [him]2638-he altogether . [He]2638-he discovered [himself]2638-he helpless and rather silly in the matter . The more obvious possibilities seemed to be that [he]2638-he might lecture upon [his]2638-he science or write . " [You]5517-you [real scientific men]5518-real scientific men , "[2638-he] [he]2638-he said , " are no doubt a thousand times more accurate and novel and all that , but as [no one]4871-no one seems able to understand [you]5517-you — — "[432-agatha alimony] [He]2638-he went to [[his]2638-he old fellow - student]2648-his old fellow - student , [Gwenn]431-gwenn , who was editing [The Scientific Review]2649-the scientific review , and through [him]2648-his old fellow - student [he]2638-he secured some semi - popular lectures , which involved , [he]2638-he found , travelling about twenty - nine miles weekly at the rate of four - and - sixpence a mile — counting nothing for the lectures .
