"[2680-he] and changed the subject at the earliest possible opportunity . But [Theodore]259-theodore was deeply moved at the prospect of becoming [an uncle]2664-an uncle , and went apart and mused deeply and darkly thereon for some time . It was difficult to tell just what [[Trafford]394-trafford 's mother]2665-trafford 's mother thought , [she]2665-trafford 's mother was complex and subtle , and evidently did not show [Marjorie]323-marjorie all that was in [her]2665-trafford 's mother mind ; but at any rate it was clear the prospect of [a grandchild]2666-a grandchild pleased and interested [her]2665-trafford 's mother . And about [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's views there was no manner of doubt at all . [She]2665-trafford 's mother thought , and remarked judicially , as one might criticize a game of billiards , that on the whole it was just a little bit too soon . [Marjorie]323-marjorie kept well throughout March and April , and then suddenly [she]323-marjorie grew unutterably weary and uncomfortable in [London]17-london . The end of April came hot and close and dry — it might have been July for the heat — the scrap of [garden]2667-garden wilted , and [the streets]1539-the streets were irritating with fine dust and blown scraps of paper and drifting straws . [She]323-marjorie could think of nothing but the shade of trees , and [cornfields]2669-cornfields under sunlight and the shadows of passing clouds . So [Trafford]394-trafford took out [an old bicycle]669-an old bicycle and wandered over [the home counties]2671-the home counties for three days , and at last hit upon [a little country cottage near [Great Missenden]120-great missenden]2672-a little country cottage near great missenden , [a cottage [a couple of girl artists]2674-a couple of girl artists had furnished and now wanted to let]2673-a cottage a couple of girl artists had furnished and now wanted to let . [It]2672-a little country cottage near great missenden had [a long , untidy vegetable garden]2675-a long , untidy vegetable garden and [a small orchard and drying - ground]2676-a small orchard and drying - ground , with [an old , superannuated humbug of a pear - tree near the centre surrounded by a green seat]2677-an old , superannuated humbug of a pear - tree near the centre surrounded by a green seat , and [high hedges with the promise of honeysuckle and dog - roses]2678-high hedges with the promise of honeysuckle and dog - roses , and gaps that opened into hospitable beechwoods — woods not so thick but that there were glades of bluebells , bracken and , to be exact , in [places embattled stinging - nettles]2679-places embattled stinging - nettles . [He]2680-he took it and engaged [a minute , active , interested , philoprogenitive servant girl]2681-a minute , active , interested , philoprogenitive servant girl for it , and took [Marjorie thither]323-marjorie in [a taxi - cab]2682-a taxi - cab . [She]2681-a minute , active , interested , philoprogenitive servant girl went out , wrapped in a shawl , and sat under the pear - tree and cried quietly with weakness and sentiment and the tenderness of afternoon sunshine , and forthwith began to pick up wonderfully , and was presently writing to [Trafford]394-trafford to buy [her]2681-a minute , active , interested , philoprogenitive servant girl a dog to go for walks with , while [he]2680-he was away in [London]17-london . [Trafford]394-trafford was still struggling along with [his]2680-he research in spite of a constant gravitation to [the cottage]2683-the cottage and [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's side , but [he]2680-he was also doing [his]2680-he best to grapple with the difficulties of [his]2680-he financial situation . [His]2680-he science notes , which were very uncongenial and difficult to do , and [his]2680-he lecturing , still left [his]2680-he income far behind [his]2680-he expenditure , and the problem of minimising the inevitable fresh inroads on [his]2680-he capital was insistent and distracting . [He]2680-he discovered that [he]2680-he could manage [his]2680-he notes more easily and write a more popular article if [he]2680-he dictated to [a typist]2684-a typist instead of writing out the stuff in [his]2680-he own manuscript . Dictating made [his]2680-he sentences more copious and open , and the effect of [the young lady]2685-the young lady 's by no means acquiescent back was to make [him]2680-he far more explicit than [he]2680-he tended to be pen in hand . With a pen and alone [he]2680-he felt the boredom of the job unendurably , and , to be through with it , became more and more terse , allusive , and compactly technical , after the style of [his]2680-he original papers . One or two articles by [him]2680-he were accepted and published by the monthly magazines , but as [he]2680-he took what [the editors]2686-the editors sent [him]2680-he , [he]2680-he did not find this led to any excessive opulence .... But [his]2680-he heart was very much with [Marjorie]323-marjorie through all this time . Hitherto [he]2680-he had taken [her]323-marjorie health and vigour and companionship for granted , and it changed [his]2680-he attitudes profoundly to find [her]323-marjorie now an ailing thing , making an invincible appeal for restraint and consideration and help . [She]323-marjorie changed marvellously , [she]323-marjorie gained a new dignity , and [her]323-marjorie complexion took upon itself a fresh , soft beauty . [He]2680-he would spend three or four days out of a week at [the cottage]2683-the cottage , and long hours of that would be at [her]323-marjorie side , paper and notes of some forthcoming lecture at hand neglected , talking to [her]323-marjorie consolingly and dreamingly . [His]2680-he thoughts were full of ideas about education ; [he]2680-he was obsessed , as are [most intelligent young parents of the modern type]2688-most intelligent young parents of the modern type , by the enormous possibilities of human improvement that might be achieved — if only one could begin with [a baby]5272-a baby from the outset , on the best lines , with the best methods , training and preparing it — presumably for [a cleaned and chastened world]2690-a cleaned and chastened world . Indeed [he]2680-he made all the usual discoveries of [intelligent modern young parents]2691-intelligent modern young parents very rapidly , fully and completely , and overlooked most of those practical difficulties that finally reduce [them]2691-intelligent modern young parents to human dimensions again in quite the normal fashion . " [I]2680-he sit and muse sometimes when [I]2680-he ought to be computing , "[2680-he] [he]2680-he said . " [Old Durgan]433-durgan watches [me]323-marjorie and grunts . But think , if [we]5526-we take reasonable care , watch its phases , stand ready with a kindergarten toy directly it stretches out its hand — think what [we]5526-we can make of it ! "[323-marjorie] ... " [We]5526-we will make it [the most wonderful child in [the world]589-the world]5527-the most wonderful child in the world , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie . " Indeed ! what else can it be ? "[394-trafford] " [Your]323-marjorie eyes , "[394-trafford] said [Trafford]394-trafford , " and [my]323-marjorie hands . "[323-marjorie] " [A girl]1099-a girl . "[2680-he] " [A boy]1458-a boy . "[2680-he] [He]2680-he kissed [her]323-marjorie white and passive wrist . [The child]1188-the child was born a little before expectation at [the cottage]2683-the cottage throughout a long summer 's night and day in early September . [Its]1188-the child coming into [the world]589-the world was a long and painful struggle ; [the general practitioner]2695-the general practitioner who had seemed two days before [a competent and worthy person enough]2696-a competent and worthy person enough , revealed [himself]2695-the general practitioner as hesitating , old - fashioned , and ill - equipped . [He]2695-the general practitioner had a lingering theological objection to the use of chloroform , and [the nurse from [London]17-london]2697-the nurse from london sulked under [his]2695-the general practitioner directions and came and discussed [his]2695-the general practitioner methods scornfully with [Trafford]394-trafford . From sundown until daylight [Trafford]394-trafford chafed in [the little sitting - room]2698-the little sitting - room and tried to sleep , and hovered listening at the foot of the narrow staircase to [the room above]2699-the room above . [He]2680-he lived through interminable hours of moaning and suspense .... The dawn and sunrise came with a quality of beautiful horror . For years afterwards that memory stood out among other memories as something peculiarly strange and dreadful . Day followed an interminable night and broke slowly . Things crept out of darkness , awoke as it were out of mysteries and reclothed themselves in unsubstantial shadows and faint - hued forms . All through that slow infiltration of [the world]589-the world with light and then with colour , the universe it seemed was moaning and endeavouring , and a weak and terrible struggle went on and kept on in [that forbidden room]2701-that forbidden room whose windows opened upon [the lightening world]2702-the lightening world , dying to a sobbing silence , rising again to agonizing cries , fluctuating , a perpetual obstinate failure to achieve a tormenting end . [He]2680-he went out , and behold the sky was a wonder of pink flushed level clouds and golden hope , and nearly every star except the morning star had gone , the supine moon was pale and half - dissolved in blue , and the grass which had been grey and wet , was green again , and the bushes and trees were green . [He]2680-he returned and hovered in [the passage]2340-the passage , washed [his]2680-he face , listened outside the door for age - long moments , and then went out again to listen under the window .... [He]2680-he went to [[his]2680-he room]2704-his room and shaved , sat for a long time thinking , and then suddenly knelt by [his]2680-he bed and prayed . [He]2680-he had never prayed before in all [his]2680-he life .... [He]2680-he returned to [the garden]4727-the garden , and there neglected and wet with dew was the camp chair [Marjorie]323-marjorie had sat on the evening before , the shawl [she]323-marjorie had been wearing , the novel [she]323-marjorie had been reading . [He]2680-he brought these things in as if they were precious treasures .... Light was pouring into [the world]589-the world again now . [He]2680-he noticed with an extreme particularity the detailed dewy delicacy of grass and twig , the silver edges to the leaves of briar and nettle , the soft clearness of the moss on bank and wall . [He]2680-he noted [the woods]5362-the woods with the first warmth of autumn tinting their green , the clear , calm sky , with just a wisp or so of purple cloud waning to a luminous pink on the brightening east , the exquisite freshness of the air . And still through the open window , incessant , unbearable , came this sound of [Marjorie]323-marjorie moaning , now dying away , now reviving , now weakening again .... Was [she]323-marjorie dying ? Were [they]2708-they murdering [her]323-marjorie ? It was incredible this torture could go on . Somehow it must end . Chiefly [he]2680-he wanted to go in and kill [the doctor]721-the doctor . But it would do no good to kill [the doctor]721-the doctor ! At last [the nurse]2711-the nurse came out , looking a little scared , to ask [him]2680-he to cycle three miles away and borrow some special sort of needle that [the fool of a doctor]2712-the fool of a doctor had forgotten . [He]2680-he went , outwardly meek , and returning was met by [the little interested servant]2713-the little interested servant , very alert and excited and rather superior — for here was something [no man]2714-no man can do — with the news that [he]2680-he had [a beautiful little daughter]2715-a beautiful little daughter , and that all was well with [Marjorie]323-marjorie . [He]2680-he said " Thank [God]249-god , thank [God]249-god ! "[2680-he] several times , and then went out into [the kitchen]1405-the kitchen and began to eat some flabby toast and drink some lukewarm tea [he]2680-he found there . [He]2680-he was horribly fatigued . " Is [she]323-marjorie all right ? "[323-marjorie] [he]2680-he asked over [his]2680-he shoulder , hearing [the doctor]721-the doctor 's footsteps on the stairs .... [They]2718-they were very pontifical and official with [him]2680-he . Presently [they]2718-they brought out a strange , wizened little animal , wailing very stoutly , with a face like [a very , very old woman]2719-a very , very old woman , and reddish skin and hair — it had quite a lot of wet blackish hair of an incredible delicacy of texture . It kicked with a stumpy monkey 's legs and inturned feet . [He]2680-he held it : [his]2680-he heart went out to it . [He]2680-he pitied [it]2720-it beyond measure , it was so weak and ugly . [He]2680-he was astonished and distressed by the fact of its extreme endearing ugliness . [He]2680-he had expected something strikingly pretty . It clenched a fist , and [he]2680-he perceived it had all its complement of fingers and ridiculous , pretentious little finger nails . Inside that fist it squeezed [his]2680-he heart .... [He]2680-he did not want to give it back to [them]2718-they . [He]2680-he wanted to protect it . [He]2680-he felt [they]2718-they could not understand it or forgive , as [he]2680-he could forgive , its unjustifiable feebleness .... Later , for just a little while , [he]2680-he was permitted to see [Marjorie]323-marjorie — [Marjorie]323-marjorie so spent , so unspeakably weary , and yet so reassuringly vital and living , so full of gentle pride and gentler courage amidst the litter of surgical precaution , that the tears came streaming down [his]2680-he face and [he]2680-he sobbed shamelessly as [he]2680-he kissed [her]323-marjorie . " [Little daughter]5531-little daughter , "[264-mrs. pope] [she]323-marjorie whispered and smiled — just as [she]323-marjorie had always smiled — that sweet , dear smile of [hers!—and]323-marjorie closed [her]323-marjorie eyes and said no more .... Afterwards as [he]2680-he walked up and down [the garden]4727-the garden [he]2680-he remembered [their]2722-their former dispute and thought how characteristic of [Marjorie]323-marjorie it was to have [a daughter]1981-a daughter in spite of all [his]2680-he wishes . For weeks and weeks this astonishing and unprecedented being filled [the Traffords]425-the traffords ' earth and sky . Very speedily its minute quaintness passed , and it became [a vigorous delightful baby]2724-a vigorous delightful baby that was , as [the nurse]2711-the nurse explained repeatedly and very explicitly , not only quite exceptional and distinguished , but exactly everything that [a baby]5272-a baby should be . Its weight became of supreme importance ; there was a splendid week when [it]2727-it put on nine ounces , and an indifferent one when it added only one . And then came a terrible crisis . [It]2727-it was ill ; some sort of infection had reached [it]2727-it , an infantile cholera . [Its]2727-it temperature mounted to a hundred and three and a half . [It]2727-it became a flushed misery , wailing with a pathetic feeble voice . Then it ceased to wail . [Marjorie]323-marjorie became white - lipped and heavy - eyed from want of sleep , and it seemed to [Trafford]394-trafford that perhaps [[his]2680-he child]1882-his child might die . It seemed to [him]2680-he that the spirit of [the universe]604-the universe must be a monstrous calivan since [children]1961-children had to die . [He]2680-he went for a long walk through the October beechwoods , under a windy sky , and in a drift of falling leaves , wondering with a renewed freshness at the haunting futilities of life .... Life was not futile — anything but that , but futility seemed to be stalking it , waiting for it .... When [he]2680-he returned [the child]1188-the child was already better , and in a few days it was well again — but very light and thin . When [they]2732-they were sure of its safety , [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [he]2680-he confessed the extremity of [their]2732-they fears to [one another]863-one another . [They]2732-they had not dared to speak before , and even now [they]2732-they spoke in undertones of the shadow that had hovered and passed over the dearest thing in [their]2732-they lives . In the course of the next six months [the child of the ages]2734-the child of the ages became [an almost ordinary healthy baby]2735-an almost ordinary healthy baby , and [Trafford]394-trafford began to think consecutively about [his]2680-he scientific work again — in the intervals of effort of a more immediately practical sort . The recall of molecular physics and particularly of the internal condition of colloids to something like [their]2736-their old importance in [his]2680-he life was greatly accelerated by the fact that [a young Oxford don named Behrens]2737-a young oxford don named behrens was showing extraordinary energy in what had been for a time [[Trafford]394-trafford 's distinctive and undisputed field]2738-trafford 's distinctive and undisputed field . [Behrens]434-behrens was [one of [those vividly clever energetic people who are the despair of [originative men]2741-originative men]2740-those vividly clever energetic people who are the despair of originative men]2739-one of those vividly clever energetic people who are the despair of originative men . [He]434-behrens had begun as [[Trafford]394-trafford 's pupil]2742-trafford 's pupil and [sedulous ape]2743-sedulous ape ; [he]434-behrens had gone on to work that imitated [Trafford]394-trafford 's in everything except its continual freshness , and now [he]434-behrens was ransacking every scrap of suggestion to be found in [Trafford]394-trafford 's work , and developing it with an intensity of uninspired intelligence that most marvellously simulated originality . [He]2680-he was already being noted as [an authority]2744-an authority ; sometimes in an article [his]2680-he name would be quoted and [Trafford]394-trafford 's omitted in relation to [Trafford]394-trafford 's ideas , and in every way [his]2680-he emergence and the manner of [his]2680-he emergence threatened and stimulated [his]2680-he model and [master]2745-master . A great effort had to be made . [Trafford]394-trafford revived the drooping spirits of [Durgan]433-durgan by a renewed punctuality in [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory . [He]2680-he began to stay away from [home]810-home at night and work late again , now , however , under no imperative inspiration , but simply because it was only by such an invasion of the evening and night that it would be possible to make headway against [Behren]435-behren 's unremitting industry . And this new demand upon [Trafford]394-trafford 's already strained mental and nervous equipment began very speedily to have its effect upon [his]2680-he domestic life . It is only in romantic fiction that [a man]837-a man can work strenuously to the limit of [his]837-a man power and come [home]810-home to be sweet , sunny and entertaining . [Trafford]394-trafford 's preoccupation involved a certain negligence of [Marjorie]323-marjorie , a certain indisposition to be amused or interested by trifling things , a certain irritability .... And now , indeed , [the Traffords]425-the traffords were coming to the most difficult and fatal phase in marriage . [They]425-the traffords had had that taste of defiant adventure which is the crown of a spirited love affair , [they]425-the traffords had known the sweetness of a maiden passion for [a maid]4816-a maid , and [they]425-the traffords had felt all those rich and solemn emotions , those splendid fears and terrible hopes that weave themselves about the great partnership in parentage . And now , so far as sex was concerned , there might be much joy and delight still , but no more wonder , no fresh discoveries of incredible new worlds and unsuspected stars . Love , which had been [a new garden]2751-a new garden , [an unknown land]2752-an unknown land , [a sunlit sea to launch upon]2753-a sunlit sea to launch upon , was now [a rich treasure - house of memories]2754-a rich treasure - house of memories . And memories , although they afford a perpetually increasing enrichment to emotion , are not sufficient in themselves for the daily needs of life . For this , indeed , is the truth of passionate love , that it works outs its purpose and comes to an end . A day arrives in every marriage when [the lovers]5240-the lovers must face [each other]709-each other , disillusioned , stripped of the last shred of excitement — undisguisedly [themselves]5240-the lovers . And [[our]2757-our two]2758-our two were married ; [they]2758-our two had bound [themselves]2758-our two together under a penalty of scandalous disgrace , to take the life - long consequences of [their]2758-our two passionate association . It was upon [Trafford]394-trafford that this exhaustion of the sustaining magic of love pressed most severely , because it was [he]2759-his who had made the greatest adaptations to the exigencies of [their]2758-our two union . [He]2759-his had crippled , [he]2759-his perceived more and more clearly , the research work upon which [his]2759-his whole being had once been set , and [his]2759-his hours were full of tiresome and trivial duties and [his]2759-his mind engaged and worried by growing financial anxieties . [He]2759-his had made these abandonments in a phase of exalted passion for [the one woman in [the world]589-the world]2760-the one woman in the world and [[her]2760-the one woman in the world unprecedented child]2762-her unprecedented child , and now [he]2759-his saw , in spite of all [his]2759-his desire not to see , that [she]2760-the one woman in the world was just a weak human being among [human beings]2763-human beings , and neither [she]2760-the one woman in the world nor [little Margharita]436-trafford so very marvellous . But while [Marjorie]323-marjorie shrank to the dimensions of reality , research remained still a luminous and commanding dream . In love one fails or one wins [home]810-home , but the lure of research is for ever beyond [the hills]2765-the hills , every victory is a new desire . Science has inexhaustibly fresh worlds to conquer .... [He]2759-his was beginning now to realize the dilemma of [his]2759-his life , the reality of the opposition between [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [child]2766-child and [home]810-home on the one hand and on the other this big wider thing , this remoter , severer demand upon [his]2759-his being . [He]2759-his had long perceived these were distinct and different things , but now it appeared more and more inevitable that they should be antagonistic and mutually disregardful things . [Each]437-each claimed [him]2759-his altogether , it seemed , and suffered compromise impatiently . And this is where the particular stress of [his]2759-his situation came in . Hitherto [he]2759-his had believed that nothing of any importance was secret or inexplicable between [himself]2759-his and [Marjorie]323-marjorie . [His]2759-his ideal of [his]2759-his relationship had assumed a complete sympathy of feeling , an almost instinctive identity of outlook . And now it was manifest [they]2768-they were living in a state of inadequate understanding , that [she]323-marjorie knew only in the most general and opaque forms , the things that interested [him]2759-his so profoundly , and had but the most superficial interest in [his]2759-his impassioned curiosities . And missing as [she]323-marjorie did the strength of [his]2759-his intellectual purpose [she]323-marjorie missed too , [she]323-marjorie had no inkling of , the way in which [her]323-marjorie careless expansiveness pressed upon [him]2759-his . [She]323-marjorie was unaware that [she]323-marjorie was destroying an essential thing in [his]2759-his life . [He]2759-his could not tell how far this antagonism was due to inalterable discords of character , how far it might not be an ineradicable sex difference , a necessary aspect of marriage . The talk of [old Sir Roderick Dover]414-dover at [the Winton Club]111-the winton club germinated in [his]2759-his mind , a branching and permeating suggestion . And then would come a phase of keen sympathy with [Marjorie]323-marjorie ; [she]323-marjorie would say brilliant and penetrating things , display a swift cleverness that drove all these intimations of incurable divergence clean out of [his]2759-his head again . Then [he]2759-his would find explanations in the differences between [his]2759-his and [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's training and early associations . [He]2759-his perceived [his]2759-his own upbringing had had a steadfastness and consistency that had been altogether lacking in [hers]323-marjorie . [He]2759-his had had the rare advantage of perfect honesty in the teaching and tradition of [[his]2759-his home]1486-his home . There had never been any shams or sentimentalities for [him]2759-his to find out and abandon . From boyhood [[his]2759-his mother]970-his mother 's hand had pointed steadily to the search for truth as the supreme ennobling fact in life . [She]970-his mother had never preached this to [him]2759-his , never delivered discourses upon [[his]2759-his father]988-his father 's virtues , but all [her]970-his mother conversation and life was saturated with this idea . Compared with this atmosphere of high and sustained direction , the intellectual and moral quality of [the Popes]2772-the popes , [he]2759-his saw , was the quality of an agitated rag bag . [They]2772-the popes had thought nothing out , joined nothing together , [they]2772-the popes seemed to believe everything and nothing , [they]2772-the popes were neither religious nor irreligious , neither moral nor adventurous . In the place of a religion , and tainting [their]2772-the popes entire atmosphere , [they]2772-the popes had the decaying remains of a dead Anglicanism ; it was clear [they]2772-the popes did not believe in its creed , and as clear that [they]2772-the popes did not want to get rid of it ; it afforded [them]2772-the popes no guidance , but only vague pretensions , and the dismal exercises of [Silas Root]250-silas root flourished in its shadows , a fungus , a post - mortem activity of the soul . [None of [them]2772-the popes]790-none of them had any idea of what [they]2772-the popes were for or what [their]2772-the popes lives as a whole might mean ; [they]2772-the popes had no standards , but only instincts and an instinctive fear of instincts ; [Pope]264-mrs. pope wanted to be tremendously respected and complimented by [everybody]1328-everybody and get six per cent . for [his]2759-his money ; [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope wanted things to go smoothly ; [the young people]2775-the young people had a general indisposition to do anything that might " look bad , "[264-mrs. pope] and otherwise " have a good time . "[439-mrs. flor] But neither [Marjorie]323-marjorie nor [any of [them]2772-the popes]2776-any of them had any test for a good time , and so [they]2772-the popes fluctuated in [their]2772-the popes conceptions of what [they]2772-the popes wanted from day to day . Now it was Plessingtonian standards , now Carmel standards , now the standards of Agatha Alimony ; now it was a stimulating novel , now a gleam of æsthetic imaginativeness come , Heaven knows whence , that dominated [her]323-marjorie mood . [He]2759-his was beginning to understand all this at last , and to see the need of coherence in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mood . [He]2759-his realized the unfairness of keeping [his]2759-his thoughts to [himself]2759-his , the need of putting [his]2759-his case before [her]323-marjorie , and making [her]323-marjorie realize [their]2772-the popes fatal and widening divergence . [He]2759-his wanted to infect [her]323-marjorie with [his]2759-his scientific passion , to give [her]323-marjorie [his]2759-his sense of the gravity of [their]2772-the popes practical difficulties . [He]2759-his would sit amidst [his]2759-his neglected work in [[his]2759-his laboratory]2105-his laboratory framing explanatory phrases . [He]2759-his would prepare the most lucid and complete statements , and go about with these in [his]2759-his mind for days waiting for an opportunity of saying what [he]2759-his felt so urgently had to be said . But the things that seemed so luminous and effective in [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory had a curious way of fading and shrinking beside the bright colours of [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's Bokhara hangings , in the presence of [little Margharita]436-trafford pink and warm and entertaining in [her]436-trafford bath , or amidst the fluttering rustle of the afternoon tea - parties that were now becoming frequent in [[his]2759-his house]4972-his house . And when [he]2759-his was alone with [her]323-marjorie [he]2759-his discovered [they]2772-the popes did n't talk now any more — except in terms of a constrained and formal affection . What had happened to [them]2772-the popes ? What was the matter between [himself]2759-his and [Marjorie]323-marjorie that [he]2759-his could n't even intimate [his]2759-his sense of [their]2772-the popes divergence ? [He]2759-his would have liked to discuss the whole thing with [[his]2759-his mother]970-his mother , but somehow that seemed disloyal to [Marjorie]323-marjorie .... One day [they]2772-the popes quarrelled . [He]2759-his came in about six in the afternoon , jaded from the delivery of a suburban lecture , and the consequent tedium of suburban travel , and discovered [Marjorie]323-marjorie examining the effect of a new picture which had replaced the German print of sunlit waves over the dining - room mantelpiece . It was a painting in the post - impressionist manner , and it had arrived after the close of the exhibition in [Weldon Street]121-weldon street , at which [Marjorie]323-marjorie had bought [it]2781-it . [She]323-marjorie had bought it in obedience to a sudden impulse , and its imminence had long weighed upon [her]323-marjorie conscience . [She]323-marjorie had gone to the show with [Sydney Flor]438-syd and [old Mrs. Flor]439-mrs. flor , [[Sydney]438-syd 's mother]2782-sydney 's mother , and a kind of excitement had come upon [them]2772-the popes at the idea of possessing this particular picture . [Mrs. Flor]439-mrs. flor had already bought [three Herbins]2783-three herbins , and [[her]439-mrs. flor daughter]772-her daughter wanted to dissuade [her]439-mrs. flor from more . " But they 're so delightful , "[438-syd] said [Mrs. Flor]439-mrs. flor . " [You]323-marjorie 're overrunning [your]323-marjorie allowance , "[323-marjorie] said [Sydney]438-syd . Disputing the point , [they]2772-the popes made inquiries for the price , and learnt that this bright epigram in colour was going begging — was even offered at a reduction from the catalogue price . A reduced price always had a strong appeal nowadays to [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind . " If [you]323-marjorie do n't get it , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie said abruptly , " [I]1267-her husband shall . "[1267-her husband] The transition from that attitude to ownership was amazingly rapid . Then nothing remained but to wait for the picture . [She]323-marjorie had dreaded a mistake , a blundering discord , but now with the thing hung [she]323-marjorie could see [her]323-marjorie quick eye had not betrayed [her]323-marjorie . It was a mass of reds , browns , purples , and vivid greens and greys ; an effect of roof and [brick house]2785-brick house facing upon [a Dutch canal]2786-a dutch canal , and it lit up [the room]813-the room and was echoed and reflected by all the rest of [her]323-marjorie courageous colour scheme , like a coal - fire amidst mahogany and metal . It justified itself to [her]323-marjorie completely , and [she]323-marjorie faced [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband with a certain confidence . " [Hullo]396-hullo ! "[323-marjorie] [he]1267-her husband cried . " A new picture , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie said . " What do [you]323-marjorie think of it ? "[436-trafford] " What is it ? "[323-marjorie] " [A town]5532-a town or something — never mind . Look at the colour . It heartens everything . "[436-trafford] [Trafford]436-trafford looked at the painting with a reluctant admiration . " [It]5533-it 's brilliant — and impudent . [He]1267-her husband 's [an artist]952-an artist — whoever [he]1267-her husband is . [He]1267-her husband hits the thing . But — [I]436-trafford say — how did [you]436-trafford get it ? "[436-trafford] " [I]436-trafford bought it . "[436-trafford] " Bought it ! [Good Lord]5535-good lord ! How much ? "[323-marjorie] " Oh ! ten guineas , "[323-marjorie] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie , with an affectation of ease ; " it will be worth thirty in ten years ' time . "[436-trafford] [Trafford]436-trafford 's reply was to repeat : " Ten guineas ! "[323-marjorie] [Their]2789-their eyes met , and there was singularly little tenderness in [their]2789-their eyes . " It was priced at thirteen , "[2790-he] said [Marjorie]323-marjorie , ending a pause , and with a sinking heart . [Trafford]436-trafford had left [her]323-marjorie side . [He]2790-he walked to the window and sat down in a chair . " [I]2790-he think this is too much , "[2790-he] [he]2790-he said , and [his]2790-he voice had disagreeable notes in it [she]323-marjorie had never heard before . " [I]2790-he have just been earning two guineas at [Croydon]122-croydon , of all places , administering comminuted science to [fools]5536-fools — and here [I]2790-he find — this exploit ! Ten guineas ' worth of picture . To say [we]2789-their ca n't afford it is just to waste a mild expression . It's — mad extravagance . It 's waste of money — it's — oh!—monstrous disloyalty . Disloyalty ! "[2790-he] [He]2790-he stared resentful at [the cheerful , unhesitating daubs of the picture]2791-the cheerful , unhesitating daubs of the picture for a moment . Its affected carelessness goaded [him]2790-he to fresh words . [He]2790-he spoke in a tone of absolute hostility . " [I]2790-he think this winds [me]2790-he up to something , "[2790-he] [he]2790-he said . " [You]323-marjorie 'll have to give up [your]323-marjorie cheque - book , [Marjorie]323-marjorie . "[2790-he] " Give up [my]323-marjorie cheque - book ! "[323-marjorie] [He]2790-he looked up at [her]323-marjorie and nodded . There was a warm flush in [her]323-marjorie cheeks , [her]323-marjorie lips panted apart , and tears of disappointment and vexation were shining beautifully in [her]323-marjorie eyes . [She]323-marjorie mingled the quality of [an indignant woman]2792-an indignant woman with the distress and unreasonable resentment of [a child]839-a child . " Because [I]2790-he 've bought this picture ? "[2790-he] " Can [we]5537-we go on like this ? "[323-marjorie] [he]2790-he asked , and felt how miserably [he]2790-he had bungled in opening this question that had been in [his]2790-he mind so long . " But it 's beautiful ! "[2790-he] [she]323-marjorie said . [He]2790-he disregarded that . [He]2790-he felt now that [he]2790-he had to go on with these long - premeditated expostulations . [He]2790-he was tired and dusty from [[his]2790-he third - class carriage]2794-his third - class carriage , [his]2790-he spirit was tired and dusty , and [he]2790-he said what [he]2790-he had to say without either breadth or power , an undignified statement of personal grievances , a mere complaint of the burthen of work that falls upon [a man]837-a man . That [she]323-marjorie missed the high aim in [him]2790-he , and all sense of the greatness [they]2796-they were losing had vanished from [his]2790-he thoughts . [He]2790-he had too heavy a share of the common burthen , and [she]323-marjorie pressed upon [him]2790-he unthinkingly ; that was all [he]2790-he could say . [He]2790-he girded at [her]323-marjorie with a bitter and loveless truth ; it was none the less cruel that in [her]323-marjorie heart [she]323-marjorie knew these things [he]2790-he said were true . But [he]2790-he went beyond justice — as [every quarrelling human being]2797-every quarrelling human being does ; [he]2790-he called the things [she]323-marjorie had bought and the harmonies [she]323-marjorie had created , " this litter and rubbish for which [I]323-marjorie am wasting [my]323-marjorie life . "[323-marjorie] That stabbed into [her]323-marjorie pride acutely and deeply . [She]323-marjorie knew anyhow that it was n't so simple and crude as that . It was not mere witlessness [she]323-marjorie contributed to [their]2798-their trouble . [She]323-marjorie tried to indicate [her]323-marjorie sense of that . But [she]323-marjorie had no power of ordered reasoning , [she]323-marjorie made futile interruptions , [she]323-marjorie was inexpressive of anything but emotion , [she]323-marjorie felt gagged against [his]2790-he flow of indignant , hostile words . They blistered [her]323-marjorie . Suddenly [she]323-marjorie went to [her]323-marjorie little desk in the corner , unlocked it with trembling hands , snatched [her]323-marjorie cheque - book out of a heap of still unsettled bills , and having locked that anti - climax safe away again , turned upon [him]2790-he . " Here it is , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie said , and stood poised for a moment . Then [she]323-marjorie flung down the little narrow grey cover — nearly empty , it was , of cheques , on the floor before [him]2790-he . " Take it , "[323-marjorie] [she]323-marjorie cried , " take it . [I]2790-he never asked [you]2790-he to give it [me]2790-he . "[2790-he] A memory of [Orta]102-orta and its reeds and sunshine and love rose like a luminous mist between [them]2799-them .... [She]323-marjorie ran weeping from [the room]813-the room . [He]2790-he leapt to [his]2790-he feet as the door closed . " [Marjorie]323-marjorie ! "[323-marjorie] [he]2790-he cried . But [she]323-marjorie did not hear [him]2790-he .... The disillusionment about marriage which had discovered [Trafford]436-trafford [a thwarted , overworked , and worried man]2801-a thwarted , overworked , and worried man , had revealed [Marjorie]323-marjorie with time on [her]323-marjorie hands , superabundant imaginative energy , and no clear intimation of any occupation . With [them]2802-them , as with [thousands of young couples in [London]17-london]2803-thousands of young couples in london to - day , [the breadwinner]2804-the breadwinner was overworked , and [the spending partner]2805-the spending partner 's duty was chiefly the negative one of not spending . [You]2806-you can not consume [your]2806-you energies merely in not spending money . Do what [she]323-marjorie could , [Marjorie]323-marjorie could not contrive to make [house]1875-house and [child]2766-child fill the waking hours . [She]323-marjorie was far too active and irritable a being to be beneficial company all day for [genial , bubble - blowing little Margharita]2809-genial , bubble - blowing little margharita ; [she]323-marjorie could play with [that young lady]2810-that young lady and lead [her]2810-that young lady into ecstasies of excitement and delight , and [she]323-marjorie could see with an almost instinctive certainty when anything was going wrong ; but for the rest that little life reposed far more beneficially upon the passive acquiescence of [May]323-marjorie , [[her]323-marjorie pink and wholesome nurse]2811-her pink and wholesome nurse . And [the household]2812-the household generally was in the hands of [a trustworthy cook - general , who maintained a tolerable routine]2813-a trustworthy cook - general , who maintained a tolerable routine . [Marjorie]323-marjorie did not dare to have an idea about food or domestic arrangements ; if [she]323-marjorie touched that routine so much as with [her]323-marjorie little finger it sent up the bills . [She]323-marjorie could knock off [butcher and greengrocer]2814-butcher and greengrocer and do every scrap of household work that [she]323-marjorie could touch , in a couple of hours a day . [She]323-marjorie tried to find some work to fill [her]323-marjorie leisure ; [she]323-marjorie suggested to [Trafford]436-trafford that [she]323-marjorie might help [him]2815-him by writing up [his]2815-him Science Notes from rough pencil memoranda , but when it became clear that the first step to [her]323-marjorie doing this would be the purchase of a Remington typewriter and a special low table to carry it , [he]2815-him became bluntly discouraging . [She]323-marjorie thought of literary work , and sat down one day to write a short story and earn guineas , and was surprised to find that [she]323-marjorie knew nothing of [any sort of human being about whom [she]323-marjorie could invent a story]2816-any sort of human being about whom she could invent a story . [She]323-marjorie tried a cheap subscription at [Mudie]440-mudie 's and novels , and they filled [her]323-marjorie with a thirst for events ; [she]323-marjorie tried needlework , and found [her]323-marjorie best efforts aesthetically feeble and despicable , and that [her]323-marjorie mind prowled above the silks and colours like a hungry wolf . The early afternoons were the worst time , from two to four , before calling began . [The devil]2817-the devil was given great power over [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's early afternoon . [She]323-marjorie could even envy [[her]323-marjorie former [home]810-home]2818-her former home life then , and reflect that there , at any rate , [one]675-one had a chance of a game or a quarrel with [Daffy]258-daffy or [Syd]438-syd or [Rom]262-rom or [Theodore]259-theodore . [She]323-marjorie would pull [herself]323-marjorie together and go out for a walk , and whichever way [she]323-marjorie went [there]1343-there were [shops]2822-shops and [shops]2822-shops and [shops]2822-shops , a glittering array of tempting opportunities for spending money . Sometimes [she]323-marjorie would give way to spending exactly as [a struggling drunkard]2825-a struggling drunkard decides to tipple . [She]323-marjorie would fix on some object , some object trivial and a little rare and not too costly , as being needed — when [she]323-marjorie knew perfectly well it was n't needed — and choose [the most remotest shops]2826-the most remotest shops and display the exactest insistence upon [her]323-marjorie requirements . Sometimes [she]323-marjorie would get [home]810-home from these raids without buying at all . After four the worst of the day was over ; [one]675-one could call on [people]631-people or [people]631-people might telephone and follow up with a call ; and there was a chance of [Trafford]436-trafford coming [home]810-home .... One day at [the Carmels ']845-the carmels ' [she]323-marjorie found [herself]323-marjorie engaged in a vigorous flirtation with [young Carmel]257-kitty carmel . [She]323-marjorie had n't noticed it coming on , but there [she]323-marjorie was in a windowseat talking quite closely to [him]2833-he . [He]2833-he said [he]2833-he was writing a play , a wonderful passionate play about [St. Francis]441-st. francis , and only [she]323-marjorie could inspire and advise [him]2833-he . Was n't [there]1343-there some afternoon in the week when [she]323-marjorie sat and sewed , so that [he]2833-he might come and sit by [her]323-marjorie and read to [her]323-marjorie and talk to [her]323-marjorie ? [He]2833-he made [his]2833-he request with a certain confidence , but it filled [her]323-marjorie with a righteous panic ; [she]323-marjorie pulled [him]2833-he up with an abruptness that was almost inartistic . On [her]323-marjorie way [home]810-home [she]323-marjorie was acutely ashamed of [herself]323-marjorie ; this was the first time [she]323-marjorie had let [any man]2836-any man but [Trafford]436-trafford think [he]2833-he might be interesting to [her]323-marjorie , but once or twice on former occasions [she]323-marjorie had been on the verge of such provocative intimations . This sort of thing anyhow must n't happen . But if [she]323-marjorie did n't dress with any distinction — because of the cost — and did n't flirt and trail [men]600-men in [her]323-marjorie wake , what was [she]323-marjorie to do at the afternoon gatherings which were now [her]323-marjorie chief form of social contact ? What was going to bring [people]631-people to [[her]323-marjorie house]2513-her house ? [She]323-marjorie knew that [she]323-marjorie was more than ordinarily beautiful and that [she]323-marjorie could talk well , but that does not count for much if [you]2840-you are rather dowdy , and quite uneventfully virtuous . It became the refrain of all [her]323-marjorie thoughts that [she]323-marjorie must find something to do . There remained " Movements . "[323-marjorie] [She]323-marjorie might take up a movement . [She]323-marjorie was [a rather exceptionally good public speaker]2841-a rather exceptionally good public speaker . Only [her]323-marjorie elopement and marriage had prevented [her]323-marjorie being [president of [[her]323-marjorie college Debating Society]123-her college debating society]2842-president of her college debating society . If [she]323-marjorie devoted [herself]323-marjorie to some movement [she]323-marjorie would be free to devise an ostentatiously simple dress for [herself]323-marjorie and stick to it , and [she]323-marjorie would be able to give [[her]323-marjorie little house]2843-her little house a significance of [her]323-marjorie own , and present [herself]323-marjorie publicly against what is perhaps quite the best of all backgrounds for [a good - looking , clear - voiced , self - possessed woman]2844-a good - looking , clear - voiced , self - possessed woman , a platform . Yes ; [she]323-marjorie had to go in for a Movement . [She]323-marjorie reviewed the chief contemporary Movements much as [she]323-marjorie might have turned over dress fabrics in [[a draper]2845-a draper 's shop]2846-a draper 's shop , weighing the advantages and disadvantages of each .... [London]17-london , of course , is always full of Movements . Essentially they are absorbents of superfluous feminine energy . [They]2847-they have a common flavour of progress and revolutionary purpose , and common features in abundant meetings , [officials]2848-officials , and organization generally . Few are expensive , and still fewer produce any tangible results in [the world]589-the world . [They]2847-they direct [themselves]2847-they at the most various ends ; [the Poor]5386-the poor , [that favourite butt]2851-that favourite butt , either as a whole or in such typical sections as [the indigent invalid]2852-the indigent invalid or [the indigent aged]2853-the indigent aged , [the young]1241-the young , public health , [the woman]5030-the woman 's cause , the prevention of animal food , anti - vivisection , the gratuitous advertisement of [Shakespear]2856-shakespear ( [that neglected poet]2857-that neglected poet ) , novel but genteel modifications of medical or religious practice , dress reform , the politer aspects of socialism , the encouragement of æronautics , universal military service , garden suburbs , domestic arts , proportional representation , duodecimal arithmetic , and the liberation of the drama . [They]2847-they range in size and importance from campaigns on a Plessingtonian scale to [sober little intellectual Beckingham things that arrange to meet half - yearly , and die quietly before the second assembly]2858-sober little intellectual beckingham things that arrange to meet half - yearly , and die quietly before the second assembly . If [Heaven]388-heaven by some miracle suddenly gave every Movement in [London]17-london all [it]2859-it professed to want , [[our]2860-our world]2861-our world would be standing on [its]2859-it head and everything would be extremely unfamiliar and disconcerting . But , as [Mr. Roosevelt]442-mr. roosevelt once remarked , the justifying thing about life is the effort and not the goal , and few Movements involve any real and impassioned struggle to get to the ostensible object . [They]2847-they exist as an occupation ; [they]2847-they exercise the intellectual and moral activities without undue disturbance of the normal routines of life . In the days when [everybody]1328-everybody was bicycling an ingenious mechanism called [Hacker]443-hacker 's Home Bicycle used to be advertised . [Hacker]443-hacker 's Home Bicycle was a stand bearing small rubber wheels upon which [one]675-one placed [one]675-one 's bicycle ( properly equipped with a cyclometer ) in such a way that it could be mounted and ridden without any sensible forward movement whatever . In bad weather , or when the state of [the roads]2188-the roads made cycling abroad disagreeable [Hacker]443-hacker 's Home Bicycle could be placed in front of an open window and ridden furiously for any length of time . Whenever [the rider]2866-the rider tired , [he]2866-the rider could descend — comfortably at [home]810-home again — and examine the cyclometer to see how far [he]2866-the rider had been . In exactly the same way the ordinary [London]17-london Movement gives scope for the restless and progressive impulse in human nature without the risk of personal entanglements or any inconvenient disturbance of the milieu . [Marjorie]323-marjorie considered the Movements about [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie surveyed the accessible aspects of socialism , but that old treasure - house of constructive suggestion had an effect like [a rich château which had been stormed and looted by [a mob]2869-a mob]2868-a rich château which had been stormed and looted by a mob . For a time the proposition that " [we]5538-we are all Socialists nowadays "[2886-the small lady in glasses] had prevailed . The blackened and discredited frame remained , the contents were scattered ; [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington had a few pieces , [the Tory Democrats]444-the tory democrats had taken freely , [the Liberals]2870-the liberals were in possession of a hastily compiled collection . There was n't , [she]323-marjorie perceived , and there never had been a Socialist Movement ; the socialist idea which had now become part of the general consciousness , had always been too big for polite domestication . [She]323-marjorie weighed [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , too , in the balance , and found [her]253-aunt plessington not so much wanting indeed as excessive . [She]323-marjorie felt that a Movement with [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington in it could n't possibly offer even elbow - room for [anybody else]2358-anybody else . Philanthropy generally [she]323-marjorie shunned . The movements that aim at getting [poor people]1313-poor people into [rooms]2873-rooms and shouting at [them]1313-poor people in an improving , authoritative way , aroused an instinctive dislike in [her]323-marjorie . [Her]323-marjorie sense of humour , again , would not let [her]323-marjorie patronize Shakespear or the stage , or raise the artistic level of [the country]613-the country by means of green - dyed deal , and the influence of [Trafford]436-trafford on [her]323-marjorie mind debarred [her]323-marjorie from attempting the physical and moral regeneration of humanity by means of beans and nut butter . It was indeed rather by the elimination of competing movements than by any positive preference that [she]323-marjorie found [herself]323-marjorie declining at last towards [Agatha Alimony]432-agatha alimony 's section of the suffrage movement .... It was one of the less militant sections , but it held more meetings and passed more resolutions than any two others . One day [Trafford]436-trafford , returning from an afternoon of forced and disappointing work in [his]2875-he laboratory,—his mind had been steadfastly sluggish and inelastic,—discovered [[Marjorie]323-marjorie 's dining room]2876-marjorie 's dining room crowded with hats and all the rustle and colour which plays so large a part in constituting contemporary feminine personality . [Buzard]416-buzard , [the feminist writer]2877-the feminist writer , and [a young man just down from [Cambridge]25-cambridge who had written a decadent poem]2878-a young man just down from cambridge who had written a decadent poem , were [the only men present]2879-the only men present . The chairs were arranged meeting - fashion , but a little irregularly to suggest informality ; the post - impressionist picture was a rosy benediction on the gathering , and at a table in the window sat [Mrs. Pope]264-mrs. pope in the chair , looking quietly tactful in an unusually becoming bonnet , supported by [[her]264-mrs. pope daughter]772-her daughter and [Agatha Alimony]432-agatha alimony . [Marjorie]323-marjorie was in a simple gown of blueish - grey , hatless amidst a froth of foolish bows and feathers , and [she]323-marjorie looked not only beautiful and dignified but deliberately and conscientiously patient until [she]323-marjorie perceived the new arrival . Then [he]2875-he noted [she]323-marjorie was a little concerned for [him]2875-he , and made some futile sign [he]2875-he did not comprehend . The meeting was debating the behaviour of [women]612-women at the approaching census , and [a small , earnest , pale - faced lady with glasses]2882-a small , earnest , pale - faced lady with glasses was standing against the fireplace with a crumpled envelope covered with pencil notes in [her]2882-a small , earnest , pale - faced lady with glasses hand , and making a speech . [Trafford]436-trafford wanted [his]2875-he tea badly , but [he]2875-he had not the wit to realize that [[his]2875-he study]2108-his study had been converted into [a refreshment room]2884-a refreshment room for the occasion ; [he]2875-he hesitated , and seated [himself]2875-he near the doorway , and so [he]2875-he was caught ; [he]2875-he could n't , [he]2875-he felt , get away and seem to slight [a woman who was giving [herself]2885-a woman who was giving herself the pains of addressing him the pains of addressing [him]2875-he]2885-a woman who was giving herself the pains of addressing him . [The small lady in glasses]2886-the small lady in glasses was giving a fancy picture of the mind of [Mr. Asquith]445-mr. asquith and its attitude to the suffrage movement , and telling with a sort of inspired intimacy just how [Mr. Asquith]445-mr. asquith had hoped to " bully [women]612-women down , "[2891-the women of england] and just how [their]2887-their various attempts to bring [home]810-home to [him]445-mr. asquith the eminent reasonableness of [their]2887-their sex by breaking [his]445-mr. asquith windows , interrupting [his]445-mr. asquith meetings , booing at [him]445-mr. asquith in [the streets]1539-the streets and threatening [his]445-mr. asquith life , had time after time baffled this arrogant hope . There had been many signs lately that [Mr. Asquith]445-mr. asquith 's heart was failing [him]445-mr. asquith . Now here was a new thing to fill [him]445-mr. asquith with despair . When [Mr. Asquith]445-mr. asquith learnt that [women]612-women refused to be counted in the census , then at least [she]2885-a woman who was giving herself the pains of addressing him was convinced [he]445-mr. asquith must give in . When [he]445-mr. asquith gave in it would not be long — [she]2885-a woman who was giving herself the pains of addressing him had [her]2885-a woman who was giving herself the pains of addressing him information upon good authority — before [they]2887-their got the Vote . So what [they]2887-their had to do was not to be counted in the census . That was [their]2887-their paramount duty at the present time . [The women of [England]9-england]2891-the women of england had to say quietly but firmly to [the census man]2892-the census man when [he]2892-the census man came round : " No , [we]2887-their do n't count in an election , and [we]2887-their wo n't count now . Thank [you]2892-the census man . "[323-marjorie] [No one]4871-no one could force [a woman]4857-a woman to fill in a census paper [she]4857-a woman did n't want to , and for [her]4857-a woman own part , said [the little woman with the glasses]2895-the little woman with the glasses , [she]4857-a woman 'd starve first . [She]4857-a woman [herself]4857-a woman was prepared , and [[her]4857-a woman house]2513-her house would be ready . "[323-marjorie] ) What was the commonest charge made by [the man]1016-the man in [the street]1545-the street against women?—that [they]2947-they were unreasonable and unmanageable , that it was [their]2947-they way to get things by crying and making an irrelevant fuss . And here [they]2947-they were , as a body , doing that very thing ! Let [them]2947-they think what the census and all that modern organization of vital statistics of which it was the central feature stood for . It stood for order , for the replacement of guesses and emotional generalization by a clear knowledge of facts , for the replacement of instinctive and violent methods , by which [women]612-women had everything to lose ( a voice : " No ! "[394-trafford] ) by reason and knowledge and self - restraint , by which [women]612-women had everything to gain . To [her]323-marjorie the advancement of science , the progress of civilization , and the emancipation of womanhood were nearly synonymous terms . [They]3001-their were already at the problem of [their]3001-their joint lives , like a tailor with [his]3002-his pins and chalk . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had n't rejected [a humorist]3003-a humorist and all [his]3003-a humorist works in order to decline at last to the humorous view of life , that rather stupid , rather pathetic , grin - and - bear - it attitude compounded in incalculable proportions of goodwill , evasion , indolence , slovenliness , and ( nevertheless ) spite ( masquerading indeed as jesting comment ) , which supplies the fabric of everyday life for [untold thousands of [educated middle - class people]3005-educated middle - class people]3004-untold thousands of educated middle - class people . [She]323-marjorie hated [the misfit]3006-the misfit . [She]323-marjorie did n't for a moment propose to pretend that the ungainly twisted sleeve , the puckered back , was extremely jolly and funny . [She]323-marjorie had married with a passionate anticipation of things fitting and fine , and it was [her]323-marjorie nature , in great matters as in small , to get what [she]323-marjorie wanted strenuously before [she]323-marjorie counted the cost . About both [their]3001-their minds there was something sharp and unrelenting , and if [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been disposed to take refuge from facts in swathings of aesthetic romanticism , whatever covering [she]323-marjorie contrived would have been torn to rags very speedily by that fierce and steely veracity which swung down out of [the laboratory]2135-the laboratory into [[her]323-marjorie home]2203-her home . [One]675-one may want to talk things out long before one hits upon the phrases that will open up the matter . There were two chief facts in the case between [them]3001-their and so far [they]3001-their had looked only one in the face , the fact that [Marjorie]323-marjorie was unemployed to a troublesome and distressing extent , and that there was nothing in [her]323-marjorie nature or training to supply , and something in [their]3001-their circumstances and relations to prevent any adequate use of [her]323-marjorie energies . With the second fact neither of [them]3001-their cared to come to close quarters as yet , and neither as yet saw very distinctly how it was linked to the first , and that was the steady excess of [her]323-marjorie expenditure over [their]3001-their restricted means . [She]323-marjorie was secretly surprised at [her]323-marjorie own weakness . Week by week and month by month , [they]3001-their were spending all [his]3010-him income and eating into that little accumulation of capital that had once seemed so sufficient against [the world]589-the world .... And here it has to be told that although [Trafford]394-trafford knew that [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been spending too much money , [he]3010-him still had no idea of just how much money [she]323-marjorie had spent . [She]323-marjorie was doing [her]323-marjorie utmost to come to an understanding with [him]3010-him , and at the same time — [I]0-i do n't explain it , [I]0-i do n't excuse it — [she]323-marjorie was keeping back [her]323-marjorie bills from [him]3010-him , keeping back urgent second and third and fourth demands , that [she]323-marjorie had no cheque - book now to stave off even by the most partial satisfaction . It kept [her]323-marjorie awake at nights , that catastrophic explanation , that all unsuspected by [Trafford]394-trafford hung over [their]3001-their attempts at mutual elucidation ; it kept [her]323-marjorie awake but [she]323-marjorie could not bring it to the speaking point , and [she]323-marjorie clung , in spite of [her]323-marjorie own intelligence , to a persuasion that after [they]3001-their had got something really settled and defined then it would be time enough to broach the particulars of this second divergence .... Talking one 's relations over is n't particularly easy between [husband]3012-husband and [wife]3013-wife at any time ; [we]3014-we are none of [us]3014-we so sure of [one another]863-one another as to risk loose phrases or make experiments in expression in matters so vital ; there is inevitably an excessive caution on the one hand and an abnormal sensitiveness to hints and implications on the other . [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's bills were only an extreme instance of these unavoidable suppressions that always occur . Moreover , when [two people]3016-two people are continuously together , it is amazingly hard to know when and where to begin ; where intercourse is unbroken it is as a matter of routine being constantly interrupted . [You]3017-you can not broach these broad personalities while [you]3017-you are getting up in the morning , or over the breakfast - table while [you]3017-you make the coffee , or when [you]3017-you meet again after a multitude of small events at tea , or in the evening when [one]675-one is rather tired and trivial after the work of the day . Then [Miss Margharita Trafford]436-trafford permitted no sustained analysis of life in [her]436-trafford presence . [She]436-trafford synthesized things fallaciously , but for the time convincingly ; [she]436-trafford insisted that life was n't a thing [you]3017-you discussed , but pink and soft and jolly , which [you]3017-you crowed at and laughed at and addressed as " Goo . "[3028-he] Even without [Margharita]436-trafford there were occasions when [the Traffords]425-the traffords were a forgetfulness to [one another]863-one another . After an ear has been pinched or a hand has been run through [a man]837-a man 's hair , or a pretty bare shoulder kissed , all sorts of broader interests lapse into a temporary oblivion . [They]425-the traffords found discussion much more possible when [they]425-the traffords walked together . A walk seemed to take [them]425-the traffords out of the everyday sequence , isolate [them]425-the traffords from [[their]425-the traffords household]3021-their household , abstract [them]425-the traffords a little from [one another]863-one another . [They]425-the traffords set out one extravagant spring Sunday to [Great Missenden]120-great missenden , and once in spring also [they]425-the traffords discovered [the Waterlow Park]3023-the waterlow park . On each occasion [they]425-the traffords seemed to get through an enormous amount of talking . But the Great Missenden walk was all mixed up with a sweet keen wind , and beechwoods just shot with spring green and bursting hedges and the extreme earliness of honeysuckle , which [Trafford]436-trafford noted for the first time , and a clamorous rejoicing of birds . And in [the Waterlow Park]3023-the waterlow park there was a great discussion of why the yellow crocus comes before white and purple , and the closest examination of the manner in which daffodils and narcissi thrust [their]425-the traffords green noses out of the garden beds . Also [they]425-the traffords found [the ugly , ill - served , aggressively propagandist non - alcoholic refreshment - room in [that gracious old house]3026-that gracious old house]3025-the ugly , ill - served , aggressively propagandist non - alcoholic refreshment - room in that gracious old house a scandal and disappointment , and [Trafford]436-trafford scolded at the stupidity of officialdom that can control so fine a thing so ill . Though [they]425-the traffords talked on these walks [they]425-the traffords were still curiously evasive . Indeed , [they]425-the traffords were afraid of [each other]709-each other . [They]425-the traffords kept falling away from [their]425-the traffords private thoughts and intentions . [They]425-the traffords generalized , [they]425-the traffords discussed Marriage and [George Gissing]451-george gissing and [Bernard Shaw]324-shaw and the suffrage movement and the agitation for the reform of the divorce laws . [They]425-the traffords pursued imaginary cases into distant thickets of contingency remotely far from the personal issues between [them]425-the traffords .... One day came an incident that [Marjorie]323-marjorie found wonderfully illuminating . [Trafford]436-trafford had a fit of rage . Stung by an unexpected irritation , [he]3028-he forgot [himself]3028-he , as [people]631-people say , and swore , and was almost physically violent , and the curious thing was that so [he]3028-he lit up things for [her]323-marjorie as no premeditated attempt of [his]3028-he had ever done . A copy of the Scientific Bulletin fired the explosion . [He]3028-he sat down at the breakfast - table with the heaviness of [a rather overworked and worried man]3030-a rather overworked and worried man , tasted [his]3028-he coffee , tore open a letter and crumpled it with [his]3028-he hand , turned to [the Bulletin]3031-the bulletin , regarded its list of contents with a start , opened it , read for a minute , and expressed [himself]3028-he with an extraordinary heat of manner in these amazing and unprecedented words : " Oh ! Damnation and damnation ! "[3028-he] Then [he]3028-he shied the paper into the corner of [the room]813-the room and pushed [his]3028-he plate from [him]3028-he . " Damn the whole scheme of things ! [It]5586-the babe is getting so pretty , and it talks — — "[436-trafford] [Margharita]436-trafford dominated intercourse for a time . "[258-daffy] At this point [Margharita]436-trafford discovered that the conversation had drifted away from [herself]436-trafford , and it was only when [they]3060-they got [downstairs]787-downstairs again that [Daffy]258-daffy could resume the thread of [Magnet]286-mr. magnet 's career , which had evidently become the predominant interest in [her]258-daffy life . [She]258-daffy brought out all the worst elements of [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's nature and [their]3060-they sisterly relationship .
