"[323-marjorie] When [Daffy]258-daffy had at last gone [Marjorie]323-marjorie went back into [[Trafford]436-trafford 's study]3064-trafford 's study and stood on the hearthrug regarding its appointments , with something of the air of [one who awakens from a dream]3065-one who awakens from a dream . [She]323-marjorie had developed a new , appalling thought . Was [Daffy]258-daffy really [a better wife]3066-a better wife than [herself]323-marjorie ? It was dawning upon [Marjorie]323-marjorie that [she]323-marjorie had n't been doing the right thing by [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband , and [she]323-marjorie was as surprised as if it had been suddenly brought [home]810-home to [her]323-marjorie that [she]323-marjorie was neglecting [Margharita]436-trafford . This was [[[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband 's study]3070-her husband 's study — and it showed just a little dusty in the afternoon sunshine , and everything about it denied the pretensions of serene sustained work that [she]323-marjorie had always made to [herself]323-marjorie . Here were the crumpled galley proofs of [his]1267-her husband science notes ; here were unanswered letters . There , [she]323-marjorie dare not touch them , were computations , under a glass paper - weight . What did they amount to now ? On the table under the window were back numbers of the Scientific Bulletin in a rather untidy pile , and on the footstool by the arm - chair [she]323-marjorie had been accustomed to sit at [his]1267-her husband feet when [he]1267-her husband stayed at [home]810-home to work , and look into the fire , and watch [him]1267-her husband furtively , and sometimes give way to an overmastering tenderness and make love to [him]1267-her husband . The thought of [Magnet]286-mr. magnet , pampered , fenced around , revered in [his]1267-her husband industrious tiresome repetitions , variations , dramatizations and so forth of the half - dozen dry little old jokes which [the British public]3072-the british public accepted as [his]1267-her husband characteristic offering and rewarded [him]1267-her husband for so highly , contrasted vividly with [her]323-marjorie new realization of [Trafford]436-trafford 's thankless work and worried face . And [she]323-marjorie loved [him]1267-her husband , [she]323-marjorie loved [him]1267-her husband — so . [She]323-marjorie told [herself]323-marjorie in the presence of all these facts , and without a shadow of doubt in [her]323-marjorie mind that all [she]323-marjorie wanted in [the world]589-the world was to make [him]1267-her husband happy . It occurred to [her]323-marjorie as a rather drastic means to this end that [she]323-marjorie might commit suicide . [She]323-marjorie had already gone some way in the composition of a touching letter of farewell to [him]1267-her husband , containing a luminous analysis of [her]323-marjorie own defects , before [her]323-marjorie common - sense swept away this imaginative exercise . Meanwhile , as if it had been working at [her]323-marjorie problem all the time that this exciting farewell epistle had occupied the foreground of [her]323-marjorie thoughts , [her]323-marjorie natural lucidity emerged with the manifest conclusion that [she]323-marjorie had to alter [her]323-marjorie way of living . [She]323-marjorie had been extraordinarily regardless of [him]1267-her husband , [she]323-marjorie only began to see that , and now [she]323-marjorie had to take up the problem of [his]1267-her husband necessities . [Her]323-marjorie self - examination now that it had begun was thorough . [She]323-marjorie had always told [herself]323-marjorie before that [she]323-marjorie had made [a most wonderful and beautiful little home for [him]1267-her husband]3074-a most wonderful and beautiful little home for him . But had [she]323-marjorie made it for [him]1267-her husband ? Had [he]1267-her husband as a matter of fact ever wanted it , except that [he]1267-her husband was glad to have it through [her]323-marjorie ? No doubt it had given [him]1267-her husband delight and happiness , it had been a marvellous little casket of love for [them]3075-them , but how far did that outweigh the burthen and limitation it had imposed upon [him]1267-her husband ? [She]323-marjorie had always assumed [he]1267-her husband was beyond measure grateful to [her]323-marjorie for [[his]1267-her husband home]1486-his home , in spite of all [her]323-marjorie bills , but was [he]1267-her husband ? It was like sticking a knife into [herself]323-marjorie to ask that , but [she]323-marjorie was now in a phase heroic enough for the task — was [he]1267-her husband ? [She]323-marjorie had always seen [herself]323-marjorie as [the giver of bounties]3077-the giver of bounties ; greatest bounty of all was [Margharita]436-trafford . [She]323-marjorie had faced pains and terrors and the shadow of death to give [him]1267-her husband [Margharita]436-trafford . Now with [Daffy]258-daffy 's illuminating conversation in [her]323-marjorie mind , [she]323-marjorie could turn the light upon a haunting doubt that had been lurking in the darkness for a long time . Had [he]1267-her husband really so greatly wanted [Margharita]436-trafford ? Had [she]323-marjorie ever troubled to get to the bottom of that before ? Had n't [she]323-marjorie as a matter of fact wanted [Margharita]436-trafford ten thousand times more than [he]1267-her husband had done ? Had n't [she]323-marjorie in effect imposed Margharita upon [him]1267-her husband , as [she]323-marjorie had imposed [[her]323-marjorie distinctive and delightful home]3078-her distinctive and delightful home upon [him]1267-her husband , regardlessly , because these things were the natural and legitimate developments of [herself]323-marjorie ? These things were not [his]1267-her husband ends . Had [she]323-marjorie hitherto ever really cared what [his]1267-her husband ends might be ? A phrase [she]323-marjorie had heard abundantly enough in current feminist discussion recurred to [her]323-marjorie mind , " the economic dependence of [women]612-women , "[456-kuropatki] and now for the first time it was charged with meaning . [She]323-marjorie had imposed these things upon [him]1267-her husband not because [she]323-marjorie loved [him]1267-her husband , but because these things that were the expansions and consequences of [her]323-marjorie love for [him]1267-her husband were only obtainable through [him]1267-her husband . [A woman]4857-a woman gives [herself]4857-a woman to [a man out of love]3080-a man out of love , and remains clinging parasitically to [him]1267-her husband out of necessity . Was there no way of evading that necessity ? For a time [she]323-marjorie entertained dreams of marvellous social reconstructions . Suppose [the community]1307-the community kept [all [its]1307-the community women]3082-all its women , suppose all property in [homes]3083-homes and furnishings and [children]1961-children vested in [them]1307-the community ! That was [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's version of that idea of the Endowment of Womanhood which has been creeping into contemporary thought during the last two decades . Then [every woman]1966-every woman would be [a Princess]3086-a princess to [the man [she]1966-every woman loved]3087-the man she loved .... [He]3087-the man she loved became more definitely personal . Suppose [she]323-marjorie [herself]323-marjorie was rich , then [she]323-marjorie could play [the Princess]3088-the princess to [Trafford]436-trafford ; [she]323-marjorie could have [him]1267-her husband free , unencumbered , happy and [[her]323-marjorie lover]1579-her lover ! Then , indeed , [her]323-marjorie gifts would be gifts , and all [her]323-marjorie instincts and motives would but crown [his]1267-her husband unhampered life ! [She]323-marjorie could not go on from that idea , [she]323-marjorie lapsed into a golden reverie , from which [she]323-marjorie was roused by the clock striking five . In half an hour perhaps [Trafford]436-trafford would be [home]810-home again . [She]323-marjorie could at least be so much of [a princess]3086-a princess as to make [his]1267-her husband home sweet for [his]1267-her husband home - coming . There should be tea in [here]4725-here , where [callers]2377-callers did not trouble . [She]323-marjorie glanced at an empty copper vase . It ached . There was no light in [the room]813-the room . There would be just time to dash out into [High Street]13-high street and buy some flowers for it before [he]1267-her husband came .... Spring and a renewed and deepened love for [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband were in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's blood . [Her]323-marjorie mind worked rapidly during the next few days , and presently [she]323-marjorie found [herself]323-marjorie clearly decided upon [her]323-marjorie course of action . [She]323-marjorie had to pull [herself]323-marjorie together and help [him]1267-her husband , and if that meant a Spartan and strenuous way of living , then manifestly [she]323-marjorie must be [Spartan]455-spartan and strenuous . [She]323-marjorie must put an end once for all to [her]323-marjorie recurrent domestic deficits , and since this could only be done by getting rid of [May]323-marjorie , [she]323-marjorie must get rid of [May]323-marjorie and mind [the child]1188-the child [herself]323-marjorie . ( Every day , thank [Heaven]388-heaven ! [Margharita]436-trafford became more intelligent , more manageable , and more interesting . ) Then [she]323-marjorie must also make a far more systematic and thorough study of domestic economy than [she]323-marjorie had hitherto done , and run the shopping and housekeeping on severer lines ; [she]323-marjorie bought fruit carelessly , they had far too many joints ; [she]323-marjorie never seemed able to restrain [herself]323-marjorie when it came to flowers . And in the evenings , which would necessarily be very frequently lonely evenings if [Trafford]436-trafford 's researches were to go on , [she]436-trafford would typewrite , and either acquire great speed at that or learn shorthand , and so save [Trafford]436-trafford 's present expenditure on [a typist]2684-a typist . That unfortunately would mean buying a typewriter . [She]323-marjorie found one afternoon in a twopenny book - box , with which [she]323-marjorie was trying to allay [her]323-marjorie craving for purchases , a tattered little pamphlet entitled : " Proposals for the Establishment of [an Order of Samurai]5599-an order of samurai , "[456-kuropatki] which fell in very exactly with [her]323-marjorie mood . The title " dated "[436-trafford] ; it carried [her]323-marjorie mind back to [her]323-marjorie middle girlhood and the defeats of [Kuropatki]456-kuropatki and the futile earnest phase in English thought which followed the Boer War . The order was to be [a sort of self - appointed nobility serving [the world]589-the world]3098-a sort of self - appointed nobility serving the world . It shone with the light of a generous dawn , but cast , [I]0-i fear , the shadow of the prig . Its end was the Agenda Club .... [She]323-marjorie read and ceased to read — and dreamt . The project unfolded the picture of a new method of conduct to [her]323-marjorie , austere , yet picturesque and richly noble . [These Samurai]3100-these samurai , it was intimated , were to lead lives of hard discipline and high effort , under self - imposed rule and restraint . [They]3100-these samurai were to stand a little apart from the excitements and temptations of everyday life , to eat sparingly , drink water , resort greatly to self - criticism and self - examination , and harden [their]3100-these samurai spirits by severe and dangerous exercises . [They]3100-these samurai were to dress simply , work hard , and be the conscious and deliberate salt of [the world]589-the world . [They]3100-these samurai were to walk among [mountains]3102-mountains . Incidentally , great power was to be given [them]3100-these samurai . Such systematic effort and self - control as this , seemed to [Marjorie]323-marjorie to give just all [she]323-marjorie was n't and needed to be , to save [her]323-marjorie life and [Trafford]436-trafford 's from a common disaster .... It particularly appealed to [her]323-marjorie that [they]3100-these samurai were to walk among mountains .... But it is hard to make a change in the colour of [one]675-one 's life amidst the routine [one]675-one has already established about [oneself]675-one , in [the house that is grooved by one 's weaknesses]3105-the house that is grooved by one 's weaknesses , amidst hangings and ornaments living and breathing with the life of an antagonistic and yet insidiously congenial ideal . A great desire came upon [Marjorie]323-marjorie to go away with [Trafford]365-trafford for a time , out of [their]3100-these samurai everyday life into strange and cool and spacious surroundings . [She]323-marjorie wanted to leave [London]17-london and [[its]17-london shops]3106-its shops , and [the home]1106-the home and the movements and [the callers]3108-the callers and [rivalries]3109-rivalries , and even dimpled little [Margharita]436-trafford 's insistent claims , and get free and think . It was the first invasion of [their]3100-these samurai lives by this conception , a conception that was ever afterwards to leave [them]3100-these samurai altogether , of retreat and reconstruction . [She]323-marjorie knelt upon the white sheepskin hearthrug at [Trafford]436-trafford 's feet one night , and told [him]365-trafford of [her]323-marjorie desire . [He]365-trafford , too , was tired of [his]365-trafford work and [his]365-trafford vexations , and ripe for this suggestion of an altered life . The Easter holiday was approaching , and nearly twenty unencumbered days . [Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford , [they]3100-these samurai knew , would come into [the house]742-the house , meanwhile , and care for [Margharita]436-trafford . [They]3100-these samurai would go away somewhere together and walk , no luggage but a couple of knapsacks , [no hotel]3111-no hotel but [some homely village inn]3112-some homely village inn . [They]3100-these samurai would be in the air all day , until [they]3100-these samurai were saturated with sweet air and spirit of clean restraints . [They]3100-these samurai would plan out [their]3100-these samurai new rule , concentrate [their]3100-these samurai aims . " And [I]436-trafford could think , "[436-trafford] said [Trafford]436-trafford , " of this new work [I]424-solomonson ca n't begin here . [I]424-solomonson might make some notes . "[424-solomonson] Presently came the question of where the great walk should be . Manifestly , it must be among [mountains]3102-mountains , manifestly , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's eye saw [those mountains with snow upon [their]3114-those mountains with snow upon their summits and cold glaciers on their flanks summits and cold glaciers on [their]3114-those mountains with snow upon their summits and cold glaciers on their flanks flanks]3114-those mountains with snow upon their summits and cold glaciers on their flanks . Could [they]3100-these samurai get to [Switzerland]20-switzerland ? If [they]3100-these samurai travelled second class throughout , and took the cheaper way , as [Samurai]457-samurai should ? ... That holiday seemed to [Marjorie]323-marjorie as if [they]3100-these samurai had found [a lost and forgotten piece of honeymoon]3115-a lost and forgotten piece of honeymoon . [She]323-marjorie had that same sense of fresh beginnings that had made [their]3100-these samurai first walk in [Italian Switzerland]20-switzerland so unforgettable . [She]323-marjorie was filled with the happiness of recovering [Trafford]436-trafford when [he]3116-he had seemed to be slipping from [her]323-marjorie . All day [they]3100-these samurai talked of [their]3100-these samurai outlook , and how [they]3100-these samurai might economise away the need of [his]3116-he extra work , and so release [him]3116-he for [his]3116-he search again . For the first time [he]3116-he talked of [his]3116-he work to [her]323-marjorie , and gave [her]323-marjorie some intimation of its scope and quality . [He]3116-he became enthusiastic with the sudden invention of experimental devices , so that it seemed to [her]323-marjorie almost worth while if instead of going on [they]3100-these samurai bolted back , [he]3116-he to [[his]3116-he laboratory]2105-his laboratory and [she]323-marjorie to [[her]323-marjorie nursery]3118-her nursery , and so at once inaugurated the new régime . But [they]3100-these samurai went on , to finish the holiday out . And the delight of being together again with unfettered hours of association ! [They]3100-these samurai rediscovered [each other]709-each other , the same — and a little changed . If [their]3100-these samurai emotions were less bright and intense , [their]3100-these samurai interest was far wider and deeper . The season was too early for high passes , and the weather was changeable . [They]3100-these samurai started from [Fribourg]129-fribourg and walked to [Thun]130-thun and then back to [Bulle]131-bulle , and so to [Bultigen]132-bultigen , [Saanen]133-saanen , [Montbovon]134-montbovon and [the Lake of [Geneva]135-geneva]3120-the lake of geneva . [They]3100-these samurai had rain several days , the sweet , soft , windless mountain rain that seemed so tolerable to those who are accustomed to the hard and driven downpours of [England]9-england , and in [places]3121-places [they]3100-these samurai found mud and receding snow ; [the inns]3122-the inns were at [[their]3122-the inns homeliest]3123-their homeliest , and none the worse for that , and there were days of spring sunshine when a multitude of minute and delightful flowers came out as it seemed to meet [them]3100-these samurai — it was impossible to suppose so great a concourse universal — and spread in a scented carpet before [their]3100-these samurai straying feet . The fruit trees in [the valleys]3124-the valleys were powdered with blossom , and the new grass seemed rather green - tinted sunlight than merely green . And [they]3100-these samurai walked with a sort of stout leisureliness , knapsacks well - hung and cloaks about [them]3100-these samurai , with [their]3100-these samurai faces fresh and bright under the bracing weather , and [their]3100-these samurai lungs deep charged with mountain air , talking of the new austerer life that was now beginning . With great snow - capped mountains in the background , streaming precipices overhead , and a sward of flowers to go upon , that strenuous prospect was altogether delightful . [They]3100-these samurai went as it pleased [them]3100-these samurai , making detours into [valleys]3125-valleys , coming back upon [their]3100-these samurai steps . The interludes of hot , bright April sunshine made [them]3100-these samurai indolent , and [they]3100-these samurai would loiter and halt where [some rock]3126-some rock or wall invited , and sit basking like happy , animals , talking very little , for long hours together . [Trafford]436-trafford seemed to have forgotten all the strain and disappointment of the past two years , to be amazed but in no wise incredulous at this enormous change in [her]436-trafford and in [their]3100-these samurai outlook ; it filled [her]436-trafford with a passion of pride and high resolve to think that so [she]436-trafford could recover and uplift [him]3127-he . [He]3127-he was now very deeply in love with [her]436-trafford again . [He]3127-he talked indeed of [his]3127-he research , but so that it might interest [her]436-trafford , and when [he]3127-he thought alone , [he]3127-he thought , not of it , but of [her]436-trafford , making again the old discoveries , [his]3127-he intense delight in the quality of [her]436-trafford voice , [his]3127-he joy in a certain indescribable gallantry in [her]436-trafford bearing . [He]3127-he pitied [all men whose wives could not carry [themselves]3128-all men whose wives could not carry themselves , and whose voices failed and broke under the things they had to say , and whose voices failed and broke under the things [they]3128-all men whose wives could not carry themselves , and whose voices failed and broke under the things they had to say had to say]3128-all men whose wives could not carry themselves , and whose voices failed and broke under the things they had to say . And then again there was the way [she]436-trafford moved [her]436-trafford arms , the way [her]436-trafford hands took hold of things , the alert lucidity of [her]436-trafford eyes , and then that faint , soft shadow of a smile upon [her]436-trafford lips when [she]436-trafford walked thinking or observant , all unaware that [he]3127-he was watching [her]436-trafford . It rained in the morning of [their]3129-we eleventh day and then gave way to warmth and sunshine , so that [they]3129-we arrived at [Les Avants]136-les avants in the afternoon a little muddy and rather hot . At one of the tables under the trees outside [the Grand Hotel]3130-the grand hotel was [a small group of people dressed in the remarkable and imposing costume which still in those days distinguished [the motorist]3132-the motorist]3131-a small group of people dressed in the remarkable and imposing costume which still in those days distinguished the motorist . [They]3131-a small group of people dressed in the remarkable and imposing costume which still in those days distinguished the motorist turned from [their]3131-a small group of people dressed in the remarkable and imposing costume which still in those days distinguished the motorist tea to a more or less frank inspection of [the Traffords]425-the traffords , and suddenly broke out into cries of recognition and welcome . [Solomonson]424-solomonson — for the most part brown leather — emerged with extended hands , and behind [him]3127-he , nestling in the midst of immense and costly furs , appeared the kindly salience and brightness of [[his]3127-he Lady]3133-his lady 's face . " Good luck ! "[424-solomonson] cried [Solomonson]424-solomonson . " Good luck ! Come and have tea with [us]3129-we ! But this is a happy encounter ! "[323-marjorie] " [We]3129-we 're dirty — but so healthy ! "[3134-that lady] cried [Marjorie]323-marjorie , saluting [Lady Solomonson]424-solomonson . " [You]424-solomonson look , oh!—splendidly well , "[3134-that lady] [that Lady]3134-that lady responded . " [We]3129-we 've been walking . "[424-solomonson] " With just that knapsack ! "[3134-that lady] " It 's been glorious . "[424-solomonson] " But the courage ! "[424-solomonson] said [Lady Solomonson]424-solomonson , and did not add , " the tragic hardship ! "[323-marjorie] though [her]424-solomonson tone conveyed it . [She]424-solomonson had all the unquestioning belief of [her]424-solomonson race in the sanity of comfort . [She]424-solomonson had ingrained in [her]424-solomonson the most definite ideas of [man]939-man 's position and [woman]2467-woman 's , and that [any one]1035-any one , [man]939-man or [woman]2467-woman , should walk in mud except under dire necessity , was outside the range of [her]424-solomonson philosophy . [She]424-solomonson thought [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's thick boots and short skirts quite the most appalling feminine costume [she]424-solomonson had ever seen . [She]424-solomonson saw only a ruined complexion and damaged womanhood in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's rain - washed , sun - bit cheek . [Her]424-solomonson benevolent heart rebelled at the spectacle . It was dreadful , [she]424-solomonson thought , that [nice young people]3140-nice young people like [the Traffords]425-the traffords should have come to this . [The rest of the party]1055-the rest of the party were now informally introduced . [They]1055-the rest of the party were all very splendid and disconcertingly free from mud . [One]675-one was [Christabel Morrison]458-christabel , [the actress]3143-the actress , [a graceful figure in a green baize coat and brown fur]3144-a graceful figure in a green baize coat and brown fur , who looked ever so much more charming than [her]3143-the actress innumerable postcards and illustrated - paper portraits would have led [one]675-one to expect ; [[her]3143-the actress neighbour]3146-her neighbour was [[Solomonson]424-solomonson 's cousin]3147-solomonson 's cousin [Lee]276-aurora leigh , [the organizer of the Theatre Syndicate]3148-the organizer of the theatre syndicate , [a brown - eyed , attenuated , quick - minded little man with an accent that struck [Trafford]436-trafford as being on the whole rather Dutch]3149-a brown - eyed , attenuated , quick - minded little man with an accent that struck trafford as being on the whole rather dutch , and [the third lady]3150-the third lady was [[Lady Solomonson]424-solomonson 's sister]3151-lady solomonson 's sister , [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee . It appeared [they]1055-the rest of the party were all staying at [[Lee]459-mrs. lee 's villa above [Vevey]138-vevey]3152-lee 's villa above vevey , part of an amusing assembly of [people who were either vividly rich or even more vividly clever]3153-people who were either vividly rich or even more vividly clever , an accumulation which [the Traffords]3000-the traffords in the course of the next twenty minutes were three times invited , with an increasing appreciation and earnestness , to join . From the first [[our]3155-we two young people]2527-our two young people were not indisposed to do so . For eleven days [they]2527-our two young people had maintained [their]2527-our two young people duologue at the very highest level ; seven days remained to [them]2527-our two young people before [they]2527-our two young people must go back to begin the hard new life in [England]9-england , and there was something very attractive — [they]2527-our two young people did not for a moment seek to discover the elements of that attractiveness — in this proposal of five or six days of luxurious indolence above [the lake]5329-the lake , a sort of farewell to the worldly side of worldly things , before [they]2527-our two young people set forth upon [the high and narrow path [they]2527-our two young people had resolved to tread]3158-the high and narrow path they had resolved to tread . "[462-minter] [The rest of [the company]3161-the company]3160-the rest of the company forced a hectic conversation in order not to seem to listen , and presently [Lady Solomonson]424-solomonson and [[her]424-solomonson sister]672-her sister were triumphant . [They]3160-the rest of the company packed [Marjorie]323-marjorie into [the motor car]3163-the motor car , and [Trafford]436-trafford and [Solomonson]424-solomonson returned to [Vevey]138-vevey by [train]3164-train and thence up to [the villa]3165-the villa by [a hired automobile]3166-a hired automobile . During all that time [they]3160-the rest of the company seemed lifted off [the common earth]3174-the common earth into a world of fine fabrics , agreeable sounds , noiseless unlimited service , and ample untroubled living . It had an effect of enchantment , and the long healthy arduous journey thither seemed a tale of incredible effort amidst these sunny excesses . The weather had the whim to be serenely fine , sunshine like summer and the bluest of skies shone above the white wall and the ilex thickets and cypresses that bounded [them]3160-the rest of the company in from the great world of [crowded homes]3175-crowded homes and sous and small necessities . And through the texture of it all for [Trafford]436-trafford ran a thread of curious new suggestion . An intermittent discussion of economics and socialism was going on between [himself]436-trafford and [Solomonson]424-solomonson and [an agreeable little stammering man in brown named [Minter]462-minter , who walked up in the afternoon from [Vevey,—he]140-vevey,—he professed to be writing a novel — during the earlier half of the day]3176-an agreeable little stammering man in brown named minter , who walked up in the afternoon from vevey,—he professed to be writing a novel — during the earlier half of the day . [Minter]462-minter displayed the keenest appreciation of everything in [his]462-minter entertainment , and blinked cheerfully and expressed opinions of the extremest socialistic and anarchistic flavour to an accompaniment of grateful self - indulgence . " [Your]459-mrs. lee port - wine is wonderful , [Lee]459-mrs. lee , "[462-minter] [he]462-minter would say , sipping it . " A terrible retribution will fall upon [you]459-mrs. lee some day for all this . "[462-minter] [The villa]3165-the villa had been designed by [Lee]459-mrs. lee to please [[his]3178-his wife]848-his wife , and if [it]3165-the villa was neither very beautiful nor very dignified , [it]3165-the villa was at any rate very pretty and amusing . [It]3165-the villa might have been built by [a Parisian dressmaker]3180-a parisian dressmaker — in the châteauesque style . [It]3165-the villa was of greyish - white stone , with a roof of tiles . [It]3165-the villa had little balconies and acutely roofed turrets , and almost burlesque buttresses , pierced by doors and gates ; and sun - trap loggias , as pleasantly casual as the bows and embroideries of [a woman]4857-a woman 's dress ; and [[its]3165-the villa central hall , with an impluvium that had nothing to do with rain - water]3182-its central hall , with an impluvium that had nothing to do with rain - water , and [[its]3165-the villa dining - room]3183-its dining - room , to which one ascended from [this hall]3184-this hall between pillars up five broad steps , were entirely irrelevant to all [its]3165-the villa exterior features . [Unobtrusive men - servants in grey with scarlet facings]3185-unobtrusive men - servants in grey with scarlet facings hovered serviceably . From [the little terrace]3186-the little terrace , all set with orange - trees in tubs , one could see , through the branches and stems of evergreens and over a foreground of budding , starting vineyard , the clustering roofs of [Vevey]138-vevey below , an agglomeration veiled ever so thinly in the morning by a cobweb of wood smoke , against the blue background of [lake]3187-lake with [its winged sailing - boats]3188-its winged sailing - boats , and sombre Alpine distances . [Minter]462-minter made it all significant by a wave of the hand . " All this , "[462-minter] [he]462-minter said , and of the crowded work - a - day life below , " all that . "[462-minter] " All this , "[462-minter] with [its]3165-the villa rich litter of stuffs and ornaments , its fine profusion , its delicacies of flower and food and furniture , its frequent inconsecutive pleasures , [its]3165-the villa noiseless , ready service , was remarkably novel and yet remarkably familiar to [Trafford]436-trafford . For a time [he]462-minter could not understand this undertone of familiarity , and then a sunlit group of hangings in one of [the small rooms that looked out upon [the lake]5329-the lake]3189-the small rooms that looked out upon the lake took [his]462-minter mind back to [[his]462-minter own dining - room]3191-his own dining - room , and the little inadequate , but decidedly good , Bokhara embroidery that dominated it like a flag , that lit it , and now lit [his]462-minter understanding , like a confessed desire . Of course , [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee — [happy woman!—was]3192-happy woman!—was doing just everything that [Marjorie]323-marjorie would have loved to do . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had never confessed as much , perhaps [she]323-marjorie had never understood as much , but now in the presence of [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee 's æsthetic exuberances , [Trafford]436-trafford at least understood . [He]462-minter surveyed [the little room]1425-the little room , whose harmonies [he]462-minter had at first simply taken for granted , noted the lustre - ware that answered to the gleaming Persian tiles , the inspiration of a metallic thread in the hangings , and the exquisite choice of the deadened paint upon the woodwork , and realized for the first time how little aimless extravagance can be , and all the timid , obstinately insurgent artistry that troubled [[his]462-minter wife]848-his wife . [He]462-minter stepped through the open window into a little loggia , and stared unseeingly over glittering , dark - green leaves to the mysteries of distance in the great masses above [St. Gingolph]141-st. gingolph , and it seemed for the first time that perhaps in [his]462-minter thoughts [he]462-minter had done [[his]462-minter wife]848-his wife a wrong . [He]462-minter had judged [her]848-his wife fickle , impulsive , erratic , perhaps merely because [her]848-his wife mind followed a different process from [his]462-minter , because while [he]462-minter went upon the lines of constructive truth , [her]848-his wife guide was a more immediate and instinctive sense of beauty . [He]462-minter was very much alive to [her]848-his wife now , and deeply in love with [her]848-his wife . [He]462-minter had reached [Les Avants]136-les avants with all [his]462-minter sense of [their]3196-their discordance clean washed and walked out of [his]462-minter mind , by rain and sun and a flow of high resolutions , and the brotherly swing of [their]3196-their strides together . [They]3196-their had come to [[the Lee]459-mrs. lee 's villa]3197-the lee 's villa , mud - splashed , air - sweet comrades , all unaware of the subtle differences of atmosphere [they]3196-their had to encounter . [They]3196-their had no suspicion that it was only about half of [each other]709-each other that had fraternized . Now here [they]3196-their were in a company that was not only altogether alien to [their]3196-their former mood , but extremely interesting and exciting and closely akin to the latent factors in [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's composition . [[Their]3196-their hostess]2954-their hostess and [[her]2954-their hostess sister]672-her sister had the keen , quick æsthetic sensibilities of [[their]3196-their race]3201-their race , with all that freedom of reading and enfranchisement of mind which is the lot of [the Western women]3202-the western women . [Lee]459-mrs. lee had an immense indulgent affection for [[his]462-minter wife]848-his wife , [he]462-minter regarded [her]848-his wife arrangements and exploits with an admiration that was almost American . And [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee 's imagination had run loose in pursuit of [beautiful and remarkable people]3204-beautiful and remarkable people and splendours rather than harmonies of line and colour . [Lee]459-mrs. lee , like [Solomonson]424-solomonson , had that inexplicable alchemy of mind which distils gold from [the commerce of [the world]589-the world]3205-the commerce of the world ( " All this , "[462-minter] said [Minter]462-minter to [Trafford]436-trafford , " is an exhalation from all that "[459-mrs. lee] ) ; [he]462-minter accumulated wealth as one grows a beard , and found [his]462-minter interest in [his]462-minter uxorious satisfactions , and so [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee , with [her]459-mrs. lee bright watchful eyes , quick impulsive movements and instinctive command had the utmost freedom to realize [her]459-mrs. lee ideals . [She]323-marjorie wore black and scarlet , that made the white face and bright eyes under [her]323-marjorie sombre hair seem the face of an inspiring spirit . [Radlett Barns]463-radlett barns exclaimed at the sight of [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie was full of the manifest consciousness of dignity as [she]323-marjorie descended , quite conscious and quite unembarrassed ; two borrowed golden circlets glittered on [her]323-marjorie shining arm , and a thin chain of gold and garnets broke the contrast of the warm , sun - touched neck above , with the unsullied skin below . [She]323-marjorie sought and met [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband 's astonishment with the faintest , remotest of smiles . "[424-solomonson] Next morning [they]3250-they found [[their]3250-they hostess]2954-their hostess at breakfast in [the dining - room]2244-the dining - room and now the sun was streaming through a high triple window that had been curtained overnight , and [they]3250-they looked out through clean , bright plate - glass upon mountains half - dissolved in a luminous mist , and [a mist - veiled lake below]3253-a mist - veiled lake below . [The schoolroom]1993-the schoolroom and [the nursery]1622-the nursery displayed a triumph of judicious shopping and arrangement , the best of German and French and English things had been blended into a harmony at once hygienic and pedagogic and humanly charming . "[463-radlett barns] Of course this was the clue to [Lee]459-mrs. lee and [Solomonson]424-solomonson . How extremely happy [Lee]459-mrs. lee appeared to be ! [He]365-trafford realized acutely the enormous gulf between [his]365-trafford attitudes towards [women]612-women and those of [[his]365-trafford host]982-his host and [Solomonson]424-solomonson — and indeed of [all the other men]3324-all the other men . It necessarily involved in practice a share of hardship for [women]612-women , and it seemed fundamental to [them]612-women that [women]612-women should have no hardship . [He]365-trafford sought for a word , and hung between chivalry and orientalism . [He]365-trafford inclined towards chivalry . If such thoughts came in [[Lee]459-mrs. lee 's villa]3342-lee 's villa , [they]3343-they returned with redoubled force when [Trafford]365-trafford found [himself]365-trafford packed painfully with [Marjorie]323-marjorie in [the night train]3344-the night train to [Paris]143-paris . [His]365-trafford head ached with the rattle and suffocation of [the train]663-the train , and [he]365-trafford knew [hers]323-marjorie must ache more . The windows of [the compartment]3346-the compartment and the door were all closed , [the litigious little commercial traveller in shiny grey]3347-the litigious little commercial traveller in shiny grey had insisted upon that , there was no corner seat either for [Marjorie]323-marjorie or [himself]365-trafford , the dim big package over [her]323-marjorie head swayed threateningly . The green shade over the light kept opening with the vibration of [the train]663-the train , [the pallid old gentleman with the beard]3349-the pallid old gentleman with the beard had twisted [himself]3349-the pallid old gentleman with the beard into a ghastly resemblance to a broken - necked corpse , and pressed [his]3349-the pallid old gentleman with the beard knees hard and stiffly against [Trafford]365-trafford , and [the small , sniffing , bow - legged little boy beside [the rusty widow woman in the corner]3351-the rusty widow woman in the corner]3350-the small , sniffing , bow - legged little boy beside the rusty widow woman in the corner smelt mysteriously and penetratingly of Roquefort cheese . For the seventeenth time [the little commercial traveller]3352-the little commercial traveller jumped up with an unbecoming expletive , and pulled the shade over the light , and [the silent young man in the fourth corner]3353-the silent young man in the fourth corner stirred and readjusted [his]3353-the silent young man in the fourth corner legs . For a time until the crack of light overhead had widened again every one became a dark head - dangling outline .... [He]365-trafford watched the dim shape before [him]365-trafford and noted the weary droop of [her]323-marjorie pose . [He]365-trafford wished [he]365-trafford had brought water . [He]365-trafford was intolerably thirsty , and [his]365-trafford thirst gave [him]365-trafford the measure of [hers]323-marjorie . This jolting fœtid compartment was a horrible place for [her]323-marjorie , an intolerably horrible place . And [she]323-marjorie was standing it , for all [her]323-marjorie manifest suffering , with infinite gallantry and patience . What [a gallant soul]3354-a gallant soul indeed [she]323-marjorie was ! Whatever else [she]323-marjorie did [she]323-marjorie never failed to rise to a challenge . [Her]323-marjorie very extravagance that had tried [their]3355-their lives so sorely was perhaps just one aspect of that same quality . It is so easy to be saving if [one]675-one is timid ; so hard if [one]675-one is unaccustomed to fear . How beautiful [she]323-marjorie had shone at times in the lights and glitter of [that house behind there]3358-that house behind there , and now [she]323-marjorie was back in [her]323-marjorie weather - stained tweeds again , like a shining sword thrust back into a rusty old sheath . Was it fair that [she]323-marjorie should come back into the sheath because of this passion of [his]365-trafford for a vast inexhaustible research ? [He]365-trafford had never asked [himself]365-trafford before if it was fair to assume [she]323-marjorie would follow [his]365-trafford purpose and [his]365-trafford fortunes . [He]365-trafford had taken that for granted . And [she]323-marjorie too had taken that for granted , which was so generously splendid of [her]323-marjorie . All [her]323-marjorie disloyalties had been unintentional , indeed almost instinctive , breaches of [her]323-marjorie subordination to this aim which was [his]365-trafford alone . These breaches [he]365-trafford realized had been the reality of [her]323-marjorie nature fighting against [her]323-marjorie profoundest resolutions . [He]365-trafford wondered what [Lee]459-mrs. lee must think of this sort of married life . How ugly and selfish it must seem from that point of view . [He]365-trafford perceived for the first time the fundamental incongruity of [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's position , [she]323-marjorie was made to shine , elaborately prepared and trained to shine , desiring keenly to shine , and then imprisoned and hidden in the faded obscurity of [a small , poor home]3359-a small , poor home . How conspicuously , how extremely [he]365-trafford must be wanting in just that sort of chivalry in which [Lee]459-mrs. lee excelled ! [Those business men]3360-those business men lived for [[their]3360-those business men women]3332-their women to an extent [he]365-trafford had hitherto scarcely dreamt of doing .... [His]365-trafford want of chivalry was beyond dispute . And was there not also an extraordinary egotism in this concentration upon [his]365-trafford own purposes , a self - esteem , a vanity ? Had [her]323-marjorie life no rights ? Suppose now [he]365-trafford were to give [her]323-marjorie — two years , three years perhaps of [his]365-trafford life — altogether . Or even four . Was it too much to grudge [her]323-marjorie four ? [Solomonson]424-solomonson had been at [his]365-trafford old theme with [him]365-trafford , a theme [the little man]3362-the little man had never relinquished since [their]3363-they friendship first began years ago , possibilities of [a business alliance and the application of a mind of exceptional freshness and penetration to industrial development]3364-a business alliance and the application of a mind of exceptional freshness and penetration to industrial development . Why should n't that be tried ? Why not " make money "[323-marjorie] for a brief strenuous time , and then come back , when [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's pride and comfort were secure ? ... ( Poor dear , how weary [she]323-marjorie looked ! ) [He]365-trafford wondered how much more remained of this appalling night . It would have made so little difference if [they]3363-they had taken [the day train]3365-the day train and travelled first - class . Was n't [she]323-marjorie indeed entitled to travel first - class ? Pictures of the immense spaciousness , the softness , cleanliness and dignity of [first - class compartments]3366-first - class compartments appeared in [his]365-trafford mind .... [He]365-trafford would have looked at [his]365-trafford watch , but to get at it would mean disturbing [the silent young man]3367-the silent young man on [his]365-trafford left . Outside in [the corridor]3368-the corridor there broke out a noisy dispute about a missing coupon , a dispute in that wonderful language that is known to [the facetious as entente cordiale]3369-the facetious as entente cordiale , between [an Englishman]3370-an englishman and [the conductor of [the train]663-the train .... In [Paris]143-paris]3371-the conductor of the train .... in paris there was a dispute with [an extortionate cabman]3373-an extortionate cabman , and the crossing from [Dieppe]144-dieppe to [Newhaven]145-newhaven was rough and bitterly cold . [They]3363-they were both ill . [They]3363-they reached [home]810-home very dirty and weary , and among the pile of letters and papers on [Trafford]365-trafford 's desk was a big bundle of Science Note proofs , and two letters from [Croydon and Pinner]477-croydon and pinner to alter the hours of [his]365-trafford lectures for various plausible and irritating reasons . [The little passage]3375-the little passage looked very small and rather bare as the door shut behind [them]3363-they , and the worn places that had begun to be conspicuous during the last six months , and which [they]3363-they had forgotten during the Swiss holiday , reasserted [themselves]3363-they . [The dining - room]2244-the dining - room , after [spacious rooms flooded with sunshine]3377-spacious rooms flooded with sunshine , betrayed how dark it was , and how small . Those Bokhara embroideries that had once shone so splendid , now , after [Mrs. Lee]459-mrs. lee 's rich and unlimited harmonies , seemed skimpy and insufficient , mere loin - cloths for the artistic nakedness of [the home]1106-the home . [They]3363-they felt , too , [they]3363-they were beginning to find out [their]3363-they post - impressionist picture . [They]3363-they had not remembered it as nearly so crude as it now appeared . The hole a flying coal had burnt in the unevenly faded dark - blue carpet looked larger than it had ever done before , and was indeed the only thing that did n't appear faded and shrunken . The atmosphere of [[the Lees]460-the lees ' villa]3168-the lees ' villa had disturbed [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's feelings and ideas even more than it had [Trafford]365-trafford 's . [She]323-marjorie came back struggling to recover those high resolves that had seemed so secure when [they]3363-they had walked down to [Les Avantes]146-les avantes . There was a curiously tormenting memory of [that vast , admirable nursery]3380-that vast , admirable nursery , and the princely procession of [children]1961-children that would not leave [her]323-marjorie mind . No effort of [her]323-marjorie reason could reconcile [her]323-marjorie to the inferiority of [Margharita]436-trafford 's equipment . [She]323-marjorie had a detestable craving for a uniform for [May.]478-may. But [May]323-marjorie was going .... But indeed [she]323-marjorie was not so sure that [May]323-marjorie was going . [She]323-marjorie was no longer buoyantly well , [she]323-marjorie was full of indefinable apprehensions of weakness and failure . [She]323-marjorie struggled to control an insurgence of emotions that rose out of the deeps of [her]323-marjorie being . [She]323-marjorie had now , [she]323-marjorie knew , to take on [her]323-marjorie share of the burden , to become one of [the Samurai]457-samurai , to show [her]323-marjorie love no longer as a demand but as a service . Yet from day to day [she]323-marjorie procrastinated under the shadow of apprehended things ; [she]323-marjorie forebore to dismiss [May]323-marjorie , to buy that second - hand typewriter [she]323-marjorie needed , to take any irrevocable step towards the realization of the new way of living . [She]323-marjorie tried to think away [her]323-marjorie fears , but they would not leave [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie felt that [Trafford]365-trafford watched [her]323-marjorie pale face with a furtive solicitude and wondered at [her]323-marjorie hesitations ; [she]323-marjorie tried in vain to seem cheerful and careless in [his]365-trafford presence , with an anxiety , with premonitions that grew daily . There was no need to worry [him]365-trafford unduly .... But soon the matter was beyond all doubting . There [you]365-trafford are ! Still , that 's how things are made .... "[364-solomonson] " But it is n't worth it . " Very well , "[364-solomonson] said [Solomonson]364-solomonson , " and now [we]5731-we can get to business . "[3391-the business man] The immediate business was the systematic exploitation of the fact that [Trafford]365-trafford had worked out the problem of synthesizing indiarubber . [He]365-trafford had done so with an entire indifference to the commercial possibilities of the case , because [he]365-trafford had been irritated by the enormous publicity given to [Behrens]434-behrens ' assertion that [he]365-trafford had achieved this long - sought end . Of course the production of artificial rubbers and rubber - like substances had been one of the activities of [the synthetic chemist]3389-the synthetic chemist for many years , from the appearance of [Tilden]481-tilden 's isoprene rubber onward , and there was already a formidable list of collaterals , dimethybutadiene , and so forth , by which the coveted goal could be approached . [Behrens]434-behrens had boldly added to this list as [his]434-behrens own a number of variations upon a theme of [Trafford]365-trafford 's , originally designed to settle certain curiosities about elasticity . [Behrens]434-behrens ' products were not only more massively rubber - like than anything that had gone before [them]3390-them , but also extremely cheap to produce , and [his]365-trafford bold announcement of success had produced a check in rubber sales and widespread depression in the quiveringly sensitive market of plantation shares . [Solomonson]364-solomonson had consulted [Trafford]365-trafford about this matter at [Vevey]138-vevey , and had heard with infinite astonishment that [Trafford]365-trafford had already roughly prepared and was proposing to complete and publish , unpatented and absolutely unprotected , first a smashing demonstration of the unsoundness of [Behrens]434-behrens ' claim and then a lucid exposition of just what had to be done and what could be done to make an indiarubber absolutely indistinguishable from the natural product . [The business man]3391-the business man could not believe [his]3391-the business man ears . [Solomonson]364-solomonson had always entertained the warmest friendship and admiration for [Trafford]365-trafford , and it was no new thing that [he]364-solomonson should desire a business co - operation . [He]364-solomonson had been working for that in the old days at [Riplings]62-riplings ; [he]364-solomonson had never altogether let the possibility drop out of sight between [them]3392-they in spite of [Trafford]365-trafford 's repudiations . [He]364-solomonson believed [himself]364-solomonson to be [a scientific man]2588-a scientific man turned to business , but indeed [his]364-solomonson whole passion was for organization and finance . [He]364-solomonson knew [he]364-solomonson could do everything but originate , and in [Trafford]365-trafford [he]364-solomonson recognized just that rare combination of an obstinate and penetrating simplicity with constructive power which is the essential blend in the making of great intellectual initiatives . To [Trafford]365-trafford belonged the secret of novel and unsuspected solutions ; what were fixed barriers and unsurmountable conditions to [trained investigators]3394-trained investigators and [commonplace minds]3395-commonplace minds , would yield to [his]365-trafford gift of magic inquiry . [He]365-trafford could startle the accepted error into self - betrayal . [Other men]5654-other men might play the game of business infinitely better than [he]364-solomonson — [Solomonson]364-solomonson knew , indeed , quite well that [he]364-solomonson [himself]364-solomonson could play the game infinitely better than [Trafford]365-trafford — but it rested with [Trafford]365-trafford by right divine of genius to alter the rules . And everything that had made [Trafford]365-trafford up to the day of [his]365-trafford marriage was antagonistic to such strategic reservations . [The servant of science]3397-the servant of science has as such no concern with personal consequences ; [his]3397-the servant of science business is the steady , relentless clarification of knowledge . "[3449-he] [I]0-i find it hard to trace the accumulation of moods and feelings that led [Trafford]365-trafford and [Marjorie]323-marjorie at last to make [their]3409-their extraordinary raid upon [Labrador]190-labrador . It took [him]365-trafford seven years from [his]365-trafford conclusive agreement with [Solomonson]364-solomonson to become [a rich and influential man]3416-a rich and influential man . It took [him]365-trafford only seven years , because already by the mere accidents of intellectual interest [he]365-trafford was in possession of knowledge of the very greatest economic importance , and because [Solomonson]364-solomonson was full of that practical loyalty and honesty that distinguishes [[his]365-trafford race]3417-his race . [I]0-i think that in any case [Trafford]365-trafford 's vigor and subtlety of mind would have achieved the prosperity [he]365-trafford had found necessary to [himself]365-trafford , but it might have been , under less favorable auspices , a much longer and more tortuous struggle . Success and security were never so abundant nor so easily attained by [men with capacity and a sense of proportion]3418-men with capacity and a sense of proportion as [they]3418-men with capacity and a sense of proportion are in the varied and flexible world of to - day . [We]3419-our live in an affluent age with a nearly incredible continuous fresh increment of power pouring in from mechanical invention , and compared with [our]3419-our own , most other periods have been meagre and anxious and hard - up times . [Our]3419-our problems are constantly less the problems of submission and consolation and continually more problems of opportunity .... [Trafford]365-trafford found the opening campaign , the operation with the plantation shares and [his]365-trafford explosion of [Behrens]434-behrens ' pretensions extremely uncongenial . It left upon [his]365-trafford mind a confused series of memories of interviews and talks in [offices]3420-offices for the most part dingy and slovenly , of bales of press - cuttings and blue - pencilled financial publications , of unpleasing encounters with a number of [bright - eyed , flushed , excitable and extremely cunning men]3421-bright - eyed , flushed , excitable and extremely cunning men , of having to be reserved and limited in [his]365-trafford talk upon all occasions , and of all the worst aspects of [Solomonson]364-solomonson . All that part of the new treatment of life that was to make [him]365-trafford rich gave [him]365-trafford sensations as though [he]365-trafford had ceased to wash [himself]365-trafford mentally , until [he]365-trafford regretted [his]365-trafford old life in [[his]365-trafford laboratory]2105-his laboratory as [a traveller in [a crowded night train among [filthy people]3425-filthy people]3424-a crowded night train among filthy people]3423-a traveller in a crowded night train among filthy people might regret [the bathroom [he]365-trafford had left behind [him]365-trafford]3426-the bathroom he had left behind him .... But the development of [his]365-trafford manufacture of rubber was an entirely different business , and for a time profoundly interesting . It took [him]365-trafford into a new astonishing world , the world of large - scale manufacture and industrial organization . The actual planning of the works was not in itself anything essentially new to [him]365-trafford . So far as all that went it was scarcely more than the problem of arranging an experiment upon a huge and permanent scale , and all that quick ingenuity , that freshness and directness of mind that had made [his]365-trafford purely scientific work so admirable had ample and agreeable scope . Even the importance of cost and economy at every point in the process involved no system of considerations that was altogether novel to [him]365-trafford . [The British investigator]3427-the british investigator knows only too well the necessity for husbanded material and inexpensive substitutes . But strange factors came in , a new region of interest was opened with the fact that instead of [one experimenter working with the alert responsive assistance of Durgan]3428-one experimenter working with the alert responsive assistance of durgan , a multitude of [human beings]2763-human beings — even in the first drafts of [his]365-trafford project [they]3430-they numbered already two hundred , before the handling and packing could be considered — had to watch , control , assist or perform every stage in a long elaborate synthesis . For the first time in [his]365-trafford life [Trafford]365-trafford encountered the reality of Labour , as it is known to [the modern producer]3431-the modern producer . It will be difficult in the future , when things now subtly or widely separated have been brought together by the receding perspectives of time , for [the historian]3432-the historian to realize just how completely out of the thoughts of [such a young man as Trafford the millions of people who live and die in organized productive industry]3433-such a young man as trafford the millions of people who live and die in organized productive industry had been . And about [this sordid - looking wilderness]3497-this sordid - looking wilderness went [a population that seemed at first as sordid . It was in no sense a tragic population]3498-a population that seemed at first as sordid . it was in no sense a tragic population . But [it]3498-a population that seemed at first as sordid . it was in no sense a tragic population saw little of the sun , felt the wind but rarely , and so had a white , dull skin that looked degenerate and ominous to a West - end eye . [It]3498-a population that seemed at first as sordid . it was in no sense a tragic population was not naked nor barefooted , but [it]3498-a population that seemed at first as sordid . it was in no sense a tragic population wore cheap clothes that were tawdry when new , and speedily became faded , discoloured , dusty , and draggled . [It]3498-a population that seemed at first as sordid . it was in no sense a tragic population was slovenly and almost wilfully ugly in its speech and gestures . And if [this great industrial multitude]3501-this great industrial multitude was neither tortured nor driven nor cruelly treated — as [the slaves and common people of other days]3502-the slaves and common people of other days have been — yet it was universally anxious , perpetually anxious about urgent small necessities and petty dissatisfying things .... That was the general effect of [this new region in which [he]365-trafford had sought out and found the fortunate site for [his]365-trafford manufacture of rubber]3503-this new region in which he had sought out and found the fortunate site for his manufacture of rubber , and against this background it was that [he]365-trafford had now to encounter [a crowd of selected individuals]3504-a crowd of selected individuals , and weld [them]3504-a crowd of selected individuals into a harmonious and successful " process . "[484-dowd] [They]3504-a crowd of selected individuals came out from [their]3504-a crowd of selected individuals millions to [him]365-trafford , dingy , clumsy , and at first it seemed without any individuality . Insensibly [they]3504-a crowd of selected individuals took on character , rounded off by unaccustomed methods into persons as marked and distinctive as any [he]365-trafford had known . There was [Dowd]484-dowd , for instance , [the technical assistant , whom [he]365-trafford came to call in [his]365-trafford private thoughts]3505-the technical assistant , whom he came to call in his private thoughts [Dowd]484-dowd the Disinherited . [Dowd]484-dowd had seemed [a rather awkward , potentially insubordinate young man of unaccountably extensive and curiously limited attainments]3506-a rather awkward , potentially insubordinate young man of unaccountably extensive and curiously limited attainments . [He]484-dowd had begun [his]484-dowd career in [a crowded home behind and above [a baker 's shop in [Hoxton]164-hoxton]3508-a baker 's shop in hoxton]3507-a crowded home behind and above a baker 's shop in hoxton , [he]484-dowd had gone as [a boy]1458-a boy into the works of [a Clerkenwell electric engineer]3510-a clerkenwell electric engineer , and [there]1343-there [he]484-dowd had developed that craving for knowledge which is so common in [poor men of the energetic type]3512-poor men of the energetic type . [He]484-dowd had gone to classes , read with a sort of fury , feeding [his]484-dowd mind on the cheap and adulterated instruction of [grant - earning crammers]3513-grant - earning crammers and on stale , meretricious and ill - chosen books ; [his]484-dowd mental food indeed was the exact parallel of the rough , abundant , cheap and nasty groceries and meat that gave [the East - ender]3514-the east - ender [his]484-dowd spots and dyspeptic complexion , the cheap text - books were like canned meat and dangerous with intellectual ptomaines , the rascally encyclopædias like weak and whitened bread , and [Dowd]484-dowd 's mental complexion , too , was leaden and spotted . Yet essentially [he]484-dowd was n't , [Trafford]365-trafford found , by any means bad stuff ; where [his]484-dowd knowledge had had a chance of touching reality it became admirable , and [he]484-dowd was full of energy in [his]484-dowd work and a sort of honest zeal about the things of the mind . [The two men]1652-the two men grew from an acute mutual criticism into a mutual respect . At first it seemed to [Trafford]365-trafford that when [he]365-trafford met [Dowd]484-dowd [he]365-trafford was only meeting [Dowd]484-dowd , but a time came when it seemed to [him]365-trafford that in meeting [Dowd]484-dowd [he]365-trafford was meeting [all that vast [new England]9-england outside the range of ruling - class dreams]3516-all that vast new england outside the range of ruling - class dreams , [that multitudinous greater [England]9-england]3517-that multitudinous greater england , cheaply treated , rather out of health , angry , energetic and now becoming intelligent and critical , [that [England]9-england which organized industrialism has created]3518-that england which organized industrialism has created . There were nights when [he]365-trafford thought for hours about [Dowd]484-dowd . [Other figures]3519-other figures grouped [themselves]3519-other figures round [him]365-trafford — [Markham]485-markham , [the head clerk]3520-the head clerk , the quintessence of East - end respectability , who saw to the packing ; [Miss Peckover]486-miss peckover , [an ex - telegraph operator]3521-an ex - telegraph operator , [a woman so entirely reliable and unobservant that the most betraying phase of the secret process]3522-a woman so entirely reliable and unobservant that the most betraying phase of the secret process could be confidently entrusted to [her]486-miss peckover hands . Behind [them]3519-other figures were [clerks]5492-clerks , [workmen]3524-workmen , [motor - van men]3525-motor - van men , [work - girls]3526-work - girls , [a crowd of wage - earners]3527-a crowd of wage - earners , from amidst which [some individual]3528-some individual would assume temporary importance and interest by doing something wrong , getting into trouble , becoming insubordinate , and having contributed a little vivid story to [Trafford]365-trafford 's gathering impressions of life , drop back again into undistinguished subordination . [Dowd]484-dowd became at last entirely representative . When first [Trafford]365-trafford looked [Dowd]484-dowd in the eye , [he]365-trafford met something of the hostile interest [one]675-one might encounter in [a swordsman ready to begin a duel]3530-a swordsman ready to begin a duel . There was a watchfulness , an immense reserve . [They]3531-they discussed the work and the terms of [their]3531-they relationship , and all the while [Trafford]365-trafford felt there was something almost threateningly not mentioned . Presently [he]365-trafford learnt from [a Silvertown employer]3532-a silvertown employer what that concealed aspect was . [Dowd]484-dowd was " [that sort of man who makes trouble , "[484-dowd] disposed to strike rather than not upon a grievance , with a taste for open - air meetings]5757-that sort of man who makes trouble , " disposed to strike rather than not upon a grievance , with a taste for open - air meetings , [a member , obstinately adherent in spite of friendly remonstrance]3533-a member , obstinately adherent in spite of friendly remonstrance , of [the Social Democratic Party]3534-the social democratic party . This in spite of [his]484-dowd clear duty to [a wife]5218-a wife and [two small white knobby children]3536-two small white knobby children . For a time [he]484-dowd would not talk to [Trafford]365-trafford of anything but business — [Trafford]365-trafford was so manifestly [the enemy , not to be trusted]3537-the enemy , not to be trusted , [the adventurous plutocrat]3538-the adventurous plutocrat , [the exploiter]3539-the exploiter — when at last [Dowd]484-dowd did open out [he]484-dowd did so defiantly , throwing opinions at [Trafford]365-trafford as [a mob]2869-a mob might hurl bricks at windows . At last [they]3541-they achieved a sort of friendship and understanding , an amiability as it were , in hostility , but never from first to last would [he]484-dowd talk to [Trafford]365-trafford as [one gentleman to another]3542-one gentleman to another ; between [them]3541-they , and crossed only by flimsy , temporary bridges , was [his]484-dowd sense of incurable grievances and fundamental injustice . [He]484-dowd seemed incapable of forgetting the disadvantages of [his]484-dowd birth and upbringing , the inferiority and disorder of [the house]742-the house that sheltered [him]484-dowd , the poor food that nourished [him]484-dowd , the deadened air [he]484-dowd breathed , the limited leisure , the inadequate books . Implicit in [his]484-dowd every word and act was the assurance that but for this handicap [he]484-dowd could have filled [[Trafford]365-trafford 's place]3544-trafford 's place , while [Trafford]365-trafford would certainly have failed in [his]365-trafford . For all these things [Dowd]484-dowd made [Trafford]365-trafford responsible ; [he]484-dowd held [him]365-trafford to that inexorably . " [You]365-trafford sweat [us]5758-us , "[484-dowd] [he]484-dowd said , speaking between [his]484-dowd teeth ; " [you]365-trafford limit [us]5758-us , [you]365-trafford stifle [us]5758-us , and away there in [the West - end]5759-the west - end , [you]365-trafford and [the women [you]365-trafford keep]5760-the women you keep waste the plunder . "[365-trafford] " Well , is n't it ? "[365-trafford] " ' Directly , ' [I]484-dowd said . No . If [we]5778-we just stopped it — over there — there'd be no improvement here . Suppose [the West - end]5759-the west - end became — [Tolstoyan]487-tolstoyan ; [the East]167-the east would become chaos . "[484-dowd] " Not much likelihood , "[484-dowd] sneered [Dowd]484-dowd . " That 's another question . That [we]5778-we earn together here and that [I]484-dowd spend alone over there , it 's unjust and bad , but it is n't a thing that admits of any simple remedy . Where [we]5778-we differ , [Dowd]484-dowd , is about that remedy . [I]484-dowd admit the disease as fully as [you]365-trafford do . [I]484-dowd , as much as [you]365-trafford , want to see the dawn of a great change in the ways of human living . But [I]484-dowd do n't think the diagnosis is complete and satisfactory ; [our]5778-we problem is an intricate muddle of disorders , not one simple disorder , and [I]484-dowd do n't see what treatment is indicated .
