" Does any one question that if [we]5778-we could have [this socialist state in which [every one]4731-every one is devoted and [every one]4731-every one is free , in which there is no waste and no want , and beauty and brotherhood prevail universally]5780-this socialist state in which every one is devoted and every one is free , in which there is no waste and no want , and beauty and brotherhood prevail universally , [we]5778-we would n't ? But——. [[You]365-trafford socialists]5783-you socialists have [no scheme of government]5784-no scheme of government , no scheme of economic organization , no intelligible guarantees of personal liberty , no method of progress , no ideas about marriage , no plan — except those little pickpocket plans of the Fabians that [you]365-trafford despise as much as [I]484-dowd do — for making this order into that other order [you]365-trafford 've never yet taken the trouble to work out even in principle . Really [you]365-trafford know , [Dowd]484-dowd , what is the good of pointing at [[my]484-dowd wife]4777-my wife 's dresses and waving the red flag at [me]484-dowd , and talking of human miseries — — "[484-dowd] " It seems to wake [you]365-trafford up a bit , "[365-trafford] said [Dowd]484-dowd with characteristic irrelevance . The accusing finger of [Dowd]484-dowd followed [Trafford]365-trafford into [his]365-trafford dreams . Behind it was [his]365-trafford grey - toned , intelligent , resentful face , [his]365-trafford smouldering eyes , [his]365-trafford slightly frayed collar and vivid , ill - chosen tie . At times [Trafford]365-trafford could almost hear [his]365-trafford flat insistent voice , [his]365-trafford measured h - less speech . [Dowd]484-dowd was so penetratingly right,—and so ignorant of certain essentials , so wrong in [his]484-dowd forecasts and ultimates . It was true beyond disputing that [Trafford]365-trafford as compared with [Dowd]484-dowd had opportunity , power of a sort , the prospect and possibility of leisure . [He]365-trafford admitted the liability that followed on that advantage . It expressed so entirely the spirit of [his]365-trafford training that with [Trafford]365-trafford the noble maxim of [the older socialists]3546-the older socialists ; " from each according to [his]365-trafford ability , to each according to [his]365-trafford need , "[253-aunt plessington] received an intuitive acquiescence . [He]365-trafford had no more doubt than [Dowd]484-dowd that [Dowd]484-dowd was [the victim of a subtle evasive injustice , innocently and helplessly underbred , underfed , cramped and crippled]3547-the victim of a subtle evasive injustice , innocently and helplessly underbred , underfed , cramped and crippled , and that all [his]365-trafford own surplus made [him]365-trafford in a sense [[Dowd]484-dowd 's debtor]3548-dowd 's debtor . But [Dowd]484-dowd 's remedies ! [Trafford]365-trafford made [himself]365-trafford familiar with the socialist and labor newspapers , and [he]365-trafford was as much impressed by [their]3549-their honest resentments and [their]3549-their enthusiastic hopefulness as [he]365-trafford was repelled by [their]3549-their haste and ignorance , [their]3549-their cocksure confidence in untried reforms and [impudent teachers]3550-impudent teachers , [their]3549-their indiscriminating progressiveness , [their]3549-their impulsive lapses into hatred , misrepresentation and vehement personal abuse . [He]365-trafford was in no mood for the humours of human character , and [he]365-trafford found the ill - masked feuds and jealousies of [the leaders]3551-the leaders , the sham statecraft of [G. B. Magdeberg]488-g. b. magdeberg , [M.P.]489-m.p. , the sham Machiavellism of [Dorvil]490-dorvil , the sham persistent good - heartedness of [Will Pipes]491-will pipes , discouraging and irritating . Altogether it seemed to [him]365-trafford the conscious popular movement in politics , both in and out of [Parliament]168-parliament , was a mere formless and indeterminate aspiration . It was a confused part of the general confusion , symptomatic perhaps , but exercising no controls and no direction . [His]365-trafford attention passed from the consideration of this completely revolutionary party to the general field of social reform . With the naïve directness of [a scientific man]2588-a scientific man , [he]365-trafford got together the published literature of half a dozen flourishing agitations and philanthropies , interviewed [prominent and rather embarrassed personages]3553-prominent and rather embarrassed personages , attended meetings , and when [he]365-trafford found the speeches too tiresome to follow watched [the audience]3554-the audience about [him]365-trafford . [He]365-trafford even looked up [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's Movement , and filled [her]253-aunt plessington with wild hopes and premature boastings about [a promising convert]3555-a promising convert . " [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's brought [him]365-trafford round at last ! "[253-aunt plessington] said [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington . " [I]484-dowd knew [I]484-dowd could trust [[my]484-dowd little [Madge]323-marjorie]5786-my little madge ! "[484-dowd] [His]365-trafford impression was not the cynic 's impression of these wide shallows of activity . Progress and social reform are not , [he]365-trafford saw , mere cloaks of hypocrisy ; a wealth of good intention lies behind [them]3556-them in spite of [their]3556-them manifest futility . There is much dishonesty due to the blundering desire for consistency in [people of hasty intention]3557-people of hasty intention , much artless and a little calculated self - seeking , but far more vanity and amiable feebleness of mind in [their]3557-people of hasty intention general attainment of failure . [The Plessingtons]350-the plessingtons struck [him]365-trafford as being after all very typical of [the publicist at large]3558-the publicist at large , quite devoted , very industrious , extremely presumptuous and essentially thin - witted . [They]3557-people of hasty intention would cheat like [ill - bred children]3559-ill - bred children for example , on some petty point of reputation , but [they]3557-people of hasty intention could be trusted to expend , ineffectually indeed , but with the extremest technical integrity , whatever sums of money [[their]3557-people of hasty intention adherents]3560-their adherents could get together .... [He]365-trafford emerged from this inquiry into the proposed remedies and palliatives for [Dowd]484-dowd 's wrongs with a better opinion of [people]631-people 's hearts and a worse one of [their]631-people heads than [he]365-trafford had hitherto entertained . Pursuing this line of thought [he]365-trafford passed from [the politicians]3562-the politicians and [practical workers]3563-practical workers to [the economists]3564-the economists and [sociologists]3565-sociologists . [He]365-trafford spent the entire leisure of the second summer after the establishment of [the factory]3566-the factory upon sociological and economic literature . At the end of that bout of reading [he]365-trafford attained a vivid realization of the garrulous badness that rules in this field of work , and the prevailing slovenliness and negligence in regard to it . [He]365-trafford chanced one day to look up the article on Socialism in the new Encyclopædia Britannica , and found in [its]3567-its entire failure to state the case for or against modern Socialism , to trace its origins , or to indicate any rational development in the movement , a symptom of the universal laxity of interest in these matters . Indeed , [the writer]3568-the writer did not appear to have heard of modern Socialism at all ; [he]365-trafford discussed collective and individualist methods very much as [a rather ill - read schoolgirl in a hurry for [her]3569-a rather ill - read schoolgirl in a hurry for her college debating society college debating society]3569-a rather ill - read schoolgirl in a hurry for her college debating society might have done . Compared with the treatment of engineering or biological science in the same compilation , this article became almost symbolical of the prevailing habitual incompetence with which all this system of questions is still handled . The sciences were done scantily and carelessly enough , but [they]3570-they admitted at any rate the possibility of completeness ; this did not even pretend to thoroughness . One might think such things had no practical significance . And at the back of it all was [Dowd]484-dowd , remarkably more impatient each year , confessing the failure of parliamentary methods , of trades unionism , hinting more and more plainly at the advent of a permanent guerilla war against capital , at the general strike and sabotage . " It 's coming to that , "[484-dowd] said [Dowd]484-dowd ; " it 's coming to that . "[365-trafford] " What 's the good of it ? "[365-trafford] [he]365-trafford said , echoing [Trafford]365-trafford 's words . " It 's a sort of relief to the feelings . Why should n't [we]3572-we ? "[365-trafford] But [you]3571-you must not suppose that at any time these huge grey problems of [our]3572-we social foundations and the riddle of intellectual confusion one reaches through them , and the yet broader riddles of human purpose that open beyond , constitute the whole of [Trafford]365-trafford 's life during this time . When [he]365-trafford came back to [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [[his]365-trafford home]1486-his home , a curtain of unreality fell between [him]365-trafford and all these things . It was as if [he]365-trafford stepped through such boundaries as [Alice]492-alice passed to reach [[her]492-alice Wonderland]3574-her wonderland ; [the other world]3575-the other world became a dream again ; as if [he]365-trafford closed the pages of a vivid book and turned to things about [him]365-trafford . Or again it was as if [he]365-trafford drew down the blind of a window that gave upon a landscape , grave , darkling , ominous , and faced the warm realities of [a brightly illuminated room]3576-a brightly illuminated room .... In a year or so [he]365-trafford had the works so smoothly organized and [Dowd]484-dowd so reconciled , trained and encouraged that [his]365-trafford own daily presence was unnecessary , and [he]365-trafford would go only three and then only two mornings a week to conduct those secret phases in the preparation of [his]365-trafford catalytic that even [Dowd]484-dowd could not be trusted to know . [He]365-trafford reverted more and more completely to [[his]365-trafford own proper world]3577-his own proper world . And the first shock of discovering [that greater [London]17-london which " is n't in [it]17-london "]5787-that greater london which " is n't in it "[323-marjorie] passed away by imperceptible degrees . Things that had been as vivid and startling as new wounds became unstimulating and ineffective with repetition . [He]365-trafford got used to the change from [Belgravia]170-belgravia to [East Ham]171-east ham , from [East Ham]171-east ham to [Belgravia]170-belgravia . [He]365-trafford fell in with the unusual persuasion in [Belgravia]170-belgravia , that , given [a firm and prompt Home Secretary]3578-a firm and prompt home secretary , [East Ham]171-east ham could be trusted to go on — for quite a long time anyhow . [One]675-one can not sit down for all [one]675-one 's life in the face of insoluble problems . [He]365-trafford had [a motor - car]3581-a motor - car now that far outshone [Magnet]286-mr. magnet 's , and [he]365-trafford made the transit from west to east in the minimum of time and with the minimum of friction . It ceased to be more disconcerting that [he]365-trafford should have [workers whom [he]365-trafford could dismiss at a week 's notice to want or prostitution than that [he]365-trafford should have [a servant]3583-a servant waiting behind [his]365-trafford chair]3582-workers whom he could dismiss at a week 's notice to want or prostitution than that he should have a servant waiting behind his chair . Things were so . The main current of [his]365-trafford life — and the main current of [his]365-trafford life flowed through [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [[his]365-trafford home]1486-his home — carried [him]365-trafford on . [Rubber]493-rubber was [his]365-trafford , but there were still limitless worlds to conquer . [He]365-trafford began to take up , working under circumstances of considerable secrecy at [[Solomonson]364-solomonson 's laboratories at [Riplings]62-riplings]3585-solomonson 's laboratories at riplings , to which [he]365-trafford would now go by [motor - car]3586-motor - car for two or three days at a time , the possibility of a cheap , resilient and very tough substance , rubber glass , that was to be , [Solomonson]364-solomonson was assured , the road surface of the future . The confidence of [Solomonson]364-solomonson had made it impossible for [Trafford]365-trafford to alter [his]365-trafford style of living almost directly upon the conclusion of [their]3587-their agreement . [He]365-trafford went back to [Marjorie]323-marjorie to broach a financially emancipated phase . It was pleasant to be respected by [[her]264-mrs. pope family]570-her family again , but the mind of [Marjorie]323-marjorie was soon reaching out to the more novel possibilities of [her]264-mrs. pope changed position . [She]264-mrs. pope need no longer confine [herself]264-mrs. pope to teas and afternoons . [She]264-mrs. pope could now , delightful thought ! give dinners . Dinners are mere vulgarities for the vulgar , but in the measure of [your]3620-your brains does a dinner become a work of art . There is the happy blending of a modern and distinguished simplicity with a choice of items essentially good and delightful and just a little bit not what was expected . There is the still more interesting and difficult blending and arrangement of [the diners]3621-the diners . From the first [Marjorie]323-marjorie resolved on a round table , and the achievement of that rare and wonderful thing , general conversation . [She]323-marjorie had a clear centre , with a circle of silver bowls filled with short cut flowers and low shaded , old silver candlesticks adapted to the electric light . The first dinner was a nervous experience for [her]323-marjorie , but happily [Trafford]365-trafford seemed unconscious of the importance of the occasion and talked very easily and well ; at last [she]323-marjorie attained [her]323-marjorie old ambition to see [Sir Roderick Dover]414-dover in [[her]323-marjorie house]2513-her house , and there was [Remington]496-remington , [the editor of the Blue Weekly]3623-the editor of the blue weekly and [[his]3623-the editor of the blue weekly silent gracious wife]3624-his silent gracious wife ; [Edward Crampton]497-edward , [the historian]3432-the historian , full of surprising new facts about [Kosciusko]498-kosciusko ; [the Solomonsons]499-the solomonsons and [Mrs. Millingham]500-mrs. millingham , and [Mary Gasthorne]303-mary gasthorne [the novelist]2659-the novelist . [I]0-i do not know whether [Marjorie]323-marjorie might not have been altogether happy during this early Sussex Square period , if it had not been for an unconquerable uncertainty about [Trafford]365-trafford . But ever and again [she]323-marjorie became vaguely apprehensive of some perplexing unreality in [her]323-marjorie position . [She]323-marjorie had never had any such profundity of discontent as [he]365-trafford experienced . It was nothing clear , nothing that actually penetrated , distressing [her]323-marjorie . It was at most an uneasiness . For [him]365-trafford the whole fabric of life was , as it were , torn and pieced by a provocative sense of depths unplumbed that robbed it of all its satisfactions . For [her]323-marjorie these glimpses were as yet rare , mere moments of doubt that passed again and left [her]323-marjorie active and assured . It was only after [they]3680-they had been married six or seven years that [Trafford]365-trafford began to realize how widely [his]365-trafford attitudes to [Marjorie]323-marjorie varied . [He]365-trafford emerged slowly from a naïve unconsciousness of [his]365-trafford fluctuations,—a naïve unconsciousness of inconsistency that for [most men]3681-most men and [women]612-women remains throughout life . [His]365-trafford ruling idea that [she]323-marjorie and [he]365-trafford were [friends]3683-friends , [equals]3684-equals , [confederates]3685-confederates , knowing everything about [each other]709-each other , co - operating in everything , was very fixed and firm . But indeed that had become the remotest rendering of [their]3680-they relationship . [Their]3680-they lives were lives of intimate disengagement . [They]3680-they came nearest to fellowship in relation to [[their]3680-they children]1132-their children ; there [they]3680-they shared an immense common pride . Beyond that was a less confident appreciation of [[their]3680-they common house]3688-their common house and [their]3680-they joint effect . And then [they]3680-they liked and loved [each other]709-each other tremendously . [They]3680-they could play upon [each other]709-each other and please [each other]709-each other in a hundred different ways , and [they]3680-they did so , quite consciously , observing [each other]709-each other with the completest externality . [She]3693-her was still in many ways for [him]3694-he [the bright girl [he]3694-he had admired in the examination]3695-the bright girl he had admired in the examination , still the mysterious dignified transfiguration of [that delightful creature on the tragically tender verge of motherhood]3696-that delightful creature on the tragically tender verge of motherhood ; these memories were of more power with [him]3694-he than the present realities of [her]3693-her full - grown strength and capacity . [He]3694-he admired and co - operated also with [the capable , narrowly ambitious , beautiful lady]3699-the capable , narrowly ambitious , beautiful lady into which [Marjorie]323-marjorie had developed , but those remoter experiences it was that gave the deeper emotions to [their]3680-they relationship . The conflict of aims that had at last brought [Trafford]365-trafford from scientific investigation into business , had left behind it a little scar of hostility . [He]3694-he felt [his]3694-he sacrifice . [He]3694-he felt that [he]3694-he had given something for [her]3693-her that [she]3693-her had had no right to exact , that [he]3694-he had gone beyond the free mutualities of honest love and paid a price for [her]3693-her ; [he]3694-he had deflected the whole course of [his]3694-he life for [her]3693-her and [he]3694-he was entitled to repayments . Unconsciously [he]3694-he had become [a slightly jealous husband]3700-a slightly jealous husband . [He]3694-he resented inattentions and absences . [He]3694-he felt [she]3693-her ought to be with [him]3694-he and orient all [her]3693-her proceedings towards [him]3694-he . [He]3694-he did not like [other people]4823-other people to show too marked an appreciation of [her]3693-her . [She]3693-her had a healthy love of admiration , and in addition [her]3693-her social ambitions made it almost inevitable that at times [she]3693-her should use [her]3693-her great personal charm to secure and retain [adherents]1322-adherents . [He]3694-he was ashamed to betray the resentments thus occasioned , and [his]3694-he silence widened the separation more than any protest could have done .... For [his]3694-he own part [he]3694-he gave [her]3693-her no cause for a reciprocal jealousy . [Other women]3703-other women did not excite [his]3694-he imagination very greatly , and [he]3694-he had none of the ready disposition to lapse to other comforters which is so frequent a characteristic of [the husband]3704-the husband out of touch with [[his]3694-he life 's companion]3705-his life 's companion . [He]3694-he was perhaps [an exceptional man in [his]3694-he steadfast loyalty to [[his]3694-he wife]848-his wife]3706-an exceptional man in his steadfast loyalty to his wife . [He]3694-he had come to [her]3693-her as new to love as [she]3693-her had been . [He]3694-he had never in [his]3694-he life taken that one decisive illicit step which changes all the aspects of sexual life for [a man]837-a man even more than for [a woman]4857-a woman . Love for [him]3694-he was a thing solemn , simple , and unspoilt . [He]3694-he perceived that it was not so for [most other men]3710-most other men , but that did little to modify [his]3694-he own private attitude . In [his]3694-he curious scrutiny of [the people about [him]3694-he]3711-the people about him , [he]3694-he did not fail to note the drift of adventures and infidelities that glimmers along beneath the even surface of [our]3712-our social life . [One or two of [[his]3694-he intimate friends]3714-his intimate friends]3713-one or two of his intimate friends , [Solomonson]424-solomonson was [one of [them]3713-one or two of his intimate friends]3715-one of them , passed through " affairs . "[0-i] Once or twice those dim proceedings splashed upward to the surface in an open scandal . There came [Remington]496-remington 's startling elopement with [Isabel Rivers]503-isabel rivers , [the writer]3568-the writer , which took [two brilliant and inspiring contemporaries]3717-two brilliant and inspiring contemporaries suddenly and distressingly out of [[Trafford]365-trafford 's world]3718-trafford 's world . [Trafford]365-trafford felt none of that rage and forced and jealous contempt for [the delinquents]3719-the delinquents in these matters which is common in the ill - regulated , virtuous mind . Indeed , [he]3694-he was far more sympathetic with than hostile to [the offenders]3720-the offenders . [He]3694-he had brains and imagination to appreciate the grim pathos of a process that begins as a hopeful quest , full of the suggestion of noble possibilities , full of the craving for missed intensities of fellowship and realization , that loiters involuntarily towards beauties and delights , and ends at last too often after gratification of an appetite , in artificially hideous exposures , and the pelting misrepresentations of [the timidly well - behaved vile]3721-the timidly well - behaved vile . But the general effect of pitiful evasions , of unavoidable meannesses , of draggled heroics and tortuously insincere explanations confirmed [him]3694-he in [his]3694-he aversion from this labyrinthine trouble of extraneous love .... But if [Trafford]365-trafford was [a faithful husband]3722-a faithful husband , [he]365-trafford ceased to be [a happy and confident one]3723-a happy and confident one . There grew up in [him]3694-he a vast hinterland of thoughts and feelings , an accumulation of unspoken and largely of unformulated things in which [[his]3694-he wife]848-his wife had no share . And it was in that hinterland that [his]3694-he essential self had its abiding place .... It came as a discovery ; it remained for ever after a profoundly disturbing perplexity that [he]3694-he had talked to [Marjorie]323-marjorie most carelessly , easily and seriously , during [their]3725-their courtship and [their]3725-their honeymoon . [He]3694-he remembered [their]3725-their early intercourse now as an immense happy freedom in love . Then afterwards a curtain had fallen . That almost delirious sense of escaping from [oneself]3726-oneself , of having at last found [some one from whom there need be no concealment]3727-some one from whom there need be no concealment , [some one before whom [one]675-one could stand naked - souled and assured of love as one stands before one 's God]3728-some one before whom one could stand naked - souled and assured of love as one stands before one 's god , faded so that [he]3694-he scarce observed its passing , but only discovered at last that it had gone . [He]3694-he misunderstood and met misunderstanding . [He]3694-he found [he]3694-he could hurt [her]323-marjorie by the things [he]3694-he said , and be exquisitely hurt by [her]323-marjorie failure to apprehend the spirit of some ill - expressed intention . And it was so vitally important not to hurt , not to be hurt . At first [he]3694-he only perceived that [he]3694-he reserved [himself]3694-he ; then there came the intimation of the question , was [she]323-marjorie also perhaps in [such another hinterland as [his]3694-he]3730-such another hinterland as his , keeping [herself]323-marjorie from [him]3694-he ? [He]3694-he had perceived the cessation of that first bright outbreak of self - revelation , this relapse into the secrecies of individuality , quite early in [their]3731-their married life . [I]0-i have already told of [his]3694-he first efforts to bridge [their]3731-their widening separation by walks and talks in [the country]613-the country , and by the long pilgrimage among the Alps that had ended so unexpectedly at [Vevey]138-vevey . In the retrospect the years seemed punctuated with phases when " [we]3731-their must talk "[365-trafford] dominated [their]3731-their intercourse , and each time the impulse of that recognized need passed away by insensible degrees again — with nothing said . [Marjorie]323-marjorie cherished an obstinate hope that [Trafford]365-trafford would take up political questions and go into Parliament . It seemed to [her]323-marjorie that there was something about [him]365-trafford altogether graver and wider than [most of [the active politicians [she]323-marjorie knew]3734-the active politicians she knew]3733-most of the active politicians she knew . [She]323-marjorie liked to think of those gravities assuming a practical form , of [Trafford]365-trafford very rapidly and easily coming forward into a position of cardinal significance . It gave [her]323-marjorie general expenditure a quality of concentration without involving any uncongenial limitation to suppose it aimed at the preparation of [a statesman]3735-a statesman 's circle whenever [Trafford]365-trafford chose to adopt that assumption . [Little men in great positions]3736-little men in great positions came to [[her]323-marjorie house]2513-her house and talked with opaque self - confidence at [her]323-marjorie table ; [she]323-marjorie measured [them]3736-little men in great positions against [[her]323-marjorie husband]1267-her husband while [she]323-marjorie played [the admiring female disciple]3739-the admiring female disciple to [their]3740-their half - confidential talk . [She]323-marjorie felt that [he]365-trafford could take up these questions and measures that [they]3740-their reduced to trite twaddle , open the wide relevancies behind [them]3740-their , and make them magically significant , sweep away the encrusting pettiness , the personalities and arbitrary prejudices . But why did n't [he]365-trafford begin to do it ? [She]323-marjorie threw out hints [he]365-trafford seemed blind towards , [she]323-marjorie exercised miracles of patience while [he]365-trafford ignored [her]323-marjorie baits . [She]323-marjorie came near intrigue in [her]323-marjorie endeavor to entangle [him]365-trafford in political affairs . For a time it seemed to [her]323-marjorie that [she]323-marjorie was succeeding — [I]0-i have already told of [his]365-trafford phase of inquiry and interest in socio - political work — and then [he]365-trafford relapsed into a scornful restlessness , and [her]323-marjorie hopes weakened again . But [he]365-trafford could not concentrate [his]365-trafford mind , [he]365-trafford could not think where to begin . Day followed day , each with its attacks upon [his]365-trafford intention , its petty just claims , its attractive novelties of aspect . The telephone bell rang , the letters flopped into [the hall]1427-the hall , [Malcom]504-malcom [the butler]3742-the butler seemed always at hand with some distracting oblong on [his]504-malcom salver . [Dowd]484-dowd was developing ideas for [a reconstructed organization of [the factory]3566-the factory]3743-a reconstructed organization of the factory , [Solomonson]424-solomonson growing enthusiastic about rubber - glass , [[his]365-trafford house]4972-his house seemed full of [women]612-women , [Marjorie]323-marjorie had an engagement for [him]365-trafford to keep or [the children]1036-the children were coming in to say good - night . To [his]365-trafford irritated brain the whole scheme of [his]365-trafford life presented itself at last as a tissue of interruptions which prevented [his]365-trafford looking clearly at reality . More and more definitely [he]365-trafford realized [he]365-trafford wanted to get away and think . [His]365-trafford former life of research became invested with an effect of immense dignity and of a steadfast singleness of purpose .... But [Trafford]365-trafford was following [his]365-trafford own lights , upon [his]365-trafford own lines . [He]365-trafford was returning to that faith in the supreme importance of thought and knowledge , upon which [he]365-trafford had turned [his]365-trafford back when [he]365-trafford left pure research behind [him]365-trafford . To that familiar end [he]365-trafford came by an unfamiliar route , after [his]365-trafford long , unsatisfying examination of social reform movements and social and political theories . Immaturity , haste and presumption vitiated all that region , and it seemed to [him]365-trafford less and less disputable that the only escape for [mankind]2591-mankind from a continuing extravagant futility lay through the attainment of a quite unprecedented starkness and thoroughness of thinking about all these questions . This conception of a needed Renascence obsessed [him]365-trafford more and more , and the persuasion , deeply felt if indistinctly apprehended , that somewhere in such an effort there was a part for [him]365-trafford to play .... Life is too great for [us]3749-us or too petty . It gives [us]3749-us no tolerable middle way between baseness and greatness . [We]3749-us must die daily on the levels of ignoble compromise or perish tragically among the precipices . On the one hand is a life — unsatisfying and secure , a plane of dulled gratifications , mean advantages , petty triumphs , adaptations , acquiescences and submissions , and on the other a steep and terrible climb , set with sharp stones and bramble thickets and the possibilities of grotesque dislocations , and the snares of such temptation as comes only to [those whose minds have been quickened by high desire , and the challenge of insoluble problems and the intimations of issues so complex and great , demanding such a nobility of purpose , such a steadfastness , alertness and openness of mind]3750-those whose minds have been quickened by high desire , and the challenge of insoluble problems and the intimations of issues so complex and great , demanding such a nobility of purpose , such a steadfastness , alertness and openness of mind , that they fill the heart of [man]939-man with despair .... There were moods when [Trafford]365-trafford would , as [people]631-people say , pull [himself]365-trafford together , and struggle with [his]365-trafford gnawing discontent . [He]365-trafford would compare [his]365-trafford lot with that of [other men]5654-other men , reproach [himself]365-trafford for a monstrous greed and ingratitude . [He]365-trafford remonstrated with [himself]365-trafford as one might remonstrate with [a pampered child]3754-a pampered child refusing to be entertained by [a whole handsome nursery full of toys]3755-a whole handsome nursery full of toys . [Other men]5654-other men did [their]5654-other men work in [the world]589-the world methodically and decently , did [their]5654-other men duty by [[their]5654-other men friends]3403-their friends and belongings , were manifestly patient through dullness , steadfastly cheerful , ready to meet vexations with a humorous smile , and grateful for orderly pleasures . Was [he]365-trafford abnormal ? Or was [he]365-trafford in some unsuspected way unhealthy ? [Trafford]365-trafford neglected no possible explanations . Did [he]365-trafford want this great Renascence of the human mind because [he]365-trafford was suffering from some subtle form of indigestion ? [He]365-trafford invoked , independently of each other , the aid of [two distinguished specialists]3759-two distinguished specialists . [They]3759-two distinguished specialists both told [him]365-trafford in exactly the same voice and with exactly the same air of guineas well earned : " What [you]365-trafford want , [Mr. Trafford]365-trafford , is a change . "[190-labrador] [Trafford]365-trafford brought [his]365-trafford mind to bear upon the instances of contentment about [him]365-trafford . [He]365-trafford developed an opinion that [all men]3760-all men and [many women]3761-many women were potentially at least as restless as [himself]365-trafford . A huge proportion of the usage and education in modern life struck upon [him]365-trafford now as being a training in contentment . Or rather in keeping quiet and not upsetting things . The serious and responsible life of [an ordinary prosperous man]3762-an ordinary prosperous man fulfilling the requirements of [our]3763-our social organization fatigues and neither completely satisfies nor completely occupies . Still less does the responsible part of the life of [a woman of the prosperous classes]3764-a woman of the prosperous classes engage all [her]3764-a woman of the prosperous classes energies or hold [her]3764-a woman of the prosperous classes imagination . And there has grown up a great informal organization of employments , games , ceremonies , social routines , travel , to consume these surplus powers and excessive cravings , which might otherwise change or shatter the whole order of human living . [He]365-trafford began to understand the forced preoccupation with cricket and golf , the shooting , visiting , and so forth , to which [the young people of the economically free classes in the community]3765-the young people of the economically free classes in the community are trained . [He]365-trafford discovered a theory for hobbies and specialized interests . [He]365-trafford began to see why [people]631-people go to [Scotland]185-scotland to get away from [London]17-london , and come to [London]17-london to get away from [Scotland]185-scotland , why [they]631-people crowd to and fro along [the Riviera]186-the riviera , swarm over [Switzerland]20-switzerland , shoot , yacht , hunt , and maintain an immense apparatus of racing and motoring . Because so [they]631-people are able to remain reasonably contented with [the world]589-the world as it is . [He]365-trafford perceived , too , that [a man who has missed or broken through the training to this kind of life]3768-a man who has missed or broken through the training to this kind of life , does not again very readily subdue [himself]3768-a man who has missed or broken through the training to this kind of life to the security of these systematized distractions . [His]365-trafford own upbringing had been antipathetic to any such adaptations ; [his]365-trafford years of research had given [him]365-trafford the habit of naked intimacy with truth , filled [him]365-trafford with a craving for reality and the destructive acids of a relentless critical method . [He]365-trafford began to understand something of the psychology of vice , to comprehend how small a part mere sensuality , how large a part the spirit of adventure and the craving for illegality , may play , in the career of [those who are called evil livers]3769-those who are called evil livers . Mere animal impulses and curiosities it had always seemed possible to [him]365-trafford to control , but now [he]365-trafford was beginning to apprehend the power of that passion for escape , at any cost , in any way , from the petty , weakly stimulating , competitive motives of [low - grade and law - abiding prosperity ....]3770-low - grade and law - abiding prosperity .... For a time [Trafford]365-trafford made an earnest effort to adjust [himself]365-trafford to the position in which [he]365-trafford found [himself]365-trafford , and make a working compromise with [his]365-trafford disturbing forces . [He]365-trafford tried to pick up the scientific preoccupation of [his]365-trafford earlier years . [He]365-trafford made extensive schemes , to [Solomonson]424-solomonson 's great concern , whereby [he]365-trafford might to a large extent disentangle [himself]365-trafford from business . [He]365-trafford began to hunt out forgotten note - books and yellowing sheets of memoranda . [He]365-trafford found the resumption of research much more difficult than [he]365-trafford had ever supposed possible . [He]365-trafford went so far as to plan [a laboratory]3771-a laboratory , and to make some inquiries as to site and the cost of building , to the great satisfaction not only of [Marjorie]323-marjorie but of [[his]365-trafford mother]970-his mother . [Old Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford had never expressed [her]394-trafford concern at [his]365-trafford abandonment of molecular physics for money - making , but now in [her]394-trafford appreciation of [his]365-trafford return to pure investigation [she]394-trafford betrayed [her]394-trafford sense of [his]365-trafford departure . But in [his]365-trafford heart [he]365-trafford felt that this methodical establishment of virtue by limitation would not suffice for [him]365-trafford . [He]365-trafford said no word of this scepticism as it grew in [his]365-trafford mind . [Marjorie]323-marjorie was still under the impression that [he]365-trafford was returning to research , and that [she]323-marjorie was free to contrive the steady preparation for that happier day when [he]365-trafford should assume [his]365-trafford political inheritance . And then presently a queer little dispute sprang up between [them]3773-them . Suddenly , for the first time since [he]365-trafford took to business , [Trafford]365-trafford found [himself]365-trafford limiting [her]323-marjorie again . [She]323-marjorie was disposed , partly through the natural growth of [her]323-marjorie circle and [her]323-marjorie setting and partly through a movement on the part of [Mrs. Halford Wallace]502-mrs. halford wallace , to move from [Sussex Square]175-sussex square into [a larger , more picturesquely built house]3774-a larger , more picturesquely built house in a more central position . [She]323-marjorie particularly desired a good staircase . [He]365-trafford met [her]323-marjorie intimations of this development with a curious and unusual irritation . The idea of moving bothered [him]365-trafford . [He]365-trafford felt that exaggerated annoyance which is so often a concomitant of overwrought nerves . [They]3773-them had a dispute that was almost a quarrel , and though [Marjorie]323-marjorie dropped the matter for a time , [he]365-trafford could feel [she]323-marjorie was still at work upon it . A Haunting desire to go away into solitude grew upon [Trafford]365-trafford very steadily . [He]365-trafford wanted intensely to think , and [London]17-london and [Marjorie]323-marjorie would not let [him]365-trafford think . [He]365-trafford wanted therefore to go away out of [London]17-london and [[Marjorie]323-marjorie 's world]3775-marjorie 's world . [He]365-trafford wanted , [he]365-trafford felt , to go away alone and face [God]249-god , and clear things up in [his]365-trafford mind . By imperceptible degrees this desire anticipated its realization . [His]365-trafford activities were affected more and more by intimations of a determined crisis . One eventful day it seemed to [him]365-trafford that [his]365-trafford mind passed quite suddenly from desire to resolve . [He]365-trafford found [himself]365-trafford with a project , already broadly definite . Hitherto [he]365-trafford had n't been at all clear where [he]365-trafford could go . From the first almost [he]365-trafford had felt that this change [he]365-trafford needed , the change by which [he]365-trafford was to get out of the thickets of work and perplexity and distraction that held [him]365-trafford captive , must be a physical as well as a mental removal ; [he]365-trafford must go somewhere , still and isolated , where sustained detached thinking was possible .... [His]365-trafford preference , if [he]365-trafford had one , inclined [him]365-trafford to [some solitude among [the Himalaya Mountains]187-the himalaya mountains]3776-some solitude among the himalaya mountains . That came perhaps from [Kim]505-kim and the precedent of [the Hindoo 's religious retreat from [the world]589-the world]3777-the hindoo 's religious retreat from the world . But [this retreat [he]365-trafford contemplated]3779-this retreat he contemplated was a retreat that aimed at a return , a clarified and strengthened resumption of [the world]589-the world . And then suddenly , as if [he]365-trafford had always intended it , [Labrador]190-labrador flashed through [his]365-trafford thoughts , like a familiar name that had been for a time quite unaccountably forgotten . [He]365-trafford had two or three streams of thought flowing in [his]365-trafford mind , as [a man who muses alone]3785-a man who muses alone is apt to do . Moreover , [he]365-trafford was watching [[his]365-trafford fellow - members]3787-his fellow - members with a critical rather than a friendly eye . A half - speculative , half - hostile contemplation of [[his]365-trafford habitual associates]3788-his habitual associates was one of the queer aspects of this period of unsettlement . [They]3788-his habitual associates exasperated [him]365-trafford by [their]3788-his habitual associates massive contentment with the surface of things . No doubt [they]3788-his habitual associates were [all more or less successful and distinguished men]3789-all more or less successful and distinguished men , matter for conversation and food for anecdotes , but why did [they]3788-his habitual associates trouble to give [themselves]3788-his habitual associates the air of it ? Did [old Booch]507-old booch over there , for example , guzzling oysters , cry at times upon the unknown God in the vast silences of the night ? [For Blenkins Trafford]508-trafford concealed an exquisite dislike and contempt ; and [Blenkins]508-trafford had a considerable admiration for [Trafford]508-trafford , based on extensive misunderstandings . [Blenkins]508-trafford admired [Trafford]508-trafford because [he]508-trafford was good - looking and well - dressed , with [a beautiful and successful wife]3823-a beautiful and successful wife , because [he]508-trafford had become reasonably rich very quickly and easily , was young and [a Fellow of [the Royal Society]2384-the royal society with a reputation that echoed in [Berlin]65-berlin]3824-a fellow of the royal society with a reputation that echoed in berlin , and very perceptibly did not return [Blenkins]508-trafford ' admiration . [Blenkins]508-trafford was [a sentimentally loyal party Liberal]3827-a sentimentally loyal party liberal , and as [he]508-trafford said at times to [Hart]511-hart and [Weston Massinghay]510-weston massinghay : " If [those other fellows]5804-those other fellows get hold of [him]508-trafford — — ! "[508-trafford] [Blenkins]508-trafford was the fine flower of Oxford Liberalism and the Tennysonian days . [He]508-trafford wanted to be like [King Arthur]512-king arthur and [Sir Galahad]513-sir galahad , with the merest touch of [Launcelot]514-launcelot , and to be perfectly upright and splendid and very , very successful . [He]508-trafford was [a fair , tenoring sort of person with an Arthurian moustache and a disposition to long frock coats]3828-a fair , tenoring sort of person with an arthurian moustache and a disposition to long frock coats . It had been said of [him]508-trafford that [he]508-trafford did n't dress like [a gentleman]574-a gentleman , but that [he]508-trafford dressed more like [a gentleman]574-a gentleman than [a gentleman]574-a gentleman ought to dress . It might have been added that [he]508-trafford did n't behave like [a gentleman]574-a gentleman , but that [he]508-trafford behaved more like [a gentleman]574-a gentleman than [a gentleman]574-a gentleman ought to behave . [He]508-trafford did n't think , but [he]508-trafford talked and [he]508-trafford wrote more thoughtfully in [his]508-trafford leaders , and in the little dialogues [he]508-trafford wrote in imitation of [Sir Arthur Helps]515-sir arthur helps , than [any other person who did n't think]3835-any other person who did n't think could possibly do . [He]508-trafford was [an orthodox Churchman , but very , very broad]3836-an orthodox churchman , but very , very broad ; [he]508-trafford held all the doctrines , a distinguished sort of thing to do in an age of doubt , but there was a quality about them as [he]508-trafford held them — as though they had been run over by something rather heavy . It was a flattened and slightly obliterated breadth — nothing was assertive , but nothing , under examination , proved to be altogether gone . [His]508-trafford profuse thoughtfulness was not confined to [his]508-trafford journalistic and literary work , it overflowed into Talks . [He]508-trafford was [a man for Great Talks]3837-a man for great talks , interminable rambling floods of boyish observation , emotional appreciation , and silly , sapient comment . [He]508-trafford loved to discuss " Who are [the Best Talkers]5805-the best talkers now Alive ? "[433-durgan] [He]508-trafford had written an essay , Talk in the Past . [He]508-trafford boasted of week - ends when the Talk had gone on from the moment of meeting in [the train]663-the train to the moment of parting at [Euston]191-euston , or [Paddington]85-paddington , or [Waterloo]81-waterloo ; and [one or two hostesses with embittered memories]3839-one or two hostesses with embittered memories could verify [his]508-trafford boasting . [He]508-trafford did [his]508-trafford best to make [the club]2464-the club [a Talking Club]3841-a talking club , and loved to summon [men]600-men to a growing circle of chairs .... [Trafford]508-trafford had been involved in Talks on one or two occasions , and now , as [he]508-trafford sat alone in [the corridor]3368-the corridor and smoked and drank [his]508-trafford coffee , [he]508-trafford could imagine the Talk [he]508-trafford had escaped , the Talk that was going on in [the smoking room]3844-the smoking room — the platitudes , the sagacities , the digressions , the sudden revelation of deep , irrational convictions . [He]508-trafford reflected upon the various Talks at which [he]508-trafford had assisted . [His]508-trafford chief impression of [them]3845-them all was of an intolerable fluidity . Never once had [he]508-trafford known a Talk thicken to adequate discussion ; never had a new idea or a new view come to [him]508-trafford in a Talk . [He]508-trafford wondered why [Blenkins]508-trafford and [[his]508-trafford like]3846-his like talked at all . Essentially [they]3847-they lived for pose , not for expression ; [they]3847-they did not greatly desire to discover , make , or be ; [they]3847-they wanted to seem and succeed . Talking perhaps was part of [their]3847-they pose of great intellectual activity , and [Blenkins]508-trafford was fortunate to have an easy , unforced running of mind .... Over [his]508-trafford cigar Trafford became profoundly philosophical about Talk . And after the manner of [those who become profoundly philosophical]3848-those who become profoundly philosophical [he]508-trafford spread out the word beyond its original and proper intentions to all sorts of kindred and parallel things . [Blenkins]508-trafford and [[his]508-trafford miscellany of [friends]3683-friends in [their]3847-they circle of chairs]3849-his miscellany of friends in their circle of chairs were , after all , only a crude rendering of very much of intellectual activity of [mankind]2591-mankind . [Men]600-men talked so often as dogs bark . [Those Talkers]3853-those talkers never came to grips , fell away from topic to topic , pretended depth and evaded the devastating horrors of sincerity . Listening was a politeness amongst [them]3853-those talkers that was presently rewarded with utterance . Tremendously like dogs [they]3853-those talkers were , in [a dog - fancying neighborhood]3854-a dog - fancying neighborhood on a summer week - day afternoon . Fluidity , excessive abundance , inconsecutiveness ; these were the things that made Talk hateful to [Trafford]508-trafford . Was n't most literature in the same class ? Was n't nearly all present philosophical and sociological discussion in [the world]589-the world merely a Blenkins circle on a colossal scale , with [every one looming forward to get in a deeply thoughtful word edgeways]3856-every one looming forward to get in a deeply thoughtful word edgeways at the first opportunity ? Imagine [any one in distress about [his]3857-any one in distress about his soul or about mankind soul or about [mankind]2591-mankind]3857-any one in distress about his soul or about mankind , going to [a professor of economics or sociology or philosophy]3858-a professor of economics or sociology or philosophy ! [He]508-trafford thought of the endless , big , expensive , fruitless books , the windy expansions of industrious pedantry that mocked the spirit of inquiry . The fields of physical and biological science alone had been partially rescued from the floods of human inconsecutiveness . There at least [a man]837-a man must , on the whole , join on to the work of [other men]5654-other men , stand a searching criticism , justify [himself]837-a man . Philosophically this was an age of [relaxed schoolmen]3861-relaxed schoolmen . [He]508-trafford thought of [Doctor Codger]516-doctor codger at [Cambridge]25-cambridge , bubbling away with [his]516-doctor codger iridescent Hegelianism like a salted snail ; of [Doctor Quiller]517-doctor quiller at [Oxford]192-oxford , ignoring [Bergson]518-bergson and fulminating a preposterous insular Pragmatism . [Each]3862-each contradicted [the other]5053-the other fundamentally upon matters of universal concern ; [neither]2304-neither ever joined issue with the other . Why in the name of humanity did n't [some one]5496-some one take hold of [those two excellent gentlemen]3866-those two excellent gentlemen , and bang [their]3866-those two excellent gentlemen busy heads together hard and frequently until [they]3866-those two excellent gentlemen either compromised or cracked ? [He]433-durgan found [himself]433-durgan presently in [Bond Street]195-bond street . The bright May day had brought out great quantities of [people]631-people , so that [he]433-durgan had to come down from altitudes of abstraction to pick [his]433-durgan way among [them]631-people . [He]433-durgan was struck by the prevailing interest and contentment in the faces [he]433-durgan passed . There was no sense of insecurity betrayed , no sense of the deeps and mysteries upon which [our]3895-our being floats like a film . [They]631-people looked solid , [they]631-people looked satisfied ; surely never before in the history of [the world]589-the world has there been so great [a multitude of secure - feeling , satisfied - looking , uninquiring people]3897-a multitude of secure - feeling , satisfied - looking , uninquiring people as there is to - day . All the tragic great things of life seem stupendously remote from them ; pain is rare , death is out of sight , religion has shrunken to an inconsiderable , comfortable , reassuring appendage of the daily life . And with the bright small things of immediacy [they]631-people are so active and alert . Never before has [the world]589-the world seen such multitudes , and a day must come when it will cease to see [them]631-people for evermore . As [he]433-durgan shouldered [his]433-durgan way through the throng before [the Oxford Street shop]3899-the oxford street shop windows [he]433-durgan appreciated a queer effect , almost as it were of insanity , about all this rich and abundant and ultimately aimless life , this tremendous spawning and proliferation of uneventful humanity . These individual lives signified no doubt enormously to [the individuals]3900-the individuals , but did all the shining , reflecting , changing existence that went by like bubbles in a stream , signify collectively anything more than the leaping , glittering confusion of shoaling mackerel on a sunlit afternoon ? [The pretty girl looking into the window]3901-the pretty girl looking into the window schemed picturesque achievements with lace and ribbon , [the beggar at the curb]3902-the beggar at the curb was alert for any sympathetic eye , [the chauffeur on [the waiting taxi - cab]3904-the waiting taxi - cab]3903-the chauffeur on the waiting taxi - cab watched the twopences ticking on with a quiet satisfaction ; each followed a keenly sought immediate end , but altogether ? Where were [they]631-people going altogether ? Until [he]433-durgan knew that , where was the sanity of statecraft , the excuse of any impersonal effort , the significance of anything beyond a life of appetites and self - seeking instincts ? [He]433-durgan found that perplexing suspicion of priggishness affecting [him]433-durgan again . Why could n't [he]433-durgan take the gift of life as it seemed [these people]797-these people took it ? Why was [he]433-durgan continually lapsing into these sombre , dimly religious questionings and doubts ? Why after all should [he]433-durgan concern [himself]433-durgan with these riddles of some collective and ultimate meaning in things ? Was [he]433-durgan for all [his]433-durgan ability and security so afraid of the accidents of life that on that account [he]433-durgan clung to this conception of a larger impersonal issue which [the world]589-the world in general seemed to have abandoned so cheerfully ? At any rate [he]433-durgan did cling to it — and [his]433-durgan sense of it made the abounding active life of [this stirring , bristling thoroughfare]3907-this stirring , bristling thoroughfare an almost unendurable perplexity .... By the Marble Arch [a little crowd]3908-a little crowd had gathered at the pavement edge . [They]797-these people would see [a carriage]3912-a carriage , [they]797-these people would see horses and [coachmen]3913-coachmen , perhaps even [they]797-these people might catch sight of a raised hat and a bowing figure . And this would be a gratification to [them]797-these people , it would irradiate the day with a sense of experiences , exceptional and precious . For that some of [them]797-these people had already been standing about for two or three hours . "[508-trafford] [Trafford]394-trafford glanced at [his]508-trafford watch and went slowly [upstairs]1927-upstairs . On [the landing]1974-the landing there had been a rearrangement of the furniture , and [he]508-trafford paused to survey [it]3928-it . The alterations had been made to accommodate a big cloisonné jar , that now glowed a wonder of white and tinted whites and luminous blues upon a dark , deep - shining stand . [He]508-trafford noted now the curtain of the window had been changed from something — surely it had been a reddish curtain!—to a sharp clear blue with a black border , that reflected upon and sustained and encouraged the jar tremendously . And the wall behind — ? Yes . Its deep brown was darkened to an absolute black behind the jar , and shaded up between the lacquer cabinets on either hand by insensible degrees to the general hue . It was wonderful , perfectly harmonious , and so subtly planned that it seemed it all might have grown , as flowers grow .... [He]508-trafford entered [the drawing - room]811-the drawing - room and surveyed [[its]811-the drawing - room long and handsome spaces]3930-its long and handsome spaces . [His]508-trafford mood of wondering at familiar things was still upon [him]508-trafford . It came to [him]508-trafford as a thing absurd and incongruous that this should be [[his]508-trafford home]1486-his home . It was all wonderfully arranged into one dignified harmony , but [he]508-trafford felt now that at a touch of social earthquake , with a mere momentary lapse towards disorder , it would degenerate altogether into litter , lie heaped together confessed the loot it was . [Trafford]436-trafford 's eyes went from [[his]775-their father offspring]3963-his offspring to [the long , white - painted room]3964-the long , white - painted room , with [its]3964-the long , white - painted room gay frieze of [ships]3965-ships and gulls and [its]3964-the long , white - painted room rug - variegated cork carpet of plain brick red . Everywhere it showed [[his]775-their father wife]848-his wife 's quick cleverness , the clean serviceable decorativeness of it all , the pretty patterned window curtains , the writing desks , the little library of books , the flowers and bulbs in glasses , the counting blocks and bricks and jolly toys , the blackboard on which [the children]1036-the children learnt to draw in bold wide strokes , the big , well - chosen German colour prints upon the walls . And [the children]1036-the children did credit to [their]1036-the children casket ; [they]1036-the children were not only full of vitality but full of ideas , even [Edward]497-edward was already [a person of conversation]3969-a person of conversation . [They]1036-the children were good stuff anyhow .... It was fine in a sense , [Trafford]436-trafford thought , to have given up [his]775-their father own motives and curiosities to afford this airy pleasantness of upbringing for [them]1036-the children , and then came a qualifying thought . Would [they]1036-the children in [their]1036-the children turn for the sake of [another generation]3970-another generation have to give up fine occupations for mean occupations , deep thoughts for shallow ? Would [the world]589-the world get [them]1036-the children in turn ? Would [the girls]815-the girls be hustled and flattered into advantageous marriages , that dinners and [drawing - rooms]3973-drawing - rooms might still prevail ? Would [the boys]667-the boys , after this gracious beginning , presently have to swim submerged in [another generation of Blenkinses]3975-another generation of blenkinses and [their]667-the boys Talk , toil in arduous self - seeking , observe , respect and manipulate shams , succeed or fail , and succeeding , beget amidst hope and beautiful emotions yet [another generation doomed to insincerities and accommodations]3976-another generation doomed to insincerities and accommodations , and so die at last — as [he]775-their father must die ? ... [He]775-their father heard [[his]775-their father wife]848-his wife 's clear voice in [the hall]1427-the hall below , and went down to meet [her]848-his wife . [She]848-his wife had gone into [the drawing - room]811-the drawing - room , and [he]775-their father followed [her]848-his wife in and through the folding doors to the hinder part of [the room]813-the room , where [she]848-his wife stood ready to open a small bureau . [She]848-his wife turned at [his]775-their father approach , and smiled a pleasant , habitual smile .... [She]848-his wife was no longer [the slim , quick - moving girl who had come out of [the world]589-the world to [him]775-their father when [he]775-their father crawled from beneath [the wreckage of [Solomonson]424-solomonson 's plane]3983-the wreckage of solomonson 's plane]3981-the slim , quick - moving girl who had come out of the world to him when he crawled from beneath the wreckage of solomonson 's plane , no longer [the half - barbaric young beauty who had been revealed to [him]775-their father on the staircase of [the Vevey villa]3985-the vevey villa]3984-the half - barbaric young beauty who had been revealed to him on the staircase of the vevey villa . [She]848-his wife was now [a dignified , self - possessed woman]3986-a dignified , self - possessed woman , controlling [[her]848-his wife house]2513-her house and [her]848-his wife life with a skilful , subtle appreciation of [her]848-his wife every point and possibility . [She]848-his wife was wearing now a simple walking dress of brownish fawn colour , and [her]848-his wife hat was touched with a steely blue that made [her]848-his wife blue eyes seem handsome and hard , and toned [her]848-his wife hair to a merely warm brown . [She]848-his wife had , as it were , subdued [her]848-his wife fine colours into a sheath in order that [she]848-his wife might presently draw them again with more effect . " [Hullo]396-hullo , [old man]4913-old man ! "[848-his wife] [she]848-his wife said , " [you]775-their father [home]810-home ? "[848-his wife] [He]775-their father nodded . "[436-trafford] " No , "[436-trafford] said [Trafford]436-trafford , with sudden fierce resentment . " [I]253-aunt plessington 've overtaken [you]848-his wife and beaten [you]848-his wife [there]1343-there , [Marjorie]323-marjorie . "[253-aunt plessington] [She]848-his wife stared at the harsh bitterness of [his]775-their father voice . [She]848-his wife was about to speak when the door opened , and [Malcom]504-malcom ushered in [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington and [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert . [Husband]3012-husband and [wife]3013-wife hung for a moment , and then realized [their]3990-their talk was at an end .... [Marjorie]323-marjorie went forward to greet [[her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt , careless now of all that once stupendous Influence might think of [her]650-her aunt . [She]650-her aunt had long ceased to feel even the triumph of victory in [[her]650-her aunt big house]3992-her big house , [her]650-her aunt costly , dignified clothes , [her]650-her aunt assured and growing social importance . For five years [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington had not even ventured to advise ; had once or twice admired . All that business of [Magnet]286-mr. magnet was — even elaborately — forgotten .... Seven years of feverish self - assertion had left their mark upon both [the Plessingtons]350-the plessingtons . [She]650-her aunt was leaner , more gauntly untidy , more aggressively ill - dressed . [She]650-her aunt no longer dressed carelessly , [she]650-her aunt defied [the world]589-the world with [her]650-her aunt clothes , waved [her]650-her aunt tattered and dingy banners in its face . [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert was no fatter , but in some queer way [he]338-hubert had ceased to be thin . Like [so many people whose peripheries defy the manifest quaint purpose of Providence]3994-so many people whose peripheries defy the manifest quaint purpose of providence , [he]338-hubert was in a state of thwarted adiposity , and with all the disconnectedness and weak irritability characteristic of [his]338-hubert condition . [He]338-hubert had developed a number of nervous movements , chin - strokings , cheek - scratchings , and incredulous pawings at [his]338-hubert more salient features . " Is n't it a lark ? "[253-aunt plessington] began [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , with something like a note of apprehension in [her]253-aunt plessington highpitched voice , and speaking almost from the doorway , " [we]5826-we 're making a call together . [I]253-aunt plessington and [Hubert]338-hubert ! It 's an attack in force . "[253-aunt plessington] [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert goggled in the rear and stroked [his]338-hubert chin , and tried to get together a sort of facial expression . [The Traffords]3000-the traffords made welcoming noises , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie advanced to meet [[her]323-marjorie aunt]650-her aunt . " [We]5826-we want [you]650-her aunt to do something for [us]5826-we , "[436-trafford] said [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington , taking two hands with two hands .... In the intervening years the Movement had had ups and downs ; it had had a boom , which had ended abruptly in a complete loss of voice for [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington — [she]253-aunt plessington had tried to run it on a patent non - stimulating food , and then it had entangled [itself]3997-itself with a new cult of philanthropic theosophy from which it had been extracted with difficulty and in a damaged condition . [It]3997-itself had never completely recovered from that unhappy association . Latterly [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington had lost [her]253-aunt plessington nerve , and [she]253-aunt plessington had taken to making calls upon [people]631-people with considerable and sometimes embarrassing demand for support , urging [them]631-people to join committees , take chairs , stake reputations , speak and act as foils for [her]253-aunt plessington . If [they]631-people refused [she]253-aunt plessington lost [her]253-aunt plessington temper very openly and frankly , and became industriously vindictive . [She]253-aunt plessington circulated scandals or created them . [Her]253-aunt plessington old assurance had deserted [her]253-aunt plessington ; [the strangulated contralto]3999-the strangulated contralto was losing its magic power , [she]253-aunt plessington felt , in [this degenerating England]4000-this degenerating england it had ruled so long . In the last year or so [she]253-aunt plessington had become extremely snappy with [Uncle Hubert]338-hubert . [She]253-aunt plessington ascribed much of the Movement 's futility to the decline of [his]338-hubert administrative powers and the increasing awkwardness of [his]338-hubert gestures , and [she]253-aunt plessington did [her]253-aunt plessington utmost to keep [him]338-hubert up to the mark . [Her]253-aunt plessington only method of keeping [him]338-hubert up to the mark was to jerk the bit . [She]253-aunt plessington had now come to compel [Marjorie]323-marjorie to address a meeting that was to inaugurate a new phase in [the Movement]4001-the movement 's history , and [she]253-aunt plessington wanted [Marjorie]323-marjorie because [she]253-aunt plessington particularly wanted [a daring , liberal , and spiritually amorous bishop , who had once told [her]253-aunt plessington with a note of profound conviction that [Marjorie]323-marjorie was [a very beautiful woman]4003-a very beautiful woman]4002-a daring , liberal , and spiritually amorous bishop , who had once told her with a note of profound conviction that marjorie was a very beautiful woman . [She]253-aunt plessington was so intent upon [her]253-aunt plessington purpose that [she]253-aunt plessington scarcely noticed [Trafford]436-trafford . [He]338-hubert slipped from [the room]813-the room unobserved under cover of [her]253-aunt plessington playful preliminaries , and went to [the untidy little apartment overhead which served in [that house]4006-that house]4005-the untidy little apartment overhead which served in that house as [[his]338-hubert study]2108-his study . [He]338-hubert sat down at the big desk , pushed [his]338-hubert methodically arranged papers back , and drummed on the edge with [his]338-hubert fingers . " [I]990-her son 'm damned if [we]5827-we have [that bigger house]5828-that bigger house , "[990-her son] said [Trafford]436-trafford . [He]338-hubert felt [he]338-hubert wanted to confirm and establish this new resolution , to go right away to [Labrador]190-labrador for a year . [He]338-hubert wanted to tell [someone the thing]4008-someone the thing definitely . [He]338-hubert would have gone [downstairs]787-downstairs again to [Marjorie]323-marjorie , but [she]323-marjorie was submerged and swimming desperately against the voluble rapids of [Aunt Plessington]253-aunt plessington 's purpose . It might be an hour before that attack withdrew . Presently there would be [other callers]4010-other callers . [He]338-hubert decided to have tea with [[his]338-hubert mother]970-his mother and talk to [her]970-his mother about this new break in the course of [his]338-hubert life . Except that [her]323-marjorie hair was now grey and [her]323-marjorie brown eyes by so much contrast brighter , [Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford 's appearance had altered very little in the ten years of [[her]394-trafford only son]5010-her only son 's marriage . Whatever fresh realizations of the inevitably widening separation between [parent]4013-parent and [child]2766-child these years had brought [her]323-marjorie , [she]323-marjorie had kept to [herself]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie had watched [[her]394-trafford daughter - in - law]4015-her daughter - in - law sometimes with sympathy , sometimes with perplexity , always with a jealous resolve to let no shadow of jealousy fall between [them]4016-them . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had been sweet and friendly to [her]323-marjorie , but after the first outburst of enthusiastic affection , [she]323-marjorie had neither offered nor invited confidences . [Old Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford had talked of [Marjorie]323-marjorie to [[her]394-trafford son]990-her son guardedly , and had marked and respected a growing indisposition on [his]990-her son part to discuss [[his]990-her son wife]848-his wife . For a year or so after [his]990-her son marriage [she]323-marjorie had ached at times with a sense of nearly intolerable loneliness , and then the new interests [she]323-marjorie had found for [herself]323-marjorie had won their way against this depression . The new insurrectionary movement of [women that had distinguished those years]4019-women that had distinguished those years had attacked [her]323-marjorie by its emotion and repelled [her]323-marjorie by its crudity , and [she]323-marjorie had resolved , quite in the spirit of [the man who had shaped [her]323-marjorie life]4020-the man who had shaped her life , to make a systematic study of all the contributory strands that met in this difficult tangle . [She]323-marjorie tried to write , but [she]323-marjorie found that the poetic gift , the gift of the creative and illuminating phrase which alone justifies writing , was denied to [her]323-marjorie , and so [she]323-marjorie sought to make [herself]323-marjorie wise , to read and hear , and discuss and think over these things , and perhaps at last inspire and encourage writing in others . [[Her]323-marjorie circle of [intimates]4022-intimates]4021-her circle of intimates grew , and [she]323-marjorie presently remarked with a curious interest that while [she]323-marjorie had lost the confidences of [[her]323-marjorie own son]4023-her own son and [[his]4023-her own son wife]848-his wife , [she]323-marjorie was becoming [the confidant of an increasing number of [other people]4823-other people]4025-the confidant of an increasing number of other people . [They]4027-they came to [her]323-marjorie , [she]323-marjorie perceived , because [she]323-marjorie was receptive and sympathetic and without a claim upon [them]4027-they or any interest to complicate the freedoms of [their]4027-they speech with [her]323-marjorie . [They]4027-they came to [her]323-marjorie , because [she]323-marjorie did not belong to [them]4027-they nor [they]4027-they to [her]323-marjorie . It is , indeed , the defect of all formal and established relationship , that it embarrasses speech , and taints each phase in intercourse with the flavour of diplomacy . [One]675-one can be far more easily outspoken to [a casual stranger one]4029-a casual stranger one may never see again than to [that inseparable other , who may misinterpret , who may disapprove or misunderstand , and who will certainly in the measure of that discord]4030-that inseparable other , who may misinterpret , who may disapprove or misunderstand , and who will certainly in the measure of that discord remember .... It became at last a matter of rejoicing to [Mrs. Trafford]394-trafford that the ties of the old instinctive tenderness between [herself]323-marjorie and [[her]323-marjorie son]990-her son , the memories of pain and tears and the passionate conflict of childhood , were growing so thin and lax and inconsiderable , that [she]323-marjorie could even hope some day to talk to [him]990-her son again — almost as [she]323-marjorie talked to [the young men and [young women who drifted out of the unknown to [her]323-marjorie]4033-young women who drifted out of the unknown to her and sat in [[her]323-marjorie little room]4034-her little room]4032-the young men and young women who drifted out of the unknown to her and sat in her little room and sought to express [their]4027-they perplexities and listened to [her]323-marjorie advice .... It seemed to [her]323-marjorie that afternoon the wished - for day had come . " [You]4050-you see , "[4049-she] [she]4049-she said , " [you]4050-you 're ill . [You]4050-you are n't just . [You]4050-you 've come to an end . [She]323-marjorie 's as aimless as [you]4050-you — and less able to help it . Ever so much less able . "[4049-she] " But [she]323-marjorie does n't show it . [She]323-marjorie goes on . [She]323-marjorie wants things and wants things — — "[4049-she] " And [you]4050-you want to go away . It 's the same thing . It 's exactly the same thing . It 's dissatisfaction . Trafford]394-trafford tried to grasp the intention of this . " [Mother]337-mother , "[4051-you] [he]4051-you said , " [I]4049-she mean to go away . "[4049-she] " But think of [her]323-marjorie ! "[4064-the dramatist] The play was in fact an admirable piece of English stagecraft , and it dealt exclusively with that unreal other world of beings the English theatre has for [its]4070-its own purposes developed . Just as [Greece]533-greece through the ages evolved and polished and perfected the idealized life of its Homeric poems , so [the British mind]4071-the british mind has evolved [their]4071-the british mind Stage Land to embody [its]4071-the british mind more honourable dreams , full of heroic virtues , incredible honour , genial worldliness , childish villainies , [profound but amiable waiters]4072-profound but amiable waiters and [domestics]4073-domestics , pathetic shepherds and preposterous crimes . [Capes]495-godwin , needing an income , had mastered the habits and customs of [this imagined world]4074-this imagined world as one learns a language ; success endorsed [his]4064-the dramatist mastery ; [he]4064-the dramatist knew exactly how deeply to underline an irony and just when it is fit and proper for [a good man]1440-a good man to call upon " [God]249-god ! "[4064-the dramatist] or cry out " Damn ! "[323-marjorie] In this play [he]4064-the dramatist had invented a situation in which [a charming and sympathetic lady]4076-a charming and sympathetic lady had killed [a gross and drunken husband]4077-a gross and drunken husband in self - defence , almost but not quite accidentally , and had then appealed to [the prodigious hero]4078-the prodigious hero for assistance in the resulting complications . At a great cost of mental suffering to [himself]4064-the dramatist [he]4064-the dramatist had told [his]4064-the dramatist First and Only Lie to shield [her]4076-a charming and sympathetic lady . Then years after [he]4064-the dramatist had returned to [England]9-england — the first act happened , of course in [India]196-india — to find [her]4076-a charming and sympathetic lady on the eve of marrying , without any of the preliminary confidences common among [human beings]2763-human beings , [an old school friend of [his]4064-the dramatist]4080-an old school friend of his . ( In plays [all Gentlemen]4081-all gentlemen have been at school together , and [one]675-one has been the other 's fag . ) [The audience]3554-the audience had to be interested in the problem of what [the prodigious hero]4078-the prodigious hero was to do in this prodigious situation . Should [he]4064-the dramatist maintain a colossal silence , continue [his]4064-the dramatist shielding , and let [[his]4064-the dramatist friend]1156-his friend marry [the murderess]4086-the murderess saved by [his]4064-the dramatist perjury , or — — ? ... The dreadful quandary ! Indeed , the absolute — inconvenience ! [Marjorie]323-marjorie watched [Trafford]394-trafford in the corner of the box , as [he]4064-the dramatist listened rather contemptuously to the statement of the evening 's Problem and then lapsed again into a brooding quiet . " No , "[4095-i] [he]4095-i said " that 's the universal blunder nowadays . [One]675-one must do the right thing . And [we]5905-we do n't know the right thing , [Marjorie]323-marjorie . "[4095-i] " But , "[4095-i] [she]4095-i said , " think of the good things in life ? It is impossible , [dear]4768-dear , it is intolerable that life was made beautiful for [us]5905-we — just for these vulgarities . "[4095-i] " Is n't there — — "[4095-i] [She]4095-i hesitated . " Love — still ? "[4104-he] " But —— Has it been love ? Love is a thing that grows . But [we]5905-we took it — as [people]631-people take flowers out of [a garden]5914-a garden , cut them off , put them in water .... How much of [our]5905-we daily life has been love ? [We]5905-we 've just cohabited and ' made love'—you and [I]4104-he — and thought of a thousand other things .... "[4104-he] [He]4104-he looked up at [her]4095-i . "[4105-i] [He]4104-he stopped this halting speech and then broke out again . " Oh ! why should the life of every day conquer [us]5919-we ? "[508-trafford] In [the train]663-the train to [Liverpool]203-liverpool [she]323-marjorie watched [Trafford]508-trafford with the queer feeling which comes to [all husbands]4145-all husbands and [wives]4146-wives at times that that [other partner]4147-other partner is indeed [an undiscovered stranger]4148-an undiscovered stranger , just beginning to show perplexing traits,—full of inconceivable possibilities . [She]323-marjorie felt a strange new wonder at [him]508-trafford that had in it just a pleasant faint flavour of fear . Not only [Trafford]508-trafford surprised [her]323-marjorie but [herself]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie found [she]323-marjorie was in an unwonted perplexing series of moods . All [her]323-marjorie feelings struck [her]323-marjorie now as being incorrect as well as unexpected ; not only had life become suddenly full of novelty but [she]323-marjorie was making novel responses . [She]323-marjorie felt that [she]323-marjorie ought to be resentful and tragically sorry for [[her]323-marjorie home and [children]1961-children]4151-her home and children . [She]323-marjorie felt this departure ought to have the quality of an immense sacrifice , a desperate and heroic undertaking for [Trafford]508-trafford 's sake . [She]323-marjorie had visited [[her]323-marjorie cabin]4155-her cabin , seen [her]323-marjorie luggage stowed away , and now [she]323-marjorie surveyed [the Mersey]205-the mersey and [its]205-the mersey shipping with a renewed freshness of mind .
