[She]323-marjorie made the chips fly , and was presently towing three venerable pine dwarfs , bumping over rock and crevice , back to [Trafford]365-trafford . [She]323-marjorie flung them down , stood for a moment bright and breathless , then set [herself]323-marjorie to hack off the splints [he]4393-he needed from the biggest stem . "[5573-a fool] Now , " [she]323-marjorie said , coming to [him]4393-he . "[323-marjorie] [A fool]5573-a fool , " [he]4393-he remarked , "[323-marjorie] would have made the splints down there . You're — good , [Marjorie]323-marjorie . " [She]323-marjorie lugged [his]4393-he leg out straight , put it into the natural and least painful pose , padded it with moss and [her]323-marjorie torn handkerchief , and bound it up . As [she]323-marjorie did so a handful of snowflakes came whirling about them . [She]323-marjorie was now braced up to every possibility . "[323-marjorie] It never rains , " [she]323-marjorie said grimly , "[323-marjorie] but it pours , " and went on with [her]323-marjorie bone - setting . [He]4393-he was badly weakened by pain and shock , and once [he]4393-he swore at [her]323-marjorie sharply . "[0-i] Sorry , " [he]4393-he said . [She]323-marjorie rolled [him]4393-he over on [his]4393-he chest , and left [him]4393-he to struggle to the shelter of the rock while [she]323-marjorie went for more wood . The sky alarmed [her]323-marjorie . [The mountains up [the valley]4295-the valley]6066-the mountains up the valley were already hidden by driven rags of slaty snowstorms . This time [she]323-marjorie found a longer but easier path for dragging [her]323-marjorie boughs and trees ; [she]323-marjorie determined [she]323-marjorie would not start the fire until nightfall , nor waste any time in preparing food until then . There were dead boughs for kindling — more than enough . It was snowing quite fast by the time [she]323-marjorie got up to [him]4393-he with [her]323-marjorie second load , and a premature twilight already obscured and exaggerated the rocks and mounds about [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie gave some of [her]323-marjorie cheese to [Trafford]394-trafford , and gnawed some [herself]323-marjorie on [her]323-marjorie way down to [the wood]1389-the wood again . [She]323-marjorie regretted that [she]323-marjorie had brought neither candles nor lantern , because then [she]323-marjorie might have kept on until the cold of night stopped [her]323-marjorie , and [she]323-marjorie reproached [herself]323-marjorie bitterly because [she]323-marjorie had brought no tea . [She]323-marjorie could forgive [herself]323-marjorie the lantern , [she]323-marjorie had never expected to be out after dark , but the tea was inexcusable . [She]323-marjorie muttered self - reproaches while [she]323-marjorie worked like [two men among the trees]6069-two men among the trees , panting puffs of mist that froze upon [her]323-marjorie lips and iced the knitted wool that covered [her]323-marjorie chin . Why do n't [they]6069-two men among the trees teach [a girl]1099-a girl to handle an axe ? ... When at last the wolfish cold of the Labrador night had come , it found [Trafford]394-trafford and [Marjorie]323-marjorie seated almost warmly on a bed of pine boughs between the sheltering dark rock behind and a big but well husbanded fire in front , drinking a queer - tasting but not unsavory soup of lynx - flesh , that [she]323-marjorie had fortified with the remainder of the brandy . Then [they]6069-two men among the trees tried roast lynx and ate a little , and finished with some scraps of cheese and deep draughts of hot water . Then — oh [Tyburnia]223-tyburnia and [Chelsea]68-chelsea and all that is becoming!—they smoked [Trafford]394-trafford 's pipe for alternate minutes , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie found great comfort in it . The snowstorm poured incessantly out of the darkness to become flakes of burning fire in the light of the flames , flakes that vanished magically , but it only reached them and wetted them in occasional gusts . What did it matter for the moment if the dim snow - heaps rose and rose about them ? A glorious fatigue , an immense self - satisfaction possessed [Marjorie]323-marjorie ; [she]323-marjorie felt that [they]6069-two men among the trees had both done well . "[0-i] [I]0-i am not afraid of to - morrow now , " [she]323-marjorie said at last — a thought matured . "[0-i] No ! " [Trafford]394-trafford had the pipe and did not speak for a moment . "[0-i] Nor [I]0-i , " [he]0-i said at last . "[0-i] Very likely [we]4407-we 'll get through with it . " [He]0-i added after a pause : "[0-i] [I]0-i thought [I]0-i was done for . [A man]837-a man — loses heart . After a loss of blood . " "[0-i] The leg 's better ? " "[0-i] Hot as fire . " [His]0-i humour had n't left [him]0-i . "[0-i] It 's a treat , " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] The hottest thing in [Labrador]190-labrador . " "[0-i] [I]0-i 've been [a good squaw]4409-a good squaw this time , [old man]4913-old man ? " [she]323-marjorie asked suddenly . [He]0-i seemed not to hear [her]323-marjorie ; then [his]0-i lips twitched and [he]0-i made a feeble movement for [her]323-marjorie hand . "[0-i] [I]0-i cursed [you]0-i , " [he]0-i said .... [She]323-marjorie slept , but on a spring as it were , lest the fire should fall . [She]323-marjorie replenished it with boughs , tucked in the half - burnt logs , and went to sleep again . Then it seemed to [her]323-marjorie that some invisible hand was pouring a thin spirit on the flames that made them leap and crackle and spread north and south until they filled the heavens . [Her]323-marjorie eyes were open and the snowstorm overpast , leaving the sky clear , and all the westward heaven alight with the trailing , crackling , leaping curtains of [the Aurora]224-the aurora , brighter than [she]323-marjorie had ever seen them before . Quite clearly visible beyond the smoulder of the fire , a wintry waste of rock and snow , boulder beyond boulder , passed into a dun obscurity . [The mountain to the right of]6071-the mountain to the right of [them]6072-them lay long and white and stiff , a shrouded death . [All earth]6073-all earth was dead and waste and nothing , and the sky alive and coldly marvellous , signalling and astir . [She]323-marjorie watched the changing , shifting colours , and they made [her]323-marjorie think of the gathering banners of [inhuman hosts]6074-inhuman hosts , the stir and marshalling of icy giants for ends stupendous and indifferent to all the trivial impertinence of [man]939-man 's existence .... That night [the whole world of [man]939-man]6076-the whole world of man seemed small and shallow and insecure to [her]323-marjorie , beyond comparison . One came , [she]323-marjorie thought , but just a little way out of [[its]6071-the mountain to the right of warm and sociable cities hither]6078-its warm and sociable cities hither , and found [this homeless wilderness]6079-this homeless wilderness ; one pricked the thin appearances of life with microscope or telescope and came to an equal strangeness . All the pride and hope of human life goes to and fro in a little shell of air between this ancient globe of rusty nickel - steel and [the void of space]6080-the void of space ; faint specks [we]6081-we are within a film ; [we]6081-we quiver between the atom and the infinite , being hardly more substantial than the glow within an oily skin that drifts upon the water . The wonder and the riddle of it ! Here [she]323-marjorie and [Trafford]394-trafford were ! Phantasmal shapes of unsubstantial fluid thinly skinned against evaporation and wrapped about with woven wool and the skins of beasts , that yet reflected and perceived , suffered and sought to understand ; that held a million memories , framed thoughts that plumbed the deeps of space and time,—and another day of snow or icy wind might leave [them]6072-them just scattered bones and torn rags gnawed by a famishing wolf ! ... [She]323-marjorie felt a passionate desire to pray .... [She]323-marjorie glanced at [Trafford]394-trafford beside [her]323-marjorie , and found [him]6082-him awake and staring . [His]6082-him face was very pale and strange in that livid , flickering light . [She]323-marjorie would have spoken , and then [she]323-marjorie saw [his]6082-him lips were moving , and something , something [she]323-marjorie did not understand , held [her]323-marjorie back from doing so . The bleak , slow dawn found [Marjorie]323-marjorie intently busy . [She]323-marjorie had made up the fire , boiled water and washed and dressed [Trafford]394-trafford 's wounds , and made another soup of lynx . But [Trafford]394-trafford had weakened in the night , the stuff nauseated [him]6082-him , [he]6082-him refused it and tried to smoke and was sick , and then sat back rather despairfully after a second attempt to persuade [her]323-marjorie to leave [him]6082-him there to die . This failure of [his]6082-him spirit distressed [her]323-marjorie and a little astonished [her]323-marjorie , but it only made [her]323-marjorie more resolute to go through with [her]323-marjorie work . [She]323-marjorie had awakened cold , stiff and weary , but [her]323-marjorie fatigue vanished with movement ; [she]323-marjorie toiled for an hour replenishing [her]323-marjorie pile of fuel , made up the fire , put [his]6082-him gun ready to [his]6082-him hand , kissed [him]6082-him , abused [him]6082-him lovingly for the trouble [he]6082-him gave [her]323-marjorie until [his]6082-him poor torn face lit in response , and then parting on a note of cheerful confidence set out to return to [the hut]4318-the hut . [She]323-marjorie found the way not altogether easy to make out , wind and snow had left scarcely a trace of their tracks , and [her]323-marjorie mind was full of the stores [she]323-marjorie must bring and the possibility of moving [him]6082-him nearer to [the hut]4318-the hut . [She]323-marjorie was startled to see by the fresh , deep spoor along [the ridge]6038-the ridge how near the wolf had dared approach [them]6086-them in the darkness .... Ever and again [Marjorie]323-marjorie had to halt and look back to get [her]323-marjorie direction right . As it was [she]323-marjorie came through [the willow scrub]6087-the willow scrub nearly half a mile above [the hut]4318-the hut , and had to follow [the steep bank of [the frozen river]6090-the frozen river]6089-the steep bank of the frozen river down . At [one place]6091-one place [she]323-marjorie nearly slipped upon [an icy slope of rock]6092-an icy slope of rock . One possibility [she]323-marjorie did not dare to think of during that time ; a blizzard now would cut [her]323-marjorie off absolutely from any return to [Trafford]365-trafford . Short of that [she]323-marjorie believed [she]323-marjorie could get through . [Her]323-marjorie quick mind was full of all [she]323-marjorie had to do . At first [she]323-marjorie had thought chiefly of [his]365-trafford immediate necessities , of food and some sort of shelter . [She]323-marjorie had got a list of things in [her]323-marjorie head — meat extract , bandages , corrosive sublimate by way of antiseptic , brandy , a tin of beef , some bread and so forth ; [she]323-marjorie went over that several times to be sure of it , and then for a time [she]323-marjorie puzzled about [a tent]6093-a tent . [She]323-marjorie thought [she]323-marjorie could manage a bale of blankets on [her]323-marjorie back , and that [she]323-marjorie could rig a sleeping tent for [herself]323-marjorie and [Trafford]394-trafford with one and some bent sticks . The big tent would be too much to strike and shift . And then [her]323-marjorie mind went on to a bolder enterprise , which was to get [him]365-trafford [home]810-home . The nearer [she]323-marjorie could bring [him]365-trafford to [the log hut]6095-the log hut , the nearer [they]6096-they would be to supplies . [She]323-marjorie cast about for some sort of sledge . The snow was too soft and broken for runners , especially among the trees , but if [she]323-marjorie could get a flat of smooth wood [she]323-marjorie thought [she]323-marjorie might be able to drag [him]365-trafford . [She]323-marjorie decided to try the side of [[her]323-marjorie bunk]6097-her bunk . [She]323-marjorie could easily get that off . [She]323-marjorie would have , of course , to run it edgewise through the thickets and across [the ravine]6025-the ravine , but after that [she]323-marjorie would have almost clear going until [she]323-marjorie reached [the steep place of broken rocks within two hundred yards of [him]365-trafford]6099-the steep place of broken rocks within two hundred yards of him . The idea of a sledge grew upon [her]323-marjorie , and [she]323-marjorie planned to nail a rope along the edge and make a kind of harness for [herself]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie found [the camping - place]6100-the camping - place piled high with drifted snow , which had invaded [tent]4381-tent and [hut]6102-hut , and that some beast , a wolverine [she]323-marjorie guessed , had been into [the hut]4318-the hut , devoured every candle - end and the uppers of [Trafford]394-trafford 's well - greased second boots , and had then gone to [the corner of [the store shed]5989-the store shed]6104-the corner of the store shed and clambered up to [the stores]4373-the stores . [She]323-marjorie made no account of its depredations there , but set [herself]323-marjorie to make a sledge and get [her]323-marjorie supplies together . There was a gleam of sunshine , but [she]323-marjorie did not like the look of the sky , and [she]323-marjorie was horribly afraid of what might be happening to [Trafford]394-trafford . [She]323-marjorie carried [her]323-marjorie stuff through the wood and across [the ravine]6025-the ravine , and returned for [[her]323-marjorie improvised sledge]6108-her improvised sledge . [She]323-marjorie was still struggling with that among the trees when it began to snow again . It was hard then not to be frantic in [her]323-marjorie efforts . As it was , [she]323-marjorie packed [her]323-marjorie stuff so loosely on the planking that [she]323-marjorie had to repack it , and [she]323-marjorie started without putting on [her]323-marjorie snowshoes , and floundered fifty yards before [she]323-marjorie discovered that omission . The snow was now falling fast , darkling the sky and hiding everything but objects close at hand , and [she]323-marjorie had to use all [her]323-marjorie wits to determine [her]323-marjorie direction ; [she]323-marjorie knew [she]323-marjorie must go down a long slope and then up to [the ridge]6038-the ridge , and it came to [her]323-marjorie as a happy inspiration that if [she]323-marjorie bore to the left [she]323-marjorie might strike some recognizable vestige of [her]323-marjorie morning 's trail . [She]323-marjorie had read of [people walking in circles]6110-people walking in circles when [they]6110-people walking in circles have no light or guidance , and that troubled [her]323-marjorie until [she]323-marjorie bethought [herself]323-marjorie of the little compass on [her]323-marjorie watch chain . By that [she]323-marjorie kept [her]323-marjorie direction . [She]323-marjorie wished very much [she]323-marjorie had timed [herself]323-marjorie across [the waste]6111-the waste , so that [she]323-marjorie could tell when [she]323-marjorie approached [the ridge]6038-the ridge . Soon [her]323-marjorie back and shoulders were aching violently , and the rope across [her]323-marjorie chest was tugging like some evil - tempered thing . But [she]323-marjorie did not dare to rest . The snow was now falling thick and fast , the flakes traced white spirals and made [her]323-marjorie head spin , so that [she]323-marjorie was constantly falling away to the south - westward and then correcting [herself]323-marjorie by the compass . [She]323-marjorie tried to think how this zig - zagging might affect [her]323-marjorie course , but the snow whirls confused [her]323-marjorie mind and a growing anxiety would not let [her]323-marjorie pause to think . [She]323-marjorie felt blinded ; it seemed to be snowing inside [her]323-marjorie eyes so that [she]323-marjorie wanted to rub them . Soon the ground must rise to [the ridge]6038-the ridge , [she]323-marjorie told [herself]323-marjorie ; it must surely rise . Then [the sledge]6114-the sledge came bumping at [her]323-marjorie heels and [she]323-marjorie perceived [she]323-marjorie was going down [hill]6115-hill . [She]323-marjorie consulted the compass , and [she]323-marjorie found [she]323-marjorie was facing south . [She]323-marjorie turned sharply to the right again . The snowfall became a noiseless , pitiless torture to sight and mind . The sledge behind [her]323-marjorie struggled to hold [her]323-marjorie back , and the snow balled under [her]323-marjorie snowshoes . [She]323-marjorie wanted to stop and rest , take thought , sit for a moment . [She]323-marjorie struggled with [herself]323-marjorie and kept on . [She]323-marjorie tried walking with shut eyes , and tripped and came near sprawling . "[249-god] Oh God ! " [she]323-marjorie cried , "[249-god] oh [God]249-god ! " too stupefied for more articulate prayers . Would the rise of the ground to the ribs of rock never come ? [A figure , black and erect]6116-a figure , black and erect , stood in front of [her]323-marjorie suddenly , and beyond appeared [a group of black , straight antagonists]6117-a group of black , straight antagonists . [She]323-marjorie staggered on towards [them]6117-a group of black , straight antagonists , gripping [her]323-marjorie rifle with some muddled idea of defence , and in another moment [she]323-marjorie was brushing against the branches of a stunted fir , which shed thick lumps of snow upon [her]323-marjorie feet . What trees were these ? Had [she]323-marjorie ever passed any trees ? No ! There were no trees on [her]323-marjorie way to [Trafford]365-trafford .... [She]323-marjorie began whimpering like [a tormented child]6118-a tormented child . But even as [she]323-marjorie wept [she]323-marjorie turned [her]323-marjorie sledge about to follow the edge of the wood . [She]323-marjorie was too much downhill , [she]323-marjorie thought and [she]323-marjorie must bear up again . [She]323-marjorie left the trees behind , made an angle uphill to the right , and was presently among trees again . Again [she]323-marjorie left [them]6117-a group of black , straight antagonists and again came back to [them]6117-a group of black , straight antagonists . [She]323-marjorie screamed with anger at [them]6117-a group of black , straight antagonists and twitched [her]323-marjorie sledge away . [She]323-marjorie wiped at the snowstorm with [her]323-marjorie arm as though [she]323-marjorie would wipe it away . [She]323-marjorie wanted to stamp on the universe .... And [she]323-marjorie ached , [she]323-marjorie ached .... Something caught [her]323-marjorie eye ahead , something that gleamed ; it was exactly like a long , bare rather pinkish bone standing erect on the ground . Just because it was strange and queer [she]323-marjorie ran forward to it . Then as [she]323-marjorie came nearer [she]323-marjorie perceived it was a streak of barked trunk ; a branch had been torn off a pine tree and the bark stripped down to the root . And then [her]323-marjorie foot hit against a freshly hewn stump , and then came another , poking its pinkish wounds above the snow . And there were chips ! This filled [her]323-marjorie with wonder . [Some one]5496-some one had been cutting wood ! There must be [Indians]6120-indians or [trappers]4327-trappers near , [she]323-marjorie thought , and then realized the wood - cutter could be none other than [herself]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie turned to the right and saw the rocks rising steeply close at hand . "[4411-you] Oh Rag ! " [she]323-marjorie cried , and fired [her]323-marjorie rifle in the air . Ten seconds , twenty seconds , and then so loud and near it amazed [her]323-marjorie , came [his]5496-some one answering shot . It sounded like [the hillside]4261-the hillside bursting . In another moment [she]323-marjorie had discovered the trail [she]323-marjorie had made overnight and that morning by dragging firewood . It was now a shallow soft white trench . Instantly [her]323-marjorie despair and fatigue had gone from [her]323-marjorie . Should [she]323-marjorie take a load of wood with [her]323-marjorie ? [she]323-marjorie asked [herself]323-marjorie , in addition to the weight behind [her]323-marjorie , and had a better idea . [She]323-marjorie would unload and pile [her]323-marjorie stuff here , and bring [him]5496-some one down on the sledge closer to the wood . [She]323-marjorie looked about and saw two rocks that diverged with a space between . [She]323-marjorie flashed schemes . [She]323-marjorie would trample the snow hard and flat , put [her]323-marjorie sledge on it , pile boughs and make a canopy of blanket overhead and behind . Then a fire in front . [She]323-marjorie saw [[her]323-marjorie camp]6123-her camp admirable . [She]323-marjorie tossed [her]323-marjorie provisions down and ran up the broad windings of [[her]323-marjorie pine - tree trail]6124-her pine - tree trail to [Trafford]365-trafford , with [the unloaded sledge]6125-the unloaded sledge bumping behind [her]323-marjorie . [She]323-marjorie ran as lightly as though [she]323-marjorie had done nothing that day . [She]323-marjorie found [him]5496-some one markedly recovered , weak and quiet , with snow drifting over [his]5496-some one feet , [his]5496-some one rifle across [his]5496-some one knees , and [his]5496-some one pipe alight . "[4411-you] Back already , " [he]5496-some one said , "[4411-you] but — — " [He]5496-some one hesitated . "[4411-you] No grub ? " [She]323-marjorie knelt over [him]5496-some one , gave [his]5496-some one rough unshaven cheek a swift kiss , and very rapidly explained [her]323-marjorie plan . In three days ' time [they]6126-they were back at [the hut]4318-the hut , and the last two days [they]6126-they wore blue spectacles because of the mid - day glare of the sunlit snow . It amazed [Marjorie]323-marjorie to discover as [she]323-marjorie lay awake in [the camp]4219-the camp on the edge of [the ravine close to the hut to which [she]323-marjorie had lugged [Trafford]394-trafford]6129-the ravine close to the hut to which she had lugged trafford during the second day , that [she]323-marjorie was deeply happy . It was preposterous that [she]323-marjorie should be so , but those days of almost despairful stress were irradiated now by a new courage . [She]323-marjorie was doing this thing , against all Labrador and the snow - driving wind that blew from [the polar wilderness]6130-the polar wilderness , [she]323-marjorie was winning . It was a great discovery to [her]323-marjorie that hardship and effort almost to the breaking - point could ensue in so deep a satisfaction . [She]323-marjorie lay and thought how deep and rich life had become for [her]323-marjorie , as though in all this effort and struggle some unsuspected veil had been torn away . [She]323-marjorie perceived again , but now with no sense of desolation , that same infinite fragility of life which [she]323-marjorie had first perceived when [she]323-marjorie had watched the Aurora Borealis flickering up the sky . Beneath that realization and carrying it , as a river flood may carry scum , was a sense of [herself]323-marjorie as something deeper , greater , more enduring than mountain or [wilderness or sky]6131-wilderness or sky , or any of those monstrous forms of nature that had dwarfed [her]323-marjorie physical self to nothingness . [She]323-marjorie had a persuasion of self detachment and illumination , and withal of self - discovery . [She]323-marjorie saw [her]323-marjorie life of time and space for what it was . Away in [London]17-london [the children , with the coldest of noses and the gayest of spirits]6132-the children , with the coldest of noses and the gayest of spirits , would be scampering about [[their]6132-the children , with the coldest of noses and the gayest of spirits bedrooms]6133-their bedrooms in the mild morning sunlight of a [London]17-london winter ; [Elsie]492-alice , [the parlourmaid]980-the parlourmaid , would be whisking dexterous about [the dining - room]2244-the dining - room , the bacon would be cooking and the coffee - mill at work , the letters of the morning delivery perhaps just pattering into the letter - box , and all the bright little household [she]323-marjorie had made , with all the furniture [she]323-marjorie had arranged , all the characteristic decoration [she]323-marjorie had given it , all the clever convenient arrangements , would be getting itself into action for another day — and it was n't [herself]323-marjorie ! It was the extremest of [her]323-marjorie superficiality . [She]323-marjorie had come out of all that , and even so it seemed [she]323-marjorie had come out of [herself]323-marjorie ; [this weary woman lying awake on the balsam boughs with a brain cleared by underfeeding]6136-this weary woman lying awake on the balsam boughs with a brain cleared by underfeeding and this continuous arduous bath of toil in snow - washed , frost cleansed , starry air , this , too , was no more than a momentarily clarified window for [her]323-marjorie unknown and indefinable reality . What was that reality ? what was [she]323-marjorie [herself]323-marjorie ? [She]323-marjorie became interested in framing an answer to that , and slipped down from the peace of soul [she]323-marjorie had attained . [Her]323-marjorie serenity gave way to a reiteration of this question , reiterations increasing and at last oppressing like the snowflakes of a storm , perpetual whirling repetitions that at last confused [her]323-marjorie and hid the sky .... [She]323-marjorie fell asleep .... With [their]6137-their return to [the hut]4318-the hut , [Marjorie]323-marjorie had found [herself]323-marjorie encountering a new set of urgencies . In [their]6137-their absence that wretched little wolverine had found great plenty and happiness in [the tent]4234-the tent and [store - shed]4382-store - shed ; its traces were manifest nearly everywhere , and it had particularly assailed the candles , after a destructive time among the frozen caribou beef . [It]6141-it had clambered up on the packages of sardines and jumped thence on to a sloping pole that it could claw along into the frame of the roof . [She]323-marjorie rearranged the packages , but that was no good . [She]323-marjorie could not leave [Trafford]365-trafford in order to track [the brute]6142-the brute down , and for a night or so [she]323-marjorie could not think of any way of checking its depredations . It came each night .... [Trafford]394-trafford kept [her]323-marjorie close at [home]810-home . [She]323-marjorie had expected that when [he]365-trafford was back in [[his]365-trafford bunk]6144-his bunk , secure and warm , [he]365-trafford would heal rapidly , but instead [he]365-trafford suddenly developed all the symptoms of a severe feverish cold , and [his]365-trafford scars , which had seemed healing , became flushed and ugly - looking . Moreover , there was something wrong with [his]365-trafford leg , an ominous ache that troubled [her]323-marjorie mind . [Every woman]1966-every woman , [she]323-marjorie decided , ought to know how to set a bone . [He]365-trafford was unable to sleep by reason of these miseries , though very desirous of doing so . [He]365-trafford became distressingly weak and inert , [he]365-trafford ceased to care for food , and presently [he]365-trafford began ta talk to [himself]365-trafford with a complete disregard of [her]323-marjorie presence . Hourly [she]323-marjorie regretted [her]323-marjorie ignorance of medicine that left [her]323-marjorie with no conceivable remedy for all the aching and gnawing that worried and weakened [him]365-trafford , except bathing with antiseptics and a liberal use of quinine . And [his]365-trafford face became strange to [her]323-marjorie , for over [his]365-trafford flushed and sunken cheeks , under the raw spaces of the scar a blond beard bristled and grew . Presently , [Trafford]394-trafford was [a bearded man]6146-a bearded man . Incidentally , however , [she]323-marjorie killed [the wolverine]6147-the wolverine by means of a trap of [her]323-marjorie own contrivance , a loaded rifle with a bait of what was nearly [her]323-marjorie last candles , rigged to the trigger . But this loss of the candles brought home to [them]6148-them the steady lengthening of the nights . Scarcely seven hours of day remained now in the black , cold grip of the darkness . And through those seventeen hours of chill aggression [they]6148-them had no light but the red glow of the stove . [She]323-marjorie had to close the door of [the hut]4318-the hut and bar every chink and cranny against the icy air , that became at last a murderous , freezing wind . Not only did [she]323-marjorie line [the hut]4318-the hut with every scrap of skin and paper [she]323-marjorie could obtain , but [she]323-marjorie went out with the spade toiling for three laborious afternoons in piling and beating snow against the outer frame . And now it was that [Trafford]394-trafford talked at last , talked with something of the persistence of delirium , and [she]323-marjorie sat and listened hour by hour , silently , for [he]365-trafford gave no heed to [her]323-marjorie or to anything [she]323-marjorie might say . [He]365-trafford talked , it seemed , to [God]249-god .... Darkness about a sullen glow of red , and a voice speaking . The voice of [a man , fevered and in pain , wounded and amidst hardship and danger]6151-a man , fevered and in pain , wounded and amidst hardship and danger , struggling with the unrelenting riddle of [his]365-trafford being . Ever and again when a flame leapt [she]323-marjorie would see [his]365-trafford face , haggard , bearded , changed , and yet infinitely familiar . [His]365-trafford voice varied , now high and clear , now mumbling , now vexed and expostulating , now rich with deep feeling , now fagged and slow ; [his]365-trafford matter varied , too ; now [he]365-trafford talked like [one who is inspired , and now like one lost and confused , stupidly repeating phrases]6152-one who is inspired , and now like one lost and confused , stupidly repeating phrases , going back upon a misleading argument , painfully , laboriously beginning over and over again . [Marjorie]323-marjorie sat before the stove watching it burn and sink , replenishing it , preparing food , and outside the bitter wind moaned and blew the powdery snow before it , and the shortening interludes of pallid , diffused daylight which pass for days in such weather , came and went . Intense cold had come now with leaden snowy days and starless nights . Sometimes [his]365-trafford speech filled [her]323-marjorie mind , seemed to fill all [her]323-marjorie world ; sometimes [she]323-marjorie ceased to listen , following thoughts of [her]323-marjorie own . Sometimes [she]323-marjorie dozed ; sometimes [she]323-marjorie awakened from sleep to find [him]365-trafford talking . But slowly [she]323-marjorie realized a thread in [his]365-trafford discourse , a progress and development . Sometimes [he]365-trafford talked of [his]365-trafford early researches , and then [he]365-trafford would trace computations with [his]365-trafford hands as if [he]365-trafford were using a blackboard , and became distressed to remember what [he]365-trafford had written . Sometimes [he]365-trafford would be under the claws of the lynx again , and fighting for [his]365-trafford eyes . "[4411-you] Ugh ! " [he]365-trafford said , "[4411-you] keep those hind legs still . Keep [your]4411-you hind legs still ! Knife ? Knife ? Ah ! got it . Gu — u — u , [you]4411-you Beast ! " But the gist of [his]365-trafford speech was determined by the purpose of [his]365-trafford journey to [Labrador]190-labrador . At last [he]365-trafford was reviewing [his]365-trafford life and [hers]4411-you , and all that [their]4412-we life might signify , even as [he]365-trafford determined to do . [She]4411-you began to perceive that whatever else drifted into [his]365-trafford mind and talk , this recurred and grew , that [he]365-trafford returned to the conclusion [he]365-trafford had reached , and not to the beginning of the matter , and went on from that .... "[4411-you] [You]4411-you see , " [he]365-trafford said , "[0-i] [our]4412-we lives are nothing — nothing in themselves . [I]0-i know that ; [I]0-i 've never had any doubts of that . [We]4412-we individuals just pick up a mixed lot of things out of the powers that begat [us]4412-we , and lay them down again presently a little altered , that 's all — heredities , traditions , the finger nails of [[my]0-i grandfather]4413-my grandfather , [a great - aunt]4414-a great - aunt 's lips , the faith of [a sect]4415-a sect , the ideas of one 's time . [We]4412-we live and then [we]4412-we die , and the threads run , dispersing this way and that . To make [other people]4823-other people again . [Whatever 's immortal]4417-whatever 's immortal is n't that , [our]4412-we looks or [our]4412-we habits , [our]4412-we thoughts or [our]4412-we memories — just the shapes , these are , of one immortal stuff .... One immortal stuff . " ... The voice died away as if [he]0-i was baffled . Then it resumed . "[4412-we] But [we]4412-we ought to partake of immortality ; that 's [my]0-i point . [We]4412-we ought to partake of immortality . " [I]1188-the child mean [we]4412-we 're like the little elements in a magnet ; ought not to lie higgledy - piggledy , ought to point the same way , be polarized —— Something microcosmic , [you]6153-you know , ought to be found in [a man]837-a man . "[1188-the child] Analogies run away with one . Suppose the bar is n't magnetized yet ! Suppose purpose has to come ; suppose the immortal stuff is n't yet , is n't being but struggling to be . Struggling to be .... [Gods]547-gods ! that morning ! When [the child]1188-the child was born ! And afterwards [she]1188-the child was there — with a smile on [her]1188-the child lips , and a little flushed and proud — as if nothing had happened so very much out of the way . Nothing so wonderful . And [we]4412-we had another life besides [our]4412-we own ! ... " Afterwards [he]0-i came back to that . "[1188-the child] That was a good image , " [he]0-i said , "[0-i] something trying to exist , which is n't substance , does n't belong to space or time , something stifled and enclosed , struggling to get through . Just confused birth cries , eyes that hardly see , deaf ears , poor little thrusting hands . A thing altogether blind at first , a twitching and thrusting of protoplasm under [the waters]5542-the waters , and then the plants creeping up [the beaches]4420-the beaches , the insects and reptiles on [the margins of [the rivers]4422-the rivers]4421-the margins of the rivers , beasts with a flicker of light in [their]4423-their eyes answering the sun . And at last , out of the long interplay of desire and fear , an ape , an ape that stared and wondered , and scratched queer pictures on a bone .... " [He]0-i lapsed into silent thought for a time , and [Marjorie]323-marjorie glanced at [his]0-i dim face in the shadows . "[0-i] [I]0-i say nothing of ultimates , " [he]0-i said at last . [He]0-i repeated that twice before [his]0-i thoughts would flow again . "[0-i] This is as much as [I]0-i see , in time as [I]0-i know it and space as [I]0-i know it — something struggling to exist . It 's true to the end of [my]0-i limits . What can [I]0-i say beyond that ? It struggles to exist , becomes conscious , becomes now conscious of itself . That is where [I]0-i come in , as a part of it . Above the beast in [me]0-i is that — the desire to know better , to know — beautifully , and to transmit [my]0-i knowledge . That 's all there is in life for [me]0-i beyond food and shelter and tidying up . [This Being]4424-this being — opening its eyes , listening , trying to comprehend . Every good thing in [man]939-man is that;—looking and making pictures , listening and making songs , making philosophies and sciences , trying new powers , bridge and engine , spark and gun . At the bottom of [my]0-i soul , that . [We]4426-we began with bone - scratching . [We]4426-we 're still — near it . [I]0-i am just a part of this beginning — mixed with other things . Every book , every art , every religion is that , the attempt to understand and express — mixed with other things . Nothing else matters , nothing whatever . One day , [she]323-marjorie did not know what day , for [she]323-marjorie had lost count of the days , [Marjorie]323-marjorie set the kettle to boil and opened the door of [the hut]4318-the hut to look out , and the snow was ablaze with diamonds , and the air was sweet and still . [He]0-i said no more , but [his]0-i eyes watched [her]323-marjorie move about with a kind of tired curiosity . [Marjorie]323-marjorie had had to cut away great fragments of gangrenous frozen flesh , and [he]0-i was clearly destined to have a huge scar over forehead and cheek , but in that pure , clear air , once the healing had begun it progressed swiftly . [His]0-i leg had set , a little shorter than its fellow and with a lump in the middle of the shin , but it promised to be a good serviceable leg none the less . " [She]323-marjorie had contrived a crutch for [him]0-i against that momentous experiment , and [he]0-i sat up in [his]0-i bunk , pillowed up by a sack and [her]323-marjorie rugs , and whittled it smooth , and padded the fork with the skin of that slaughtered wolverine , poor victim of hunger!—while [she]323-marjorie knelt by the stove feeding it with logs , and gave [him]0-i an account of [their]4450-we position . "[4450-we] [We]4450-we 're somewhere in the middle of December , " [she]323-marjorie said , "[0-i] somewhere between the twelfth and the fourteenth,—yes ! [I]0-i 'm as out as that!—and [I]0-i 've handled the stores pretty freely . So did that little beast until [I]0-i got [him]4451-him . " [She]323-marjorie nodded at the skin in [his]0-i hand . "[549-right o] [I]0-i do n't see [myself]0-i shooting much now , and so far [I]0-i 've not been able to break the ice to fish . It 's too much for [me]0-i . Even if it is n't too late to fish . This book [we]4450-we 've got describes barks and mosses , and that will help , but if [we]4450-we stick here until the birds and things come , [we]4450-we 're going to be precious short . [We]4450-we may have to last right into [July]227-july . [I]0-i 've plans — but it may come to that . [We]4450-we ought to ration all the regular stuff , and trust to luck for a feast . Tell [me]0-i , make [me]0-i [[your]4491-you partner]4499-your partner ; it 's [you]4491-you who know , what are [we]4497-we doing with life ? " What are [we]4497-we doing with life ? That question overtakes [a reluctant and fugitive humanity]6194-a reluctant and fugitive humanity . [The Traffords]425-the traffords were but two of [a great scattered host of people , who , obeying all the urgencies of need and desire , struggling , loving , begetting , enjoying]6195-a great scattered host of people , who , obeying all the urgencies of need and desire , struggling , loving , begetting , enjoying , do nevertheless find [themselves]425-the traffords at last unsatisfied . [They]425-the traffords have lived the round of experience , achieved all that [living creatures]6196-living creatures have sought since the beginning of [the world]589-the world — security and gratification and [offspring]6198-offspring — and [they]425-the traffords find [themselves]425-the traffords still strong , unsatiated , with power in [their]425-the traffords hands and years before [them]425-the traffords , empty of purpose . What are [they]425-the traffords to do ? [The world]589-the world presents such a spectacle of evasion as it has never seen before . Never was there such a boiling over and waste of vital energy . The Sphinx of [our]4497-we opportunity calls for the uttermost powers of heart and brain to read its riddle — the new , astonishing riddle of excessive power . [A few]6200-a few give [themselves]6200-a few to those honourable adventures that extend the range of [man]939-man , [they]6200-a few explore [untravelled countries]6202-untravelled countries , climb [remote mountains]6203-remote mountains , conduct researches , risk life and limb in the fantastic experiments of flight , and a monstrous outpouring of labour and material goes on in the strenuous preparation for needless and improbable wars . [The rest]1737-the rest divert [themselves]1737-the rest with the dwarfish satisfactions of recognized vice , the meagre routine of pleasure , or still more timidly with sport and games — those new unscheduled perversions of the soul . [We]4500-we are afraid of [our]4500-we new selves . The dawn of human opportunity appals [us]4500-we . [Few of [us]4500-we]6205-few of us dare look upon this strange light of freedom and limitless resources that breaks upon [[our]4500-we world]2861-our world . "[4491-you] Think , " said [Trafford]394-trafford , "[0-i] while [we]4500-we sit here in [this dark hut]4501-this dark hut — think of the surplus life that wastes itself in [the world]589-the world for sheer lack of direction . Away there in [England]9-england — [I]0-i suppose that is westward"—he pointed—"there[0-i] are [thousands of [men]600-men going out to - day to shoot]4503-thousands of men going out to - day to shoot . Think of the beautifully made guns , the perfected ammunition , the excellent clothes , the army of [beaters]4505-beaters , the carefully preserved woodland , the admirable science of it — all for that idiot massacre of half - tame birds ! Just because [man]939-man once had need to be [a hunter]4507-a hunter ! Think of [the others]968-the others again — golfing . Think of [the big , elaborate houses from which [they]4503-thousands of men going out to - day to shoot come]4509-the big , elaborate houses from which they come , the furnishings , the service . And [the women]5442-the women — dressing ! Perpetually dressing . [You]4511-you , [Marjorie]323-marjorie — [you've]4512-you've done nothing but dress since [we]4500-we married . No , let [me]0-i abuse [you]4511-you , [dear]4768-dear ! It 's insane , [you]4511-you know ! [You]4511-you dress [your]4511-you minds a little to talk amusingly , [you]4511-you spread [your]4511-you minds out to [backgrounds]4514-backgrounds , to [households]4515-households , [picturesque and delightful gardens]4516-picturesque and delightful gardens , [nurseries]4517-nurseries . " On the evening of the day when [Trafford]394-trafford first tried to stand upon [his]0-i leg , [they]4500-we talked far into the night . It had been a great and eventful day for [them]4500-we , full of laughter and exultation . [He]0-i had been at first ridiculously afraid ; [he]0-i had clung to [her]6207-her almost childishly , and [she]6207-her had held [him]0-i about the body with [his]0-i weight on [her]6207-her strong right arm and [his]0-i right arm in [her]6207-her left hand , concealing [her]6207-her own dread of a collapse under a mask of taunting courage . The crutch had proved admirable . "[0-i] It 's [my]0-i silly knees ! " [Trafford]394-trafford kept on saying . "[0-i] The leg 's all right , but [I]0-i get put out by [my]0-i silly knees . " [They]4500-we made the day a feast , a dinner of two whole day 's rations and a special soup instead of supper . "[0-i] The birds will come , " [they]4500-we explained to [each other]709-each other , "[4520-you] ducks and geese , long before May. May , [you]4520-you know , is the latest . " Then , as [he]0-i lay back in [his]0-i bunk and [she]323-marjorie crammed the stove with fresh boughs and twigs of balsam that filled the little space about [them]4521-we with warmth and with a faint , sweet smell of burning and with flitting red reflections , [he]0-i took up a talk about religion [they]4521-we had begun some days before . That 's why [one]675-one thinks of those things in darkness and loneliness — and finds them hard to tell . " [I]0-i feel that [man]939-man has now before all things to know . "[0-i] [He]0-i sat up , speaking very earnestly to [her]323-marjorie , and in that flickering light [she]323-marjorie realized for the first time how thin [he]0-i had become , how bright and hollow [his]0-i eyes , [his]0-i hair was long over [his]0-i eyes , and a rough beard flowed down to [his]0-i chest . " All the religions , "[0-i] [he]0-i said , " all the philosophies , have pretended to achieve too much . [We]4539-we 've no language yet for religious truth or metaphysical truth ; [we]4539-we 've no basis yet broad enough and strong enough on which to build . Religion and philosophy have been impudent and quackish — quackish ! [They]4545-they 've been like [the doctors , who have always pretended [they]6210-the doctors , who have always pretended they could cure since the beginning of things , cure everything [could cure since the beginning of things , cure everything]6211-could cure since the beginning of things , cure everything]6210-the doctors , who have always pretended they could cure since the beginning of things , cure everything , and to this day even [they]6210-the doctors , who have always pretended they could cure since the beginning of things , cure everything have n't got more than the beginnings of knowledge on which to base a cure . [They]4545-they 've lacked humility , [they]4545-they 've lacked the honour to say [they]4545-they did n't know ; [the priests]6212-the priests took things of wood and stone , [the philosophers]6213-the philosophers took little odd arrangements of poor battered words , metaphors , analogies , abstractions , and said : "[4552-you] That 's it ! Think of [their]4545-they silly old Absolute,—ab - solutus , an untied parcel . [I]0-i heard [Haldane]552-haldane at the Aristotelian once , go on for an hour — no ! it was longer than an hour — as glib and slick as a well - oiled sausage - machine , about the different sorts of Absolute , and not [a soul of [us]4547-we]4546-a soul of us laughed out at [him]0-i ! The vanity of such profundities ! [They]4548-they 've no faith , faith in patience , faith to wait for the coming of [God]249-god . And since [we]4547-we do n't know [God]249-god , since [we]4547-we do n't know [His]249-god will with [us]4547-we , is n't it plain that all [our]4547-we lives should be a search for [Him]249-god and it ? Can anything else matter,—after [we]4547-we are free from necessity ? That is the work now that is before [all mankind]4549-all mankind , to attempt understanding — by the perpetual finding of thought and the means of expression , by perpetual extension and refinement of science , by the research that [every artist]4550-every artist makes for beauty and significance in [his]4550-every artist art , by the perpetual testing and destruction and rebirth under criticism of all these things , and by a perpetual extension of this intensifying wisdom to more minds and more minds and more , till [all men]3760-all men share in it , and share in the making of it .... There [you]4552-you have [my]0-i creed , [Marjorie]323-marjorie ; there [you]4552-you have the very marrow of [me]0-i . " ... [He]0-i became silent . "[0-i] Will [you]0-i go back to [your]0-i work ? " [she]323-marjorie said , abruptly . "[0-i] Go back to [[your]0-i laboratory]5567-your laboratory ? " [He]0-i stared at [her]323-marjorie for a moment without speaking . "[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]4933-my dear , " [he]0-i said , at last , "[0-i] [I]0-i 've thought of that . But since [I]0-i left [that dear , dusty little laboratory]4555-that dear , dusty little laboratory , and all those exquisite subtle things — [I've]0-i lived . [I]0-i 've left [that man]1393-that man seven long years behind [me]0-i . [Some other man]5434-some other man must go on — [I]0-i think [some younger man]4558-some younger man — with the riddles [I]0-i found to work on then . [I]0-i 've grown — into something different . It is n't how atoms swing with [one another]863-one another , or why [they]4560-they build [themselves]4560-they up so and not so , that matters any more to [me]0-i . [I]0-i 've got [you]4561-you and [all [the world]589-the world in which [we]4564-we live]4562-all the world in which we live , and a new set of riddles filling [my]0-i mind , how thought swings about thought , how [one man]5129-one man attracts [[his]5129-one man fellows]4346-his fellows , how the waves of motive and conviction sweep through [a crowd]5497-a crowd and all the little drifting crystallizations of spirit with spirit and all the repulsions and eddies and difficulties , that [one]675-one can catch in that turbulent confusion . [I]0-i want to do a new sort of work now altogether .... Life has swamped [me]0-i once , but [I]0-i do n't think it will get [me]0-i under again;—I want to study [men]600-men . " [He]0-i paused and [she]6214-she waited , with a face aglow . "[4573-you] [I]0-i want to go back to watch and think — and [I]0-i suppose write . [I]0-i believe [I]0-i shall write criticism . But everything that matters is criticism ! ... [I]0-i want to get into contact with [the men who are thinking]4570-the men who are thinking . [I]0-i do n't mean to meet [them]4570-the men who are thinking necessarily , but to get into the souls of [their]4570-the men who are thinking books . [Every writer who has anything to say , every artist who matters , is the stronger for [every man or woman who responds to [him]4571-every writer who has anything to say , every artist who matters , is the stronger for every man or woman who responds to him]4572-every man or woman who responds to him]4571-every writer who has anything to say , every artist who matters , is the stronger for every man or woman who responds to him . That 's the great work — the Reality . [I]0-i want to become a part of this stuttering attempt to express , [I]0-i want at least to resonate , even if [I]0-i do not help .... And [you]4573-you with [me]0-i , [Marjorie]323-marjorie — [you]4573-you with [me]0-i ! Everything [I]0-i write [I]0-i want [you]4573-you to see and think about . "[4573-you] Do n't please make [me]0-i , " [she]4573-you stumbled through [her]4573-you thoughts , "[323-marjorie] one of [those little parasitic , parroting wives]4575-those little parasitic , parroting wives — don't pretend too much about [me]0-i — because [you]4573-you want [me]0-i with [you——.]4573-you Do n't forget [a woman]4857-a woman is n't [a man]837-a man . " "[323-marjorie] [Old Madge]323-marjorie , " [he]0-i said , "[4579-a candidate girl] [you]323-marjorie and [I]0-i have got to march together . "[0-i] The absurdity ! The infinite absurdity ! " "[0-i] But what ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i might have married Will Magnet——. That 's all . " [She]323-marjorie sprang to [her]323-marjorie feet . There came a sound of wind outside , a shifting of snow on the roof , and the door creaked . "[0-i] Half - past eleven , " [she]323-marjorie exclaimed looking at the watch that hung in the light of the stove door . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want to sleep yet ; do [you]0-i ? [I]0-i 'm going to brew some tea — make a convivial drink . And then [we]4580-we will go on talking . It 's so good talking to [you]0-i . So good ! ... [I]0-i 've an idea ! Do n't [you]0-i think on this special day , it might run to a biscuit ? " [Her]323-marjorie face was keenly anxious . [He]0-i nodded . "[0-i] One biscuit each , " [she]323-marjorie said , trying to rob [her]323-marjorie voice of any note of criminality . "[0-i] Just one , [you]0-i know , wo n't matter . " [She]323-marjorie hovered for some moments close to the stove before [she]323-marjorie went into the arctic corner that contained the tin of tea . "[0-i] If [we]4580-we can really live like that ! " [she]323-marjorie said . "[0-i] When [we]4580-we are [home]810-home again . " "[0-i] Why not ? " [he]0-i answered . [She]323-marjorie made no answer , but went across for the tea .... [He]0-i turned [his]0-i head at the sound of the biscuit tin and watched [her]323-marjorie put out the precious discs . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall have another pipe , " [he]0-i proclaimed , with an agreeable note of excess . "[0-i] Thank heaven for unstinted tobacco .... " And now [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's mind was teaming with thoughts of this new conception of a life lived for understanding . As [she]323-marjorie went about the preparation of the tea , [her]323-marjorie vividly concrete imagination was active with the realization of the life [they]4580-we would lead on [their]4580-we return . [She]323-marjorie could not see [it]6215-it otherwise than framed in [a tall , fine room]6216-a tall , fine room , [a study]6217-a study , [a study in sombre tones]6218-a study in sombre tones , with high , narrow , tall , dignified bookshelves and rich deep green curtains veiling [its]6216-a tall , fine room windows . There should be a fireplace of white marble , very plain and well proportioned , with furnishings of old brass , and a big desk towards the window beautifully lit by electric light , with abundant space for papers to lie . And [she]323-marjorie wanted some touch of the wilderness about it ; a skin perhaps .... The tea was still infusing when [she]323-marjorie had determined upon an enormous paper - weight of that iridescent Labradorite that had been so astonishing a feature of [the Green River Valley]228-the green river valley . [She]323-marjorie would have it polished on one side only — the other should be rough to show the felspar in its natural state .... It was n't that [she]323-marjorie did n't feel and understand quite fully the intention and significance of all [he]0-i had said , but that in these symbols of texture and equipment [her]323-marjorie mind quite naturally clothed itself . And while [this room]5923-this room was coming into anticipatory being in [her]323-marjorie mind , [she]323-marjorie was making the tea very deftly and listening to [Trafford]394-trafford 's every word . That talk marked an epoch to [Marjorie]323-marjorie . From that day forth [her]323-marjorie imagination began to shape a new , ordered and purposeful life for [Trafford]394-trafford and [herself]323-marjorie in [London]17-london , a life not altogether divorced from [their]6220-their former life , but with a faith sustaining it and aims controlling it . [She]323-marjorie had always known of the breadth and power of [his]0-i mind , but now as [he]0-i talked of what [he]0-i might do , what interests might converge and give results through [him]0-i , it seemed [she]323-marjorie really knew [him]0-i for the first time . In [his]0-i former researches , so technical and withdrawn , [she]323-marjorie had seen little of [his]0-i mind in action : now [he]0-i was dealing in [his]0-i own fashion with things [she]323-marjorie could clearly understand . There were times when [his]0-i talk affected [her]323-marjorie like that joy of light one has in emerging into sunshine from [a long and tedious cave]6221-a long and tedious cave . [He]0-i swept things together , flashed unsuspected correlations upon [her]323-marjorie intelligence , smashed and scattered absurd yet venerated conventions of thought , made undreamt - of courses of action visible in a flare of luminous necessity . And [she]323-marjorie could follow [him]0-i and help [him]0-i . Just as [she]323-marjorie had hampered [him]0-i and crippled [him]0-i , so now [she]323-marjorie could release [him]0-i — [she]323-marjorie fondled that word . [She]323-marjorie found a preposterous image in [her]323-marjorie mind that [she]323-marjorie hid like a disgraceful secret , that [she]323-marjorie tried to forget , and yet its stupendous , its dreamlike absurdity had something in it that shaped [her]323-marjorie delight as nothing else could do ; [she]323-marjorie was , [she]323-marjorie told [herself]323-marjorie — hawking with [an archangel]6222-an archangel ! ... These were [her]323-marjorie moods of exaltation . And [she]323-marjorie was sure [she]323-marjorie had never loved [[her]323-marjorie man]6223-her man before , that this was indeed [her]323-marjorie beginning . It was as if [she]323-marjorie had just found [him]0-i .... Perhaps , [she]323-marjorie thought , [true lovers]6224-true lovers keep on finding each other all through [their]6224-true lovers lives . And [he]0-i too had discovered [her]323-marjorie . All the host of Marjories [he]0-i had known , the shining , delightful , seductive , wilful , perplexing aspects that had so filled [her]323-marjorie life , gave place altogether for a time to [this steady - eyed woman]6225-this steady - eyed woman , lean and warm - wrapped with the valiant heart and the frost - roughened skin . What a fine , strong , ruddy thing [she]323-marjorie was ! How glad [he]0-i was for this wild adventure in [the wilderness]4183-the wilderness , if only because it had made [him]0-i lie among the rocks and think of [her]323-marjorie and wait for [her]323-marjorie and despair of [her]323-marjorie life and [God]249-god , and at last see [her]323-marjorie coming back to [him]0-i , flushed with effort and calling [his]0-i name to [him]0-i out of that whirlwind of snow .... And there was at least one old memory mixed up with all these new and overmastering impressions , the memory of [her]323-marjorie clear unhesitating voice as it had stabbed into [his]0-i life again long years ago , minute and bright in the telephone : "[323-marjorie] It 's [me]0-i , [you]4582-you know . It 's [Marjorie]323-marjorie ! " Perhaps after all [she]323-marjorie had not wasted a moment of [his]0-i life , perhaps every issue between [them]6227-they had been necessary , and it was good altogether to be turned from the study of crystals to the study of [men]600-men and [women]612-women .... And now both [their]6227-they minds were Londonward , where all the tides and driftage and currents of human thought still meet and swirl together . [They]6227-they were full of what [they]6227-they would do when [they]6227-they got back . [Marjorie]323-marjorie sketched that study to [him]0-i — in general terms and without the paper - weight — and began to shape the world [she]323-marjorie would have about it . [She]323-marjorie meant to be [his]0-i squaw and body - servant first of all , and then — [a mother]4834-a mother . [Children]1961-children , [she]323-marjorie said , are none the worse for being kept a little out of focus . And [he]0-i was rapidly planning out [his]0-i approach to the new questions to which [he]0-i was now to devote [his]0-i life . "[675-one] [One]675-one wants something to hold the work together , " [he]0-i said , and projected a book . "[675-one] [One]675-one can not struggle at large for plain statement and copious and free and courageous statement , one needs a positive attack . " [He]0-i designed a book , which [he]0-i might write if only for the definition it would give [him]0-i and with no ultimate publication , which was to be called : "[675-one] The Limits of Language as a Means of Expression . " ... It was to be a pragmatist essay , a sustained attempt to undermine the confidence of all that scholasticism and logic chopping which still lingers like the sequelæ of a disease in [our]6232-our University philosophy . "[4585-those duffers] [Those duffers]4585-those duffers sit in [their]4585-those duffers studies and make a sort of tea of dry old words — and think [they]4585-those duffers 're distilling the spirit of wisdom , " [he]0-i said . [He]0-i proliferated titles for a time , and settled at last on "[4585-those duffers] From Realism to Reality . " [He]0-i wanted to get at that at once ; it fretted [him]0-i to have to hang in the air , day by day , for want of books to quote and [opponents to lance and confute]6233-opponents to lance and confute . And [he]0-i wanted to see pictures , too and plays , read novels [he]0-i had heard of and never read , in order to verify or correct the ideas that were seething in [his]0-i mind about the qualities of artistic expression . [His]0-i thought had come out to a conviction that the line to wider human understandings lies through a huge criticism and cleaning up of the existing methods of formulation , as a preliminary to the wider and freer discussion of those religious and social issues [[our]6232-our generation]6234-our generation still shrinks from . "[4585-those duffers] It 's grotesque , " [he]0-i said , "[323-marjorie] and utterly true that the sanity and happiness of all [the world]589-the world lies in its habits of generalization . " There was not even paper for [him]0-i to make notes or provisional drafts of the new work . [He]0-i hobbled about [the camp]4219-the camp fretting at these deprivations . "[323-marjorie] [Marjorie]323-marjorie , " [he]0-i said , "[4587-we] [we]4587-we 've done [our]4587-we job . " "[4587-we] [The valley]4295-the valley would guide [us]4587-we . [We]4587-we could do four hours a day before [we]4587-we had to camp . [I]0-i 'm not sure [we]4587-we could n't try [the river]4906-the river . [We]4587-we could drag and carry all [our]4587-we food .... Plainly there would be nothing for it then but to lie down and die together .... And a sort of weariness had come to [her]323-marjorie as a consequence of two months of half - starved days , not perhaps a failure so much as a reluctance of spirit . " "[0-i] While [you]4592-you were asleep the other night , " [Trafford]394-trafford began one day as [they]4587-we sat spinning out [their]4587-we mid - day meal , "[4599-he] [I]0-i was thinking how badly [I]0-i had expressed [myself]0-i when [I]0-i talked to [you]4592-you the other day , and what a queer , thin affair [I]0-i made of the plans [I]0-i wanted to carry out . [They]4593-they must be . [They]4593-they only begin when those others are at peace . [The world]589-the world has gone out of its way time after time through simplifications and short cuts . Save [us]4587-we from epigrams ! And when [one]675-one thinks over what [one]675-one has said , at a little distance,—one wants to go back to it , and say it all again . But [you]323-marjorie 're nearer as [woman to the immediate personal life of sense and reality]6248-woman to the immediate personal life of sense and reality than [I]323-marjorie am as [man]939-man . It may be it will always be so . [Men]600-men were released from that close , continuous touch with physical necessities long before [women]612-women were . "[4601-i] " [You]6289-you know , [Marjorie]323-marjorie , [I]4604-i 've always felt [you]6289-you 're [a finer individual]6290-a finer individual than [me]4604-i , [I]4604-i 've never had a doubt of it . "[4604-i] That 's the real perplexity between [thousands of men]4602-thousands of men and [women]612-women .... " It seems to [me]0-i that the primitive socialism of Christianity and all the stuff of modern socialism that matters is really aiming — almost unconsciously , [I]0-i admit at times — at one simple end , at the release of the human spirit from the individualistic struggle — — "[0-i] [You]4604-i used ' release ' the other day , [Marjorie]323-marjorie ? Of course , [I]0-i remember . It 's queer how [I]0-i go on talking after [you]323-marjorie have understood . " "[4605-we] It was just a flash , " said [Marjorie]323-marjorie . "[0-i] [We]4605-we have intimations . Neither of [us]4605-we really understands . [We]4605-we 're like people climbing a mountain in a mist , that thins out for a moment and shows valleys and [cities]4606-cities , and then closes in again , before [we]4605-we can recognize [them]4607-them or make out where [we]4605-we are . " [Trafford]394-trafford thought . "[323-marjorie] When [I]0-i talk to [you]323-marjorie , [I]0-i 've always felt [I]0-i must n't be too vague . And the very essence of all this is a vague thing , something [we]4605-we shall never come nearer to it in all [our]4605-we lives than to see it as a shadow and a glittering that escapes again into a mist .... And yet it 's everything that matters , everything , the only thing that matters truly and for ever through the whole range of life . And [we]4605-we have to serve it with the keenest thought , the utmost patience , inordinate veracity .... " The practical trouble between [[your]323-marjorie sort]5761-your sort and [[my]323-marjorie sort]5762-my sort , [Marjorie]323-marjorie , is the trouble between faith and realization . [You]323-marjorie demand the outcome . Oh ! and [I]323-marjorie hate to turn aside and realize . [I]323-marjorie 've had to do it for seven years . Damnable years ! [Men of [my]323-marjorie sort]6295-men of my sort want to understand . [We]4605-we want to understand , and [you]323-marjorie ask [us]4605-we to make . [We]4605-we want to understand atoms , ions , molecules , refractions . [You]323-marjorie ask [us]4605-we to make rubber and diamonds . [I]323-marjorie suppose it 's right that incidentally [we]4605-we should make rubber and diamonds . Finally , [I]323-marjorie warn [you]323-marjorie , [we]4605-we will make rubber unnecessary and diamonds valueless . And again [we]4605-we want to understand how [people]631-people react upon [one another]863-one another to produce social consequences , and [you]323-marjorie ask [us]4605-we to put it at once into a draft bill for the reform of something or other . [I]323-marjorie suppose life lies between [us]4605-we somewhere , [we]4605-we 're the two poles of truth seeking and truth getting ; with [me]323-marjorie alone it would be nothing but a luminous dream , with [you]323-marjorie nothing but a scramble in which sooner or later all the lamps would be upset .... But it 's ever too much of a scramble yet , and ever too little of a dream . All [[our]4605-we world]2861-our world over there is full of the confusion and wreckage of premature realizations . There 's no real faith in thought and knowledge yet . Old necessity has driven [men]600-men so hard that [they]600-men still rush with a wild urgency — though [she]6300-she goads no more . Greed and haste , and if , indeed , [we]4605-we seem to have a moment 's breathing space , then [the Gawdsaker]6301-the gawdsaker tramples [us]4605-we under . "[323-marjorie] " [[My]323-marjorie dear]4933-my dear ! "[323-marjorie] cried [Marjorie]323-marjorie , with a sharp note of amusement . " What is [a Gawdsaker]6303-a gawdsaker ? ' Gawdsaking ' is the curse of all progress , the hectic consumption that kills a thousand good beginnings . [You]323-marjorie see it in small things and in great . [You]323-marjorie see it in [my]4608-i life ; [Gawdsaking]555-gawdsaking turned [my]4608-i life - work to cash and promotions , Gawdsaking —— Look at the way [the aviators]6309-the aviators took to flying for prizes and gate - money , the way pure research is swamped by endowments for technical applications ! Then that poor ghost - giant of an idea [the socialists]6310-the socialists have;—it 's been treated like [one of those unborn lambs [they]6310-the socialists kill for the fine skin of it , made into results before ever it was alive]6311-one of those unborn lambs they kill for the fine skin of it , made into results before ever it was alive . Was there anything more pitiful ? The first great dream and then the last phase ! when [[your]323-marjorie Aunt Plessington]4746-your aunt plessington and [the district visitors]6313-the district visitors took and used it as a synonym for Payment in Kind .... It 's natural , [I]4608-i suppose , for [people]631-people to be eager for results , personal and immediate results — the last lesson of life is patience . Naturally [they]631-people want reality , naturally ! [They]631-people want the individual life , something to handle and feel and use and live by , something of [their]631-people very own before [they]631-people die , and [they]631-people want it now . But the thing that matters for the race , [Marjorie]323-marjorie , is a very different thing ; it is to get the emerging thought process clear and to keep it clear — and to let those other hungers go . [We]6315-we 've got to go back to [England]9-england on the side of that delay , that arrest of interruption , that detached , observant , synthesizing process of the mind , that solvent of difficulties and obsolescent institutions , which is the reality of collective human life . [We]6315-we 've got to go back on the side of pure science — literature untrammeled by the preconceptions of [the social schemers]6316-the social schemers — art free from the urgency of immediate utility — and a new , a regal , a god - like sincerity in philosophy . "[837-a man] One astonishing afternoon in [January]238-january [a man]837-a man came out of [the wilderness]4183-the wilderness to [Lonely Hut]239-lonely hut . [He]837-a man was [a French - Indian half - breed]4627-a french - indian half - breed , [a trapper]4344-a trapper up and down [the Green River]212-the green river and across [the Height of Land]219-the height of land to [Sea Lake]240-sea lake . [He]837-a man arrived in a sort of shy silence , and squatted amiably on a log to thaw . " Much snow , "[837-a man] [he]837-a man said , " and little fur . "[837-a man] After [he]837-a man had sat at [their]4629-their fire for an hour and eaten and drunk , [his]837-a man purpose in coming thawed out . [He]837-a man explained [he]837-a man had just come on to [them]4629-their to see how [they]4629-their were . [He]837-a man was , [he]837-a man said , [a planter furring]4630-a planter furring ; [he]837-a man had a line of traps , about a hundred and twenty miles in length . The nearest trap in [his]837-a man path before [he]837-a man turned northward over [the divide]4631-the divide was a good forty miles down [the river]4906-the river . [He]837-a man had come on from there . Just to have a look . [His]837-a man name , [he]837-a man said , was [Louis Napoleon Partington]561-louis napoleon . [He]837-a man had carried a big pack , a rifle and [a dead marten,—they]4633-a dead marten,—they lay beside [him]837-a man — and out of [his]837-a man shapeless mass of caribou skins and woolen clothing and wrappings , peeped a genial , oily , brown face , very dirty , with a strand of blue - black hair across one eye , irregular teeth in its friendly smile , and little , squeezed - up eyes . Conversation developed . There had been doubts of [his]837-a man linguistic range at first , but [he]837-a man had an understanding expression , and [his]837-a man English seemed guttural rather than really bad . [He]837-a man was told the tremendous story of [Trafford]394-trafford 's leg ; was shown it , and felt it ; [he]837-a man interpolated thick and whistling noises to show how completely [he]837-a man followed [their]4634-their explanations , and then suddenly [he]837-a man began a speech that made all [his]837-a man earlier taciturnity seem but the dam of a great reservoir of mixed and partly incomprehensible English . [He]837-a man complimented [Marjorie]323-marjorie so effusively and relentlessly and shamelessly as to produce a pause when [he]837-a man had done . " Yes , "[837-a man] [he]837-a man said , and nodded to button up the whole . [He]837-a man sucked [his]837-a man pipe , well satisfied with [his]837-a man eloquence . [Trafford]394-trafford spoke in [his]837-a man silence . " [We]6381-we are coming down , "[561-louis napoleon] [he]837-a man said . ( " [I]394-trafford thought , perhaps — — "[394-trafford] whispered [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon . ) " Yes , "[837-a man] said [Trafford]394-trafford , " [we]6381-we are coming down with [you]561-louis napoleon . Why not ? [We]6381-we can get a sledge over the snow now ? It 's hard ? [I]837-a man mean a flat sledge — like this . See ? Like this . "[837-a man] [He]837-a man got up and dragged [[Marjorie]323-marjorie 's old arrangement]4635-marjorie 's old arrangement into view . "[561-louis napoleon] " [You]561-louis napoleon 'd have to leave [the tent]4234-the tent , "[561-louis napoleon] said [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon . "[837-a man] " If [you]561-louis napoleon liked . "[561-louis napoleon] For some moments [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon was intently silent . Eh ? "[561-louis napoleon] [Trafford]394-trafford said that was the idea . [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon 's eye brightened , but [his]561-louis napoleon face preserved its Indian calm .
