"[561-louis napoleon] [They]4636-they had talked out nearly every particular of [their]4636-they return before [they]4636-they slept that night ; [they]4636-they yarned away three hours over the first generous meal that [any one of [them]4636-they]4637-any one of them had eaten for many weeks . [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon stayed in [the hut]4318-the hut as a matter of course , and reposed with snores and choking upon [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's sledge and within a yard of [her]323-marjorie . It struck [her]323-marjorie as [she]323-marjorie lay awake and listened that [the housemaids in [Sussex Square]175-sussex square]4639-the housemaids in sussex square would have thought things a little congested for [[a lady]4640-a lady 's bedroom]4641-a lady 's bedroom , and then [she]323-marjorie reflected that after all it was n't much worse than [a crowded carriage]4642-a crowded carriage in [an all - night train]4643-an all - night train from [Switzerland]20-switzerland . [She]323-marjorie tried to count how many [people there]4644-people there had been in [that compartment]4645-that compartment , and failed . How stuffy that had been — the smell of cheese and all ! And with that , after a dream that [she]323-marjorie was whaling and had harpooned a particularly short - winded whale [she]323-marjorie fell very peacefully into oblivion . Next day was spent in the careful preparation of the two sledges . [They]4636-they intended to take a full provision for six weeks , although [they]4636-they reckoned that with good weather [they]4636-they ought to be down at [Hammond 's]536-hammond in four . The day after was Sunday , and [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon would not look at the sledges or packing . Instead [he]561-louis napoleon held a kind of religious service which consisted partly in making [Trafford]394-trafford read aloud out of a very oily old New Testament [he]561-louis napoleon produced , a selected passage from the book of Corinthians , and partly in moaning rather than singing several hymns . [He]561-louis napoleon was rather disappointed that [they]4636-they did not join in with [him]561-louis napoleon . In the afternoon [he]561-louis napoleon heated some water , went into [the tent]4234-the tent with it and it would appear partially washed [his]561-louis napoleon face . In the evening , after [they]4636-they had supped , [he]561-louis napoleon discussed religion , being curious by this time about [their]4636-they beliefs and procedure . [He]561-louis napoleon spread [his]561-louis napoleon mental and spiritual equipment before [them]4636-they very artlessly . [Their]4636-they isolation and [their]4636-they immense concentration on each other had made [them]4636-they sensitive to personal quality , and [they]4636-they listened to the broken English and the queer tangential starts into new topics of [this dirty mongrel creature]4647-this dirty mongrel creature with the keenest appreciation of its quality . It was inconsistent , miscellaneous , simple , honest , and human . It was as touching as the medley in the pocket of [a dead schoolboy]4648-a dead schoolboy . [He]561-louis napoleon was superstitious and sceptical and sensual and spiritual , and very , very earnest . The things [he]561-louis napoleon believed , even if they were just beliefs about the weather or drying venison or filling pipes , [he]561-louis napoleon believed with emotion . [He]561-louis napoleon flushed as [he]561-louis napoleon told [them]4636-they . For all [his]561-louis napoleon intellectual muddle [they]4636-they felt [he]561-louis napoleon knew how to live honestly and die if need be very finely . [He]561-louis napoleon was more than a little distressed at [their]4636-they apparent ignorance of the truths of revealed religion as it is taught in [the Moravian schools upon [the coast]5954-the coast]4649-the moravian schools upon the coast , and indeed it was manifest that [he]561-louis napoleon had had far more careful and infinitely more sincere religious teaching than either [Trafford]394-trafford or [Marjorie]323-marjorie . For a time the missionary spirit inspired [him]561-louis napoleon , and then [he]561-louis napoleon quite forgot [his]561-louis napoleon solicitude for [their]4636-they conversion in a number of increasingly tall anecdotes about [hunters]4651-hunters and [fishermen]4652-fishermen , illustrating at first the extreme dangers of any departure from a rigid Sabbatarianism , but presently becoming just stories illustrating the uncertainty of life . Thence [he]561-louis napoleon branched off to the general topic of life upon [the coast]5954-the coast and the relative advantages of " [planter "]6385-planter "[561-louis napoleon] and [fisherman]4654-fisherman . And then with a kindling eye [he]561-louis napoleon spoke of [women]612-women , and how that some day [he]561-louis napoleon would marry . [His]561-louis napoleon voice softened , and [he]561-louis napoleon addressed [himself]561-louis napoleon more particularly to [Marjorie]323-marjorie . [He]561-louis napoleon did n't so much introduce the topic of [the lady]4656-the lady as allow [the destined young woman]4657-the destined young woman suddenly to pervade [his]561-louis napoleon discourse . [She]4657-the destined young woman was , it seemed , [a servant]3583-a servant , [an Esquimaux girl at [the Moravian Mission station at [Manivikovik]211-manivikovik]4660-the moravian mission station at manivikovik]4659-an esquimaux girl at the moravian mission station at manivikovik . [He]561-louis napoleon had been plighted to [her]4657-the destined young woman for nine years . [He]561-louis napoleon described a gramophone [he]561-louis napoleon had purchased down at [Port Dupré]210-port dupré and brought back to [her]4657-the destined young woman three hundred miles up [the coast]5954-the coast — it seemed to [Marjorie]323-marjorie an odd gift for [an Esquimaux maiden]4662-an esquimaux maiden — and [he]561-louis napoleon gave [his]561-louis napoleon views upon its mechanism . [He]561-louis napoleon said [God]249-god was with [[the man who invented the gramophone " truly . "]6386-the man who invented the gramophone " truly . "]6386-the man who invented the gramophone " truly . "[561-louis napoleon] [They]4663-they would have found one a very great relief to the tediums of [their]4663-they sojourn at [Lonely Hut]239-lonely hut . The gramophone [he]561-louis napoleon had given [[his]561-louis napoleon betrothed]4664-his betrothed possessed records of [the Rev. Capel Gumm]562-the rev. capel gumm 's preaching and of [Madame Melba]563-madame melba 's singing , a revival hymn called " Sowing the Seed , "[561-louis napoleon] and a comic song — [they]4663-they could not make out [his]561-louis napoleon pronunciation of the title — that made [you]4665-you die with laughter . " It goes gobble , gobble , gobble , "[561-louis napoleon] [he]561-louis napoleon said , with a solemn appreciative reflection of those distant joys . " It 's good to be jolly at times , "[561-louis napoleon] [he]561-louis napoleon said with [his]561-louis napoleon bright eyes scanning [Marjorie]323-marjorie 's face a little doubtfully , as if such ideas were better left for week - day expression . [Their]4663-they return was a very different journey from the toilsome ascent of the summer . An immense abundance of snow masked [the world]589-the world , snow that made [them]4663-they regret acutely [they]4663-they had not equipped [themselves]4663-they with ski . With ski and a good circulation , [a man]837-a man may go about [Labrador]190-labrador in winter , six times more easily than by the canoes and slow trudging of summer travel . As it was [they]4663-they were glad of [their]4663-they Canadian snow shoes . One needs only shelters after [the Alpine Club hut]4668-the alpine club hut fashion , and [all that vast solitary country]4669-all that vast solitary country would be open in the wintertime . [Its]4669-all that vast solitary country shortest day is no shorter than the shortest day in [Cumberland]242-cumberland or [Dublin]243-dublin . This is no place to tell of the beauty and wonder of snow and ice , the soft contours of gentle slopes , the rippling of fine snow under a steady wind , the long shadow ridges of shining powder on the lee of trees and stones and rocks , the delicate wind streaks over broad surfaces like the marks of a chisel in marble , the crests and cornices , the vivid brightness of edges in the sun , the glowing yellowish light on sunlit surfaces , the long blue shadows , the flush of sunset and sunrise and the pallid unearthly desolation of snow beneath the moon . Nor need the broken snow in woods and amidst [tumbled stony slopes]4670-tumbled stony slopes be described , nor the vast soft overhanging crests on [every outstanding rock beside [the icebound river]4672-the icebound river]4671-every outstanding rock beside the icebound river , nor the huge stalactites and stalagmites of green - blue ice below [the cliffs]4673-the cliffs , nor trees burdened and broken by frost and snow , nor snow upon ice , nor the blue pools at mid - day upon the surface of [the ice - stream]4674-the ice - stream . Across the smooth wind - swept ice of [the open tarns]4675-the open tarns [they]4663-they would find a growth of ice flowers , six - rayed and complicated , more abundant and more beautiful than the Alpine summer flowers . But the wind was very bitter , and the sun had scarcely passed its zenith before the thought of fuel and shelter came back into [their]4663-they minds . As [they]4663-they approached [[Partington]561-louis napoleon 's tilt]4676-partington 's tilt , at the point where [his]561-louis napoleon trapping ground turned out of [the Green River gorge]4677-the green river gorge , [he]561-louis napoleon became greatly obsessed by the thought of [his]561-louis napoleon traps . [He]561-louis napoleon began to talk of all that [he]561-louis napoleon might find in [them]4678-them , all [he]561-louis napoleon hoped to find , and the " dallars "[394-trafford] that might ensue . [They]4663-they slept the third night , [Marjorie]323-marjorie within and [the two men under the lee of the little cabin]4679-the two men under the lee of the little cabin , and [Partington]561-louis napoleon was up and away before dawn to a trap towards [the ridge]6038-the ridge . [He]561-louis napoleon had infected [Marjorie]323-marjorie and [Trafford]394-trafford with a sympathetic keenness , but when [they]4663-they saw [his]561-louis napoleon killing of [a marten that was still alive in its trap]4681-a marten that was still alive in its trap , [they]4663-they suddenly conceived a distaste for trapping . [They]4663-they insisted [they]4663-they must witness no more . [They]4663-they would wait while [he]561-louis napoleon went to a trap .... " Think what [he]561-louis napoleon 's doing ! "[394-trafford] said [Trafford]394-trafford , as [they]4663-they sat together under the lee of a rock waiting for [him]561-louis napoleon . " [We]4663-they imagined this was [a free , simple - souled man]6388-a free , simple - souled man leading an unsophisticated life on the very edge of humanity , and really [he]561-louis napoleon is as much [a dependant of [[your]6390-your woman]6391-your woman 's world]6389-a dependant of your woman 's world , [Marjorie]323-marjorie , as [any sweated seamstress in [a Marylebone slum]6393-a marylebone slum]6392-any sweated seamstress in a marylebone slum . [Their]4663-they pelts will be dressed and prepared because [women who have never dreamt of this bleak wilderness]6399-women who have never dreamt of this bleak wilderness desire [them]4663-they . [They]4663-they will get at last into [Regent Street shops]6400-regent street shops , and [Bond Street shops]6401-bond street shops , and [shops in [Fifth Avenue]244-fifth avenue and in [Paris]143-paris and [Berlin]65-berlin]6402-shops in fifth avenue and in paris and berlin , [they]4663-they will make delightful deep muffs , with scent and little bags and powder puffs and all sorts of things tucked away inside , and long wraps for [tall women]6403-tall women , and jolly little frames of soft fur for pretty faces , and dainty coats and rugs for [expensive little babies]6404-expensive little babies in [Kensington Gardens]69-kensington gardens . "[4683-i] One day [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon sent [them]4684-they on along [the trail]4225-the trail while [he]561-louis napoleon went up [the mountain]6014-the mountain to a trap among the trees . [He]561-louis napoleon rejoined [them]4684-they — not as [his]561-louis napoleon custom was , shouting inaudible conversation for the last hundred yards or so , but in silence . [They]4684-they wondered at that , and at the one clumsy gesture that flourished something darkly grey at [them]4684-they . What had happened to [the man]1016-the man ? Whatever [he]4683-i had caught [he]4683-i was hugging it as one hugs a cat , and stroking it . " Ugh ! "[4683-i] [he]4683-i said deeply , drawing near . " Oh ! "[561-louis napoleon] A solemn joy irradiated [his]4683-i face , and almost religious ecstasy found expression . [He]4683-i had got a silver fox , a beautifully marked silver fox , the best luck of [Labrador]190-labrador ! [One]675-one goes for years without one , in hope , and when it comes , it pays [the trapper]4689-the trapper 's debts , it clears [his]4683-i life — for years ! [They]4684-they tried poor inadequate congratulation .... As [they]4684-they sat about the fire that night a silence came upon [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon . It was manifest that [his]561-louis napoleon mind was preoccupied . [He]561-louis napoleon got up , walked about , inspected the miracle of fur that had happened to [him]561-louis napoleon , returned , regarded [them]4684-they . " ' M'm , "[561-louis napoleon] [he]561-louis napoleon said , and stroked [his]561-louis napoleon chin with [his]561-louis napoleon forefinger . A certain diffidence and yet a certain dignity of assurance mingled in [his]561-louis napoleon manner . It was n't so much a doubt of [his]561-louis napoleon own correctness as of some possible ignorance of the finer shades on [their]4684-they part that might embarrass [him]561-louis napoleon . [He]561-louis napoleon coughed a curt preface , and intimated [he]561-louis napoleon had a request to make . Behind the Indian calm of [his]561-louis napoleon face glowed tremendous feeling , like the light of a foundry furnace shining through chinks in the door . [He]561-louis napoleon spoke in a small flat voice , exercising great self - control . [His]561-louis napoleon wish , [he]561-louis napoleon said , in view of all that had happened , was a little thing .... This was nearly a perfect day for [him]561-louis napoleon , and one thing only remained .... " Well , "[394-trafford] [he]561-louis napoleon said , and hung . " Well , "[323-marjorie] said [Trafford]394-trafford . [He]561-louis napoleon plunged . Just simply this . Would [they]4684-they give [him]561-louis napoleon the brandy bottle and let [him]561-louis napoleon get drunk ? [Mr. Grenfell]564-mr. grenfell was [a good man]1440-a good man , [a very good man]4691-a very good man , but [he]564-mr. grenfell had made brandy dear — dear beyond the reach of [common men]4692-common men altogether — along [the coast]5954-the coast .... [He]564-mr. grenfell explained , dear bundle of clothes and dirt ! that [he]564-mr. grenfell was always perfectly respectable when [he]564-mr. grenfell was drunk . It seemed strange to [Trafford]394-trafford that now that [Marjorie]323-marjorie was going [home]810-home , a wild impatience to see [[her]323-marjorie children]5929-her children should possess [her]323-marjorie . So long as it had been probable that [they]4684-they would stay out [their]4684-they year in [Labrador]190-labrador , that separation had seemed mainly a sentimental trouble ; now at times it was like an animal craving . [She]323-marjorie would talk of [them]4684-they for hours at a stretch , and when [she]323-marjorie was not talking [he]564-mr. grenfell could see [her]323-marjorie eyes fixed ahead , and knew that [she]323-marjorie was anticipating a meeting . And for the first time it seemed the idea of possible misadventure troubled [her]323-marjorie .... [They]4684-they reached [[Hammond]536-hammond 's]6384-hammond 's in one and twenty days from [Lonely Hut]239-lonely hut , three days [they]4684-they had been forced to camp because of a blizzard , and three because [Louis Napoleon]561-louis napoleon was rigidly Sabbatarian . [They]4684-they parted from [him]561-louis napoleon reluctantly , and the next day [Hammond]536-hammond 's produced [its]536-hammond dogs , twelve stout but extremely hungry dogs , and sent [the Traffords]425-the traffords on to [the Green River pulp - mills]4697-the green river pulp - mills , where [there were good beds and a copious supply of hot water]4698-there were good beds and a copious supply of hot water . Thence [they]4684-they went to [Manivikovik]211-manivikovik , and thence [the new Marconi station]4699-the new marconi station sent [their]4684-they inquiries [home]810-home , inquiries that were answered next day with matter - of - fact brevity : " [Everyone]1186-everyone well , love from all . "[4713-him] When [the operator]4701-the operator hurried with that to [Marjorie]323-marjorie [she]323-marjorie received it off - handedly , glanced at it carelessly , asked [him]561-louis napoleon to smoke , remarked that wireless telegraphy was a wonderful thing , and then , in the midst of some unfinished commonplace about the temperature , broke down and wept wildly and uncontrollably .... Then came the long , wonderful ride southward day after day along [the coast]5954-the coast to [Port Dupré]210-port dupré , a ride from headland to headland across [the frozen bays]4703-the frozen bays behind long teams of straining , furry dogs , that leapt and yelped as [they]4684-they ran . Sometimes over [the land]1157-the land [the brutes]4705-the brutes shirked and loitered and called for the whip ; [they]4684-they were [a quarrelsome crew to keep waiting]4706-a quarrelsome crew to keep waiting ; but across [the sea - ice]4707-the sea - ice [they]4684-they went like the wind , and downhill [the komatic]565-the komatic chased [their]4684-they waving tails . The sledges swayed and leapt depressions , and shot athwart icy stretches . [The Traffords]425-the traffords , spectacled and wrapped to [their]425-the traffords noses , had all the sensations then of hunting [an unknown quarry]4708-an unknown quarry behind a pack of wolves . The snow blazed under the sun , out to [sea]5312-sea beyond the ice the water glittered , and it was n't so much air [they]425-the traffords breathed as a sort of joyous hunger . One day [[their]425-the traffords teams]4710-their teams insisted upon racing . [[Marjorie]323-marjorie 's team]4711-marjorie 's team was the heavier , [[her]323-marjorie driver]4712-her driver more skillful , and [her]323-marjorie sledge the lighter , and [she]323-marjorie led in that wild chase from start to finish , but ever and again [Trafford]394-trafford made wild spurts that brought [him]4713-him almost level . Once , as [he]4713-him came alongside , [she]323-marjorie heard [him]4713-him laughing joyously . " [Marjorie]323-marjorie , "[4713-him] [he]4713-him shouted , " [d'you]323-marjorie remember ? Old donkey cart ? "[4713-him] [[Her]323-marjorie team]4714-her team yawed away , and as [he]4713-him swept near again , behind [his]4713-him pack of whimpering , straining , furious dogs , [she]323-marjorie heard [him]4713-him shouting , " [You]323-marjorie know , [that old cart]6409-that old cart ! Under the overhanging trees ! So thick and green [they]6409-that old cart met overhead ! [You]323-marjorie know ! When [you]323-marjorie and [I]4713-him had [our]4715-they first talk together ! In [the lane]6410-the lane . It was n't so fast as this , eh ? "[None-None] ... At [Port Dupré]210-port dupré [they]4715-they stayed ten days — days that [Marjorie]323-marjorie could only make tolerable by knitting absurd garments for [the children]1036-the children ( [her]323-marjorie knitting was atrocious ) , and then one afternoon [they]4715-they heard the gun of [the Grenfell]245-the grenfell , [the new winter steamer]4717-the new winter steamer from [St. John 's]206-st. john 's , signalling as it came in through the fog , very slowly , from that great wasteful world of [men]600-men and [women beyond the seaward grey]4719-women beyond the seaward grey .
